Sense.DEF: the 23rd letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第二十三个字母
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= west or 或 western 西﹔西方(的)﹔朝西(的)
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= watt or 或 watts 瓦(特)

Sense.DEF: a crazy or strange person
silly in an exciting or amusing way
Sense.TRAN: 疯疯癫癫的﹔古怪的﹔荒唐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wonderfully wacky idea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个非常可笑的古怪想法

Sense.DEF: a thick pile of pieces of paper or thin material

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wad of dollar bills
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一叠美钞

Sense.DEF: a thick soft mass of material that has been pressed together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wad of cotton wool
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团脱脂棉

Sense.DEF: to press something such as a piece of paper or cloth into a small tight ball
soft material used for packing or to protect a wound
to walk with short steps, with your body moving from one side to another – used especially about people or birds with fat bodies and short legs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体胖腿短的人或鸟〕摇摇摆摆地走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Half a dozen ducks waddled up the bank.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六只鸭子摇摇摆摆地上了岸。

Sense.DEF: to walk through water that is not deep
to enter a discussion, argument etc in a forceful and annoying way, often without thinking about the possible results
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指不顾后果地〕干涉﹐介入﹐插手
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you wouldn’t always wade in with your opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你不要总是硬插进来提意见。

Sense.DEF: to move forward and attack someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police waded into the crowd swinging sticks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察挥舞着警棍冲进人群。

Sense.DEF: to read or deal with a lot of boring papers or written work
Sense.TRAN: 吃力地阅读﹐费力地处理〔乏味的文件或文章〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each day Parkin wades through lengthy court reports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕金每天都要处理冗长的法庭报告。

Sense.DEF: a bird that has long legs and a long neck, and that walks around in water to find its food
high rubber boots that you wear for walking in deep water, usually when fishing
a river bed in a desert which is usually dry but becomes full of water when there is a lot of rain
a small pool filled with water that is not very deep, for small children to play in
a very thin biscuit
a thin round piece of bread eaten with wine in the Christian communion ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教圣餐仪式上用的〕圣饼

Sense.DEF: a very thin flat piece of a hard substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: wafers of silicon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 硅片

Sense.DEF: extremely thin
Sense.EXAMPLE: wafer-thin chocolates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄片巧克力

Sense.DEF: a flat cake, marked with a pattern of deep squares
Sense.TRAN: 〔带四方深纹的〕华夫饼﹐蛋奶烘饼

Sense.DEF: talk or writing that uses a lot of words but says nothing important
to talk or write using a lot of words but without saying anything important
Sense.TRAN: 唠叨﹐说[写]废话﹐空话连篇
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop waffling and get to the point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别瞎扯了﹐说正题吧。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to decide what action to take
Sense.EXAMPLE: He cannot continue to waffle on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上他不能再犹豫不决了。

Sense.DEF: a piece of kitchen equipment used to cook waffles
if a smell, smoke, or a light wind wafts somewhere, or if something wafts it somewhere, it moves gently through the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cooking smells wafted up from downstairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烧菜的气味从楼下飘了上来。

Sense.DEF: if sounds waft somewhere, you hear them there and they are pleasant but not very loud

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sound of laughter wafted through the open window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 笑声从敞开的窗户里传了出来。

Sense.DEF: if a dog wags its tail, or if its tail wags, the dog moves its tail many times from one side to the other
to move your finger or head from side to side, especially to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 摇﹐摆动〔手指或头﹐尤指表示不赞同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You naughty girl!’ Mom said, wagging her finger at me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你这个调皮的丫头！”妈妈对我摇了摇手指说道。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: it’s (a case of) the tail wagging the dog

Sense.DEF: someone who says or does something clever and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some wag had drawn a face on the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某个爱搞笑的家伙在墙上画了张人脸。

Sense.DEF: a wagging movement
the wife or girlfriend of a famous sports player
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are WAGs good role models for girls?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体坛明星的娇妻﹑女友是女孩们的榜样吗？

Sense.DEF: money you earn that is paid according to the number of hours, days, or weeks that you work
Sense.TRAN: 〔按小时﹑日或周计算的〕工资﹐薪金
Sense.EXAMPLE: He earns a good wage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他工资挺高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wage increases will come into effect in June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次加薪将于6月份施行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a weekly wage of $250
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 250美元的周薪

GramExa.GLOSS: fixed amounts of money paid for particular jobs
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔特定工作固定的〕工资水平/等级

Sense.DEF: money you earn for work that is enough to pay for the basic things that you need to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church no longer paid a living wage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会不再支付可以维持生计的薪俸了。

Sense.DEF: an action taken by a company, government etc to stop wages increasing
the amount of money asked for by workers as an increase in wages
Sense.TRAN: 增加工资的要求﹐加薪要求

Sense.DEF: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are waging war on drug pushers in the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在市内开展一场打击毒贩的斗争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The council has waged a vigorous campaign against the proposal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会发起了一场激烈的运动反对这项提议。

Sense.DEF: waged work or employment is work for which you get paid
someone who is waged has a job for which they earn money
someone in a family who earns money for the rest of the family
someone who works for wages
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both wage-earners and salaried officials were protected by the new regulations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挣工资的人和领薪俸的官员都受新法规的保护。

Sense.DEF: an envelope that contains your wages
an agreement in which you win or lose money according to the result of something such as a race
to agree to win or lose an amount of money on the result of something such as a race

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stipes wagered all his money on an unknown horse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂普斯把他所有的钱都押在一匹不出名的马上。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are confident that something is true
a waggish person makes clever and amusing jokes, remarks etc
to move something up and down or from side to side using short quick movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you waggle your ears?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的耳朵会动吗？

Sense.DEF: a strong vehicle with four wheels, used for carrying heavy loads and usually pulled by horses
a large open container pulled by a train, used for carrying goods
to not drink alcohol any more
to start drinking alcohol again after you have stopped
a long line of wagons and horses used by the people who moved to the West of America in the 19th century
Sense.TRAN: 〔19世纪向美国西部移民时用的〕马车队

Sense.DEF: a small European bird that moves its tail quickly up and down when it walks
Sense.TRAN: 鹡鸰〔一种欧洲小鸟﹐行走时尾巴上下快速摆动〕

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who is pale and thin and looks as if they do not have a home
Sense.TRAN: 苍白瘦弱的人〔似为无家可归者﹐尤指小孩〕

Sense.DEF: children or animals who do not have a home
Sense.EXAMPLE: She loved cats, and would take any waifs and strays into her home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢猫﹐什么流浪猫都会带回家去养。

Sense.DEF: extremely pale and thin
Sense.EXAMPLE: images of waif-like models in girls’ magazines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女杂志上苍白瘦弱的模特形象

Sense.DEF: to say something in a loud, sad, and complaining way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But what shall I do?’ Bernard wailed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “但我该怎么办呢？”伯纳德哭喊道。

Sense.DEF: to cry out with a long high sound, especially because you are very sad or in pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因悲伤或痛楚而〕恸哭﹐痛哭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somewhere behind them a child began to wail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个孩子在他们身后的什么地方大哭起来。

Sense.DEF: to make a long high sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind wailed in the chimney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风灌进烟囱里呼呼作响。

Sense.DEF: a skirting board
the narrow part in the middle of the human body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skirt was too big around the waist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条裙子腰围太大。

GramExa.GLOSS: in the top or bottom half of your body
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lota was paralysed from the waist down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛塔下半身瘫痪了。

GramExa.GLOSS: not wearing any clothes on the top half of your body
having a thin, thick etc waist
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 腰身苗条的/细腰的/粗腰的

Sense.DEF: the part of a piece of clothing that goes around this part of your body
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with waste, which is used as a verb and a noun to talk about using too much of something, or not using it in a sensible way. 不要和waste混淆﹐waste用作动词和名词﹐意思是“浪费”。

Sense.DEF: the part of a skirt, trousers etc that fastens around your waist
a piece of clothing without sleeves that has buttons down the front and is worn over a shirt, often under a jacket as part of a man’s suit
deep enough to reach your waist
Sense.EXAMPLE: standing waist-deep in water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 站在齐腰深的水中

Sense.DEF: high enough to reach your waist
Sense.EXAMPLE: waist-high grass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 齐腰高的草

Sense.DEF: the amount you measure around the waist, especially used to judge how fat or thin you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trim waistline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苗条的腰身

Sense.DEF: the position of the waist of a piece of clothing

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb wait are. 本图表所示为动词wait构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurry up! Everyone’s waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点！大家在等着呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you mind waiting outside?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在外面等好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a queue of people waiting for a bus
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等候公共汽车的队伍
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wait for me!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等我！

GramExa.PROPFORM: wait for sb/sth to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She paused, waiting for Myles to say something.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停下来﹐等着迈尔斯说些什么。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sat waiting patiently for the wedding to end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我耐心地坐着等待婚礼结束。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll wait till you come back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会等到你回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you wait for five minutes?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能等五分钟吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been waiting ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经等了很长时间了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you waiting to use the phone?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在等着用电话吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone wait, especially by arriving late
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔尤指因迟到而〕使某人一直等候
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry to have kept you waiting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐让你久等了。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 you ‘are waiting’ someone or 或 something. Say that 而要说 you are waiting for someone or 或 something.

Sense.DEF: if you are waiting for something that you expect or hope will happen or arrive, it has not happened or arrived yet
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you heard about the job?’ ‘No, I’m still waiting.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那份工作有消息了吗？”“没有﹐我还在等呢。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m still waiting for my results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还在等我的结果。

GramExa.PROPFORM: wait for sb/sth to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m waiting for him to realize how stupid he’s been.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在等着他意识到自己有多么笨。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone not to leave or start doing something immediately
Subsense.TRAN: 等一下﹐慢着〔用于叫某人别离开或不要立刻做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wait a second, I’ll get my coat and come with you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一等﹐我拿上大衣和你一起去。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wait a moment, just let me think.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下﹐让我想想。

Subsense.DEF: used to interrupt someone, especially because you do not agree with what they are saying
Subsense.TRAN: 等等﹐且慢〔用于打断别人的话﹐尤因有不同意见〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wait a minute! That’s not what we agreed!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等！我们原先说好的不是这样！

Subsense.DEF: used when you suddenly think of, remember, or notice something
Subsense.TRAN: 等等〔用于突然想到﹑记起或注意到某事物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wait a minute, I’ve got a better idea.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等﹐我有个更好的主意。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone is very excited about something and is eager for it to happen
Subsense.TRAN: 某人急着/等不及〔用于强调对即将发生的事感到兴奋和迫不及待〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to Australia on Saturday – I can’t wait!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期六去澳大利亚——我都等不及了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t wait to tell Gloria the good news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迫不及待地要告诉格洛丽亚这个好消息。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laura could hardly wait to see the twins again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉迫不及待地想要再见到那对双胞胎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t wait for the summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我急切地等待夏天的到来。

Subsense.DEF: used humorously to say that something seems likely to be very boring
Subsense.TRAN: 我等不及了〔幽默说法﹐用于表示某事物实际上可能十分乏味〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A lecture on transformational grammar? I can hardly wait!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关转换语法的讲座？我可等不及了！

Sense.DEF: if something can wait, it is not very urgent. If something can’t wait, it is very urgent.
Sense.TRAN: 某事可以等[不急]/刻不容缓[不能等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go home. The report can wait till tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家吧。报告可以等到明天再说。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should be patient because they will find out about something later
Sense.TRAN: 等等看〔用于叫某人耐心等待事情的结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s for dinner?’ ‘Wait and see.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “晚餐吃什么？”“等一下就知道了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will just have to wait and see how things develop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只能耐心等着看事情怎样发展。

Sense.DEF: used when you are excited about telling or showing someone something
Sense.TRAN: 等到…〔用于兴奋地向某人诉说某事或展示某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait till you see Gaby’s new house!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你等着看加比的新家吧！

Sense.DEF: if something is waiting for you, it is ready for you to use, collect etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物已准备好〕可供(某人)使用[提取等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’ll be a rental car waiting for you at the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会有一辆租来的车在机场等你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come round at eight and I’ll have dinner waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8点钟过来﹐我会准备好晚餐等你。

Sense.DEF: to stay calm until it is your turn to do something, instead of trying to move ahead of other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got two hands and there are three of you. So you’ll have to wait your turn!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只有两只手﹐而你们有三个人﹐所以你们得等着一个个来！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very good, even though it takes a long time to come
Sense.TRAN: 某事物值得等〔表示某事物很好﹐值得久等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their new album was worth waiting for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的新专辑值得一等。

Subsense.DEF: used to warn or threaten someone
Subsense.TRAN: 你等着〔用于警告或威胁某人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get you back for what you’ve done, just you wait.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你干的好事我会跟你算账的﹐你等着。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone you are sure something will happen
Subsense.TRAN: 你就等着吧〔用于告诉某人某事肯定会发生〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be a huge success. Just you wait.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会大获成功的﹐你就等着吧。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to do something immediately
Sense.TRAN: 你还在等什么？〔用于叫某人马上做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, what are you waiting for? Go and apologize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐你还在等什么？去道歉呀。

Sense.DEF: used to say in a cheerful way that you think everyone should start doing something immediately
Sense.TRAN: 我们还等什么？〔用于高兴地建议大家立即做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are we waiting for? Let’s go eat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还等什么？去吃吧。

Subsense.DEF: used just before you tell someone something that is funny or surprising
Subsense.TRAN: 听好了〔用于表示要说的话有趣或使人吃惊〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His name was – wait for it – Mr Bacon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字叫——听好了——“培根”先生。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone not to do something until the correct time because they seem very impatient to do it now
Subsense.TRAN: 等等再说〔用于告诉某人要等时机合适再做某事〕

Sense.DEF: to be ready to do something if it is necessary or if a suitable time comes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other firms are waiting in the wings, ready to step in and make an offer should the current deal fall through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他公司都在伺机而动﹐一旦目前的这笔交易谈不成﹐他们随时准备介入进来出价。

Sense.DEF: to work in a restaurant serving food and drink to people at their tables
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the summer waiting tables.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天我在餐馆端盘子。

Sense.DEF: if you play a waiting game, you try to gain an advantage for yourself in a particular situation by deliberately doing nothing until you have seen what other people do

Exponent.DEF: to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll wait here while you call him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里等着﹐你打电话给他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He said he was waiting for a friend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他在等一个朋友。

Exponent.DEF: to wait in a place not doing anything, especially so that you are wasting time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They kept us hanging around for hours at the hospital.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让我们在医院干等了好几个小时。

Exponent.DEF: to wait because you are hoping that something will happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The captain decided it was best to hold on and wait for the other ship to arrive.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 船长决定最好是坚持等到另一艘船到达。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We hung on until the very last moment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坚持到了最后一刻。

Exponent.DEF: used when telling someone to wait
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you hang on a minute? I just want to finish this email.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能稍等一会儿吗？我想把这封电子邮件写完。

Exponent.DEF: to wait and be ready to do something if needed – used especially about soldiers, police, medical teams etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指士兵﹑警察﹑医疗队等〕待命
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The army are standing by.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队在待命。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Emergency services were on standby after someone called to say there was a bomb in the city centre.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人打电话说在市中心有颗炸弹﹐应急机构的人员便待命准备行动。

Exponent.DEF: to wait for something – used about something that you know will happen or arrive
Exponent.TRAN: 等待〔已知将要发生或来临的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I will await your reply in a formal letter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恭候您的回复。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In February, nearly 200,000 prisoners were awaiting trial.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 2月份﹐有近20万名囚犯在等待审判。

Sense.DEF: to stay in the same place and do nothing while you are waiting for something to happen, someone to arrive etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Movie-making involves acting for ten minutes and then waiting around for two hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍电影就是拍十分钟﹐然后等上两个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better be going. We can’t wait about like this any longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还是走吧﹐不能再像这样干等着。

Sense.DEF: to stay somewhere after other people have left
Sense.EXAMPLE: She waited behind to help Debbie with the clearing up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她留下来帮黛比打扫。

Sense.DEF: to stay at home and wait there for someone to arrive
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to wait in for the repair man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得在家等修理工来。

Sense.DEF: to serve food and drink to someone at their table, especially in a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在餐馆〕侍候〔客人〕进餐﹐招待

Sense.DEF: to wait for a particular event, piece of information etc, especially before doing something or making a decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在做某事或作出决定前〕等待〔某事件﹑消息等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re waiting on the blood test results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在等验血结果。

Sense.LEXUNIT: wait on sb hand and foot
Sense.DEF: to do everything for someone while they do nothing – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 无微不至地侍候某人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife waits on him hand and foot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子无微不至地侍候他。

Sense.DEF: if you wait out an event, period, or time, especially an unpleasant one, you wait for it to finish
Sense.TRAN: 耐心等待〔尤指令人不快的事件﹑时期或时间〕结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s find a place where we can wait out the storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找个地方躲一躲等暴风雨过去吧。

Sense.DEF: to wait for someone to return before you go to bed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t wait up for me; I may be late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要熬夜等我了﹐我可能很晚才回来。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop, so that you can talk to them or go with them
Sense.TRAN: 等一等！〔用于叫某人停下来以便和对方说话或同去〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Wait up!’ he called.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “等一等！”他喊道。

Sense.DEF: a period of time in which you wait for something to happen, someone to arrive etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The average wait for an appointment at the clinic was eight weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该诊所预约等候的平均时间是八个星期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an hour wait before the next train departed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一班火车要等上一个小时才开出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll have a long wait.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们得等很久。

Sense.DEF: a man who serves food and drink at the tables in a restaurant
a list of people who have asked for something but who must wait before they can have it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is still a three-month waiting list for the cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 买这些车仍要排队等三个月。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was then put on a waiting list to see a specialist at the local hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后我就被排上等候名单﹐等着看当地医院的专家门诊。

Sense.DEF: a room for people to wait in, for example before they see a doctor, until their train arrives etc
to put someone’s name on a waiting list
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人名字〕放入等候者名单

Sense.DEF: a waiting list
a woman who serves food and drink at the tables in a restaurant
a waiter or waitress – used humorously
to state officially that a right, rule etc can be ignored
Sense.TRAN: 宣布放弃〔权利〕﹔宣布取消〔规则等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She waived her right to a lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她放弃了请律师的权利。

Sense.DEF: an official written statement saying that a right, legal process etc can be waived
to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
Sense.EXAMPLE: When she woke, the sun was streaming through the windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醒来时﹐阳光泻入窗内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try not to wake the baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量不要吵醒宝宝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nancy woke to the sound of birds outside her window she heard birds singing when she woke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希在窗外的鸟鸣声中醒来。

Sense.DEF: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
Sense.EXAMPLE: James usually wakes up early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯通常醒得早。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll wake you up when it’s time to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到走的时候我会叫醒你。

Sense.DEF: to start to listen or pay attention to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wake up give me your attention at the back there!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面的人注意！

Sense.LEXUNIT: wake up and smell the coffee
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to recognize the truth or reality of a situation
to start to realize and understand a danger, an idea etc
Sense.TRAN: 开始觉察[认识]到〔危险﹑想法等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time you woke up to the fact that it’s a tough world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该清醒地认识到这是一个残酷的世界了。

Sense.DEF: if something, especially something bad, happens in the wake of an event, it happens afterwards and usually as a result of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不好的事〕紧随某事而来﹔作为某事的后果
Sense.EXAMPLE: Famine followed in the wake of the drought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旱灾之后﹐饥荒紧随而来。

Sense.DEF: behind or after someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car left clouds of dust in its wake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车驶过，扬起团团尘土。

Sense.DEF: the time before or after a funeral when friends and relatives meet to remember the dead person
the track made behind a boat as it moves through the water
a short wide board that you stand on while you are pulled behind a boat, usually done as a sport

Subsense.DEF: not sleeping or unable to sleep
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She lay wakeful in her room for most of the night.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她躺在自己的房间里﹐一晚上大部分时间都不能入眠。

Subsense.DEF: a wakeful period of time is one when you cannot sleep

Sense.DEF: to wake up, or to wake someone up
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gently wakened the sleeping child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地唤醒睡梦中的孩子。

Sense.DEF: an experience or event that shocks you and makes you realize that you must do something to change a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The success of extremist groups in the elections should be a wake-up call to all decent citizens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极端主义团体在选举中获胜﹐这对于所有正派公民来 说应该是一个警示。

Sense.DEF: a telephone call that someone makes to you, especially at a hotel, to wake you up in the morning
used to tell someone in a humorous way to wake up
Sense.TRAN: 醒醒〔用于幽默地唤醒某人〕

Sense.DEF: all the time when you are awake
Sense.TRAN: 醒着的时刻/生活/日子等
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face haunted her every waking moment!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她醒着的每一刻﹐脑子里都是他的面容！

Sense.DEF: to move forward by putting one foot in front of the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How did you get here?’ ‘We walked.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你们是怎么来这里的？”“我们是步行来的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors said he’d never walk again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说他再也不能行走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carrie walked into the room and sat down in her chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽走进房间﹐坐在她的椅子上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He loved walking in the hills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢在山里散步。

GramExa.PROPFORM: walk a mile/200 metres/a short distance etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must have walked ten miles today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我们肯定走了有十英里路。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked all the way to San Rafael.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一路走到圣拉斐尔。

GramExa.GLOSS: near enough to be able to walk to
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在离酒店几步路的地方﹐有许多酒吧和餐馆。

GramExa.GLOSS: the speed that you normally walk at

Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere with someone, especially in order to make sure that they are safe or to be polite
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s late – I’ll walk you home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很晚了——我送你回家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Schools are urging parents to walk their children to school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校正在敦促家长护送孩子上学。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She walked me to the front gate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把我送到前门。

Sense.DEF: to take a dog for a walk for exercise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grandma’s out walking the dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶奶出去遛狗了。

Sense.DEF: if something has walked, it has disappeared and you think someone may have taken it
Sense.EXAMPLE: My pen seems to have walked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钢笔好像不翼而飞了。

Sense.DEF: to leave a court of law without being punished or sent to prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ferguson walked free after the charges were dropped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撤诉后﹐弗格森被无罪释放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If more evidence isn’t found, Harris will walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果找不到更多的证据﹐哈里斯将被无罪释放。

Subsense.DEF: to make a journey by walking
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If the last bus has gone, we’ll have to walk it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果末班车走了﹐我们只能步行。

Subsense.DEF: to succeed or win something easily

Sense.DEF: to be feeling extremely happy

Subsense.DEF: to walk around the streets in a town or city
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was not safe to walk the streets at night.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里走在街上不安全。

Subsense.DEF: to be a prostitute

Sense.DEF: when a police officer walks the beat, they walk around an area of a town or city in order to make sure nobody is committing a crime
to be proud and confident because you know that you have not done anything wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔因知道未做错事而〕理直气壮

Sense.DEF: to make someone tired by making them walk too far
Sense.TRAN: 走得某人腿都断了﹐使某人走得精疲力竭

Sense.DEF: to do the things that people expect or think are necessary in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: People are motivated by leaders who actually walk the walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导做该做的事﹐下面的人就会受到激励。

Sense.DEF: to be forced to walk along a board laid over the side of the ship until you fall off into the sea, used as a punishment in the past
Sense.TRAN: 走跳板〔旧时的一种惩罚﹐逼人在放于船舷的一块木板上走﹐直到掉入海里〕

Sense.DEF: to be very careful about how you behave with someone because they are easily upset or made angry
Sense.TRAN: 战战兢兢地行事﹐如履薄冰

Exponent.DEF: to move forward by putting one foot in front of the other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I missed the bus so I decided to walk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有赶上公共汽车﹐因此决定步行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve walked about eight miles today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我们走了大约八英里路。

Exponent.DEF: to walk without any clear purpose or direction
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They wandered around the narrow streets of the old city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在旧城区狭窄的街道上闲逛。

Exponent.DEF: to walk with long steps in a determined, confident, or angry way
Exponent.TRAN: 〔坚定﹑自信或愤怒地〕大踏步走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A man in a suit came striding purposefully into the hall.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穿套装的男子大步流星地直入大厅。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She strode onto the stage and began to address the audience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大步走到台上﹐开始对听众演讲。

Exponent.DEF: to walk first in one direction and then in another many times, especially because you are nervous
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nick was pacing up and down, waiting for the phone to ring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克踱来踱去﹐等着电话铃响。

Exponent.DEF: to walk quickly with firm regular steps – used especially about soldiers or someone who is angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The troops marched past with smart uniform and good discipline.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们穿着整洁漂亮的制服﹐军容整肃地齐步走过。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sheila marched into the office and demanded an apology.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉大步冲进办公室要求道歉。

Exponent.DEF: to walk through deep water
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had to wade across the river.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只好涉水过河。

Exponent.DEF: to walk putting your feet down very hard, especially because you are angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She turned and stomped off without looking back.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过身﹐头也不回地踏着重步走了。

Section.SECHEADING: TO WALK QUIETLY 轻轻地走

Exponent.DEF: to walk quietly and carefully on your toes because you do not want to make a noise
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tiptoed out trying not to wake the baby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我踮着脚走出去﹐尽量不吵醒宝宝。

Exponent.DEF: to walk quietly and slowly because you do not want anyone to see or hear you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因不想被看到或听到〕悄悄地走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stella crept up the stairs, hoping not to wake her parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉悄悄地上楼﹐希望不会吵醒父母。

Exponent.DEF: to walk quietly so that no-one notices you, especially because you are doing something you should not do
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因正在做不该做的事〕偷偷地走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They sneaked off without paying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没付钱就偷偷溜走了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I quickly sneaked out to have a cigarette.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迅速溜出去吸支烟。

Exponent.DEF: to walk quietly without wearing shoes – also used about cats and dogs walking quietly
Exponent.TRAN: 〔赤脚〕放轻脚步走﹔〔猫狗〕悄无声息地走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Michelle got up and padded barefoot down to the kitchen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 米歇尔起来﹐赤着脚轻轻地下楼去厨房。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cat padded in, asking for her food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫不声不响地进来讨食吃。

Section.SECHEADING: TO WALK SLOWLY 慢慢地走

Exponent.DEF: to walk in a slow tired way because it is difficult to continue walking, or you do not want to go somewhere
Exponent.TRAN: 缓慢而疲惫地走﹐艰难地走﹐步履沉重地走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The men trudged along the road, heads bent against the wind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人低着头﹐在路上艰难地顶风走着。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve spent hours trudging around the shops looking for a present.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经在商店里兜了好几个小时寻找礼物。

Exponent.DEF: to walk slowly in a tired way – often used about a horse, donkey etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指马﹑驴等〕吃力而缓慢地走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The donkey was plodding slowly along under its heavy load.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 驴子驮着重物﹐艰难地慢慢往前走。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I plodded on growing thirstier and hungrier.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我步履艰难地走着﹐越来越渴﹐越来越饿。

Exponent.DEF: to walk very slowly and noisily without lifting your feet off the ground
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The old man got up and shuffled to the door.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人站起来﹐慢慢地拖着脚朝门那边走去。

Section.SECHEADING: TO WALK WITH DIFFICULTY 艰难地走

Exponent.DEF: to walk with difficulty because one leg hurts, so that you put most of your weight on the other leg
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因一条腿受伤〕跛行﹐一瘸一拐地走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jake was limping because of the injury to his knee.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克因为膝盖受伤﹐走路一瘸一拐的。

Exponent.DEF: to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over, especially because you are drunk or have been injured
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因醉酒或受伤〕蹒跚﹐摇摇晃晃地走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They finally staggered back to the hotel at 4 o’clock in the morning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晨4点钟﹐他们终于蹒跚着走回了宾馆。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He hit her and she staggered and fell.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打了她﹐她一个踉跄倒了下去。

Exponent.DEF: to walk with difficulty in a slow and unsteady way because your legs or feet hurt or have been injured
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My new shoes were so painful I could only hobble along.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鞋夹得脚很痛﹐我只能瘸着走。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She hobbled out to the car on crutches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拄着拐杖﹐一瘸一拐地出来﹐走到汽车旁边。

Section.SECHEADING: TO WALK FOR PLEASURE 为乐趣行走

Exponent.DEF: to walk somewhere for pleasure
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We went for a walk in the park.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去公园散了步。

Exponent.DEF: to walk in a relaxed way, especially for pleasure
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People were strolling along beside the river.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在河边漫步。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: On Sunday, they went for a stroll in the park.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天他们去公园散步。

Exponent.DEF: to walk a long way in the mountains or countryside as an activity you enjoy
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在山区或乡间〕远足﹐徒步旅行
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’re going hiking in Scotland this summer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年夏天我们要去苏格兰徒步旅行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They hiked around the Lake District.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在湖区一带徒步旅行。

Exponent.DEF: to go for a walk lasting several days or weeks in a faraway place, carrying your clothes with you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔连续几天或几个星期在遥远的地方〕远足﹐徒步旅行
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve always wanted to go trekking in Nepal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直想去尼泊尔徒步旅行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They trekked up to Qomolangma Base Camp.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们长途步行到达珠穆朗玛峰大本营。

Sense.DEF: to leave a bad or difficult situation, instead of trying to make it better

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t just walk away from 15 years of marriage!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 15年的婚姻﹐你不能说放弃就放弃！

Sense.EXAMPLE: When the business started to have problems, it was very tempting to walk away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意中遇到困难时﹐会让人不禁想要放弃。

Sense.DEF: to come out of an accident or very bad situation without being harmed
Sense.TRAN: 从〔事故或险情中〕平安脱身
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miraculously, both drivers walked away without a scratch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名司机都奇迹般地死里逃生﹐毫发未损。

Sense.DEF: to win something easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: And the lucky winner will walk away with a prize of £10,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的优胜者将轻松赢得一万英镑的奖金。

Sense.DEF: to go into a room and accidentally interrupt someone who is doing something private that they would not want you to see
Sense.TRAN: 进屋撞见〔某人正在干不想让人看到的私事〕

Sense.DEF: to hit an object accidentally as you are walking along

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Zeke wasn’t looking and walked straight into a tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 齐克不看路﹐径直撞到了一棵树上。

Sense.DEF: if you walk into an unpleasant situation, you become involved in it without intending to
Sense.TRAN: 〔无意中〕陷入〔令人不快的境地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fairly certain now that he was walking into a trap, and wished he’d come armed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在非常肯定自己是落入了圈套﹐真希望自己是带着武器来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I walked right into a mob of maybe 50 young white guys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无意中走进了五十来个白人小子的包围中。

Sense.DEF: if you walk into a job, you get it very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t expect to walk straight into a job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别指望不费力气就能找到工作。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself look stupid when you could easily have avoided it if you had been more careful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You walked right into that one!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那都是你疏忽大意造成的！

Sense.DEF: to leave someone by walking away from them, especially in a rude or angry way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指无礼或愤怒地〕离开〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just walk off when I’m trying to talk to you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正要跟你说话呢﹐不要转身就走！

Sense.DEF: if you walk off an illness or unpleas­ant feeling, you go for a walk to make it go away
Sense.TRAN: 用散步来消除〔病痛或不快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go out – maybe I can walk this headache off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出去吧——说不定我走走头就不痛了。

GramExa.GLOSS: go for a walk so that your stomach feels less full
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 走路帮助消化晚餐/一顿饭等

Sense.DEF: to stop working as a protest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without new contracts, mine workers will walk off their jobs Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为没有新合同﹐煤矿工人将于星期四举行罢工。

Sense.DEF: to win something easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lottery winners can walk off with a cool £18 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中彩者能轻而易举地拿走足足1,800万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to steal something or take something that does not belong to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thieves walked off with two million dollars’ worth of jewellery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷偷走了价值200万美元的珠宝。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place suddenly, especially because you disapprove of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指由于反对某事而〕突然离开﹐退席
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play was awful and we walked out after half an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那出戏很糟糕﹐演了半小时我们就退场了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the issue that led to the US walking out of the trade talks this week
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致美国退出本周贸易会谈的问题

Sense.DEF: to leave your husband, wife etc suddenly and go and live somewhere else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband walked out, leaving her with three children to look after.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫离家而去﹐留下三个孩子要她抚养。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five years later she walked out on Matthew and their two boys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年之后她抛弃了马修和他们的两个儿子。

Sense.DEF: to leave your job suddenly because you no longer want to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re so short-staffed. I can’t just walk out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们人手这么紧缺﹐我不能说走就走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you can afford to walk out of your job, why not?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你有足够的钱可以不用工作﹐为什么不辞职呢？

Sense.DEF: to stop working as a protest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers are threatening to walk out if an agreement is not reached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们威胁说﹐如果不能达成协议就举行罢工。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something you have agreed to do or that you are responsible for
Sense.TRAN: 不履行〔答应了或有责任做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I never walk out on a deal,’ Dee said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “说好的事我决不反悔。”迪伊说。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly by always making them do what you want them to do
Sense.TRAN: 苛刻地对待〔某人﹐指对其随意驱使〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s terrible – she lets her kids just walk all over her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太糟糕了——她就听任孩子们的摆布。

Sense.DEF: a journey that you make by walking, especially for exercise or enjoyment
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了锻炼或娱乐的〕步行﹔散步
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a long walk. Maybe we should get the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走着去很远﹐或许我们应该乘公共汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a walk through the castle grounds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 步行穿过城堡庭院

Sense.DEF: a particular journey that you make by walking, especially one that goes through an interesting or attractive area
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指穿越有趣或吸引人的地方的〕徒步旅行
Sense.EXAMPLE: He says he’s going on a long walk tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说明天要作一次长途步行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you ever done the Three Peaks walk?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去三峰山徒步旅行过吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a stunning 10-mile coastal walk from St Andrews to Crail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从圣安德鲁斯沿海滨步行到克雷尔﹐可以看到十英里令人惊叹的美景。

Sense.DEF: an organized event when people walk for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s all go on the beach walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家都去海滩走走吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local tourist office organises a number of guided walks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地旅游局组织了一些有导游带领的徒步旅行。

Sense.DEF: the way someone walks
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can often recognize people by their walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你往往可以从走路的姿态辨认出一个人。

Sense.DEF: when you walk rather than run
Sense.EXAMPLE: Breathless, she slowed to a walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上气不接下气﹐放慢速度走了起来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a walk on the beach.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到海滩上散步去吧。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She took a walk through the town.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她步行穿过镇子。

Collocate.COLLOC: take sb/a dog for a walk

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We went for a long walk in the woods.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去树林里走了很久。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The house is only a short walk from local shops.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子离当地的商店只有短短几步路。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I just felt like a little walk.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想稍稍散个步。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 五英里/十公里等的步行距离
五分钟/两小时等的步行路程

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘go a walk’ or 或 ‘make a walk’. Say 而要说 go for a walk.

Sense.DEF: an occasion when an important person walks through a crowd, talking informally to people
Sense.TRAN: 〔重要人物〕深入群众闲话家常
Sense.EXAMPLE: The press conference was followed by a walkabout and a factory visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻发布会之后是亲民活动和参观工厂。

Sense.DEF: to get lost – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 消失﹐不翼而飞〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My watch has gone walkabout again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的手表又不翼而飞了。

Sense.DEF: an easy victory
someone who walks for pleasure or exercise
Sense.TRAN: 〔以自娱或锻炼为目的的〕步行者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is popular with walkers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方很受徒步者欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: climbers and hill-walkers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山者和山地徒步旅行者

Sense.DEF: someone who walks fast, slowly etc
a metal frame on wheels that old or sick people use to help them walk
Sense.TRAN: 〔老人或病人用的〕有轮助行架

Sense.DEF: a frame on wheels that a baby can sit in and move around using its legs, before it can walk
used to tell a dog that you are going to take it for a walk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, Shep! Walkies!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐谢普！散步去！

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of radios that you can carry with you, and use to speak to the person who has the other radio
big enough for a person to walk inside
Sense.TRAN: 大得能容人走进的﹐步入式的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a walk-in closet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步入式壁橱

Sense.DEF: a business, doctor’s office etc that you can use or go to without having previously arranged a time to do this
Sense.TRAN: 无需预约的业务/诊所/中心等

Sense.DEF: the activity or sport of going for walks, especially in the countryside or mountains
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在乡村或山中的〕徒步旅行
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went walking in the hills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去山里徒步了。

GramExa.GLOSS: a holiday on which you walk a lot, especially in the countryside
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 徒步旅行假日/徒步旅行等

Sense.DEF: the sport of walking long distances as fast as you can without actually running
someone who knows a lot, and always has the information that you want – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 活字典/百科全书〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone who always drops things, has accidents, makes mistakes etc – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 倒霉鬼﹐活灾区 〔形容经常丢东西﹑发生意外﹑犯错误等的人﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a group of children who walk to or from school together, with other children and their parents joining the group at different places along the way
Sense.TRAN: 结伴步行上下学的儿童

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that they must leave a place or a job
Sense.TRAN: 给某人发解雇通知书﹐辞退某人

Sense.DEF: a stick that is used to support someone, especially an old person, while they walk
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指老人步行时用的〕手杖﹐拐杖

Sense.DEF: a small cassette player with headphones, that you carry with you so that you can listen to music
the position in society someone has, especially the type of job they have
Sense.TRAN: 社会阶层﹔〔尤指〕行业﹐职业

GramExa.PROPFORM: from every walk of life/from all walks of life
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our volunteers include people from all walks of life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的志愿者包括各界人士。

Sense.DEF: a small acting part with no words to say in a play or film, or an actor who has a part like this
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧或影片的〕跑龙套角色﹐无台词的小角色﹔龙套演员

Sense.DEF: someone who plays for a college sports team without having been given a sports scholarship
Sense.TRAN: 〔未获得体育奖学金的〕大学运动队成员

Sense.DEF: an occasion when people stop working or leave a meeting as a protest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Members of the Irish delegation staged a walk-out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱尔兰代表团成员全体退席表示抗议。

Sense.DEF: a very easy victory
written instructions that tell you all the details of how you should play a video game
Sense.TRAN: 〔电子游戏的〕玩法说明﹐通关攻略

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the official walkthrough for ‘Tomb Raider’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方发布的《古墓丽影》通关攻略

Sense.DEF: a tall building with apartments in it that does not have an elevator
an apartment, office etc in a building like this
Sense.TRAN: 无电梯大楼里的公寓房[办公室等]

Sense.DEF: an outdoor path built for people to walk along, often above the ground
Sense.TRAN: 人行通道﹐连廊〔建于户外﹐常高出地面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airport hotel will be linked to the terminal building by a covered walkway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场酒店将由一条有顶通道和航站楼相连。

Sense.DEF: an upright flat structure made of stone or brick, that divides one area from another or surrounds an area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The estate is surrounded by high stone walls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 庄园的四周是高高的石墙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ancient city walls
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的城墙

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Great Wall of China
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国的长城
Sense.EXAMPLE: We climbed over the wall into the orchard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们翻墙进了果园。

Sense.DEF: one of the sides of a room or building

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I put some pictures up on the walls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在墙上挂了几幅照片。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob leaned against the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃靠在墙上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We decided to paint the bathroom walls blue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定把浴室墙壁漆成蓝色。

Sense.DEF: the side of something hollow, especially within the body
Sense.TRAN: 〔空心物﹐尤指体内器官的〕内壁
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls of the blood vessels had been damaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血管壁已经受损。
Sense.EXAMPLE: cell walls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细胞壁

Sense.DEF: a tall mass of something such as fire or water, that stops anything from getting past
Sense.TRAN: 〔使任何东西都无法通过的高大〕火墙/水墙等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boat was hit by a wall of water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船被一道水幕击中。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which nobody will tell you what you want to know
Sense.TRAN: 默不作声/秘而不宣〔指想知道某事却无人回应〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police investigation was met with a wall of silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的调查工作受阻﹐谁都闭口不言。

Sense.DEF: very angry or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: That noise is driving me up the wall making me annoyed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那声音都快把我逼疯了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to be on time or Sarah will go up the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一定得准时﹐否则萨拉要发火的。

Sense.DEF: very strange or unusual, often in an amusing way
Sense.TRAN: 古怪的﹔不同寻常的﹔奇妙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of Krista’s ideas are a little off the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克丽丝塔的一些想法有点新奇古怪。

Sense.DEF: if a company goes to the wall, it fails, especially because of financial difficulties
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公司因财务困难而〕破产﹐倒闭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many small investors will go to the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多小投资者将会破产。

Sense.DEF: the room that you are in, especially considered as a private place
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人所在的〕房间〔尤被视为私人的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want anything repeated outside these four walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望这些话出了这个屋子就不要再说了。

Sense.DEF: to reach a point where you cannot make progress, especially because something or someone is stopping you
Sense.EXAMPLE: We seem to have come up against a brick wall in this investigation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这次调查似乎碰壁了。

Sense.DEF: to be feeling extremely anxious, unhappy, or annoyed, especially because you are waiting for something or are in a situation which you cannot get away from
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因等待某事或不能做某事而〕极度焦急﹔不满﹔不耐烦﹔心烦意乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids soon had him climbing the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们不久就搞得他心烦意乱。

Sense.DEF: used to warn people to be careful what they say, because other people, especially enemies, could be listening
to reach the point when you are most physically tired when doing a sport

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have your back to/against the wall
be (like) banging your head against a brick wall
like talking to a brick wall
the writing is on the wall

Sense.DEF: to surround an open area with walls
to keep one area or room separate from another, by building a wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: The control room is walled off by soundproof glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制室是用隔音玻璃隔起来的。

Subsense.DEF: to fill in an entrance, window etc with bricks or stone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The entrance had long since been walled up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入口处早就被堵死了。

Subsense.DEF: to fill in all the entrances and windows of a place so that someone cannot get out

Sense.DEF: to keep someone as a prisoner in a building
an Australian animal like a small kangaroo
someone who does a particular kind of job or duty – used in India and Pakistan
Sense.TRAN: 从事某种工作的人〔用于印度和巴基斯坦〕

Sense.DEF: a large piece of paper with information on it that is fastened to a wall
a garden etc that has a wall around it
Sense.TRAN: 有围墙的花园/有城墙的城市/有城墙的城镇等

Sense.DEF: a small flat case, often made of leather, that you carry in your pocket, for holding paper money, bank cards etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve only got about £10 in my wallet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钱包里只有大概十英镑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a credit card out of his wallet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从钱包里拿出一张信用卡。

Sense.DEF: a case for documents, often made of leather or plastic
having one or both eyes that seem to point to the side, rather than straight forwards
someone at a party, dance etc who is not asked to dance or take part in the activities
Sense.TRAN: 壁花〔指在聚会﹑舞会等中没被邀请跳舞或参加活动的人〕

Sense.DEF: a sweet-smelling garden plant with yellow and red flowers
Sense.TRAN: 桂竹香〔庭园植物﹐气味清香﹐开黄色和红色的花〕

Sense.DEF: attached to a wall

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 壁钟/挂壁式加热器/壁灯等

Sense.DEF: to hit someone or something very hard, especially with your hand
to hit someone hard several times as a punishment, or to be hit in this way
Sense.TRAN: 给某人/遭到一顿痛打〔以示惩罚〕

Sense.DEF: very big

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a walloping great house
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢非常大的房子

Sense.DEF: to seem to enjoy being sad etc, especially because you get sympathy from other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因为得到他人同情而〕沉湎于自怜/绝望/失败等〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d been feeling sorry for himself, wallowing in self-pity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直自哀自怜﹐无法自拔。

Sense.DEF: if an animal or person wallows, it rolls around in mud, water etc for pleasure or to keep cool
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物、人为取乐或保持凉爽在泥﹑水等中〕打滚
Sense.EXAMPLE: hippos wallowing in the mud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在泥浆中打滚的河马

Sense.DEF: if a ship or boat wallows, it moves with difficulty through a rough sea
a picture that has been painted directly onto a wall, especially a fresco
paper that you stick onto the walls of a room in order to decorate it
the colour, pattern, or picture which you have as the background on the screen of a computer
to put wallpaper onto the walls of a room
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t finished wallpapering the bedroom yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没给卧室贴完墙纸。

Sense.DEF: a street in New York which is the most important financial centre in America
Sense.TRAN: 华尔街〔纽约市的一条街﹐是美国最重要的金融中心〕

Sense.DEF: the American stock market
Sense.TRAN: 华尔街〔指美国股票市场〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drop in share prices on Wall Street
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华尔街的股价下跌

Sense.DEF: the sudden large fall in the value of company shares on the US Stock Exchange in October 1929. For about two years before this, the price of shares had risen very fast, and when people realized that companies were therefore worth more than their true value, they lost confidence. The severe fall that followed led directly to the Great Depression of the 1930s.
Sense.TRAN: 华尔街股灾〔1929年10月美国纽约证券交易所的股价暴跌﹐直接导致20世纪30年代的经济大萧条〕

Sense.DEF: covering the whole floor
Sense.EXAMPLE: wall-to-wall carpeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺满整个地板的地毯

Sense.DEF: filling all the space or time available, especially in a way you do not like
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指令人讨厌地〕占满所有空间[时间]的﹐无所不在的﹐无孔不入的
Sense.EXAMPLE: wall-to-wall advertising on TV
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视上无孔不入的广告

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a silly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop being such a wally!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别犯傻了！

Sense.DEF: a nut that you can eat, shaped like a human brain
Sense.EXAMPLE: coffee and walnut cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡核桃蛋糕

Sense.DEF: a tree that produces this type of nut
the wood from a walnut tree, often used to make furniture
a large sea animal with two long tusksthings like teeth coming down from the sides of its mouth
a fairly slow dance with a regular pattern of three beats
a piece of music intended for this type of dance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Strauss waltz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施特劳斯的圆舞曲

Sense.DEF: to dance a waltz
Sense.EXAMPLE: They waltzed elegantly around the dance floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在舞池里优雅地跳着华尔兹舞。

Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere calmly and confidently – used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jeff just waltzed up to the bar and helped himself to a drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫大摇大摆地走到吧台﹐给自己弄了一杯喝的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She can’t waltz in here and start making changes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不能大摇大摆地跑到这里来动手改这改那的。

Sense.DEF: to take something without permission or without realizing that you have done this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe must have waltzed off with my jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯定是乔拿走了我的外套。

Sense.DEF: to pass an examination, win a game etc very well and without any difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 轻松通过〔考试〕﹔轻易获胜

Sense.DEF: shells put into strings, belts etc, used in the past as money by Native Americans
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时美洲土著居民用作货币的〕贝壳串﹐贝壳带

Sense.DEF: looking pale, weak, or tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a wan smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无力地笑了一下。

Sense.DEF: a thin stick that you hold in your hand to do magic tricks

GramExa.GLOSS: move a wand about to make something magical happen
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t just wave a magic wand and make it all better.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可没本事一挥魔棒就把什么都变好。

Sense.DEF: a tool that looks like a thin stick
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mascara wand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睫毛膏棒

Sense.DEF: to move a small scanner over something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were wanded by security guards before being allowed in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被保安人员用扫描器进行扫描安检后才被允许进入。

Sense.DEF: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll wander around the mall for half an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会在商场里逛半小时。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She wandered aimlessly about the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她漫无目的地在房子里走来走去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ana wandered off to get a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜溜达着去弄了一杯喝的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was found wandering the streets of New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人看到他在纽约街头游荡。

Sense.DEF: to walk away from where you are supposed to stay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

Sense.DEF: if your mind, thoughts etc wander, you no longer pay attention to something, especially because you are bored or worried
Sense.TRAN: 〔因厌倦或焦虑而注意力〕不集中﹐走神
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Snell’s mind wandered and the voices went on and on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯内尔太太走神了﹐而说话声依然不绝于耳。

Sense.DEF: to start to talk about something not related to the main subject that you were talking about before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pauline started to wander from the point.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保利娜开始偏题了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has become unable to think clearly, especially because they are old
Sense.TRAN: 某人〔尤因年老而〕头脑糊涂[思路不清]

Sense.DEF: if your eyes or your gaze wander, you look around slowly at different things or at all parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His gaze wandered round the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他环视房间。

Sense.DEF: if a road or a river wanders somewhere, it does not go straight but in curves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Missouri River wanders across several states.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 密苏里河蜿蜒流经几个州。

Sense.DEF: if a man’s hands wander, he touches the body of a woman he is with, especially where she does not want him to
Sense.TRAN: 〔男人的手〕在女人的身上摸来摸去〔尤指女人不情愿时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful, he’s got wandering hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心点﹐他的手不老实。

Sense.DEF: a short relaxed walk

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a bit of a wander round the shops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我逛了一会儿商店。

Sense.DEF: a person who moves from place to place and has no permanent home
journeys to places where you do not stay for very long
Sense.EXAMPLE: his wanderings through the Australian outback
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在澳大利亚内陆的漫游

Sense.DEF: a strong desire to travel to different places
if something such as power, influence, or a feeling wanes, it becomes gradually less strong or less important
Sense.TRAN: 〔权力﹑影响或感觉等〕逐渐减弱[变小]
Sense.EXAMPLE: My enthusiasm for the project was waning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这个项目的热情逐渐减退了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group’s influence had begun to wane by this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此时﹐这个团体的影响力已经开始减弱。

Sense.DEF: when the moon wanes, you gradually see less of it
becoming smaller, weaker, or less important
Sense.TRAN: 正在减小[减弱]﹔日渐衰败
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the 5th century, the power of the Roman Empire was on the wane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到5世纪时﹐罗马帝国的势力逐渐衰落。

Sense.DEF: to get something, or arrange for something to happen, by cleverly persuading or tricking someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the end she wangled an invitation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后她搞到了一张请帖。

GramExa.PROPFORM: wangle your way out of/into sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wangled my way into art school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法混进了艺术学校。

Sense.DEF: to masturbate
an act of masturbation
something which you think is very stupid, useless, or of bad quality
Sense.TRAN: 愚蠢的东西﹔无用之物﹔讨厌的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: This music’s a load of wank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这音乐糟透了。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a boy or man who you think is stupid or unpleasant. Do not use this word.
a short form of ‘want to’ or ‘want a’, used in writing to show how people sound when they speak
Sense.TRAN: 想要﹔想要个〔want to 或 want a 的缩略形式﹐用于书面语中表示说话者的发音〕

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to look or behave like someone famous or like a particular type of successful person, because they want to be like them – usually used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 仿效名人[富人]的人〔一般含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a load of Michael Schumacher wannabes trying to show what they can do on the track
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多想像迈克尔•舒马赫那样在赛车场上一展身手的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: wannabe pop stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想当流行歌星的人

Sense.DEF: to have a desire for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really want a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很想喝一杯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you want for your birthday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你生日想要什么礼物？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d always wanted to go to Thailand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直想去泰国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want Linda to hear about this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让琳达听到这事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want the holiday to end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不希望假期结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can order whatever you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想要什么随便点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This shampoo is mild enough to use every day if you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种洗发液很温和﹐你想天天用都可以。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she doesn’t get what she wants, she’s not happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要是得不到想要的就不开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted that job so badly he was willing to kill for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常想得到那份工作﹐哪怕要为此去杀人他都愿意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They desperately wanted a son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们非常想要个儿子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What I want to know is when we’re going to get paid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想知道的是我们何时能拿到报酬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All I want is the chance to prove myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想有个机会证明自己。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh thank you, it’s just what I’ve always wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐谢谢你﹐这正是我一直想要的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you need something or to ask someone firmly to do something for you
Sense.TRAN: 需要〔某物〕﹔要〔某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you still want these magazines, or can I throw them out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些杂志你还需要吗﹐还是可以扔掉了？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want that letter typed today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要那封信今天就打好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want you to find out what they’re planning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要你查明他们有什么计划。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make you want to cry/throw up etc
GramExa.GLOSS: give you a strong feeling that you must do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It always makes me want to sneeze.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它总让我想打喷嚏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you want with a tool kit what do you need it for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要工具箱干什么？

GramExa.GLOSS: need to be done
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The carpet really wants cleaning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块地毯真的需要清洗了。

Sense.DEF: used when offering or suggesting something to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want a drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要喝点什么吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want me to come with you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要我和你一起去吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Want a game of chess?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想不想下盘棋？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who wants a cup of coffee used to offer something to a group of people?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁要咖啡？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is sensible or that someone should do it, especially when giving advice
Sense.TRAN: 理应﹐应该〔尤用于提建议〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You might want to install anti-virus software.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许应该安装杀毒软件。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say something would not be a good idea
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t want to come here at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想晚上到这地方来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You want to see a doctor about that cough.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该找医生看一下咳嗽。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t want to leave that – it’ll get wet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该就让它那么放着﹐会弄湿的。

Sense.DEF: used to ask, often in a slightly rude way, what someone wants you to give them, do for them etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you want now? I’m busy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会儿你想要什么？我忙着呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you want – chocolate or vanilla?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想要什么﹐巧克力味的还是香草味的？

Sense.DEF: to ask for someone to come and talk to you, or to come to a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 要求〔某人〕到来﹔要求与〔某人〕谈话﹔要〔某人〕到某地
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re wanted on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有你的电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christine wants you in her office now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯蒂娜要你现在就到她办公室去。

Sense.DEF: to suffer because you do not have something
Sense.TRAN: 缺乏﹐缺少〔某物﹐因而受苦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In many poorer countries, people still want basic food and shelter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在许多贫困国家﹐人们仍然缺少必需的食物和住处。

Subsense.DEF: used to offer to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 如果你想的话〔用于表示愿意做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll come with you if you want.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想的话﹐我就陪你一起去。

Subsense.DEF: used to invite someone to do something or to give them permission
Subsense.TRAN: 如果你想的话〔用于邀请或允许某人做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Join in if you want.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你想的话就一起来吧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can stay if you want to.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想留下就留下吧。

Subsense.DEF: used when someone suggests doing something, to say that you will do it, although you do not especially want to
Subsense.TRAN: 如果你想的话〔用于表示自己虽然不太乐意﹐但还是会做对方建议的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hey, shall we go to the beach?’ ‘If you want.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “嘿﹐我们去海滩怎么样？”“好吧，如果你想去的话。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not like something or do not think that it is worth doing
Sense.TRAN: 谁想要…？〔表示不喜欢某物﹐或认为某事不值得去做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who wants to go to a noisy disco anyway?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 算了吧﹐谁想去闹哄哄的迪斯科舞厅？

Sense.LEXUNIT: I just wanted to say/know etc
Sense.DEF: used to politely say something, ask about something etc
Sense.TRAN: 我只想说/知道等〔用于礼貌地说或询问某事等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just wanted to check that the meeting is still on next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就想问问清楚﹐会议是否仍定在下星期。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I don’t want to sound/be ..., but ...
Sense.DEF: used to be polite when you are going to tell someone something that may upset them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to sound rude, but I think you’ve had too much to drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想显得无礼﹐不过你已经喝得太多了。

Sense.DEF: if you want someone, you want to have sex with them
Sense.TRAN: 想要﹐要〔指想和某人发生性关系〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: not want for sth/want for nothing
Sense.DEF: to have something you need, or everything you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: Say what you like, my kids never wantedfor anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便你怎么说﹐反正我的孩子从来都不缺什么。

Sense.DEF: to want to be involved in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You want in, Mike?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想加入吗﹐迈克？

Sense.DEF: to want to go into a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog wants in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗想进来。

Sense.DEF: to want to stop being involved in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was fed up and she wanted out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她厌倦了﹐想退出。

Sense.DEF: to want to leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think the cat wants out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这猫想出去。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not have or cannot find what you need in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gallery closed down for want of funding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家画廊由于缺乏资金关闭了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: for want of a better word/phrase etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot find an exact word or phrase to describe something
Sense.TRAN: 没有更贴切的词语/短语等〔用于表示找不到确切的说法来形容某事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They should behave, for want of a better word, decently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该表现得﹐怎么说呢﹐得体些吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that even though something did not happen or succeed, it was not because you did not try hard enough or have what you needed
Sense.TRAN: 并非因为没有…〔用于表示尽管某事没有发生或成功﹐但这并非因为没有尽力或没有所需的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Well, if he doesn’t get the job it won’t be for want of trying!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐就算他得不到那份工作﹐那也并非是他没有尽力！

Sense.LEXUNIT: for want of anything better (to do)
Sense.DEF: if you do something for want of anything better, you do it only because there is nothing else you want to do
Sense.TRAN: 既然没有更好的事(可做)〔表示做某事只是因为没有别的事想做〕

Sense.DEF: something that you need but do not have
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disgraceful want of proper care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏妥善照料的不光彩现象

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you do not have enough food, money, clothes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔食品﹑金钱﹑衣服等的〕匮乏﹔贫困
Sense.EXAMPLE: the chronic want and deprivation in the townships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇区的长期贫困现象

Sense.DEF: to need something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house is sadly in want of repair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子急需修缮。

Sense.DEF: someone who is wanted is being looked for by the police
Sense.TRAN: 被警方追捕的﹐被通缉的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is wanted for the murder of a teenage girl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因涉嫌谋杀一名少女而被警方通缉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most wanted men in China
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国的头号通缉犯之一

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who is wanted is loved and cared for
something that is wanting lacks or misses something that it needs or something that you expect it to have
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their security procedures were found wanting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的保安程序被发现有漏洞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were skilled, but wanting in discipline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们技术熟练﹐但是纪律不足。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A certain humanity is wanting in big cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大城市里少了一些人情味。

Sense.DEF: deliberately harming someone or damaging something for no reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: an act of wanton aggression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肆无忌惮的侵略行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wanton disregard for life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对生命的全然漠视

Sense.DEF: a wanton woman is considered immoral because she has sex with a lot of men
uncontrolled
Sense.EXAMPLE: wanton growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁芜的生长

Sense.DEF: a system that uses radio waves to allow electronic equipment that is not physically attached to a computer, for example a mobile phone, to use the Internet
a large North American deer
when there is fighting between two or more countries or between opposing groups within a country, involving large numbers of soldiers and weapons
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Vietnam War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越南战争
Sense.EXAMPLE: He served as a pilot during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在战时担任飞行员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the war with Spain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与西班牙的战争

Sense.DEF: a struggle over a long period of time to control something harmful
Sense.TRAN: 〔为控制有害事物而进行的长期的〕斗争

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the State’s war on drugs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家针对毒品的斗争

Sense.EXAMPLE: the war against racism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对种族主义的斗争

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a person or group is fighting for power, influence, or control
Sense.TRAN: 〔个人或团体为取得权力﹑影响力或控制权进行的〕斗争﹐竞争
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one wants to start a trade war here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里没有人想挑起一场贸易战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ratings war between the major TV networks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各大电视网之间的收视率之争

Sense.DEF: used, often humorously, to say that someone has lots of injuries or health problems
Sense.TRAN: 身上有多处伤痛﹔患有多种疾病〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve really been in the wars lately, haven’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近你毛病很多﹐是吗？

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that you are ready to fight or argue about something
Sense.TRAN: 这意味着战争〔表示已准备好为某事物而斗争或争论﹔幽默用法〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The two countries fought a brief war in 1995.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1995年﹐这两个国家曾短期交战。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take part as a soldier
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her grandfather fought in the war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她祖父参加了这场战争。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Allies had won the war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 同盟国取得了战争的胜利。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In 1941, Britain and the US declared war on Japan.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1941年﹐英国和美国对日宣战。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to start and continue a war
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their aim was to destroy the country’s capacity to wage war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的目的是要摧毁这个国家发动战争的能力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become involved in a war
it starts

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Russia was at war with Poland.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄国当时在和波兰交战。

Collocate.COLLOC: be on the brink of war
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be about to be involved in a war
the time when a war starts

Collocate.EXAMPLE: No one wants another world war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人想再来一次世界大战。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: between opposing groups within a country
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the English Civil War
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国内战

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: involving nuclear weapons
not nuclear
involving a small unofficial military group

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 朝鲜战争/越南战争/伊拉克战争等
第一次世界大战/第二次世界大战

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you believe is right

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The couple spent most of the war years apart.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对夫妇在战争年代大部分时间不在一起。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: At home he was hailed as a war hero.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在国内他被誉为战斗英雄。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who took part in a war
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 参加过战争的退伍军人

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who behaves very cruelly in a war, in a way that is against international law
a reporter sending reports from a war
an area where a war is fought
a cruel act in a war which is against international law

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘do the war’. Say 而要说 go to war or 或 make war.

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which there is fighting between countries or opposing groups within a country, with large numbers of soldiers and weapons
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He fought in World War II.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参加过第二次世界大战。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the horrors of war
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的恐怖

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which there is fighting or a war – used especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 冲突﹐战争〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the conflict in the Middle East
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中东的冲突
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is increasing danger of armed conflict.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生武装冲突的可能性越来越大。

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which people or groups fight each other and try to kill each other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fighting went on for months.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗持续了好几个月。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fighting in the north has resulted in hundreds of deaths.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 北部的战斗已造成数百人死亡。

Exponent.DEF: fighting in a war
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The agreement called on the guerrillas to cease hostilities stop fighting and begin peace talks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议呼吁游击队停止敌对行动﹐展开和平谈判。

Exponent.DEF: the activity of fighting in a war – used especially to talk about a method of fighting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: new and more advanced methods of warfare
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 更为先进的新式作战方法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: chemical warfare
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学战

Exponent.DEF: an occasion when two armies, groups of ships etc fight each other in one place during a war
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the great naval battles of the Napoleonic Wars
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿破仑战争中的大海战
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1805年特拉法尔加海战
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He died in battle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他阵亡了。

Exponent.DEF: a short fight between small groups of soldiers, ships etc, especially one that happens away from the main part of a war or battle
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were minor skirmishes between Indian and Pakistani troops across the border.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度和巴基斯坦的军队在边境上发生了小规模冲突。

Exponent.DEF: the act of fighting, especially during a war
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Few of them had any experience of combat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们当中没几个有战斗经验。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hand-to-hand combat
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉搏战

Exponent.DEF: military actions carried out by the army, navy etc of a country during a war – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 军事行动﹐战斗〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was killed in action in 1944.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于1944年阵亡。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her son went missing in action.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的儿子在战斗中失踪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her grandfather saw action fought in two world wars.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的祖父参加过两次世界大战。

Sense.DEF: (1863–1869) a novel by the Russian writer Leo Tolstoy, set during the Napoleonic Wars and considered by many people to be one of the greatest novels ever written. It is sometimes mentioned as being a very typical example of an extremely long book.
Sense.TRAN: 《战争与和平》〔1863–1869﹐俄国作家列夫•托尔斯泰所著以拿破仑战争为背景的长篇小说﹐被许多人认为是有史以来最伟大的小说之一﹐有时用于指篇幅极长的书的典型〕

Sense.DEF: to sing with a high continuous but quickly changing sound, the way a bird does
to sing, especially not very well – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 唱〔尤指唱得不好﹔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mills warbled a few notes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米尔斯凑合着唱了几个音。

Sense.DEF: a bird that can make musical sounds
a singer, especially one who does not sing very well – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指唱得不好的〕歌手〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the activity of drawing symbols on the pavement to show the position of a wireless Internet network which hackers can use to make a free connection to the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 无线上网标记〔指在路面上标示出无线网络的位置﹐黑客可以在这些位置免费上网〕

Sense.DEF: the money that a government has available to spend on war
the money that a politician or organization has available to spend on achieving something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s huge war chest could be used to improve transport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的这笔巨额专款可用于改善交通。

Sense.DEF: a cruel act done during a war which is illegal under international law
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was put on trial for war crimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因战争罪接受审判。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an international war crimes tribunal court judging war crimes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际战争罪行法庭

Sense.DEF: a shout used by people fighting in a battle to show their courage and frighten the enemy
Sense.TRAN: 〔作战时显示勇气和震慑敌人的〕喊杀声﹐呐喊

Sense.DEF: a large room in a hospital where people who need medical treatment stay

GramExa.GLOSS: a ward for people with a particular medical condition
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 产科/普通/老年科等病房

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a young nurse in her first day on the wards
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一天进入病房的年轻护士

Sense.EXAMPLE: the other patients in the ward
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病房里的其他病人

Sense.DEF: one of the small areas that a city has been divided into for the purpose of local elections
Sense.TRAN: 〔城市中为本地选举而划分的〕选区

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who is under the legal protection of another person or of a law court
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was made a ward of court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被判由法院监护。

Sense.DEF: to do something to try to protect yourself from something bad, such as illness, danger, or attack
Sense.TRAN: 防止﹐抵挡〔疾病﹑危险或攻击等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget insect repellent to ward off the mosquitoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了带上防蚊子的驱虫剂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spell to ward off evil spirits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 避邪的咒语

Sense.DEF: towards a particular direction or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: our homeward journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们归家的旅程
Sense.EXAMPLE: a downward movement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向下移动

Sense.DEF: a dance performed by tribes in preparation for battle or to celebrate a victory
Sense.TRAN: 〔原始部落作战前或庆祝胜利时跳的〕战舞

Sense.DEF: a person who is responsible for a particular place and whose job is to make sure its rules are obeyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔监督规章制度执行的〕监察员﹐管理人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the warden of the college
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院的院长

Sense.DEF: the person in charge of a prison
someone who takes care of a building and the people in it, for example a place such as a home for old people
someone who works in a prison guarding the prisoners
a piece of furniture like a large cupboard that you hang clothes in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you hang these in the wardrobe, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把这些衣服挂到衣橱里去好吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: wardrobes built against a wall or fitted between two walls

Sense.DEF: the clothes that someone has
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can win a complete new wardrobe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以赢得各式齐全的新衣服。

GramExa.GLOSS: the clothes you have for a particular time of year

Sense.DEF: a department in a theatre, television company etc that deals with the clothes worn by actors
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院﹑电视台等的〕服装部﹐戏装管理部

Sense.DEF: an occasion when your clothing accidentally shows a part of your body that you want to be covered – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 走光〔指衣服意外敞开暴露身体某一部位﹔幽默说法〕

Sense.DEF: the space in a warship where the officers live and eat, except for the captain
Sense.TRAN: 〔军舰上除舰长外的军官使用的〕军官起居室

Sense.DEF: towards a particular direction or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re travelling northwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在向北方前进。
Sense.EXAMPLE: look skywards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝天上看

Sense.DEF: things made of a particular material, especially for use in the home
Sense.EXAMPLE: glassware glass bowls, glasses etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃器皿
Sense.EXAMPLE: silverware silver spoons, knives etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银餐具

Sense.DEF: things used in a particular place for the preparation or serving of food
Sense.EXAMPLE: ovenware dishes for use in the oven
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤箱用器皿
Sense.EXAMPLE: tableware plates, glasses, knives etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐具

Sense.DEF: things used in operating a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: software programs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件
Sense.EXAMPLE: shareware programs which can be shared via the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共享软件

Sense.DEF: things done by all the people in a country to help when that country is at war
a large building for storing large quantities of goods
a type of store that sells things in large amounts, so that you can buy them at a lower price than at normal stores
the business or practice of storing large quantities of goods, especially in warehouses
Sense.EXAMPLE: warehousing costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仓储成本
Sense.EXAMPLE: warehousing and distribution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仓储和分销

Sense.DEF: things that are for sale, usually not in a shop
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般不在商店内出售的〕商品﹐货物
Sense.EXAMPLE: craftspeople selling their wares
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售自制产品的手艺人

Sense.DEF: the activity of fighting in a war – used especially when talking about particular methods of fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: the realities of modern warfare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代战争的真实面貌

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 堑壕战/丛林战/山地战等

GramExa.GLOSS: fighting by small groups of fighters in mountains, forests etc

Sense.DEF: a continuous and often violent struggle or argument between different groups
Sense.TRAN: 不同集团之间的〕斗争﹐冲突

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the problems of drugs and gang warfare
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品和黑帮冲突问题

Sense.DEF: an activity in which soldiers fight an imaginary battle in order to test military plans
a game played by adults in which models of soldiers, guns, horses etc are moved around a table, or a similar game played on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔成人在桌上或计算机上玩的〕战争游戏

Sense.DEF: the explosive part at the front of a missile
a soldier or politician who has been in their job a long time, and enjoys dealing with all the difficulties involved in it
Sense.TRAN: 沙场老将〔指资历深﹑喜欢挑战的军人或政治家〕

Sense.DEF: a horse used in battle
liking war and being skilful in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warlike nation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好战的民族

Sense.DEF: threatening war or attack
Sense.TRAN: 以战争相威胁的﹐进行战争恫吓的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warlike stance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争姿态

Sense.DEF: a man who has magical powers, especially evil powers
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指有邪恶力量的〕男巫﹐术士

Sense.DEF: the leader of an unofficial military group fighting against a government, king, or different group
slightly hot, especially in a pleasant way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was lovely and warm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子漂亮温暖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope we get some warm weather soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望天气很快就会回暖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve put your dinner in the oven to keep it warm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把你的饭菜放进了烤箱里保温。
Sense.EXAMPLE: warm water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温水

Sense.DEF: if you are warm, your body is at a comfortable temperature
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you warm enough?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你够暖和吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: wear enough clothes not to feel cold
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure you keep warm!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要穿暖和点！

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll be as warm as toast in that sleeping bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡在那个睡袋里你会很暖和的。

Sense.DEF: clothes or buildings that are warm can keep in heat or keep out cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here, put on your nice warm coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐穿上你舒适暖和的大衣。

Sense.DEF: friendly or making someone feel comfortable and relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warm, reassuring smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热情亲切的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please give a warm welcome to our special guest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请热烈欢迎我们的特邀嘉宾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warm glow of satisfaction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由衷的满足
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Hungarian people are warm and friendly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匈牙利人民热情友好。

Sense.DEF: warm colours contain the colours red, yellow, and orange, which make you feel comfortable and happy
used especially in games to say that someone is near to guessing the correct answer or finding a hidden object
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指游戏中〕即将猜中〔答案〕的﹐快要找到〔隐藏物〕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re getting warmer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你快要猜中了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something warm or warmer, or to become warm or warmer
Sense.EXAMPLE: They gathered round the fire to warm their hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们围坐在炉火边暖手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Warm yourself by the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到炉火边来暖和暖和吧。
