Sense.DEF: to begin to like someone you have just met
Sense.TRAN: 对〔刚认识的人〕开始有好感
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bruce didn’t warm to him as he had to Casey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁斯对他不像对凯西那样有好感。

Sense.DEF: to become more eager, interested, or excited about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The more she spoke, the more she warmed to her subject.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的话题越说越起劲。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Voters are starting to warm up to the idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民开始对这个观点越来越感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to become warm, or to make someone or something warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: With the fire on, the room should soon warm up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点着火炉﹐房间应该很快就会暖和起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once the weather warms up, you can move the plants outdoors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦天气变暖﹐你就可以把植物搬到户外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I turned on the grill to warm it up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开了烤架﹐让它热起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come inside and have a drink. It’ll warm you up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进来喝一杯吧﹐暖和暖和身子。

Sense.DEF: to heat food, especially food that has already been cooked, so that it is hot enough to eat, or to become hot enough to eat

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll put the lasagne in the oven to warm it up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把意大利千层面放到烤箱里热一热。

Sense.DEF: to do gentle physical exercises to prepare your body for dancing, sport etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔舞蹈﹑运动前〕做热身运动﹔做准备活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The runners began warming up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛跑运动员开始做热身运动。

Sense.DEF: if a machine or engine warms up, or if you warm it up, it becomes ready to work properly after being switched on
Sense.EXAMPLE: He waited for the photocopier to warm up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他等待复印机预热。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started to warm up the aircraft’s engines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始预热飞机引擎。

Sense.DEF: if a party, election etc warms up, it starts to become enjoyable or interesting, especially because more is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The race for governor is beginning to warm up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长竞选活动开始变得激烈起来。

Sense.DEF: if musicians, singers, or performers warm up, they practise just before a performance
Sense.TRAN: 〔乐手﹑歌手或演员等在演出前〕做准备练习
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band had little time to warm up before going on stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队上台前几乎没时间准备。

Sense.DEF: to perform or speak first at an event, so that the people listening are relaxed or excited before the main singer, speaker etc comes on
Sense.TRAN: 〔在正式活动之前〕暖场﹔调动〔观众情绪〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He warmed up the audience by telling them a few jokes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲了几个笑话﹐把观众的情绪调动了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They warmed up for U2 on one of their early tours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们曾为U2乐队早期的一场巡回演唱会暖场。

Sense.DEF: a place that is warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come into the warm!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进来暖和暖和！

Sense.DEF: to put on enough clothes so that you do not feel cold
animals that are warm-blooded have a body temperature that remains fairly high whether the temperature around them is hot or cold
exercises that you do to relax your body after playing a sport or dancing
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动或跳舞之后的〕放松活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gentle walk can act as a warm-down after a race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛跑之后慢步走可以放松身体。

Sense.DEF: warmed-over food has been cooked before and then heated again for eating
warmed-over ideas or arguments have been used before and are not interesting or useful any more
Sense.TRAN: 〔意见或论点〕重复的﹐陈腐的﹐老调重弹的

Sense.DEF: if you are warmed-up, you have done a set of gentle exercises to prepare your body for playing a sport, dancing etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动﹑跳舞等之前〕已做好准备活动的

Sense.DEF: a monument in memory of the people who were killed in a war
Sense.TRAN: 战争纪念碑﹐阵亡将士纪念碑

Sense.DEF: something, especially a piece of equipment, that is used to make or keep things warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plate warmer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖盘器

Sense.DEF: an expression used especially in weather reports meaning the front edge of a mass of warm air
friendly, kind, and always willing to help
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warm-hearted landlady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热心的女房东

Sense.DEF: making you feel pleasantly warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warming cup of cocoa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯热乎乎的可可

Sense.DEF: an increase in the temperature of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the warming of the ocean currents in the Pacific
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太平洋洋流的变暖

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a relationship becomes more friendly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the warming of relations between Britain and Iran
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国和伊朗之间关系的升温

Sense.DEF: a metal container with a long handle, used in the past to hold hot coals for warming beds
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时用来暖床的〕长柄炭炉﹐长柄暖床器

Sense.DEF: in a friendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Terry greeted the visitor warmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里友好地接待来客。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were warmly welcomed by the villagers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们受到了村民的热情欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack smiled warmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克热情地微笑着。

Sense.DEF: in a way that makes something or someone warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pat wrapped the baby up warmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特把婴儿裹得暖暖的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the children are dressed warmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要让孩子们穿得暖和。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows that you like something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech was warmly received.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演讲反响热烈。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a politician, who wants people to start fighting or start a war – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 战争贩子〔热衷于发动战争的人﹐尤指政客﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the heat something produces, or when you feel warm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the warmth of the summer sun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天太阳的暖意

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children huddled closely together for warmth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们紧紧地挤在一起取暖。

Sense.DEF: friendliness and happiness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the warmth of her smile
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她微笑中的热情

Sense.DEF: a set of gentle exercises you do to prepare your body for sport, dancing etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动﹑跳舞等前做的〕热身运动﹐准备活动

Sense.DEF: clothes that you wear when you are doing exercises to prepare your body for playing a sport or dancing
a warm-up match, game, or race is held to give the sportsmen or players practice before a big event
warm-up exercises are done to prepare your body before playing a sport or dancing
a warm-up jacket is worn to keep you warm when you are doing exercises
a warm-up man or band prepares the people at an event for the main speaker, singer etc by singing, telling jokes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或乐队在正式活动之前〕暖场的

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “小心﹐岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Travellers to Africa are being warned about the danger of HIV infection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去非洲旅行的人被警告要注意感染艾滋病的危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Salmon farmers are warning of the severe crisis facing the industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲑鱼养殖场主警告说该行业正面临严重危机。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I warned you not to walk home alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诫过你不要一个人走路回家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Motorists are being warned to avoid the centre of London this weekend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现正提醒驾车者本周末要绕行伦敦市中心道路。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We warned them that there was a bull in the field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提醒他们﹐田里有一头公牛。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about something before it happens so that they are not worried or surprised by it
Sense.TRAN: 预先通知〔某人以免其担忧或惊讶〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Warn her you’re going to be back late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提前告诉她你要晚回去。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often use the expression let someone know rather than warn someone.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中，人们一般用 let someone know﹐而不用 warn someone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Let me know if you’re not going to finish on time
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不能准时完成的话，就提早告诉我。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone about something bad or dangerous that might happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I warned you about sitting out in the sun too long.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提醒过你别在外面太阳底下坐太长时间。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We were warned that there could be delays on the motorway, so we took another route.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人提醒我们说走高速公路可能会有延误﹐因此我们走了另一条路线。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone that if they continue to behave in an unsatisfactory way, they will be punished
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s already been given several warnings about handing in his essays late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为晚交论文已经受到好几次警告。

Exponent.DEF: to officially or publicly warn people of possible danger so that they can prevent it or be ready to deal with it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a campaign to alert people to the dangers of smoking
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 提醒人们注意吸烟危害的运动
Exponent.EXAMPLE: An anonymous caller alerted the police that a bomb was due to go off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个匿名者打电话报警﹐说有一枚炸弹即将爆炸。

Exponent.DEF: to secretly warn someone about something that is going to happen – used especially about warning the police about a crime
Exponent.TRAN: 秘密警告某人﹔〔尤指〕向警察密报
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police found the drugs after being tipped off by local residents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方得到当地居民的密报﹐找到了这批毒品。

Exponent.DEF: to warn someone to do or not to do something in order to avoid a dangerous or bad result
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People are being cautioned against using credit cards abroad, in case of fraud.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们得到警告说为防止被诈骗﹐不要在国外使用信用卡。

Exponent.DEF: to warn someone about something that is going to happen, so that you are expecting it or ready for it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had been forewarned that the roads weren’t very good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预先得到提醒说道路状况不太好。

Sense.DEF: to advise someone not to do something because it may have dangerous or unpleasant results
Sense.TRAN: 〔因可能有危险或产生不良结果而〕告诫(某人)不要做〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her financial adviser warned her against such a risky investment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的理财顾问告诫过她不要进行风险那么大的投资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police have warned tourists against leaving the main tourist centres.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方告诫游客不要离开主要旅游中心。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that they should not go near something, especially because it may be dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: The snake’s markings are intended to warn away predators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇身上的斑纹是用来警告捕食者不要靠近。

Sense.DEF: to tell people that they should not go near something, especially because it might be dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some animals mark their territory to warn off rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些动物在自己的地盘上留下记号﹐警告竞争者不要靠近。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that they should not do or use something because it might be dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 告诫某人不要用某物/做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors should have warned people off using the drug much earlier than they did.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生早就应该告诫人们不要使用这种药品。

Sense.DEF: something, especially a statement, that tells you that something bad, dangerous, or annoying might happen so that you can be ready or avoid it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a warning of floods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水警报

GramExa.EXAMPLE: warnings about the dangers of smoking
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关吸烟危害的警告

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This experience should serve as a warning against complacency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个经历应该可以成为不要自满的警示。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a warning to pregnant women not to drink alcohol
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕妇不要饮酒的警告

Sense.EXAMPLE: a warning that grey squirrels are threatening the existence of red squirrels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于灰松鼠正威胁到红松鼠生存的警告

Sense.DEF: a statement telling someone that if they continue to behave in an unsatisfactory way, they will be punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Surrey team were given a warning last year for repeated offences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支萨里的球队去年因多次犯规受到一次警告。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m giving you a final warning – don’t be late again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最后一次警告你——不要再迟到了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He slammed on the brakes without giving any warning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不提醒一下就猛踩刹车。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially warn people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government issued a warning about eating raw eggs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府发出警告说不要食用生蛋。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take notice of it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Workers were given no advance warning of the closure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人没有得到过关闭工厂的提前通知。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a warning that something is bad for your health
Collocate.EXAMPLE: All tobacco products must carry a health warning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的烟草制品上都必须有健康警告。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police fired into the crowd without warning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察在毫无预警的情况下朝人群开枪了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used before telling someone to be careful about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A word of warning: don’t use too much glue.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一句提醒: 别用太多胶水。

Sense.DEF: a warning action or thing tells you that something bad or dangerous might happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Red warning lights were flashing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色警告灯在闪烁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government ignored all the warning signs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府忽视了所有的预警征兆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She said nothing but gave him a warning look.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没说什么﹐但给了他一个警告的眼色。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something makes someone start to be worried or careful about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As she read his letter, warning bells began to sound in her head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她读着他的来信﹐心中开始涌起一种不祥的预感。

Sense.DEF: a struggle in which you harm your opponent in a lot of small ways, so that they become gradually weaker
an attempt to make an enemy worried, and to destroy their courage by threatening them, spreading false information etc
a public argument between politicians etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治家等之间的〕论战﹐舌战﹐口水仗

Sense.DEF: the name given to the actions and other measures taken by the US, Britain, and other countries to destroy international terrorist groups, especially al-Qaeda after the attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon on September 11th, 2001
Sense.TRAN: 反恐怖主义战争﹐反恐战争

Sense.DEF: if something warps, or if heat or cold warps it, it becomes bent or twisted, and loses its original shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door must be warped. It won’t close properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门肯定是变形了﹐关不严。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone in a way that has a harmful effect on how they think or behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mustn’t allow your dislike of her to warp your judgement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能因为不喜欢她而使自己的判断受到影响。

Sense.DEF: the threads used in weaving cloth that go from the top to the bottom of the machine
a part of something that has become bent or twisted from its original shape
paint that some tribes put on their bodies and faces before going to war
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些部落在出战前〕涂在身上[脸上]的颜料

Sense.DEF: make-up1 – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Josie’s just putting on her war paint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔茜正在化妆。

Sense.DEF: to be angry and looking for someone to fight or punish
Sense.TRAN: 怒气冲冲地寻人打架﹔寻衅

Sense.DEF: someone who is warped has ideas or thoughts that most people think are unpleasant or not normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warped mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怪诞的头脑
Sense.EXAMPLE: You really have a warped sense of humour think strange and unpleasant things are funny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的幽默感实在怪异。

Sense.DEF: something that is warped is bent or twisted so that it is not the correct shape
a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action
Sense.TRAN: 〔法院授权警方采取行动的〕令状

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The magistrate issued a warrant for his arrest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方法官发出了对他的逮捕令。

Sense.DEF: an official document giving someone the right to do something, for example buy shares in a company
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company issued warrants for 300,000 shares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司发放了30万股的认股权证。

Sense.DEF: no good reason for doing something
Sense.TRAN: 不是(做)某事的正当理由
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no warrant for copying other people’s work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剽窃他人作品毫无道理。

Sense.DEF: to need or deserve
Sense.EXAMPLE: This tiny crowd does not warrant such a large police presence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这几个人﹐没必要出动这么多警察。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Another area that warrants attention is that of funding for universities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个值得注意的方面就是大学的资金。

Sense.DEF: to promise that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Author hereby warrants that the Publisher is the owner of the copyright.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作者特此声明版权归出版商所有。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are sure about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll warrant we won’t see him again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢保证﹐我们不会再见到他了。

Sense.DEF: an official card carried by British police officers to prove that they belong to the police
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国警察携带以证明身份的〕授权令﹐搜查令

Sense.DEF: a middle rank in the army, air force, or US Navy
Sense.TRAN: 〔陆军﹑空军〕准尉﹔〔美国海军〕二级准尉

Sense.DEF: a written agreement in which a company selling something promises to repair it if it breaks within a particular period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car is still under warranty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车还在保修期内。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-year warranty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年的保修期

Sense.DEF: the underground home of rabbits
a place with so many streets, rooms etc that it is difficult to find the place that you want
Sense.TRAN: 〔因街道﹑房间等过多而〕容易迷路的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warren of tiny streets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地下迷宫似的狭窄街巷

Sense.DEF: at war or fighting each other

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: groups of people fighting each other

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交战的各方

Sense.DEF: a soldier or fighter who is brave and experienced – used about people in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: a noble warrior
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠勇的战士

Sense.DEF: a ship with guns that is used in a war
a small hard raised part on someone’s skin
including all the faults or unpleasant things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, you married him – warts and all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐再不好﹐你都已经嫁给他了。

Sense.DEF: an African wild pig with long front teeth that stick out of the side of its mouth
Sense.TRAN: 疣猪〔非洲的一种野猪﹐长有獠牙〕

Sense.DEF: the period of time when a country is fighting a war

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even in wartime some people held concerts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是在战争时期也有人举行音乐会。

Sense.DEF: a war-torn country, city etc is being destroyed by war
Sense.TRAN: 受到战争破坏的﹐饱受战争蹂躏的

Sense.DEF: a woman whose husband has been killed in a war
someone who is wary is careful because they think something might be dangerous or harmful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m a bit wary of driving in this fog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点害怕在这样的雾天开车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must teach children to be wary of strangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定要教育孩子警惕陌生人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep a wary eye on the weather before you set sail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出航前要密切注意天气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a wary expression on her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上带着小心谨慎的表情。

Sense.DEF: an area where a war is being fought
the first and third person singular of the past tense of be
Sense.TRAN: be的第一和第三人称单数过去式

Sense.DEF: a green strong-tasting Japanese food, which is added to sushi and other food in small amounts in order to make it taste hotter
to clean something using water and a type of soap
Sense.EXAMPLE: This shirt needs washing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件衬衫该洗洗了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your turn to wash the dishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该轮到你洗碗碟了。

Sense.DEF: to clean your body with soap and water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amy washed and went to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米洗过澡就去睡觉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a hot bath and washed her hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她洗了个热水澡并洗了头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just going to wash my hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚准备洗手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When a cat has finished eating, it often washes itself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫吃完东西后﹐常会把自己舔干净。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone has a wash ( BrE ) or washes up ( AmE ) rather than washes.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 have a wash【英】或 wash up【美】﹐而不说 wash。

Sense.DEF: if a river, sea etc washes somewhere, or if something carried by the river or sea is washed somewhere, it flows or moves there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waves washed against the shore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海浪冲刷着海岸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sea washed over her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海水冲过来淹没了她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The young man was washed overboard pushed from a boat into the sea by the force of the water in the storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨中﹐那个年轻人被冲下船掉进海里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The body was washed ashore brought to the shore by waves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸体被冲上岸。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not believe or accept someone’s explanation, reason, attitude etc
Sense.TRAN: 不相信﹔不接受〔某人的解释﹑理由﹑态度等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry but all his charm just doesn’t wash with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐他那些魅力打动不了我。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to be responsible for something any more
Sense.TRAN: 不愿再管[不再过问]某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve washed my hands of the whole affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经完全不过问此事了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone who has just sworn or said something rude that they should not have spoken that way
Sense.TRAN: 嘴巴干净点！〔用于告诫说了脏话的人〕

Sense.DEF: to be easy to clean using soap and water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silk doesn’t wash well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丝绸不好洗。

Sense.DEF: if water washes something away, it carries it away with great force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Floods in Bangladesh have washed hundreds of homes away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孟加拉的洪水冲走了数百户人家。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of unhappy feelings, thoughts, or memories
Sense.TRAN: 消除〔不愉快的情绪﹑想法或记忆〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My anxiety was washed away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的焦虑一扫而光。

Sense.DEF: to clean something large using a lot of water
Sense.TRAN: 用大量水冲洗〔大件物体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you wash down the driveway?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把车道冲洗一下吗？

Sense.DEF: to drink something with or after food or with medicine to help you swallow it
Sense.TRAN: 〔借助饮料等〕将〔食物或药物〕吞下

GramExa.EXAMPLE: steak and chips washed down with red wine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一边吃牛排和炸薯条﹐一边喝红葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: to clean dirt, dust etc from the surface of something with water
if a substance washes off, you can remove it from the surface of something by washing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will this paint wash off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这油漆能洗掉吗？

Sense.DEF: to wash the inside of something quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just wash out this vase for flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就把这花瓶洗干净放花吧。

Sense.DEF: if a substance washes out, you can remove it from a material by washing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dye that won’t wash out
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗不掉的染料

Sense.DEF: if an event is washed out, it cannot continue because of rain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The summer fair was washed out by the English weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季博览会因为英格兰的天气而告吹。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling washes over you, you suddenly feel it very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A feeling of relief washed over her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她顿时感到如释重负。

Sense.DEF: if you let something wash over you, you do not pay close attention to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was content to let the conversation wash over her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她乐得不去理会那番谈话。

Sense.DEF: to wash plates, dishes, knives etc
to wash your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go wash up before dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃饭前先去洗手。

Sense.DEF: if waves wash something up, they carry it to the shore

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His body was washed up on the beach the next morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早晨他的尸体被冲上海滩。

Sense.DEF: an act of cleaning something using soap and water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those jeans need a good wash a thorough wash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条牛仔裤要好好洗一洗了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just have a quick wash before we go out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快洗个澡﹐然后我们就出门。

Sense.DEF: clothes that are to be washed, are being washed, or have just been washed
Sense.TRAN: 待洗[正在洗﹐刚洗好]的衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better put that shirt in the wash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好把那件衬衫拿去洗洗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need me to put another wash on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我再放进去洗一批吗？

Sense.DEF: a liquid used to clean your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anti-bacterial facial wash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗菌洗面奶

Sense.DEF: the movement of water caused by a passing boat
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wash of a large motorboat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大摩托艇的尾流

Sense.DEF: a very thin transparent layer of paint or colour
the area of land that is sometimes covered by the sea

Sense.LEXUNIT: it will all come out in the wash

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry about a problem because it will be solved in the future
Subsense.TRAN: 总会有办法的﹐问题总会解决的〔用于叫某人不要担心〕

Subsense.DEF: used to say that the truth about something will be known in the end
Subsense.TRAN: 总会水落石出﹐总会真相大白

Sense.DEF: something that is washable can be washed without being damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: washable cushion covers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可洗的坐垫套
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gloves are machine washable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这副手套可以用洗衣机洗。

Sense.DEF: paint or ink that is washable will come out of cloth when you wash it
a container like a small sink used for washing your hands and face
a piece of metal with a slightly rough surface, used in the past for rubbing clothes on when washing them
a small square cloth used for washing your hands and face
the day each week when you wash your clothes
not brightly coloured any more, usually as a result of being washed many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: a washed-out shade of blue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 褪淡的蓝色

Sense.DEF: feeling weak and looking unhealthy because you are very tired
Sense.TRAN: 筋疲力尽的﹔〔因疲劳而〕面色苍白的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Debbie’s looking a bit washed-out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛比看上去有点疲倦。

Sense.DEF: a washed-out road has been damaged by rain or floods and cannot be driven on
if a person or an organization is washed-up, they will never be successful again
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或组织〕彻底失败的﹔不再有希望的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a washed-up movie star
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过气的电影明星

Sense.DEF: a thin flat ring of plastic, metal, rubber etc that is put over a bolt before the nut is put on, or between two pipes, to make a tighter joint
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于螺母上或管子间的〕垫圈

Sense.DEF: a washing machine
a machine that both washes and dries clothes
Sense.TRAN: 烘干洗衣机﹐洗衣干衣两用机

Sense.DEF: a woman in the past whose job was to wash other people’s clothes
clothes that need to be washed, are being washed, or have just been washed
Sense.TRAN: 待洗[正在洗﹐刚洗好]的衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really must do the washing wash the dirty clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真得洗衣服了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you put the washing out hang it on a washing line for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能帮我把洗好的衣服晾出去？

Sense.DEF: a piece of string stretched between two poles that you hang wet clothes on so that they can dry outside
a machine for washing clothes
soap in the form of a powder used for washing clothes
a chemical that is added to water to clean very dirty things
Sense.TRAN: 洗涤碱〔放入水中﹐用来清洗很脏的东西〕

Sense.DEF: the washing of plates, dishes, knives etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your turn to do the washing-up, Sam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆﹐轮到你来洗餐具了。

Sense.DEF: the dirty pans, plates, dishes, knives etc that have to be washed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pile of washing-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆要洗的餐具

Sense.DEF: a liquid soap for washing plates, knives etc
a failure
Sense.EXAMPLE: The picnic was a total washout – nobody turned up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野餐彻底失败——根本没人来！

Sense.DEF: an occasion when heavy rain causes damage or stops an event from happening
Sense.TRAN: 〔大雨造成的〕冲毁﹐损毁﹔〔活动的〕因雨取消

Sense.DEF: a washcloth
a room in a public building where you can wash and use the toilet
a table in a bedroom, used in the past for holding the things needed for washing your face
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时卧室里放置盥洗用具的〕脸盆架﹐盥洗台

Sense.DEF: a very large bowl used in the past for washing clothes in

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘was not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jason wasn’t at the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾森没有参加聚会。

Sense.DEF: a thin black and yellow flying insect that can sting you
an American whose family was originally from northern Europe and who is therefore considered to be part of the most powerful group in society
Sense.TRAN: 盎格鲁——撒克逊裔的白人新教徒﹐北美中上层白人〔被视为属于社会上最有权势的阶层〕

Sense.DEF: bad-tempered and cruel in the things that you say
Sense.TRAN: 脾气暴躁的﹔言语刻簿的
Sense.EXAMPLE: waspish remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶毒的话语

Sense.DEF: to enjoy yourself eating and drinking at Christmas
another spelling of whassup
when something is lost or destroyed, especially in a way that is not useful or reasonable, or the amount that is lost or destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system used to result in a great deal of food wastage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种做法过去造成了大量的食物浪费。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: wastage of ability among working class children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人阶级子女中才能的浪费现象

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the number of workers because of people leaving, retiring etc and not because they have lost their jobs
Sense.TRAN: 〔因离职﹑退休等引起的〕自然减员

Sense.DEF: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Being unemployed is such a waste of your talents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业简直是浪费了你的才能。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many believe that state aid is a waste of taxpayers’ money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人认为政府援助是浪费纳税人的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What a waste of all that good work!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是白辛苦了！

Sense.EXAMPLE: excessive waste in state spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府支出方面的过度浪费

Sense.DEF: if something goes to waste, it is not used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let all this food go to waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让这些食物白白浪费掉。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a waste of time/money/effort etc
Sense.DEF: to be not worth the time, money etc that you use because there is little or no result
Sense.TRAN: 是浪费时间/金钱/精力等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should never have gone – it was a total waste of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们真不该去——那纯粹是浪费时间。

Sense.DEF: unwanted materials or substances that are left after you have used something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The emphasis now is on recycling waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前的重点是废弃物的再利用。

Sense.DEF: someone who has no good qualities
a large area of land where there are very few people, plants, or animals
Sense.TRAN: 人烟稀少的地区﹐荒芜地区﹔荒原

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the icy wastes of Antarctica
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南极洲冰原

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 4

Collocate.EXAMPLE: How much of our household waste is recycled?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的家庭垃圾有多少得到了回收？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: environmentally friendly ways to dispose of waste
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对环境无害的垃圾处理方式

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Newspapers and magazines make up 10% of household waste.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸和杂志占家庭垃圾的10%。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: pollution caused by industrial waste
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业废料导致的污染

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from people going to the toilet

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a washing machine waste pipe
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗衣机排水管

Sense.DEF: to use more money, time, energy etc than is useful or sensible
Sense.TRAN: 滥用﹐浪费〔金钱﹑时间﹑精力等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaving the heating on all the time wastes electricity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让暖气整天开着是浪费电力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t waste your money on that junk!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把钱浪费在那种垃圾上！

Sense.DEF: to not make full use of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hannah’s wasted in that clerical job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜干那种文书工作是大材小用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His talents were being wasted as a lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有那样的才华﹐当律师真是浪费。

Sense.DEF: if something is wasted on someone, they do not understand how good or useful it is
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物〕浪费在某人身上〔因为此人不懂其好处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her good advice was wasted on the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对孩子们的规劝是白费口舌了。

Sense.DEF: to say something that has no effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to reason with Paul – you’re wasting your breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要跟保罗讲理了——你是白费唇舌。

Sense.DEF: to do something as quickly as you can because it will help you
Sense.TRAN: 〔因对自己有帮助而〕不失时机地做某事﹐赶紧做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasted no time in introducing himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赶忙自我介绍。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if you use what you have carefully, you will still have some of it if you need it later
to kill someone, severely injure them, or defeat them
to gradually become thinner and weaker, usually because you are ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因有病而〕逐渐消瘦虚弱

Sense.DEF: waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed
waste land is empty or not looked after by anyone
a small container for holding paper, cans etc that are not wanted
a journey etc that does not achieve anything
Sense.TRAN: 白费的行程/旅行/努力等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry you’ve had a wasted trip. Mr Newton isn’t here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐让你白跑了一趟﹐牛顿先生不在这里。

Sense.DEF: very thin and weak because of illness, old age etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: her thin, wasted body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她瘦弱的身体

Sense.DEF: very drunk or affected by drugs
the process of getting rid of unwanted materials or substances
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of radioactive waste disposal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放射性废物的处理问题

Sense.DEF: a small machine under the kitchen sink that cuts food waste into small pieces so that it can be washed down the drain
Sense.TRAN: 废物处理装置〔与厨房水槽废水管连接的机器﹐可把厨房垃圾碾碎让水冲走〕

Sense.DEF: using more of something than you should, especially money, time, or effort
Sense.TRAN: 挥霍的﹔浪费的〔尤指金钱﹑时间或努力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wasteful use of resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滥用资源

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The software is very wasteful of memory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件很占内存。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Lily had wastefully left the light on.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莉让电灯开着﹐真浪费。

Sense.DEF: an empty unattractive piece of land that is not used for anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piece of waste ground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块荒地

Sense.DEF: an unattractive area, often with old ruined buildings, factories etc on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the restoration of industrial wasteland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业废址的重建

Sense.DEF: a place, situation, or time that has no excitement or interest
Sense.TRAN: 荒漠〔喻指乏味无趣的地方﹑状况或时期〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The seventies were a cultural wasteland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 70年代是文化荒漠。

Sense.DEF: paper that has been used and thrown away
a small container for holding paper, cans etc that are not wanted
a useless material or substance that is produced during the process of making something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: nuclear waste products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核废物

Sense.DEF: someone who you think will never achieve any success in life
Sense.EXAMPLE: All her friends are drunks or wasters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的朋友不是酒鬼就是饭桶。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that does not use time etc carefully or well
Sense.TRAN: 浪费时间/金钱/能源的人[物]

Sense.DEF: a disease that gradually makes you thinner and weaker
Sense.TRAN: 〔使人日益消瘦﹑虚弱的〕消耗性疾病

Sense.DEF: a property, business etc that is losing money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airline is a wasting asset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家航空公司是个亏本企业。

Sense.DEF: a lazy person who does not try to achieve anything in life
to look at someone or something for a period of time, paying attention to what is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you mind if I watch?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你介意我看着吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat and watched the sunset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐下来看日落。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He watched helplessly as Paula fell into the icy water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无助地看着葆拉落入冰冷的水中。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Watch carefully. You may learn something.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细看﹐也许你能学到点东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harriet watched him with interest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈丽雅特饶有兴致地注视着他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I watched him go, then went home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着他离去﹐然后回了家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth could not bear to watch her parents arguing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝看不得父母争吵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I watched to see how he’d react.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看看他会作何反应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The debate was watched by 97 million viewers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场辩论有9,700万观众观看。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most parents don’t know what their kids are watching on TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数父母不知道自己的孩子都在看什么电视节目。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s useful to watch how other pilots handle the glider.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观察别的飞行员如何操纵滑翔机很有帮助。

Sense.DEF: to act carefully in order to avoid an accident or unwanted situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Watch he doesn’t run into the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 留心别让他跑到马路上去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a student and has to watch her budget closely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还是个学生﹐所以只能掂量着花钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Watch your head on the shelf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心头﹐别碰到架子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Silly old fool! Why doesn’t he watch where he’s going?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老傻瓜！他走路怎么不看着点？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Watch what you’re doing! It’s spilling everywhere!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做事小心点！你洒得到处都是！

Sense.EXAMPLE: Watch yourself be careful in Madrid; there are some rough areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在马德里要小心点﹐有些地区很危险。

GramExa.PROPFORM: watch what you say/your tongue/your language/your mouth etc
GramExa.GLOSS: be careful not to hurt or offend people by what you say
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 说话小心﹐注意自己的言辞
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees should watch what they say in personal emails.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工应该注意自己在私人电子邮件中的措辞。

GramExa.PROPFORM: watch your weight/watch what you eat
GramExa.GLOSS: be careful not to get fat
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He may be a former athlete, but he still has to watch his weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽说他以前是个运动员﹐但他还是得注意自己的体重。

Sense.DEF: to pay attention to a situation that interests or worries you to see how it develops

GramExa.EXAMPLE: American companies are watching Japanese developments closely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国公司正在密切关注日本的发展情况。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government will watch the progress of these schemes with interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府会很有兴趣地关注这些计划的进展。

Sense.DEF: to stay with someone or something so that nothing bad happens to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She watches the kids for us occasionally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她偶尔会替我们照看孩子。

Sense.DEF: to secretly watch a person or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel like I’m being watched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉似乎有人在监视我。

Sense.DEF: to be careful, especially about making someone angry
Sense.TRAN: 做事要谨慎小心〔尤指不要惹怒他人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He soon saw he’d have to watch his step with some of these guys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就明白自己得小心﹐免得惹恼了这帮家伙中的某些人。

Sense.DEF: informal to be careful because other people may try to harm you
Sense.TRAN: 小心背后〔因可能有人暗算〕

Sense.DEF: to keep looking at the time because you are worried or bored
Sense.TRAN: 〔因担心或不耐烦而〕老在看钟
Sense.EXAMPLE: anxious mums watching the clock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 急得不停地看时间的妈妈们

Sense.DEF: to make sure you know what time it is to avoid being late
used to warn someone to be careful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Watch it, there’s a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心﹐有车。

Sense.DEF: used to tell people to pay attention in the future because things are going to develop further – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 关注事态的发展﹐请继续关注〔尤用于新闻报道〕

Sense.DEF: someone or something that people should pay attention to because they are interesting or exciting
Sense.TRAN: 值得一看的人[事物]﹐值得关注的人[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the tournament so far, Italy’s Stefania Croce looks like the one to watch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锦标赛进行到现在﹐意大利的斯特凡尼娅•克罗齐看来值得关注。

Sense.DEF: to relax outside by just looking at the people around you
Sense.TRAN: 〔悠闲地〕观察周围发生的事﹐看周围的世界
Sense.EXAMPLE: lingering in a pavement café, watching the world go by
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流连于路边咖啡馆﹐闲看周围的世界

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you know what will happen
Sense.TRAN: 你看着吧〔用于告诉某人你知道将要发生什么〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll win this time, you watch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看着吧﹐这次他会赢的。

Exponent.DEF: to look at someone or something for a period of time and pay attention to what is happening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were all watching the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都在看比赛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I watched him get out of his car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着他从他车上下来。

Exponent.DEF: to watch someone or something carefully so that you are prepared if anything bad happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctors are keeping a careful eye on her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生仔细留意她的情况。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you keep an eye on my bag for me?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能照看一下我的包吗？

Exponent.DEF: to watch someone or something carefully in order to learn more about them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A 24-hour camera is being used to observe the birds’ behaviour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台24小时运作的摄像机被用来观察鸟类的行为。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: During your teacher training you will be encouraged to observe lessons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师培训期间会鼓励你观摩别人上课。

Exponent.DEF: to watch a situation carefully to see how it changes over a period of time
Exponent.TRAN: 监视﹔监测〔一段时期内的变化〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Class teachers are responsible for monitoring the progress of each student.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 班主任有责任密切关注每个学生的进步。

Exponent.DEF: to watch someone secretly in order to find out what they are doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He hired a private detective to spy on her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他雇了一名私家侦探监视她。

Sense.DEF: to pay close attention in a particular situation because you are expecting something to happen or you want to avoid something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stepped outside to watch for the cab.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走到外面等出租车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What problems should I watch out for when buying an old house?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我买旧房子该注意哪些问题？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to be careful
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll become an alcoholic if you don’t watch out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是不当心﹐就会变成酒鬼的。

Sense.DEF: to protect someone so that they are not harmed
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must have been an angel watching over me that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天一定是有天使在保护我。

Sense.DEF: a small clock that you wear on your wrist or keep in your pocket
Sense.EXAMPLE: My watch has stopped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的表停了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She glanced nervously at her watch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧张地看了看表。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you keep track of time if you don’t wear a watch?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不戴表﹐怎么知道时间？

PIC.HEADING: WATCH 手表
PIC.PICCONTENT: buckle 带扣；watchstrap 表带；hand 指针；face 表面

Sense.DEF: when you watch someone or something carefully, or pay careful attention to them, so that you are ready to act if necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police arrived to keep watch on the mouth of the tunnel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察赶来监控隧道口的情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He maintained a 24-hour watch over his son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他24小时看着儿子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Security forces kept a close watch on our activities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安部队密切监视着我们的活动。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep a watch out for sb/sth

Variant.LEXVAR: be on the watch for sb/sth

Sense.DEF: to be looking and waiting for something that might happen or someone you might see, especially so that you can avoid danger, trouble etc
Sense.TRAN: 小心提防某人/某事物﹐对某人/某事物保持戒备
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be on the watch for anything suspicious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意任何可疑情况。

Sense.DEF: a group of people whose job is to guard or protect someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were arrested and held until the arrival of the night watch people responsible for keeping the streets safe at night, especially in past times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被逮住﹐并一直扣留到巡夜警察到来。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when it is someone’s duty to stay somewhere and look for signs of danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first watch is from now until midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一班从现在开始到午夜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who’s on watch tonight?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚谁值班？

Sense.DEF: if a film, television programme etc is watchable, it is interesting and enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly watchable film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常值得看的电影

Sense.DEF: a piece of leather or metal for fastening your watch on your wrist
a person or group of people whose job is to protect the rights of people who buy things and to make sure companies do not do anything illegal or harmful
Sense.TRAN: 〔保护购买者权利﹐确保公司不从事非法或有害活动的〕监察委员会﹔监察人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a consumer watchdog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护消费者权益的监督员

Sense.DEF: a guard dog
someone who watches someone or something for pleasure or as part of their job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fifteen thousand bird watchers visit annually.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有1.5万名观鸟者到访。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Industry-watchers hailed the takeover as a triumph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行业观察员把这次收购誉为一次巨大的成功。

Sense.DEF: very careful to notice what is happening, and to make sure that everything is all right
Sense.EXAMPLE: The entrances are guarded by watchful security staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入口处由警惕的保安人员把守。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes were watchful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他目光警惕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep a watchful eye on elderly residents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请留心老年居民。

Sense.DEF: following someone’s instructions or with someone’s help
Sense.EXAMPLE: Learn the basics under the watchful eye of a qualified instructor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要在合格教练的指导下学习基本要领。

Sense.DEF: instructions to someone to watch a situation carefully but not to become involved in it
Sense.TRAN: 监视﹐监督〔对某一情况进行监视﹐但自己并不介入〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of his responsibilities is to keep a watching brief on foreign broadcasts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的职责之一是监督外国广播节目。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to guard or protect something, especially a ship
a list of people or things to keep your attention on because they may do something, especially a list of people who may be terrorists
Sense.TRAN: 监控名单〔尤指嫌疑恐怖分子名单〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is making and repairing clocks and watches
Sense.TRAN: 钟表匠﹔钟表制造[修理]师

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to guard a place
a piece of leather or metal for fastening your watch on your wrist
a high tower used for watching and guarding a place
a word or phrase that expresses an attitude or belief
Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmental quality will be the watchword for the 21st century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境质量将是21世纪的口号。

Sense.DEF: the clear liquid without colour, smell, or taste that falls as rain and that is used for drinking, washing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s water all over the bathroom floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴室地面上都是水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does anyone want a drink of water?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有谁想喝杯水吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of sparkling mineral water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯有气矿泉水
Sense.EXAMPLE: All rooms have hot and cold running water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有房间都有冷热自来水供应。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pour boiling water over the rice and let it soak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大米中倒入沸水浸泡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fresh water spring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡水泉
Sense.EXAMPLE: When dealing with a burst pipe, always turn off the water first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处理破裂水管时﹐一定要先把水关掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: contamination of the local water supply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地供水受到污染

Subsense.DEF: an area of water such as the sea, a lake etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Rangoon is surrounded on three sides by water.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仰光三面环水。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Denzil dived into the water.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登齐尔跳入水中。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He stepped down to the water’s edge.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向水边走去。

GramExa.GLOSS: by boat
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The temple can only be reached by water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座庙只有坐船才能到达。

Subsense.DEF: the surface of a lake, river etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: something floating on the water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂浮在水面上的东西

Sense.DEF: a large area of water, especially an ocean that is near or belongs to a particular country
Sense.EXAMPLE: the coastal waters of Alaska
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿拉斯加沿海水域

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship drifted into Turkish territorial waters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船漂入了土耳其领海。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a species found in inland waters not the sea, but rivers, lakes etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见于内陆水域的一个物种

Sense.DEF: the highest or lowest level of the sea and some rivers
a situation that is difficult, dangerous, or unfamiliar
Sense.TRAN: 未知的境况/困难情况/隐晦的困境
Sense.EXAMPLE: the uncharted waters of the 21st century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 21世纪的未知数

Sense.DEF: used to say that what happened in the past should be forgotten
Sense.TRAN: 是过去的事了﹐已成往事

Sense.DEF: if you use something or spend money like water, you use or spend large amounts of it when you should try to save it – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用东西或花钱〕大量地﹐无节制地〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the companies were spending money like water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些公司花钱如流水。

Sense.LEXUNIT: like water off a duck’s back
Sense.DEF: if criticism, warnings etc are like water off a duck’s back, they have no effect on the person you are saying them to
Sense.TRAN: 就像水过鸭背﹐像耳边风〔指批评﹑警告等对某人不起作用〕

Sense.DEF: when a pregnant woman’s waters break, liquid comes from her body just before her baby is born
Sense.TRAN: 某人的羊水破了〔指孕妇即将生产〕

Sense.DEF: liquid around the brain or knee as the result of a disease
to wash yourself in or drink special water that is thought to make you healthy
Sense.TRAN: 〔为保健〕用特殊的水洗澡﹔饮用特殊的水

Sense.DEF: to urinate

Crossrefto.REFLEX: take to sth like a duck to water
(be/feel) like a fish out of water

Sense.DEF: if you water plants or the ground they are growing in, you pour water on them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you water my houseplants while I’m away?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不在时你能给我家里的盆栽浇浇水吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden needs watering daily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园每天都需要浇水。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes water, tears come out of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chopping onions makes my eyes water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切洋葱会使我眼睛流泪。

Sense.DEF: to give an animal water to drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have the horses been fed and watered?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些马喂过食饮过水了吗？

Sense.DEF: if an area is watered by a river, the river flows through it and provides it with water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colombia is watered by several rivers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几条河流经哥伦比亚﹐为其提供水源。

Sense.DEF: to add water to a drink to make it less strong
to make a statement, report etc less forceful by changing it or removing parts that may offend people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过删去声明﹑报告等中可能冒犯人的部分〕减弱﹐削弱〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report of the investigation had been watered down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查报告已被淡化。

Sense.DEF: to add water to a drink to make it less strong
Sense.TRAN: 往〔液体〕中加水冲淡[稀释]

Sense.DEF: a bed with a part inside that is made of rubber and filled with water
a wild bird that swims and lives near water
a thin biscuit that is not sweet and is often eaten with cheese
Sense.TRAN: 水面饼干﹐薄脆饼干〔一种不甜的饼干﹐常配奶酪食用〕

Sense.DEF: the action of pouring water onto a prisoner’s face so that they cannot breathe properly, in order to get information from them
Sense.TRAN: 水刑〔往犯人脸上浇水使其产生窒息感﹐用于逼供〕

Sense.DEF: spread or carried by water
Sense.TRAN: 由水传播的﹔由水运送的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: waterborne diseases such as cholera
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍乱等经水传播的疾病

Sense.EXAMPLE: waterborne traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水上交通

Sense.DEF: a bottle used for carrying water to drink
someone whose job is to give the members of a sports team water to drink
someone who has a very unimportant job
a large animal like a cow with long horns, used to work on farms in Asia
Sense.TRAN: 〔在亚洲地区用于耕种的〕水牛

Sense.DEF: a small insect that lives in water
a large container that is kept outside and used for collecting rainwater
a machine that sends out a powerful stream of water, used by police to control violent crowds
Sense.TRAN: 〔警察用于驱散骚乱人群的〕高压水炮

Sense.DEF: the thick stem of a plant that grows in water, used in Chinese cooking
a toilet
a type of paint that you mix with water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margaret began experimenting with watercolor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特开始尝试使用水彩颜料。

Sense.DEF: a picture painted using watercolours
Sense.EXAMPLE: a watercolour of the castle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座城堡的水彩画

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment, used especially in offices, from which you can get a cup of cold water to drink
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指办公室里用于供应冷水的〕饮水机

Sense.DEF: conversation about other people’s behaviour or lives that happens in offices when people meet each other by the water cooler
a place where water flows, for example a river or canal
Sense.EXAMPLE: chemicals that pollute the local watercourse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染当地河道的化学品

Sense.DEF: a long thin hole for water to flow through
a small green plant with strong-tasting leaves that grows in water
Sense.TRAN: 水田芥〔水生植物﹐叶辛辣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of watercress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把水田芥

Sense.DEF: a watered-down plan, report etc has been changed so that it is less extreme or forceful than when it was first written – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑报告等〕作用比原来减弱了的﹐淡化了的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a watered-down version of the original
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与最初版本相比语气缓和的版本

Sense.DEF: a type of silk with a pattern of waves on it
a place where water from a river or stream falls down over a cliff or rock
a small pool, stream, or other structure that has water in it or running through it, built in a garden to make it more interesting and attractive
a drinking fountain
a water cooler
a wild bird that swims and lives near water
Sense.EXAMPLE: the varied waterfowl of North America
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北美洲种类繁多的水鸟

Sense.DEF: the part of a town or an area of land next to the sea, a river etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔城镇等的〕滨水地区﹐水边土地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is down on the waterfront.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店位于滨水区。

Sense.DEF: a small area of water in a dry country where wild animals drink
Sense.TRAN: 〔干旱地区野生动物饮水的〕水池﹐水坑
雪芭〔一种由果汁、糖和水制成的冰糕〕

Sense.DEF: a container used for pouring water on garden plants
a bar or other place where people drink alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your favorite watering hole?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最喜欢去哪儿喝酒？

Sense.DEF: a waterhole
a waterhole
a town which people visited in the past because the water there was thought to be good for your health
an area of water that you have to jump over during a competition, race etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛马中的〕水沟障碍﹔〔障碍赛跑中的〕水池
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her horse fell at the water jump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的马在跨越水沟障碍时失足摔倒。

Sense.DEF: a waterless place has no water for people or animals to drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a barren, waterless desert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫瘠干旱的沙漠

Sense.DEF: a plant that grows in water, with large white or pink flowers
the level that water reaches on the side of a ship etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two torpedoes struck below the waterline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两颗鱼雷击中船身吃水线以下部位。

Sense.DEF: the edge of a large area of water, especially the sea, where it joins the land
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the waterline advanced, the vegetation was swamped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着海岸线的前移﹐植被被淹没了。

Sense.DEF: a waterlogged area of land is flooded with water and cannot be used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Heavy rain meant the pitch was waterlogged.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨意味着球场浸水。

Sense.DEF: a waterlogged boat is full of water and may sink

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The race was cancelled due to waterlogging.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于场地浸水﹐比赛被取消了。

Sense.DEF: a large underground pipe that carries the public supply of water to buildings
Sense.EXAMPLE: a burst water main
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆裂的总水管

Sense.DEF: a special design put onto paper, especially bank notes, that can only be seen when you hold it up to the light

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sheet bears the watermark ‘1836’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸上有“1836”的水印。

Sense.DEF: a special mark contained in electronic documents, pictures, music etc that is used to stop people from copying them
Sense.TRAN: 〔防止电子文件﹑图片﹑音乐等被复制的〕水印
Sense.EXAMPLE: The card has a digital watermark detectable only by electronic cash dispensers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种卡上带有只能被电子取款机识别的数码水印。

Sense.DEF: the high watermark of a particular process is its most successful time or achievement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reagan’s presidency may prove to have been the high watermark of the US-Israeli alliance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里根任总统时也许是美以联盟最紧密的时期。

Sense.DEF: a line showing the highest or lowest levels of the sea
a field that is near a river and that is sometimes flooded
a large round fruit with hard green skin, red flesh, and black seeds
a piece of equipment that measures how much water is used in a building
a mill that operates using water
an underground pipe used to carry the public water supply
a pipe used for smoking, consisting of a long tube and a container of water
a toy gun that shoots water
a ball game played in water between two teams
power obtained from moving water, used to produce electricity or to make a machine work
not allowing water to enter
Sense.EXAMPLE: a waterproof jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防水上衣
Sense.EXAMPLE: waterproof adhesive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防水黏合剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rub the wax in to make the shoe waterproof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在鞋子上抹点蜡使其防水。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Plastic sheeting was used to waterproof the shed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 用了塑料板以防棚子进水。

Sense.DEF: a jacket or coat that does not allow rain and water through it

GramExa.GLOSS: a waterproof jacket and trousers

Sense.DEF: an animal like a big mouse that can swim and lives near water
material that is water-repellent has been covered with a substance that makes water run off it, so that it does not become wet
Sense.TRAN: 〔材料因涂满某种物质〕防水的﹐拒水的

Sense.DEF: something that is water resistant does not allow water to enter easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is this watch water resistant?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块表防水吗？

Sense.DEF: an event or time when important changes happen in history or in your life
Sense.TRAN: 〔历史或人生的〕转折点﹐重要关头

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 1932 election represented a watershed in American politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1932年的选举是美国政治的分水岭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a watershed case on pension rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 标志着退休金权利转折性变化的案例

Sense.DEF: the time in the evening after which television programmes that are not considered suitable for children may be shown in Britain
Sense.TRAN: (9点钟)分水线〔英国晚间允许成人电视节目播放的起始时间〕

Sense.DEF: the high land separating two river systems
the area at the edge of a lake, river etc
a sport in which you ski over water while being pulled by a boat

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Tracy was a keen swimmer and water skier.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 特雷西热衷于游泳和滑水。

Sense.DEF: a slide that goes down into a swimming pool, usually with water running down it
a chemical used for removing unwanted minerals from water
a piece of equipment used for removing unwanted minerals from water
a water-soluble substance is solid but becomes liquid when mixed with water
sports that you play in water
a tall stream of water that the wind pulls up from the sea during a violent storm
Sense.TRAN: 〔由风暴引起的〕水龙卷﹐海龙卷

Sense.DEF: a pipe that carries water
the level below the ground where there is water
a watertight container, roof, door etc does not allow water to get in or out
Sense.TRAN: 〔容器﹑屋顶﹑门等〕不透水的﹐防水的﹐水密的

Sense.DEF: an argument, plan etc that is watertight is made very carefully so that people cannot find any mistakes in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔论点﹑计划等〕严密的﹐周密的﹔无懈可击的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucky for him, his alibi is watertight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 算他走运﹐不在犯罪现场的证据无懈可击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unless the ban is watertight, EU laws will overturn it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条禁令除非是十分严密﹐否则会被欧盟法律推翻。

Sense.DEF: a tall building supporting a large container of water that supplies the buildings near it
water in the form of small drops in the air
an animal like a big mouse that can swim and lives near water
a river or canal that boats travel on
a large wheel that is turned by water and is used to drive machinery
two bags filled with air that you fasten on your arms when you are learning to swim
Sense.TRAN: 〔学习游泳时套在两臂上的〕双翼形充气浮袋

Sense.DEF: the system of pipes and water supplies in a town or city
a building in which water is cleaned and then pumped to houses, buildings etc
to start crying in order to get sympathy
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t turn on the waterworks,’ he sighed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别哭了。”他叹了口气说。

Sense.DEF: the organs in your body through which urineliquid waste is removed
full of water or relating to water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were red and watery from crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛哭得红红的﹐眼里含满泪水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snakes lay eggs in a watery environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇在潮湿的环境里产卵。

Sense.DEF: very weak or pale
Sense.EXAMPLE: a watery sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苍白的太阳
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a watery smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝他淡然一笑。

Sense.DEF: watery food or drink contains too much water and has little taste
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物或饮料〕稀薄的﹐含水太多的﹔味淡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bowl of watery stew
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一碗稀薄无味的炖菜

Sense.DEF: if someone has a watery grave, they drowndie by breathing in water
a humorous expression for the northern part of Britain, especially in its distance from London
Sense.TRAN: 沃特福德以北〔英国北部的幽默说法﹐尤指离伦敦很远〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know where that town is. It’s north of Watford somewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道那镇子在哪里﹐大约是在沃特福德以北的什么地方吧。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring electrical power
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 100-watt bulb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 100瓦的灯泡

Sense.DEF: the power of a piece of electrical equipment, measured in watts
a frame made from sticks woven together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wattle fence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编筑的篱笆
Sense.EXAMPLE: walls made of wattle and daub this frame covered with clay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抹灰篱笆墙

Sense.DEF: the red flesh that grows on the head or neck of some birds, such as chickens
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些禽类头部或颈部的〕红色肉垂

Sense.DEF: a type of computer file that contains sound
Sense.TRAN: 波形音频文件﹐WAV音频文件〔一种计算机声音文件格式〕

Sense.DEF: a line of raised water that moves across the surface of the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dee watched the waves breaking on the shore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪伊凝视着拍岸的波涛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship tipped over, and finally vanished beneath the waves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船倾覆了﹐最终沉没在海浪之下。

Sense.DEF: a sudden increase in a particular type of behaviour, activity, or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑活动或感情的〕一阵﹔风潮﹐浪潮
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a wave of public protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一波公众抗议浪潮出现了。

Sense.DEF: a sudden increase in the number of people or things arriving at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new wave of immigrants
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一股新的移民潮

Sense.EXAMPLE: They faced wave after wave of fresh troops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们遭遇了一批又一批的增援部队。

Sense.DEF: the form in which some types of energy such as light and sound travel
a movement in which you raise your arm and move your hand from side to side
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dismissed her with a wave of the hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摆摆手让她离开。

Sense.DEF: a feeling or activity that happens again and again in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain swept over him in waves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛一阵阵向他袭来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wave after wave of aircraft passed overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批又一批飞机从头顶飞过。

Sense.DEF: a loose curl in your hair
to cause problems, especially when you should not
Sense.EXAMPLE: With so many jobs already cut, he didn’t want to make waves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经有那么多人被裁员﹐他可不想惹麻烦。

Sense.DEF: a new style of music, art, film etc that is very different and unusual
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐﹑艺术﹑电影等风格的〕新浪潮﹐新流派
Sense.EXAMPLE: new wave music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新浪潮音乐

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the new wave of Black feminist theorists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新涌现的这批黑人女权主义理论家

Sense.DEF: an occasion when many people who are watching an event stand up, move their arms up and down, and sit down again one after another in a continuous movement that looks like a wave moving on the sea
Sense.TRAN: 人浪〔指观众依次站起和坐下以造成波浪的效果〕

Sense.DEF: the sea

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一波暴力/攻击/爆炸事件
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The incident triggered a wave of violence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件引发了一波暴力事件。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A wave of relief washed over Harry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵宽慰感涌上亨利心头。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a sudden increase in crime
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The city is experiencing a crime wave.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市正在经历一波犯罪浪潮。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a period of unusually hot weather
Collocate.EXAMPLE: California is in the middle of a heat wave.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚州正处在一波热浪中。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was hit by a wave of nausea every time he tried to stand up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次他试图站起身﹐都会感觉到一阵恶心。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it affects someone or something very strongly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The city was engulfed by a fresh wave of violence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一波暴力浪潮席卷该市。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone suddenly experiences a feeling or emotion
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A sudden wave of joy swept over her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵喜悦涌上她心头。

Sense.DEF: to raise your arm and move your hand from side to side in order to make someone notice you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She turned to wave to the approaching soldiers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转身向走来的士兵挥手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Enid waved at us and we waved back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊妮德向我们挥手﹐我们也向她挥手。

GramExa.GLOSS: say goodbye to someone by waving to them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The nurses came out to wave Grandad goodbye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士们出来跟爷爷挥手道别。

Sense.DEF: if you wave something, or if it waves, it moves from side to side
Sense.TRAN: 挥动﹐摆动〔某物〕﹔上下起伏﹔左右摇晃
Sense.EXAMPLE: The starter waved a green flag to indicate that the race would begin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发令员挥动绿旗﹐示意比赛即将开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tree waving in the breeze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在微风中摇曳的树
Sense.EXAMPLE: He waved a hand in the air to attract her attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挥手想吸引她的注意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trudie waved a $50 bill under his nose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特鲁迪拿着一张50美元的钞票在他鼻子底下晃了晃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stranger spoke rapidly, waving his arms around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个陌生人挥舞着双臂﹐急急地说着。

Sense.DEF: to show someone which way to go by waving your hand in that direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The border guards waved us through.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 边防哨兵挥手示意我们通过。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter waved them back to their seats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得挥挥手让他们坐回自己的位子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: wave sth goodbye/wave goodbye to sth
Sense.DEF: to be forced to accept that something you want will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 与某事挥别〔指被迫接受不如意的结局〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re not careful, you can wave goodbye to any pay rise this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不小心点的话﹐今年就别想涨工资了。

Sense.DEF: to make a bad situation better, even though this is impossible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t wave a magic wand and change what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有办法挥动魔杖改变已经发生的事。

Sense.DEF: if hair waves, or if it is waved, it forms loose curls
to ignore someone’s opinion or ideas because you do not think they are important
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人的意见或主意〕不屑一顾﹐不理会
Sense.EXAMPLE: He waved her protests aside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她的抗议置之不理。

Sense.DEF: to signal to the driver of a car to stop by waving at them
Sense.EXAMPLE: People in passing cars tried waving him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驶过的车辆里的人挥手示意他停车。

Sense.DEF: to wave goodbye to someone as they leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you coming to the station to wave me off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去车站给我送行吗？

Sense.DEF: a set of sound waves of a particular length, used to broadcast radio programmes
the size of a radio wave used to broadcast a radio signal
the distance between two points on energy waves such as sound or light

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the same/a different wavelength
Sense.DEF: to have the same or different opinions and feelings as someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔与他人的观点﹑感情〕相投/不合
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad is just on a different wavelength from me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸和我就是没有共同语言。

Sense.DEF: to become weaker or less certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice wavered uncertainly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吞吞吐吐的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The students’ attention did not waver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生的兴趣没有减弱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harris never wavered in his loyalty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里斯的忠心从未动摇过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were determined not to waver from our goals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坚决不会动摇目标。

Sense.DEF: to not make a decision because you have doubts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shareholders who were wavering met the directors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 举棋不定的股东们会见了董事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party wavered between free trade and protectionism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党在自由贸易和保护主义之间摇摆不定。

Sense.DEF: to move gently in several different directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The candle flame wavered, throwing shadows on the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烛光摇曳﹐在墙上投下影子。

Sense.DEF: someone who cannot make a decision, especially in a vote
Sense.TRAN: 犹豫不决的人〔尤指投票者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a final push to win over the waverers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把摇摆不定的人争取过来的最后努力

Sense.DEF: wavy hair grows in waves
a wavy line is smoothly curved
a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: wax crayons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜡笔

Sense.DEF: a natural sticky substance in your ears
to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine
to talk with extreme feeling, liking, or pleasure about something – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 伤感/滔滔不绝/热情奔放地说〔幽默用法〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Journalists wax lyrical about the band.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者盛赞那支乐队。

Sense.DEF: when the moon waxes, it seems to get bigger each night
to increase and decrease over time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest in the show has waxed and waned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对这个节目曾经颇有兴趣﹐现已热情不再。

Sense.DEF: if you wax your legs, arms etc, you remove the hair from them using wax
Sense.TRAN: 用蜡去除〔腿﹑手臂等〕的毛

Sense.DEF: paper covered with a thin layer of wax, used to wrap food
pale and shiny like wax
Sense.EXAMPLE: his waxen face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他蜡一般的苍白面孔

Sense.DEF: made from wax
Sense.EXAMPLE: waxen images
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜡像

Sense.DEF: a place where you can see models of famous people made of wax
a wax model of a person
like wax, or made of wax
Sense.EXAMPLE: the waxy blossoms of the water lily
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡莲那如蜡一般的花朵
Sense.EXAMPLE: young men with waxy faces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面如白蜡的青年男子

Sense.DEF: a method that you use to do or achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are several different ways we can tackle this problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以用几种不同的方法处理这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Evening classes are one way of meeting new people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上夜校是认识新朋友的一个渠道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no way of knowing if the treatment will work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有办法知道这种治疗方法是否有效。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the best way to learn a language?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学一门语言最好的方法是什么？

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the same way/in various ways
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make the drink with boiling water in the same way as tea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 像泡茶一样用沸水冲泡这种饮料。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Animals communicate in various ways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物用各种各样的方式交流。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you’re going about this the wrong way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你这么做方法不对。

GramExa.GLOSS: methods of doing something, especially ones that are secret or not yet decided
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔尤指秘密或还未确定的〕办法﹐手段﹐方式
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are ways and means of raising the money that we need.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些办法可以筹到我们需要的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One way around the problem method of dealing with it is recycling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这个问题的一种途径就是回收利用。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There seems to be no way out of the current economic crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎没有办法能摆脱目前的经济危机。

GramExa.GLOSS: a method of getting involved in a particular activity or type of work
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 进入电视界/出版界/金融界等的途径
GramExa.EXAMPLE: companies eager for a way into business in Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 急于在欧洲打通商路的公司

Sense.DEF: the manner or style in which someone does something or in which something happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人做某事或某事发生的〕方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look at the way he’s dressed!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看他的打扮！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Hello,’ he said in a friendly way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你好。”他友好地说。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maria got up and took a shower in a leisurely way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚起了床﹐从从容容地洗了个淋浴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I find it easier to work in this way like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这样做容易一些。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I didn’t know you felt that way had that feeling or opinion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不知道你原来是这么想的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The drugs didn’t seem to affect Anna in the same way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药似乎在安娜身上没有起到相同的效果。

GramExa.PROPFORM: that’s no way to do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone that they should not be doing something in a particular manner
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 不能用这种方式做某事
GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s no way to speak to your father!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能这样跟你父亲说话！

GramExa.GLOSS: in a number of ways
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The changes will benefit the company in more ways than one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些改变将使公司在多方面受益。

GramExa.GLOSS: in a personal way that other people may not recognize
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he does love you, in his own way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信他是爱你的﹐用他自己的方式。

Subsense.DEF: a road, path, direction etc that you take in order to get to a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Which is the quickest way to the sea from here?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里到海边走哪条路最快？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are several ways through the woods.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有好几条路可以穿过树林。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you tell me the way to the station?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我到车站怎么走吗？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Does anyone know the way from here?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有谁知道从这里怎么走吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was afraid of losing my way in the dark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我害怕在黑暗中迷路。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you find your way back to the car park?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能找到回停车场的路吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: the door, path etc which you can use to leave a building or area
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Which is the way out?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪条路可以出去？

GramExa.GLOSS: the door, path etc which you can use to enter a building or area
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked all around, but she couldn’t seem to find the way in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她环顾四周﹐但似乎找不到入口。

GramExa.GLOSS: in the same direction as someone is going
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Want a lift? It’s on my way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要搭车吗？我顺路。

GramExa.GLOSS: not in the same direction as someone is going
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I live miles out of your way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家和你那儿完全是两个方向。

Subsense.DEF: a particular direction from where you are now
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Which way is north?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪边是北？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Walk this way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这边走。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A big Mercedes was coming the other way from the opposite direction.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆很大的梅赛德斯汽车正从对面开来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He left the house, looking carefully both ways.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开房子﹐谨慎地望望两边。

Sense.SIGNPOST: PART OF STH THAT IS TRUE
Sense.DEF: used to say that there is a fact or a feature of something that makes a statement or description true
Sense.TRAN: 方面〔用于指出从某方面来看某种陈述或描述是正确的〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In one way you’re right, I suppose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想从某种意义上来说你是对的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Working at home makes sense, in many ways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在家工作从很多方面来说都是合理的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben is a perfectly normal child in every way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本在各方面都是一个完全正常的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never got mad at me. He was great in that way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从不对我发火﹐在这一点上他相当不错。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that something is not true
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This should in no way be seen as a defeat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这绝对不应该被看成一次失败。

Sense.DEF: a distance or a length of time, especially a long one
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was still a long way from home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我离家还很远。

GramExa.GLOSS: quite a long distance
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had to park some way from the restaurant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只得把车停在离餐馆很远的地方。

GramExa.GLOSS: far away in distance or in time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A peace settlement now seems a long way off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 签订和平协议现在看来似乎还很遥远。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to go all that way and not see him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想跑了那么远的路却见不到他。

GramExa.GLOSS: the full distance or length of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you really swim all the way across?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的是一路游过去的吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was awake all the way through the night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我彻夜未眠。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s quite a ways from here, isn’t it?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离这里很远﹐是吗？

Sense.SIGNPOST: THE SPACE IN FRONT OF YOU
Sense.DEF: if someone or something is in the way, they are blocking the space in front of you, and you cannot move forward

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in the way/be in sb’s way
GramExa.GLOSS: be blocking a road, someone’s path etc so that they cannot move forward easily
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a big truck in the way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一辆大卡车挡着路。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sorry, am I in your way?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我是不是挡你的路了？

Sense.EXAMPLE: A policeman yelled at the crowds to get out of the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个警察大声呼喊要人群让开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way ahead was blocked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前面的路被堵住了。

Subsense.DEF: to move to the side so that there is space for someone or something to pass
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The crowd stepped aside to make way for the procession.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群退到一边﹐给游行队伍让路。

Subsense.DEF: to make it possible for something newer or better to be built, organized etc
Subsense.TRAN: 让位给〔更新或更好的事物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Several houses were demolished to make way for a new road.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几栋房子被拆了﹐让出地方修一条新路。

Subsense.DEF: if someone or something is out of the way, they are somewhere where they are not likely to cause a problem, need attention, be annoying etc

GramExa.PROPFORM: move/put/push etc sth out of the way
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you tie your hair back, out of the way?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不把头发扎到后面去﹐省得碍事？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: If Uncle Tom had been drinking, I kept out of his way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是汤姆叔叔喝过酒﹐我就不去惹他。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When Mac was safely out of the way, Peter came round.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克总算不再碍事了﹐又来了个彼得。

Subsense.DEF: if a particular matter, job etc is out of the way, it has been done or dealt with
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d rather get the interview out of the way in the morning.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宁愿上午就完成面试。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As soon as the contract’s out of the way, we can start.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同一签完﹐我们就可以开始了。

Subsense.DEF: a place that is out of the way is far from any towns
arriving or happening soon
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s a letter on its way to you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你很快就会收到一封信。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: More changes are on the way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还会有更多变化。

Subsense.DEF: travelling towards a particular place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She should be on the way here by now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在她应该在来的路上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ships were already on their way to the gulf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些船已经在开往海湾的路上。

Subsense.DEF: while going from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ran out of gas on my way to the airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在去机场的路上我的车没油了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Guess who I bumped into on the way home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 猜猜我在回家的路上碰到谁了？

Subsense.DEF: while moving from one situation or part of your life to another
Subsense.TRAN: 一路过来〔指经历不同境况或人生阶段〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’s had to change jobs several times along the way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐一路走来已经被迫换了好几次工作。

Subsense.DEF: if someone has a baby on the way, they are pregnant
to have started to happen or be done
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Plans are well under way for a new shopping centre.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座新的购物中心正在规划中。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The tournament got under way on Friday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锦标赛是星期五开始的。

Subsense.DEF: to have started to move or travel somewhere
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Our train was already under way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的列车已经出发了。

Subsense.DEF: to go towards something, especially when this is difficult or takes a long time
Subsense.TRAN: 行进〔尤指路途艰难或需要很长时间〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team slowly made their way back to base.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队慢慢地返回基地。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make your own way (home/to sth etc)
GramExa.GLOSS: go somewhere without the help or company of other people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. I can make my own way to the beach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我可以自己去海滩。

Subsense.DEF: to gradually become successful in a particular job, activity, profession etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在工作﹑活动﹑职业等中〕逐步取得成功
Subsense.EXAMPLE: young people who are making their way in industry
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在行业里逐渐立足的年轻人

Sense.DEF: to get somewhere by using force or moving carefully
Sense.TRAN: 硬挤向/摸索着走向/小心翼翼地挪向某处
Sense.EXAMPLE: She elbowed her way to the front of the queue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挤到了队伍的前面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drank some water, then groped his way back to the bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝了些水﹐又摸回卧室。

Subsense.DEF: to be replaced by something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stone has given way to glass and concrete.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石料已经被玻璃和混凝土取代。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My anger gave way to depression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我由愤怒变成了沮丧。

Subsense.DEF: to agree to do what someone else wants, instead of what you want, especially after a lot of discussion or argument
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过反复讨论或争论〕让步﹐退让
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Despite growing pressure, the Minister of State refused to give way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管压力越来越大﹐国务大臣仍然拒绝让步。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maria seemed to despise him for giving way to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚似乎看不起他让着自己。

Subsense.DEF: to break because of too much weight or pressure
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The floor’s rotten and likely to give way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板烂了﹐可能会塌。

Subsense.DEF: to stop or slow down when you are driving, in order to allow other vehicles to go first
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In Britain, give way to cars coming from the right.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国﹐要让右方来车先行。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for something to happen or develop later
Sense.TRAN: (为某事物)扫清道路/铺平道路/开辟道路/创造条件等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a study that paved the way for further research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为进一步研究创造了条件的一项调查
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Queen’s death opened the way for him to return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王的去世为他的回归铺平了道路。

Sense.DEF: an action, plan etc that seems a good idea because it is likely to lead to success
Sense.EXAMPLE: A way forward lies in developing more economic links.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望在于建立更多的经济纽带。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This treatment may be the way forward for many inherited disorders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种治疗方法可能会为治愈众多遗传疾病带来希望。

Sense.DEF: a particular state or condition
