Sense.EXAMPLE: My family was in a bad way financially.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家当时经济窘迫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chicken’s nice and crispy – just the way I like it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这鸡肉很脆﹐正是我喜欢的口味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s worth thinking how you can improve the way things are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该想想如何让现状变得更好。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that someone’s character is not likely to change
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’ll always be mean – he was born that way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他永远都很吝啬——天生就这样。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate the way you always give in to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌你总是向他让步。

Sense.DEF: someone’s typical style of behaving, especially when it seems different or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人典型的〕行为方式〔尤指看起来不同或不寻常〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry if she’s quiet – that’s just her way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她不说话你也别担心﹐她就是那样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Esther quickly changed the subject, as was her way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃丝特很快转换了话题﹐她一向如此。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We all have our funny little ways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都有些小怪癖。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop behaving badly

Crossrefto.REFLEX: see the error of your ways

Sense.DEF: used in expressions about developing and improving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team has a long way to go needs to develop or improve a lot before it can match that performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队要想有那样的表现﹐还有很长一段路要走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Microwave ovens have come a long way have developed or improved a lot since they first appeared in our kitchens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与刚进入我们的厨房时相比﹐微波炉现在已经大有改进。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jen is now well on the way to recovery she has improved and will be well soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍现在恢复得很好。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go some way towards doing sth

Variant.LEXVAR: go a long way towards doing sth

Sense.DEF: to help a little or a lot to make something happen
Sense.TRAN: 对于做某事有点帮助[很有帮助]
Sense.EXAMPLE: ideas that go some way towards reducing environmental problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对减少环境问题有些许帮助的想法

Sense.DEF: used when talking about two choices someone could make, or two possibilities that could happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种之中的一种〕选择﹔可能性
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure which way he’ll decide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太确定他会如何决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The election could go either way both results are equally possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次选举两种结果都有可能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make your mind up one way or the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论如何你都要作出决定。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something will be the same, whichever of two things happens
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Either way, it’s going to be expensive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管怎样都会很贵。

Sense.LEXUNIT: within two feet/ten years etc either way
Sense.DEF: no more than two feet etc more or less than a particular amount
Sense.TRAN: 〔误差〕上下不超过两英尺/十年等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your answer must be within a centimetre either way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 答案的误差必须在上下一厘米之内。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (in) one way or another/one way or the other
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does or will do something somehow, although you are not sure how
Sense.EXAMPLE: One way or the other he always seems to win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管怎样他看上去都是胜券在握的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll find the money, one way or another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会找到这笔钱的﹐不管怎样。

Sense.DEF: a particular order or position that something should be in
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物应该属于某个〕次序[位置]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which way around does this skirt go?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条裙子该放在哪儿？

GramExa.GLOSS: in the opposite order or position
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The picture should be the other way up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画应该上下倒过来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Art reflects life, or is it the other way around is it ‘life reflects art’?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是艺术反映生活﹐还是生活反映艺术？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are the batteries in the wrong way round?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电池是不是放反了？

Subsense.DEF: as a form or means of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to say something by way of introduction.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想说几句介绍一下。

GramExa.PROPFORM: little in the way of sth

Variant.LEXVAR: not much/enough in the way of sth

GramExa.GLOSS: not much of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The town has little in the way of leisure facilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个镇子几乎没有休闲设施。

Subsense.DEF: if you travel by way of a place, you go through it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We went by way of London.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们途经伦敦。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get in the way of sth
Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing something, or prevent something from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your social life must not get in the way of your studies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能让社交生活影响学业。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go out of your way to do sth
Sense.DEF: to do something with more effort than is usual or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went out of her way to make me feel welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她费尽心思要让我觉得我是受欢迎的。

Sense.DEF: to do what you want to, even though someone else wants something different
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let the children always get their own way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让孩子总是随心所欲。

Sense.DEF: to do what you want, make your own decisions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: At 18, most young people are ready to go their own way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了18岁﹐大多数年轻人都准备好自己做主了。

Subsense.DEF: if an event goes your way, it happens in the way you want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government are hopeful that the vote will go their way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府很乐观﹐相信选举将会对他们有利。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to talk about events in general
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 事事/没有一件事遂某人心愿

Subsense.DEF: to continue a journey, or to leave and do what you want to do next
Subsense.TRAN: 继续〔旅程〕﹔离开〔去做要做的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She said goodbye and went her way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她道别以后就离开了。

Subsense.DEF: to travel in the same direction as someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can take you – I’m going your way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以带上你﹐我和你同路。

Sense.DEF: if something comes your way, you get or experience it, especially by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luck had come her way at the very last moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好运在最后时刻降临到她头上。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the degree to which something happens, or how important it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business was a success, in a small way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司成功了﹐是小规模的成功。

Sense.DEF: by a large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the best in the group by a long way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这些人当中鹤立鸡群。

Sense.LEXUNIT: talk/buy etc your way into/past etc sth/sb
Sense.DEF: to get where you want or achieve something you want by saying or doing something
Sense.TRAN: 通过说[做]〔某事〕达到目的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Caroline managed to talk her way past the guard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗琳设法说服了卫兵让她过去。

Sense.LEXUNIT: work/munch/smoke etc your way through sth
Sense.DEF: to deal with, eat, smoke etc a large amount of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: He worked his way through the pile of documents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从头到尾处理了那一堆文件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had munched her way through a packet of biscuits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃掉了一整包饼干。

Sense.DEF: to be becoming less popular, important, powerful etc
Sense.TRAN: 变得不再受欢迎[不再重要﹐不再有权势等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the royal family on the way out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室是否已过时？

Sense.DEF: on the opposite side of the street
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live across the way from us at number 23.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在我们对面的23号。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a way of doing sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that something often or usually happens
Sense.TRAN: 经常[总是]以某种形式发生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cheer up – these problems have a way of working out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 振作起来﹐这些问题总会解决的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get into the way of doing sth
Sense.DEF: to start to do something regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d got into the way of smoking first thing in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他养成了一起床就抽烟的习惯。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not in any way, shape, or form
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is not true
Sense.TRAN: 不以任何形式〔强调某事不是真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am not responsible for his actions in any way, shape, or form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他的行为不负一丝一毫的责任。

Sense.DEF: to divide something into two, three etc equal parts
Sense.TRAN: 将某物平均分成两份/三份等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll split the cost between us five ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们五个人将平摊费用。

Sense.DEF: to be especially good at dealing with people or things of a particular type
Sense.TRAN: 对付某人/做某事很有一套
Sense.EXAMPLE: David seems to have a way with children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来戴维对付孩子很有一手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always had a way with words been good at using words effectively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一向善于辞令。

Sense.DEF: how things always happen or are done, especially when this is not easy to change
Sense.TRAN: 大多数人的行为方式﹔世道﹔事情发生的规律
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days these policies favoured men. That was the way of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候这些政策倾向于男性﹐当时的世道就是这样。

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: in all directions
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bullets were flying every which way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹四处横飞。

Subsense.DEF: every possible method
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I tried every which way to avoid it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想方设法避免那种情况。

Sense.DEF: used in the names of roads
Sense.EXAMPLE: Church Way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂道

Sense.DEF: used when saying something that is not related to the main subject you were talking about before
Sense.TRAN: 附带[顺便]说〔用于转入与之前主题无关的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the way, have you seen my keys anywhere?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺便问问﹐你有没有在哪儿见过我的钥匙？

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you will definitely not do or allow something
Subsense.TRAN: 不！不行！〔表示断然拒绝做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I borrow your car?’ ‘No way!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我能借用你的汽车吗？”“不行！”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s no way I’ll ever get married again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不再婚。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that you will not do something

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not believe something or are very surprised by it
Subsense.TRAN: 不会吧！不可能！〔表示不相信或惊讶〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s 45? No way!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她45岁？不会吧！

Sense.DEF: used before telling someone your opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way I see it, it was a fair trade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看﹐这是公平交易。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are doing something correctly or well, especially when you are showing them how
Sense.TRAN: 就是这样﹔就这么做〔尤用于告诉某人其做法正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now bring your foot gently off the clutch – that’s the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在把你的脚慢慢地松开离合器——对了﹐就是这样。

Sense.LEXUNIT: that’s (just) the way sth/sb is/that’s (just) the way sth goes
Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular situation or person cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 某事物/某人就是那样〔指无法改变〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to fight it. That’s just the way it is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要试图抗争﹐只能这样了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes Tim needs to be alone. That’s the way he is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆有时需要独处﹐他就是那样。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be with sb all the way
Sense.DEF: to agree with someone completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m with you all the way on this salary issue, Joe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个工资问题上﹐我完全同意你﹐乔。

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone what you think it would be best to do
Sense.TRAN: 要我说〔用于告诉某人什么办法最好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I had my way, we’d leave this place tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我说﹐我们明天就应该离开这地方。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone in an annoyed way that you will agree to what they want

Sense.LEXUNIT: (there are) no two ways about it
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is definitely true, especially something unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不愉快的事〕千真万确﹐绝对错不了

Sense.LEXUNIT: you can’t have it both ways
Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot have the advantages from both of two different possible decisions or actions
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种决定或行动的好处〕不能兼得
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a choice between the time and the money – you can’t have it both ways!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是时间和金钱之间的选择——你不能两者兼得！

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they have done something very well or achieved something special
used to say that things always happen in the way that is least convenient
Sense.TRAN: 总是这样！〔用于表示事情总是以让人感到最不方便的方式发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was late – always the way when you’re in a hurry!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车误点了——在你赶时间的时候总是这样！

Sense.DEF: in your area, the area of London etc
Sense.TRAN: 在你住的地区/在伦敦(附近)等

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone

Crossrefto.REFLEX: that’s the way the cookie crumbles
go the way of all flesh
be laughing all the way to the bank
rub sb up the wrong way
see which way the wind is blowing
see your way (clear) to doing sth
where there’s a will there’s a way
work your way to/through etc sth

Section.SECHEADING: A WAY OF DOING SOMETHING 做某事的方法

Exponent.DEF: something you can do in order to achieve what you want or deal with a problem
Exponent.TRAN: 〔达到目的或处理问题的〕方法﹐方式
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Visiting a country is a great way to learn a language.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 去一个国家是学习语言的好办法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a good way to lose weight
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 减肥妙方

Exponent.DEF: a way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指许多人知道并使用的〕方法﹐办法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They still use traditional methods of farming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们仍采用传统的农耕方式。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: modern teaching methods
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代教学法

Exponent.DEF: a general way of dealing with a particular problem or situation, especially a way that has been carefully thought about
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指经过仔细考虑的〕方法﹐途径
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need a whole new approach to environmental issues.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 应对环境问题我们需要全新的方法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There will be considerable advantages to adopting this approach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 采用这一方法好处很多。

Exponent.DEF: a way of doing something for which you need a skill that must be learned and practised
Exponent.TRAN: 〔需通过学习和实践才能获取的〕技巧﹐手法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I went to a class to learn relaxation techniques.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上了一个学习班学习放松技巧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: new surgical techniques
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的外科技术
Exponent.EXAMPLE: techniques for improving staff performance
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 提升员工工作表现的技巧

Exponent.DEF: a carefully planned way to achieve something difficult or complicated that may take a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They met to discuss the company’s business strategy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开会讨论公司的经营策略。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the government’s long-term strategy for reducing crime
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府减少犯罪的长期策略

Sense.DEF: very far

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other cyclists were way behind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他骑车者远远落在后面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives way out of town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她住得离镇上很远。

Sense.DEF: by a large amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her IQ is way above average.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的智商远远高于平均水平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your guess was way out completely incorrect, he’s actually thirty-eight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你完全猜错了﹐他其实是38岁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We first met way back a long time ago in the seventies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们早在70年代就认识了。

GramExa.GLOSS: much heavier etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 重得多/聪明得多/大得多等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tickets were way more expensive than I thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 票比我预想的要贵多了。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she’s way cool, man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她太酷了﹐哥们。

Sense.DEF: a document sent with goods that says where the goods are to be delivered, how much they are worth, and how much they weigh
someone who travels from one place to another on foot
if someone waylays you, they stop you when you are going somewhere, for example to attack you or talk to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: They used to waylay him as he came out of the factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以前总是在他从工厂出来的时候上去纠缠他。

Sense.DEF: if you are waylaid, you are delayed when you are doing something – often used humorously to say why you are late
Sense.TRAN: 耽搁〔常为幽默用法﹐说明为何迟到〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, we got waylaid at the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我们在酒吧耽搁了一会儿。

Sense.DEF: the behaviour, habits, customs etc that are typical of a particular society or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tribe’s traditional way of life is under threat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个部落的传统生活方式受到了威胁。

GramExa.PROPFORM: the American/British etc way of life
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 美国人/英国人等的生活方式

Sense.DEF: a job or interest that is so important that it affects everything you do
Sense.TRAN: 生活方式﹔生活中重要的事情〔如工作或兴趣爱好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For Mark, travelling has become a way of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对马克来说﹐旅游已经成了一种生活方式。

Sense.DEF: a door or passage through which you leave a building
a way to escape a difficult or bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was in a dilemma, and could see no way out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他左右为难﹐不知如何是好。

Subsense.DEF: if you do something on the way out, you do it as you leave a place
Subsense.TRAN: 离开某地的时候〔做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Pick up your mail on the way out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出门的时候取回你的邮件

Subsense.DEF: soon to be replaced by someone or something else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The old type of passport is on its way out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老版本的护照就要淘汰了。

Sense.DEF: very modern, unusual, and strange
Sense.TRAN: 时髦的﹔不寻常的﹔新奇的

Sense.DEF: the side of a road
a place to stop between the main stations of a railway
a place where you can stop before going on somewhere else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The refugee camps, however dreadful, were a way station to their dream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民营虽然糟糕﹐却是他们实现梦想的一块跳板。

Sense.DEF: behaving badly, in a way that is difficult to control
Sense.TRAN: 难以控制的﹔任性的﹔倔强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wayward teenager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任性的少年

Sense.DEF: in a large amount, or to a great degree
a toilet – used especially on signs in public places
Sense.TRAN: 厕所〔尤用于公共厕所的标记〕

Head.GRAM: used as the subject of a verb

Sense.DEF: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you go into the supermarket?’ ‘No, we didn’t.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你们进超级市场了吗？”“我们没有进去。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall we stop for a coffee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们停下来喝杯咖啡好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: So we all travelled down to Brighton together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所以我们一起都去了布赖顿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We declare our support for a government of national unity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们宣布支持一个全国统一的政府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We Italians are proud of our history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们意大利人为自己的历史感到自豪。

Sense.DEF: used by a writer or speaker to include themselves and their readers or listeners
Sense.TRAN: 我们〔作者或说话人使用﹐指读者或听众和自己〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As we saw in Chapter 4, slavery was not the only cause of the Civil War.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如我们在第四章所见﹐蓄奴制并非内战的唯一起因。

Sense.DEF: people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: We live on a complex planet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们居住在一个复杂的星球上。

Sense.DEF: used by a king or queen to refer to himself or herself
Sense.TRAN: 寡人﹐朕〔国王或女王在正式场合的自称〕

Sense.DEF: sometimes used to mean ‘you’ when speaking to children or people who are ill
Sense.TRAN: 我们﹐咱们〔和小孩或病人说话时用﹐实指对方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are we feeling today, Mr Robson?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天感觉怎样﹐罗布森先生？

Sense.DEF: not physically strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The illness left her feeling weak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病使她感到身体虚弱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor light produces weak plants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光照不足﹐植物就生长不好。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be too weak to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s too weak to feed herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虚弱得吃不动东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nina was weak with hunger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜饿得没有力气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The animal was weak from loss of blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只动物因失血而虚弱无力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My grandfather had a weak heart.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖父心脏不好。

Sense.DEF: unable to support much weight
Sense.TRAN: 不牢固的﹐易破的﹐易损坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weak bridge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不牢固的桥

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The branch was too weak to support his weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那根树枝不牢﹐支撑不住他的重量。

Sense.DEF: easily influenced by other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 意志薄弱的﹐软弱的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weak indecisive man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软弱而优柔寡断的男人

Sense.DEF: not having much power or influence

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a weak and ineffective president
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 软弱无能的总统

Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was left weak and divided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个党被弄得软弱无力﹐四分五裂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country is in a weak position economically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个国家经济实力薄弱。

Sense.DEF: without the power to interest or amuse people
Sense.TRAN: 没有吸引力的﹐不逗人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play is well acted but the plot is weak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏演得很好﹐但情节乏味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weak joke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味的笑话

Sense.DEF: done without energy or confidence
Sense.TRAN: 无活力的﹐无生气的﹔没有自信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed a weak smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挤出一丝淡淡的微笑。

Sense.DEF: not good at a particular skill or subject, or in a particular area of activity or knowledge
Sense.TRAN: 不擅长的﹐能力弱的﹐差的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New Zealand was weak in defense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新西兰队防守薄弱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She speaks quite fluently but she’s weak on grammar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说得挺流利﹐不过语法不好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Be honest about your weak points your faults or the things you do not do well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要对自己的弱点实事求是。

Sense.DEF: not financially successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pound was weak against the dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑对美元的汇率疲软。

Sense.DEF: not likely to make people believe that something is true or right
Sense.TRAN: 没有说服力的﹐不能说服人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s washing her hair? That sounds like a weak excuse!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在洗头？这个理由也太牵强了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are some weak points in her argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的论点有几处漏洞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The defence lawyer clearly knew that his case was weak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辩护律师心里清楚﹐他的论据没有说服力。

Sense.DEF: weak tea, beer etc contains a lot of water and has little taste
difficult to see or hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weak radio signal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微弱的无线电信号
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had only a weak light to see by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只能靠一线微弱的灯光来看东西。

Sense.DEF: the parts of something that can easily be attacked or criticized
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check your house for weak spots where a thief could enter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查一下你的房子﹐看有没有容易让小偷溜进来的地方。

Sense.DEF: feeling strange because of strong emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: His smile made her go weak at the knees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的微笑让她两腿发软。

Sense.DEF: a time when you can be persuaded more easily than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave caught me at a weak moment and I lent him £10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫正好碰到我心软的时候﹐我就借了他10英镑。

Sense.DEF: the person or thing in a situation that is less strong, skilful etc than the others
Sense.TRAN: 薄弱环节/最薄弱的一环
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goalkeeper Gouter proved to be the weakest link.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员古特成了最薄弱的一环。

Sense.DEF: a verb that forms regular past tenses
Sense.TRAN: 弱动词〔过去式是规则形式的动词〕

Sense.DEF: one that is not emphasized

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He sank down weakly beside her.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他虚弱地在她旁边坐了下来。

Section.SECHEADING: NOT PHYSICALLY STRONG 身体不好的

Exponent.DEF: not physically strong, sometimes because you are ill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tom’s had flu and he’s still feeling weak.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆得了感冒﹐仍觉得身体虚弱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctors said she was too weak to have an operation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说她太虚弱﹐不能动手术。

Exponent.DEF: weak and thin, especially because you are old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a frail 85-year-old lady
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位虚弱的85岁老妇
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My grandfather’s becoming quite frail now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爷爷现在已经很虚弱了。

Exponent.DEF: feeling weak in your legs and only able to walk slowly and unsteadily
Exponent.TRAN: 摇摇晃晃的﹐步履不稳的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I came out of hospital I was a bit shaky for a while.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我出医院时有一阵子感到有点站立不稳。

Exponent.DEF: small, thin, and looking very weak
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his puny white arms
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他白白的细胳膊
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was a puny little boy who was often bullied at school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个瘦小的男孩﹐在学校里常被人欺负。

Exponent.DEF: weak and unable to do much because you are very ill, very old or young
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For a week she was too feeble to get out of bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一个星期虚弱得起不了床。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tiny, feeble baby
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个弱不禁风的娇小婴儿

Exponent.DEF: weak and often becoming ill easily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a delicate child
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个娇弱的小孩
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had rather a delicate constitution her body easily became ill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身体很娇弱。

Exponent.DEF: weak or ill for a long time, especially because you are old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a residential home for people who are elderly and infirm
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 供老年体弱者居住的安老院

Section.SECHEADING: LIKELY TO BREAK 可能断裂的

Exponent.DEF: unable to support much weight, and likely to break
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The foundations of the building are rather weak.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢建筑的地基很不坚固。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an old chair with weak legs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张椅腿不牢固的旧椅子

Exponent.DEF: made of a thin material that is easy to break or damage – used when something needs to be handled carefully
Exponent.TRAN: 易碎的﹐易损坏的〔用于表示某物需要小心轻放〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fragile china vase
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 易碎的瓷花瓶
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Be careful of those glasses – they’re very fragile.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心这些杯子﹐它们很容易碎的。

Exponent.DEF: easy to break or damage – used especially about soft materials, skin etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指柔软的面料﹑皮肤等〕易损的﹐易碎的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wash delicate fabrics separately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 精细织物要分开洗涤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This soap is good for delicate skin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种肥皂对娇嫩的皮肤很好。

Exponent.DEF: not well-made from strong materials and so easily damaged – used about furniture, houses etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔家具﹑房屋等〕劣质的﹐不结实的﹐易损坏的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a flimsy plastic table
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张劣质的塑料桌
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This keyboard’s very cheap but it’s a bit flimsy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这键盘很便宜﹐但不结实。

Exponent.DEF: in very bad condition and likely to break – used about a building, piece of furniture, vehicle etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑家具﹑车辆等〕不结实的﹐易折断的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a rickety old bicycle
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 快要散架的旧自行车
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lived in a rickety hut on the beach for several years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在海滩上一间摇摇欲坠的小屋子里住了几年。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the last two years the president’s position has weakened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去两年来﹐总统的地位被削弱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Changes in policy have weakened the power of the trade unions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策的变化削弱了工会的力量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The absence of this witness has weakened the case against the accused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名证人的缺席削弱了对被告的指控力度。

Sense.DEF: to make someone lose their physical strength, or to become physically weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julia was weakened by her long illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅因为长期患病﹐身体衰弱。

Sense.DEF: to make someone less determined, or to become less determined
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such policies weaken the resolve of potential troublemakers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的政策动摇了潜在闹事者的决心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When she begged him to let her stay, he weakened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她求他让她留下来﹐他心软了。

Sense.DEF: to make a building, structure etc less strong, or to become less strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earthquake in Cairo weakened a number of structures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开罗的这场地震使大量建筑物根基松动。

Sense.DEF: if a particular country’s money or a company’s share prices weaken, or if they are weakened, their value is reduced
Sense.TRAN: (使 货币﹑股票等价值〕疲弱﹐疲软

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pound has weakened against the dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑兑美元走势疲软。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to women as a group, in a way that is now considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 女性〔现在认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: lacking courage and unable to make your own decisions
someone who is not physically strong
Sense.TRAN: 身体虚弱的人﹐体格不强壮的人

Sense.DEF: showing little intelligence, or easily persuaded
Sense.TRAN: 智力低下的﹔优柔寡断的﹐容易说服的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weak-minded man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优柔寡断的男子

Sense.DEF: a fault in someone’s character or in a system, organization, design etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔性格﹑体制﹑组织﹑设计等的〕弱点﹐缺点﹐不足
Sense.EXAMPLE: The legislation has a fundamental weakness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项立法有一个根本性缺陷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan has strengths and weaknesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划既有优点又有缺点。

Sense.DEF: lack of strength, power, or influence

GramExa.EXAMPLE: weakness in the economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济疲软

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the growing weakness of local government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地政府的日渐软弱

Sense.DEF: the state of being physically weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: muscular weakness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肌无力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: weakness in the right arm
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 右臂无力

Sense.DEF: lack of determination shown in someone’s behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人行为上所表现的〕软弱﹐懦弱
Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t explain his weakness in giving in to her demands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也不清楚自己为什么那么懦弱﹐屈从了她的要求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dared not cry or show any sign of weakness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢哭﹐也不敢有任何懦弱的表现。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his weakness of character
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他性格的软弱

Sense.DEF: the condition of not being worth a lot of money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the weakness of the pound against the dollar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑对美元汇率的疲软

Sense.DEF: if you have a weakness for something, you like it very much even though it may not be good for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a real weakness for fashionable clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我实在是喜欢时髦的衣服。

Sense.DEF: someone who is weak-willed does not do something difficult that they had intended to do
a red swollen mark on the skin where someone has been hit
a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的财富来自石油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the distribution of wealth the way wealth is divided among the people of a country or society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财富的分配
Sense.EXAMPLE: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

Sense.DEF: a lot of something useful or good
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a wealth of information available about pregnancy and birth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以获得大量关于怀孕和分娩方面的信息。

Sense.DEF: having a lot of money, possessions etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He left as a poor, working class boy and returned as a wealthy man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走的时候是一个工人阶层的穷小子﹐回来时已经是一个腰缠万贯的富翁了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the wealthy nations of the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上的富国

Sense.DEF: people who have a lot of money, possessions etc
to gradually stop feeding a baby or young animal on its mother’s milk and start giving it ordinary food

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s time to start weaning her onto solid foods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该让她断奶吃固体食物了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone gradually stop doing something you disapprove of
Sense.EXAMPLE: advice on how to wean yourself off nicotine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于如何戒除尼古丁的建议

Sense.DEF: to be influenced by something from a very early age
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was weaned on a diet of Hollywood fantasy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自幼深受好莱坞梦的影响。

Sense.DEF: something that you use to fight with or attack someone with, such as a knife, bomb, or gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all had sticks which they planned to use as weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都持有棍棒﹐打算当武器用。

Sense.DEF: an action, piece of information, piece of equipment etc that you can use to win or be successful in doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new weapon in the fight against AIDS
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对抗艾滋病的新武器
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right now, she felt the need of every weapon in her armoury weapon that she had, including surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此时此刻﹐她觉得有必要采取一切可以采用的手段﹐包括突然袭击。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country is thought to be developing nuclear weapons.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家被认为在发展核武器。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not nuclear
one that can be used to attack someone illegally
one that can kill
the weapon used to kill someone

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The man is believed to be carrying a weapon.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名男子被认为携带了武器。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They claim the government used chemical weapons against them.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们声称政府对他们使用了化学武器。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: shoot a gun or missile

Sense.DEF: weapons of a particular type or belonging to a particular country or group
Sense.TRAN: 武器〔指某类武器﹐或指某国﹑某一组织所拥有的武器〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: nuclear weaponry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核武器

Sense.DEF: a scientist who is sent to a country that has or that might have biological or nuclear weapons in order to check that UN resolutionlaws on these types of weapon are being obeyed

chemical, nuclear, or biological weapons that are very powerful and could kill a lot of people or destroy large areas. This expression is used especially by politicians and news reporters to talk about weapons that are held by countries which are considered to be a threat to world peace.
Sense.TRAN: 大规模杀伤性武器〔此说法尤为政治人物和新闻记者使用〕

Sense.DEF: to have something such as clothes, shoes, or jewellery on your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susanna was wearing a black silk dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊娜穿着一条黑色真丝连衣裙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore glasses for reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他阅读时戴眼镜。

GramExa.GLOSS: have it around yourself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Usually I wear black, grey, or brown.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常穿黑色﹑灰色或棕色的衣服。

GramExa.PROPFORM: wear sth to a party/a dance/an interview etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m wearing a scarlet dress to the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备穿一件大红色连衣裙去参加聚会。

Sense.DEF: to have your hair or beard in a particular style or shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore her hair loose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她散着头发。

Sense.DEF: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

Subsense.DEF: to remain in good condition after a period of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The tyres on the car seem to be wearing well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车的轮胎看来很耐磨。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is wearing well, they look younger than they really are
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He must have been around his mid-forties at least, but he’d worn well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他至少该有四十五六岁了﹐不过显得很年轻。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular expression on your face

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His face wore a welcoming smile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上挂着热情的微笑。

Subsense.DEF: if something is wearing thin, you are bored with it because it is not interesting any more, or has become annoying
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The film begins well but the joke wears thin after about ten minutes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影开始时很有意思﹐不过大约十分钟以后就索然无味了。

Subsense.DEF: if your patience is wearing thin, you have very little left, because of a delay or problem
Subsense.TRAN: 〔由于延误或出现问题〕耐性渐渐消失﹐变得不耐烦

Sense.DEF: to be the person in a family who makes the decisions

Sense.LEXUNIT: wear your heart on your sleeve
Sense.DEF: informal to show your true feelings openly
Sense.TRAN: 把喜怒挂在脸上﹐公开流露感情

Sense.DEF: to gradually become thinner or smoother, or to make something become like this, because of rubbing or touching
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leather is starting to wear away at the seams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮面的接缝处开始磨损了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the grass had already been worn away by the spectators.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分草已被观众踏平了。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become flatter or smoother, or to make something become like this, because of rubbing or use
Sense.EXAMPLE: My shoes have worn down at the heel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的鞋子后跟已经磨损了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Its teeth were worn down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的齿被磨平了。

Sense.DEF: to gradually make someone physically weaker or less determined
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was clear he was being worn down by the rumours over his future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很明显﹐那些关于他前途的传言搞得他意志消沉。

Sense.DEF: if pain or the effect of something wears off, it gradually stops
Sense.TRAN: 〔疼痛或某种效果〕逐渐减少[消失]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The effects of the anaesthetic were starting to wear off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麻醉剂的效力开始逐渐消退。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you stop feeling interested or excited about something because it is no longer new
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was funny for a while but the novelty soon wore off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始有一会儿很好玩﹐但是新鲜感很快就过去了。

Sense.DEF: if time wears on, it passes very slowly, especially when you are waiting for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔时间〕慢慢过去〔尤指在等待某事发生时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was feeling more tired as the night wore on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜渐渐深了﹐我感觉越来越疲倦。

Sense.DEF: to become damaged and useless, or to make something like this, by using it a lot or for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: My boots are beginning to wear out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的靴子开始磨破了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He travels so much he actually wears out suitcases.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经常出门旅行﹐连旅行箱都用坏了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel extremely tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this shopping has worn us out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买这些东西把我们累坏了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Illness and death came suddenly; over the years she had simply worn herself out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病和死亡突然降临﹔这些年她就是把自己累垮了。

Sense.DEF: to stay with someone longer than they want you to
the clothes worn for a particular occasion or activity, or by a particular group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某个场合﹑活动中或某个群体穿的〕衣服﹐服装

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new range of casual wear
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的休闲服系列

Sense.EXAMPLE: bridal wear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘服装
Sense.EXAMPLE: the children’s wear department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 童装部

Sense.DEF: damage caused by continuous use over a long period
Sense.TRAN: 〔因长期使用而造成的〕磨损﹐损坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: Replace your trainers when they start to show signs of wear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动鞋开始出现磨损迹象就要更换。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check the equipment for wear and tear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查设备有没有损耗。

Sense.DEF: the amount of use an object, piece of clothing etc has had, or the use you can expect to get from it
Sense.TRAN: 〔物品﹑衣服等的〕使用量﹔耐用度
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dress stood up to the wear small children give their clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这连衣裙经得住小孩子那样的穿法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll get years of wear out of that coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件外套你能穿很多年。

Sense.DEF: a computer that is designed to be worn as an item of clothing
Sense.TRAN: 可穿戴计算机﹐穿戴式计算机

Sense.DEF: someone who wears a particular type of clothing, jewellery etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔服装的〕穿戴者﹔〔珠宝等的〕佩戴者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bicycle helmets offer wearers protection against head injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车头盔可以保护骑车者头部免受伤害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: hearing aid wearers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴助听器的人

Sense.DEF: making you feel tired or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 使人疲倦的﹔令人厌烦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taking care of children can be wearing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照料孩子有时很烦人。

Sense.DEF: making you feel bored, tired, or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 令人厌烦的﹔使人疲倦的﹔让人讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wearisome task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烦人的任务

Sense.DEF: very tired or bored, especially because you have been doing something for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因长期做某事〕筋疲力尽的﹐非常疲劳的﹐厌烦的﹐厌倦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found Rachel in the kitchen, looking old and weary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现雷切尔在厨房里﹐看上去苍老而疲惫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat down with a weary sigh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她疲倦地叹口气坐了下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was weary of the constant battle between them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对他们之间无休止的争斗感到厌倦了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say tired rather than weary.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 tired﹐而不说 weary
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They were tired after their journey.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行结束后他们感到很疲惫。

Sense.DEF: very tiring
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long and weary march
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人疲倦的长途行军

Sense.DEF: to become very tired, or make someone very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amanda wouldn’t admit how much the children wearied her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿曼达不愿承认孩子们把她折腾得很疲惫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As the day wore on, we wearied of the journey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着一天慢慢过去﹐我们对旅行感到厌倦了。

Sense.DEF: a small thin furry animal that kills and eats rats and birds
to avoid doing something you should do by using clever or dishonest excuses

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s now in court trying to weasel out of $25 million in debts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在正在法庭上﹐试图逃避2,500万美元的债务。

Sense.DEF: a word used instead of another word when someone wants to be less direct, honest, or clear
the temperature and other conditions such as sun, rain, and wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the weather like today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天天气如何？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather turned bitterly cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气变得很冷了。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Weather is usually used with ‘the’ or with no determiner. Do not say ‘a weather’.
F2NBox.TRAN: weather一般和the连用﹐或者不带限定词。不要说a weather
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We had good weather (NOT 不说 a good weather).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气很好。

Sense.DEF: a description on radio or television, in newspapers etc of what the weather will be like in the near future
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台﹑电视或报纸等上的〕天气预报
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always watch the weather after the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻之后我总是要看天气预报。

Sense.DEF: in all types of weather, even when it is very hot or cold
Sense.TRAN: 无论天气好坏﹐无论阴晴冷暖
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are homeless people sleeping on the streets in all weathers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不论阴晴冷暖都有无家可归的人露宿街头。

Sense.DEF: slightly ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look a bit under the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好像有点不舒服。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep a weather eye on sth
Sense.DEF: to watch a situation carefully so that you notice anything unusual or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 密切注视﹐时刻警惕〔不寻常或令人不安的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep a weather eye on your finances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要注意自己的财务状况。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not wet
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ll go out if the weather is good.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气好的话我们就出去。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: wet or stormy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Several flights were cancelled owing to bad weather.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气恶劣﹐有几个航班被取消了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Drink lots of water in hot weather.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气炎热时要多喝水。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The weather was cold and grey.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气寒冷阴沉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have had lovely weather all week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们整个星期碰上的都是好天气。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a description of what the weather is expected to be like in the near future
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s the weather forecast like for the weekend?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报说周末的天气怎么样？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a map showing the current or expected future weather
the usual weather that comes at a particular time each year
a place used for studying and recording weather conditions
if the weather is good enough
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Breakfast is served on the terrace, weather permitting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果天气允许﹐早餐就安排在露天平台上。

Sense.DEF: to come through a very difficult situation safely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company weathered the storm of objections to the scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司安然渡过了反对这个计划的风暴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Northern Ireland weathered the recession better than any other region in the UK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与英国其他地区相比﹐北爱尔兰更为顺利地熬过了经济萧条时期。

Sense.DEF: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔岩石﹑木头等〕受风雨侵蚀﹔(使)〔脸〕饱经风霜
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brick has weathered to a lovely pinky-brown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砖块经过风吹日晒﹐变成了漂亮的粉棕色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face was weathered by the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸晒得黝黑粗糙。

Sense.DEF: weather-beaten buildings, skin, clothing etc look old and damaged because they have been out in bad weather
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑皮肤﹑衣物等〕受日晒雨淋的﹐饱经风霜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his weather-beaten face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他饱经风霜的脸

Sense.DEF: boards covering the outer walls of a house
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋外墙上的〕护墙板﹐风雨板

Sense.DEF: a board fixed across the bottom of a door, to prevent water from getting inside
a weather girl or weatherman
a weather vane in the shape of a male chicken
a woman on television or radio who tells you what the weather will be like
a man on television or radio who tells you what the weather will be like
weatherproof clothing or material can keep out wind and rain
a metal object fixed to the top of a building that blows around to show the direction the wind is coming from
to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom
Sense.EXAMPLE: hand-woven scarves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手织围巾
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only a few of the women still weave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有数量很少的妇女还在编织。
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional basket weaving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的编篮技术

Sense.DEF: to put many different ideas, subjects, stories etc together and connect them smoothly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She weaves a complicated plot of romance and intrigue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她编织了一套爱情与阴谋交织的复杂情节。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the complex patterns which evolve when individuals’ lives are woven together
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人生活交织在一起形成的复杂格局

Sense.DEF: to attract or interest someone very much
to move somewhere by turning and changing direction a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: cyclists weaving in and out of the traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在车流中穿进穿出的骑车人

GramExa.PROPFORM: weave your way through/to etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lori spotted them as they weaved their way through the tables.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在桌子中间穿行时﹐被洛丽看到了。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a material is woven, and the pattern formed by this
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fine weave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精织法

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to weave cloth
the system on the Internet that allows you to find and use information that is held on computers all over the world

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a guide to the best education-related sites on the Web
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最佳教育类网站指南

Sense.DEF: a net of thin threads made by a spider to catch insects
Sense.EXAMPLE: He watched a spider spinning its web.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他观察一只蜘蛛织网。

Sense.DEF: a closely related set of things that can be very complicated

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一套错综复杂的阴谋/骗术/谎言等

Sense.EXAMPLE: a tangled web of relationships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复杂的关系

Sense.DEF: a piece of skin that connects the toes of ducks and some other birds, and helps them to swim well
a website address
webbed feet or toes have skin between the toes
strong woven material in narrow bands, used for supporting seats, holding things etc
a computer program that finds information on the Internet and shows it on your computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 网络浏览器﹐网页浏览器

Sense.DEF: a video camera that broadcasts what it is filming on a website
an event such as a musical performance which you can listen to or watch on the Internet
to broadcast an event on the Internet, at the time the event happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Various local news sites plan to webcast each of the mayoral debates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地各家新闻网站都计划在网上直播市长竞选的每一场辩论。

Sense.DEF: the use of the Internet to send information, especially news or entertainment, to many people at the same time
a computer program that finds information on the Internet, especially so that this information can be used by a search engine
someone who designs websites, especially websites for businesses or organizations
having toes that are joined by pieces of skin
someone who uses the Internet a lot, especially in a skilful way
a talk or meeting that people take part in using the Internet and often telephones as well
a list of the websites you used to get information when writing something
Sense.TRAN: 网络参考目录〔写作时曾引用﹑参考等的网站清单〕

Sense.DEF: a website that is owned by a particular person or group of people rather than by an organization or company, and that has information about one or more subjects
someone who is in charge of a website
the study of the structure and content of the World Wide Web, and how the different websites are linked together
all the information that you can see in one part of a website
a group of similar websites which are connected to each other by links, so that it is easy for people to find a lot of information on a particular subject on the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a classical music web ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古典音乐网盟

Sense.DEF: a place on the Internet where you can find information about something, especially a particular organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: For more information on weight loss and healthy eating, visit our website.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关减肥和健康饮食的更多信息﹐请访问我们的网站。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Responses will be posted put on the website.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 答复将在网站上公布。

Sense.DEF: the series of letters and other symbols that is the name of a website
the number of people who visit a particular website
a website that is like a magazine
to marry – used especially in literature or newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 娶﹔嫁﹔结婚〔尤用于文学作品或报纸〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘we had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d already eaten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经吃过了。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘we would’
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d rather stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们宁愿留下。

Sense.TRAN: a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Wednesday 星期三

Sense.DEF: married
Sense.EXAMPLE: a newly-wedded couple
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对新婚夫妇
Sense.EXAMPLE: my lawfully wedded wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的合法妻子

Sense.DEF: the happiness that comes when you are married – used humorously
to believe strongly in a particular idea or way of doing things
Sense.TRAN: 执着于[坚持]〔某种思想或做法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the whole the working class is still wedded to the Labour Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的说来﹐工薪阶层仍然拥护工党。

Sense.DEF: a marriage ceremony, especially one with a religious service
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s busy planning her daughter’s wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正忙着筹备女儿的婚礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When is the wedding?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼是什么时候？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think it is likely that two people will get married
Sense.TRAN: (听到)婚礼的钟声﹐好事近了〔用于表示认为两个人将要结婚〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m going to a wedding on Saturday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六我要去参加一场婚礼。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wrote to say she couldn’t come to the wedding.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来信说她不能来参加婚礼了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say the official words and perform the actions at a wedding
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their wedding was conducted by the local priest.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚礼由当地牧师主持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I wanted a church wedding.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想办一个教堂婚礼。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a lot of guests
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They couldn’t afford a big wedding.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有钱举办盛大的婚礼。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a traditional wedding where the bride wears a white dress
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 白色婚礼〔新娘穿白色礼服的传统婚礼〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at a local government office, not in a church
a wedding that is not performed by a religious leader

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She looked beautiful on her wedding day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在婚礼那天看上去很漂亮。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They spent their wedding night in a hotel.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的新婚之夜在一家酒店度过。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They celebrated their tenth wedding anniversary in May.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在5月份庆祝了结婚十周年。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the ceremony in a church
the large formal meal or party after a wedding
the meal after a wedding, usually in the afternoon

Sense.DEF: a building used in the US for wedding ceremonies
a long dress, especially a white dress, worn at a traditional wedding
a ring that you wear to show that you are married
the promises you make during your wedding ceremony
a piece of wood, metal etc that has one thick edge and one pointed edge and is used especially for keeping a door open or for splitting wood
Sense.TRAN: 〔木头﹑金属等材质的〕楔子〔尤用于抵住门或劈开木头〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of food shaped like a wedge
Sense.EXAMPLE: Garnish with lemon wedges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用几角柠檬片作装饰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wedge of cheese
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一角奶酪

Sense.DEF: to make the relationship between two people or groups worse
Sense.TRAN: 造成〔两个人或团体〕之间的不和[疏远]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their divorce has driven a wedge between the two families.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的离婚造成双方家庭闹翻。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the thin end of the wedge

Sense.DEF: to force something firmly into a narrow space
Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone was wedged under his chin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话夹在他下巴下面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victoria wedged herself into the passenger seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚挤到了乘客座位上。

Sense.DEF: to put something under a door, window etc to make it stay open or shut
Sense.TRAN: 用楔子把〔门窗等〕抵住使开着/关上

Sense.DEF: shoes worn by women, with high heels that are a solid block from the front of the shoe to the back
the situation of having your underwear pulled too tightly between your buttocks, or the action of pulling someone’s underwear into this position as a joke
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave me a wedgie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提了一下我的内裤。

Sense.DEF: if a child is born out of wedlock, its parents are not married when it is born
the state of being married
the day between Tuesday and Thursday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sale starts on Wednesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大减价从星期三开始。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can go Wednesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以星期三去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw Vicky on Wednesday evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期三晚上看到了维基。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They left last Wednesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是上个星期三离开的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come down this Wednesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期三过来一下吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: Wednesday of next week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can let you know next Wednesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期三我可以告诉你。

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the Wednesdays in the year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you free on the 19th?’ ‘Is that a Wednesday?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你19号有空吗？”“那天是星期三吗？”

Sense.DEF: very small – used especially in Scottish English
Sense.TRAN: 很小的〔尤用于苏格兰英语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wee boy is three.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的小儿子三岁。

Sense.DEF: to a small degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked a wee bit confused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看起来有些困惑。

Sense.DEF: the early hours of the morning, just after 12 o’clock at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party continued into the wee small hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会一直持续到凌晨。

Sense.DEF: to pass water from your body – used by or to children
a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: the constant battle against weeds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对付杂草的长期斗争

Sense.DEF: a plant without flowers that grows on water in a large green floating mass
someone who is weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nigel’s such a weed, isn’t he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奈杰尔真懦弱﹐是不是啊？

Sense.DEF: in large numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cars clogged the roads like weeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量汽车堵住了道路。

Sense.DEF: cigarettes or tobacco
black clothes worn by a woman whose husband has died
to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place
to get rid of people or things that are not very good
Sense.TRAN: 除去﹐淘汰〔不合格的人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The research will help governments to weed out ineffective aid schemes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究将会帮助政府废除无效的援助计划。

Sense.DEF: poison used to kill unwanted plants
full of unwanted wild plants
physically weak or having a weak character
a period of seven days and nights, usually measured in Britain from Monday to Sunday and in the US from Sunday to Saturday
Sense.TRAN: 星期﹐周〔七天为一周﹐英国从星期一至星期日算作一周﹔美国从星期日至星期六算作一周〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Letters were delivered twice a week only.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信件一星期只递送两次。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t see you this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这星期不能见你。

GramExa.GLOSS: the week before or after this one
GramExa.EXAMPLE: See you next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期见。

Sense.DEF: any period of seven days and nights

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been living here for six weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经在这里住了六个星期了。

GramExa.GLOSS: one, two etc weeks from now
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he hasn’t phoned in a week, I’ll phone him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他一个星期不打电话来﹐我就打电话给他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It will cost you an estimated £10 per week to feed one dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条狗每星期喂食估计要花费十英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The training program lasts three weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 培训计划为期三周。

Sense.DEF: the part of the week when you go to work, usually from Monday to Friday
Sense.TRAN: 工作周〔通常由星期一至星期五〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 35-hour week
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 35小时的工作周

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t see her during the week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了周末﹐平时我和她不见面。

Sense.DEF: a week after the day that is mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 一周后的星期一/星期二等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re off to Spain Sunday week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下周星期天去西班牙。

Sense.DEF: a week after the day that is mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Reids are coming for dinner a week from Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里德一家一周后的星期天来吃饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keith’s coming home two weeks on Saturday two weeks after next Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基思两周后的星期六回家。

Sense.DEF: continuously for many weeks
Sense.TRAN: 连续几个星期﹐一周又一周
Sense.EXAMPLE: We do the same things week in week out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一个又一个星期做同样的事。

Sense.DEF: any day of the week except Saturday and Sunday
Sense.TRAN: 工作日〔一周中除星期六和星期日之外的任何一天〕

Sense.DEF: Saturday and Sunday, especially considered as time when you do not work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you doing anything nice this weekend?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个周末你有什么好的安排？

GramExa.GLOSS: the weekend before or after this one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I never work at the weekend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末我从不工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you doing on the weekend?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末你准备干什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I only see him at weekends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只在周末和他见面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony has been unwell over the weekend during the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼这个周末身体不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to Paris for a long weekend Saturday and Sunday, and also Friday or Monday, or both.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要到巴黎去度一个长周末。

GramExa.GLOSS: a place in the country where you spend your weekends

Sense.DEF: to spend the weekend somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re weekending on the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在海滨度周末。

Sense.DEF: someone who spends time in a place only at weekends
someone who plays a sport or does some other type of exercise at the weekend, but does not usually exercise during the week
Sense.TRAN: 周末勇士〔指只在周末从事某项运动或某类体育锻炼的人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who spends their weekends and holidays training to be part of an extra military force that is used only if it is needed to help the regular military forces
Sense.TRAN: 周末战士〔指在周末及假日进行训练﹑必要时协助正规军队的预备役军人〕

Sense.DEF: continuing for a week
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weeklong training course
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为期一周的培训课程

Sense.DEF: happening or done every week
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weekly current affairs programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周一档的时事节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: twice-weekly flights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周两次的航班

Sense.DEF: a magazine that appears once a week
Sense.EXAMPLE: a popular news weekly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受欢迎的新闻周刊

Sense.DEF: any night except Saturday and Sunday
a type of sausage
Sense.TRAN: 法兰克福香肠﹐熏肉香肠
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weenie roast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法兰克福烤肠

Sense.DEF: someone who is weak, afraid, or stupid – used especially by children
extremely small
to cry, especially because you feel very sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: James broke down and wept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯控制不住感情﹐哭了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wept for the loss of her mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因母亲去世而哭泣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He wept bitterly cried a lot when it was time for us to leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要分别的时候他痛哭了一场。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say cry rather than weep.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说cry﹐而不说weep
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She was crying all the way through the movie.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 看电影时她从头哭到尾。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you felt very disappointed about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could have wept thinking what I’d missed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想想自己错过的这一切﹐我真想大哭一场。

Sense.DEF: if a wound weeps, liquid comes out of it
another spelling of weepy2
a tree with branches that hang down towards the ground
tending to cry a lot
a film or story that is intended to make people cry
a small insect that feeds on grain, flour etc and spoils it
Sense.TRAN: 〔吃谷物﹑面粉等的〕象甲﹐象鼻虫

Sense.DEF: to pass water from your body – used by or to children
the threads in a piece of cloth that are woven across the threads that go from top to bottom
to have a particular weight
Sense.EXAMPLE: The young birds weigh only a few grams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雏鸟重量只有几克。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know how much it weighs?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道它的重量吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What how much do you weigh?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的体重是多少？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The box was full of books and weighed a ton was very heavy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这箱子里放满了书﹐重得很。

Sense.DEF: to use a machine to discover how much something or someone weighs
Sense.EXAMPLE: He weighed some potatoes on the scales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用秤称了一些土豆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you weighed yourself lately?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最近称过体重吗？

Sense.DEF: to consider something carefully so that you can make a decision about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is my job to weigh the evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认真研究证据是我的职责。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have to weigh the benefits of the scheme against the costs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须把这个方案的好处和费用放在一起进行权衡。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone’s opinion and the decision that they make

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This unfortunate experience will weigh heavily against further investment in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次遗憾的经历将大大影响对这个地区的进一步投资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These facts will weigh in your favour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事实将对你有利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her evidence weighed strongly with the judge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的证词对法官影响很大。

Sense.DEF: to think very carefully about what you say because you do not want to say the wrong thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不想说错话而〕斟字酌句﹐推敲字眼
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was weighing his words carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在仔细斟酌要怎么说。

Sense.DEF: to raise an anchor and sail away
if something weighs you down, it is heavy and difficult to carry
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕感到沉重﹔压下﹐压倒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sally was weighed down with shopping bags.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉吃力地提着购物袋。

Sense.DEF: if a problem weighs you down, it makes you feel worried and upset
Sense.TRAN: 使感到焦虑﹐使烦恼﹐使忧心忡忡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt weighed down by his responsibilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到自己的责任重得难以承受。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a family weighed down with grief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉浸在悲痛之中的一家人

Sense.DEF: to have your weight measured before taking part in a competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Higgins weighed in at just over 100 kilos.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希金斯赛前测得的体重刚好100公斤多一点。

Sense.DEF: to join in an argument or fight

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman then weighed in with his views.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后主席也加入讨论﹐提出了自己的观点。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel worried and upset
Sense.TRAN: 加重…的心理负担﹔使〔某人〕忧虑[烦恼]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The desire for peace will weigh heavily on the negotiators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对和平的渴望将会给谈判者带来极大的压力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure there’s something weighing on his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定他有心事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The burden of responsibility weighed heavily on his shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 责任的担子重重地压在他肩上。

Sense.DEF: to measure an amount of something by weighing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She weighed out half a kilo of rice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她称出半公斤米。

Sense.DEF: to consider something carefully so that you can make a decision about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still weighing up the pros and cons the advantages and disadvantages of the two options.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍在对两个选择权衡利弊。

Sense.DEF: to watch someone and listen to them carefully so that you can form an opinion about what they are like
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see that he was weighing me up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出他是在掂量我。

Sense.DEF: a machine that vehicles drive onto so that they can be weighed
a check on the weight of a boxer or jockey before a competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔拳击手或骑师在赛前的〕称体重

Sense.DEF: how heavy something is when you measure it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average weight of a baby at birth is just over seven pounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿的平均出生体重是七磅多一点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fish that are over two kilos in weight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两公斤多重的鱼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fruit and vegetables are sold by weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水果和蔬菜是称重出售的。

Sense.DEF: how heavy and fat someone is
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t worry about your weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该担心自己的体重。

Sense.DEF: the fact that something is heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weight of her boots made it hard for Sue to run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉重的靴子使休跑起来很困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know if the bridge would support our weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道这座桥能否承受住我们的重量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Karen staggered along under the weight of her backpack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦背着沉重的背包﹐蹒跚而行。

Sense.DEF: something that is heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t lift heavy weights because of my bad back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我因背部有毛病提不了重物。

Sense.DEF: something that causes you a lot of worry because you have to deal with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a great weight of responsibility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到责任很重﹐压力很大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: families who are crumbling under the weight of increasing debt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因债务越来越多而不堪重负的家庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Selling the house is a weight off my mind something that no longer causes a lot of worry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖掉房子卸下了我心头的一副重担。

Sense.DEF: if something has weight, it is important and influences people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew that her opinion carried very little weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道自己的看法无足轻重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This scandal adds more weight to their arguments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩丑闻更加证明他们的论点是正确的。

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weight of evidence is that unemployment leads to all sorts of health problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量证据显示失业会导致各种健康问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weight of public opinion is behind the teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众舆论倒向教师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won the battle by sheer weight of numbers very large numbers of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们取胜纯粹靠的是人数优势。

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal that weighs an exact amount and is balanced against something else to measure how much the other thing weighs
a piece of metal that weighs an exact amount and is lifted by people as a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been lifting weights since I was 18.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从18岁起就开始练举重了。

Sense.DEF: to use your position of authority to tell people what to do in an unpleasant and unreasonable way
to use all your power and influence to support someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US has thrown its weight behind the new leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国倾其全力支持这位新领导人。

Sense.DEF: to do your full share of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused me of not pulling my weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责我没有尽责。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take the weight off your feet
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to sit down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come in, take the weight off your feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进来歇歇脚吧。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had put on weight since she last saw him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 与她上次见到他相比﹐他体重增加了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She lost a lot of weight when she was ill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生病时体重减轻了许多。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try not to get fatter, by eating the correct foods
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔通过健康饮食〕控制自己的体重
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has to watch his weight because he has a heart condition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有心脏病﹐所以得注意自己的体重。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become thinner or stay thin
Collocate.EXAMPLE: How can I keep my weight down?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎样才能减轻体重呢？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become or stay thinner
a tendency to be too fat
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve always had a weight problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的体重一向是个问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She weighs about 10lbs more than her ideal weight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比她的理想体重重十磅左右。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You’ll feel better if you lose the excess weight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果减掉超出的体重﹐你会感觉更好。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘lose your weight’. Say lose weight. Do not use ‘weight’ as a verb, for example by saying ‘I weight 55 kilos’. Say I weigh 55 kilos. 不要说lose your weight﹐而要说lose weight。不要把weight用作动词﹐比如不要说I weight 55 kilos﹐而要说I weigh 55 kilos。

Sense.DEF: to fix a heavy object to something in order to keep it in place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fishing nets are weighted down with lead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 渔网是靠铅坠下沉的。

Sense.DEF: to change something slightly so that you give more importance to particular ideas or people

GramExa.PROPFORM: weight sth in favour of sb/sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a temptation to weight the report in favour of the option you want
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图修改报告使其偏向自己所想方案的念头

Sense.DEF: giving an advantage or disadvantage to one particular group or activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某团体或活动〕有利[不利]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The voting system is weighted against the smaller parties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种选举制度对较小的党派不利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This year’s pay increase is heavily weighted in favour of the lower paid staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的加薪大幅向工资较低的员工倾斜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course is weighted towards language skills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程侧重于语言技能。

Sense.DEF: additional money that you get paid because of the high cost of living in a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 〔因所生活地区生活费用高而得到的〕额外津贴﹐生活补贴
Sense.EXAMPLE: salary £24,000 plus £2,400 London weighting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2.4万英镑工资﹐外加2,400英镑伦敦生活补贴

Sense.DEF: something that is weightless seems to have no weight, especially when it is floating in space or water
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在太空或水中〕失重的﹔没有重量的

Sense.DEF: the sport of lifting specially shaped pieces of metal that weigh an exact amount
the activity of lifting specially shaped pieces of metal that weigh an exact amount, as a form of exercise
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does weight training at the gym twice a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每周在健身房做两次举重锻炼。

Sense.DEF: important and serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t feel like discussing weighty matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想讨论严肃问题。

Sense.DEF: heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weighty tome a big and heavy book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部沉重的大书

Sense.DEF: a low fence or wall that is built across a river or stream to control the flow of water, or to make a pool where people can catch fish
Sense.TRAN: 堰﹐拦河坝﹔〔围塘捕鱼的〕鱼梁

Sense.DEF: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain
Sense.EXAMPLE: A really weird thing happened last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a weird bloke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个古怪的家伙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful very strange products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

Sense.DEF: if something weirds you out, it is so strange that it makes you feel uncomfortable or worried
someone who wears strange clothes or behaves strangely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny’s going out with a real weirdo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮正和一个十分古怪的人交往。

Sense.DEF: another spelling of welsh2
to say hello in a friendly way to someone who has just arrived
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must be there to welcome my guests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须在那里迎接我的客人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They welcomed us warmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们热烈欢迎我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His family welcomed me with open arms in a very friendly way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的家人热情友好地欢迎我。

Sense.DEF: to be glad to accept something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college welcomes applications from people of all races.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本学院欢迎任何种族的人提交申请。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We would welcome any advice or suggestions with open arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们热忱欢迎任何建议。

Sense.DEF: to be glad that something has happened because you think it is a good idea
Sense.TRAN: 欢迎﹐乐于接受〔已发生的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economists have welcomed the decision to raise interest rates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济学家们欢迎提高利率的决定。

Sense.DEF: if someone is welcome in a place, other people are glad that they are there
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had the feeling I wasn’t really welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉到我其实不受欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t feel welcome in the club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我在俱乐部里不受欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary made us very welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽让我们感觉很受欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We try to make the new students feel welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量让新同学感到自己是受欢迎的。

Sense.DEF: if something is welcome, you enjoy it because you feel that you need it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weekend was a welcome break from the pressures of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个周末没有工作的压力﹐舒舒服服地休息了一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Six months in Scotland would make a welcome change from London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在苏格兰的六个月将是离开伦敦换个环境的好机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cup of tea would be very welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来杯茶非常不错。

Sense.DEF: if something is welcome, you are glad that it has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The increase in interest rates is welcome news for investors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高利率对投资者来说是个很好的消息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This new funding will come as a welcome boost for the industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔新资金对该行业将是积极的促进。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone can have something if they want it, because you certainly do not want it
Sense.TRAN: 可随意拥有…〔因为说话者不需要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want to take the job you’re welcome to it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果想要这份工作﹐那你来做吧！

Sense.DEF: used to invite someone to do something if they would like to
Sense.TRAN: 可随意做某事〔用于邀请某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re welcome to stay for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎你留下来吃午饭。

Sense.DEF: a polite way of replying to someone who has just thanked you for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Thanks for the coffee.’ ‘You’re welcome.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “谢谢你的咖啡。”“别客气。”

Sense.DEF: the way in which you greet someone when they arrive at a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His colleagues gave him a very warm welcome when he returned to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回来工作时﹐同事们非常热情地欢迎他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can be sure of a friendly welcome at all our hotels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们的每一家酒店你都一定会受到热情接待。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The president got a tremendous welcome at the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在机场受到了隆重欢迎。

Sense.DEF: the way in which people react to an idea, and show that they like it or do not like it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians have given an enthusiastic welcome to the Queen’s speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治家们对女王的演讲给予了热烈欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposals have so far received a cautious welcome from government ministers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些提议到目前为止得到了政府各部长的谨慎欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to stay at someone’s house longer than they want you to
Sense.TRAN: 因做客时间太久而不再受欢迎

Sense.DEF: used to greet someone who has just arrived
Sense.TRAN: 欢迎〔用于对刚刚到达的人表示欢迎〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Welcome to London!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎来到伦敦！

Sense.EXAMPLE: Welcome back – it’s good to see you again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎回来——很高兴又见到你了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello, welcome home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐欢迎回家。

Sense.DEF: an event that is organized to welcome someone who has just arrived in a new place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is bringing out the welcome wagon for the new sales recruits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司将为新招募的销售员举行迎新活动。

Sense.DEF: someone who is welcoming is friendly when you arrive in a place
Sense.TRAN: 〔对来访或到达的人〕友好的﹐热情的﹔欢迎的﹔殷勤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone was very welcoming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都很热情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephanie was standing at the door with a welcoming smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬妮带着热情的微笑站在门口。

Sense.DEF: a welcoming place is pleasant and makes you feel relaxed
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕令人感到惬意的﹐舒适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a restaurant with a welcoming atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家气氛宜人的餐馆

Sense.DEF: done or organized in order to welcome someone to a place
Sense.TRAN: 〔准备好或组织起来〕迎接〔某人〕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was met by a welcoming committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个迎宾团在迎接我。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a welcoming speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎辞

Sense.DEF: to join metals by melting their edges and pressing them together when they are hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new handle will have to be welded on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的把手得焊上去。

Sense.DEF: to join or unite people into a single strong group
Sense.TRAN: 使〔人〕团结〔成一个强大集体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His job is now to weld the players into a single team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在的任务是要把这些队员团结起来﹐打造成一个整体。

Sense.DEF: a joint that is made by welding two pieces of metal together
someone whose job is to weld metal in a factory
someone’s welfare is their health and happiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

Sense.DEF: help that is provided for people who have personal or social problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔对有个人或社会问题的人提供的〕帮助﹔福利

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the provision of education and welfare services
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供教育和福利服务

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s welfare officer deals with employees’ personal problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司负责福利的工作人员处理雇员的个人问题。

Sense.DEF: money that is paid by the government in the US to people who are very poor or unemployed
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府向穷人或失业者发放的〕救济金

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the people in this neighborhood are on welfare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一街区的大多数人都领取福利救济。

Sense.DEF: a system in which the government provides money, free medical care etc for people who are unemployed, ill, or too old to work
a country with such a system

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘we will’ or 或 ‘we shall’

Sense.DEF: in a successful or satisfactory way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you sleep well?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你睡得好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: James reads quite well for his age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就詹姆斯的年龄来说﹐他的阅读能力算不错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the team played very well today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天所有队员都打得很不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon doesn’t work well under pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有压力时西蒙的工作表现就不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The festival was very well organized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节庆活动组织得很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert went very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会进行得非常顺利。

Sense.DEF: in a thorough way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mix the flour and butter well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面粉和黄油搅匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know Birmingham quite well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很熟悉伯明翰。

Subsense.DEF: a lot, or to a great degree

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stand well back from the bonfire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 站得离篝火远点。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was well after 12 o’clock when they arrived.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们到达时早过了12点。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The village is well below sea level.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个村子远低于海平面。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The amphitheatre is well worth a visit.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座露天圆形剧场很值得参观。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m well aware of the problems involved.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很清楚所涉及的问题。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I went out and got well and truly completely drunk.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我出去喝了个烂醉。

Subsense.DEF: very
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That was well funny!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那太滑稽了！

Subsense.DEF: to be successful, especially in work or business
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指在工作或生意上〕成功﹐干得好
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s doing very well at college.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在大学里成绩很好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Elizabeth’s done well for herself since she moved to London.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎白自从到了伦敦以后干得非常好。

Subsense.DEF: if someone who has been ill is doing well, they are becoming healthy again
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He had the operation yesterday, and he’s doing very well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他昨天做了手术﹐恢复得很好。

Sense.DEF: in addition to something or someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you come along as well?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不一起来呢？

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: As well is used mostly in spoken English. In written English, people usually prefer to use also.
F2NBox.TRAN: as well大多用于英语口语﹐在英语书面语中﹐人们一般喜欢用also
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Parents are also welcome.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 也欢迎家长参加。

Sense.DEF: in addition to something or someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: They own a house in France as well as a villa in Spain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在法国有一栋房子﹐在西班牙还有一处别墅。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The organization gives help and support to people in need, as well as raising money for local charities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该机构为贫困者提供帮助﹐还为当地的慈善机构募捐。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is likely to happen or is likely to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: What you say may well be true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说的或许是真的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could try the drugstore, but it might well be closed by now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以到药店去看看﹐不过现在有可能关门了。

Subsense.DEF: used when you do not particularly want to do something but you decide you should do it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I suppose we may as well get started.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们不妨开始吧。

Subsense.DEF: used to mean that another course of action would have an equally good result
Subsense.TRAN: 倒不如〔用于表示另一个行动也可能产生同样好的结果〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The taxi was so slow we might just as well have gone on the bus.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出租车开得那么慢﹐我们当时还不如乘公共汽车呢。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot do something because it would be unacceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t very well tell him we don’t want him at the party!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总不能告诉他我们不想让他参加聚会吧！

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does know something even though they are behaving as if they do not
Sense.TRAN: 当然知道﹐十分清楚〔尽管某人表现得似乎并不知道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know full well what I mean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你当然知道我的意思。

Sense.DEF: to talk about someone in an approving way or to have a favourable opinion of them
Sense.TRAN: 称赞某人/对某人印象好
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue has always spoken well of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休总是说你好。

Sense.DEF: used to praise someone when you think they have done something very well
used to say that you agree with what someone has just said, or that you admire them for saying it
informal

Subsense.DEF: to be making good progress
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If we can get that grant from the local authority, we’ll be well away.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果能从地方政府得到那笔拨款﹐我们就会获得很大进展。

Subsense.DEF: to be very drunk

Sense.DEF: to have a friendly relationship with someone, especially someone important
Sense.TRAN: 与某人〔尤指要人〕关系密切
