Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s very well in with members of the management committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和管理委员会的成员关系很好。

Sense.DEF: to be lucky to no longer be involved in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 幸而不受某事牵连﹔幸而摆脱了某事

Sense.DEF: to know a lot about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Geoff’s always been well up on the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫对因特网一直都懂得很多。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is a good reason for someone’s feelings or reactions
Sense.TRAN: 某人应该如此〔用于表示某人的感受或反应有充分的理由〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marilyn looked guilty, as well she might.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽莲看上去很内疚——她理应如此。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone generously
used to emphasize something you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 好﹐嗯〔用以强调所说之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I think it’s a good idea anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐不管怎么说﹐我认为这是个好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I’ve had enough and I’m going home!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐我受够了﹐我要回家了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘James doesn’t want to come to the cinema with us.’ ‘Well then, let’s go on our own.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “詹姆斯不想和我们一起去看电影。”“那好﹐我们就自己去吧。”

Sense.DEF: used to pause or give yourself time to think before saying something
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐这个〔用于停顿片刻或使自己在说话前有时间考虑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, let’s see now, I could meet you on Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐让我想一想﹐我可以在星期四见你。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you accept a situation even though you feel disappointed or annoyed about it
Sense.TRAN: 好吧﹐算了〔对不愉快的事表示接受〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I did my best – I can’t do any more than that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐我已经尽力了﹐只能做到这样了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh well, we’ll just have to cancel the holiday, I suppose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那好吧﹐我想我们只能取消这次休假了。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or amusement
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀﹐哟〔表示惊讶或高兴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, so Steve got the job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐这么说史蒂夫得到那份工作了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, well, well, I didn’t think I’d see you here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎哟喂﹐没想到会在这里见到你。

Sense.DEF: used to express anger or disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 哎﹐哼﹐唉〔表示生气或不赞成〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, she could at least have phoned to say she wasn’t coming!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哼﹐她至少可以打个电话说她不来了！

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are about to finish speaking or doing something
Sense.TRAN: 好了﹐好啦〔表示准备结束讲话或停止做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, that’s all for today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐今天到此为止。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, that’s the last one done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐最后一件事情干完啦。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are not sure about something
Sense.TRAN: 哦〔表示对某事并无把握〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will you be in on Friday evening?’ ‘Well, it depends.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “星期五晚上你在吗？”“哦﹐要看情况。”

Sense.DEF: used to slightly change something that you have said
Sense.TRAN: 哦〔用于纠正刚刚说过的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s rolling in money! Well, he’s got a lot more than me, anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有的是钱！哦﹐应该说至少比我有钱多了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree with an idea or accept a suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 好吧〔表示同意某一想法或接受某一建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Very well,’ he said. ‘I accept.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “好吧﹐”他说﹐“我接受。”

Sense.DEF: used to continue a story you are telling people, especially in order to make it seem more interesting
Sense.TRAN: 对了﹐于是〔向人讲述某故事时的接续用语﹐尤以为讲述增色为目的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know that couple I was telling you about the other day? Well, last night I saw a police car in front of their house!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道那天我跟你讲的那对夫妻吧？是这样的﹐昨晚我看见一辆警车停在他们家门前！

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to answer a question you have asked them, when you are angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 怎么样？〔用于要求别人回答所提问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well? What have you got to say for yourself?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么样？你有什么要为自己辩解的吗？

Sense.DEF: healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How are you?’ ‘Very well, thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你好吗？”“很好﹐谢谢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t feel very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得身体不太舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re looking very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去身体很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you get well again soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望你早日康复。

Sense.DEF: used to say that things have happened in a good or fortunate way
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just as well I kept some money aside for emergencies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好我留了些钱应急。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something seems to be a good idea, but is not really possible or helpful
Sense.TRAN: …好是好﹐可是…〔表示某事看似不错﹐但并非真正可行或有益〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s all very well the doctors telling me I’ve got to rest, but who’s going to look after my children?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生叫我休息是很好﹐可谁来照顾我的孩子呢？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is good or enjoyable, but it also has some disadvantages
Sense.EXAMPLE: Going off on foreign holidays is all well and good, but you’ve got to get back to reality sometime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到国外度假当然好﹐但你总得回到现实中来。

Sense.DEF: used to give someone advice or make a helpful suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 最好…〔给某人劝告或提出有用的意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It might be as well to make him rest for a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好能让他休息几天。

Sense.LEXUNIT: all is well/all is not well
Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation is satisfactory or not satisfactory
Sense.EXAMPLE: All is not well with their marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻不美满。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a difficult situation has ended with a good result. It is the title of a humorous play by William Shakespeare about the relationship between the two main characters, Helena and Bertram.
Sense.TRAN: 结果好就一切都好〔莎士比亚一喜剧《终成眷属》即得名于此〕

Sense.DEF: a deep hole in the ground from which people take water
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lowered her bucket into the well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把水桶放到井里。

Sense.DEF: an oil well
the space in a tall building where the stairs are
if a liquid wells or wells up, it comes to the surface of something and starts to flow out
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt tears well up in my eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到泪水夺眶而出。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling wells or wells up in you, you start to feel it strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anger welled up within him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: emotionally healthy and able to deal well with the problems of life
Sense.TRAN: 能适应环境的﹐性格健全的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a happy, well-adjusted child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个快乐﹑适应性强的孩子

Sense.LEXUNIT: you would be well-advised to do sth
Sense.DEF: used when you are strongly advising someone to do something that will help them avoid trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: You would be well-advised to accept his offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈建议你接受他的提议。

Sense.DEF: a well-appointed room, house, or hotel has attractive furniture and all the equipment that you need
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋或宾馆〕设备完善的﹐陈设齐全的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He showed me to a large, well-appointed room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带我看了一间设施齐全的大房间。

Sense.DEF: if a meeting, event etc is well-attended, a lot of people go to it
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议﹑事件等〕有许多人参加的

Sense.DEF: a well-balanced meal or diet contains all the different things you need to keep you healthy
a well-balanced person is sensible and does not allow strong emotions to control their behaviour
behaving in a calm polite way, and not being rude or violent
Sense.TRAN: 行为端正的﹔彬彬有礼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-behaved child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规规矩矩的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very well-behaved dog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常听话的狗
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd was well-behaved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群很守秩序。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that a child is good rather than well-behaved.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常用good来表示孩子表现好﹐而不说well-behaved
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Have the children been good ?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们乖不乖？

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being comfortable, healthy, and happy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are responsible for the care and well-being of all our patients.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们承担所有病人的护理工作﹐并对他们的健康负责。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good meal promotes a feeling of well-being.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顿美食能增强幸福感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the physical and emotional well-being of the children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的身心健康

Sense.DEF: the well-being of a country is the state in which it is strong and doing well
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are now concerned for the economic well-being of the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在担心国家的经济繁荣。

Sense.DEF: born into a very rich or important family
Sense.TRAN: 出身优裕的﹔出身高贵的

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-bred is polite, and behaves as if they come from a family of high social class
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-bred, courteous man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位温文尔雅﹑彬彬有礼的男子

Sense.DEF: a child who is well-brought-up has been taught to be polite and to behave well
someone who is well-built has a big strong body
chosen carefully and so very suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: good food and well-chosen wines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美食和精选的葡萄酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: He encouraged us with a few well-chosen words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他斟词酌句地说了几句应景的话鼓励我们。

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-connected knows a lot of powerful important people
Sense.TRAN: 与显贵人物有关系的﹐和有社会地位的人有来往的

Sense.DEF: clear and easy to see or understand
Sense.TRAN: 易于辨认理解的﹔规定得清楚的﹔明确的
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-defined limits on spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明确的开支限定

Sense.DEF: deserved because of very good or bad behaviour, work, skill etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-deserved victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应得的胜利

Sense.DEF: fully developed or formed and able to function very well
Sense.TRAN: 发育良好的﹔完善的﹔健全的
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-developed back muscles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发达的背部肌肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-developed reading skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完善的阅读技能

Sense.DEF: feeling friendly towards a person or positive about an idea or plan
Sense.TRAN: 〔对人〕亲切的﹐有好感的﹔〔对想法或计划〕表示赞同的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I did not feel particularly well-disposed towards him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他不是很有好感。

Sense.DEF: if something is well-documented, people have written a lot about it and so the facts about it are clear
Sense.TRAN: 有大量文字资料证明的﹔证据充分的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His life is remarkably well-documented.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的生平有大量文字记载。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are all well-documented facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些都是证据充分的事实。

Sense.DEF: meat that is well-done has been cooked thoroughly
well-drained soil allows water to pass through it easily
wearing attractive fashionable clothes
Sense.TRAN: 衣着考究的﹐穿着入时的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attractive, well-dressed young woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有魅力、穿着考究的年轻女子

Sense.DEF: something that is well-earned is something you deserve because you have worked hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-earned rest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应有的休息
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-earned drink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理所应当的一杯酒

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-educated has had a lot of education and has a lot of knowledge about many different things
Sense.TRAN: 受过良好教育的﹔知识丰富的

Sense.DEF: a woman who is well-endowed has large breasts – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子〕乳房大的〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a man who is well-endowed has a large penis – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子〕阴茎大的﹐生殖器大的〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: something that is well-established has existed for a long time and is respected or trusted by people
Sense.TRAN: 历史悠久且享有盛誉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-established law firm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 久负盛名的律师事务所
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-established scientific theory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得到公认的科学理论

Sense.DEF: having plenty of good food to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: The animals all look happy and well-fed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的动物看上去都无忧无虑﹐营养充足。

Sense.DEF: a belief or feeling etc that is well-founded is based on facts or good judgment
Sense.TRAN: 〔信仰﹑感觉等〕有事实根据的﹐基于准确判断的
Sense.EXAMPLE: My suspicions proved to be well-founded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明我的怀疑是有根据的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-groomed looks very neat and clean
Sense.TRAN: 干净整洁的﹔衣冠楚楚的

Sense.DEF: fully trained in an activity or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were well-grounded in survival skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们的生存技能训练有素。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My fears were well-grounded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的害怕是有道理的。

Sense.DEF: rich
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-heeled businessman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有钱的生意人

Sense.DEF: a man who is well-hung has a large penis – used humorously
a wellington
Sense.TRAN: 长筒橡胶雨靴﹐防水橡胶靴

Sense.DEF: physical effort or force that you use to move or hit something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to give it some wellie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得用点劲。

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-informed knows a lot about one particular subject or about many subjects
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某一问题〕非常熟悉的﹔〔在许多问题上〕知识渊博的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people are not very well-informed about the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人对这种疾病都不是很了解。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a serious and well-informed debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进行了一次认真且论据翔实的辩论。

Sense.DEF: a rubber boot that stops your foot getting wet
Sense.TRAN: 长筒橡胶雨靴﹐防水橡胶靴

Sense.DEF: trying to be helpful to people, but actually making things worse for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-intentioned grandparents who interfere between parents and children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于善意干涉父母和子女关系却弄巧成拙的祖父母

Sense.DEF: a well-kept building or garden is very well cared for and looks neat and clean
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或花园〕悉心照管的﹔整洁的

Sense.DEF: a well-kept secret is known only to a few people
known by a lot of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a well-known fact that smoking can cause lung cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽烟会引起肺癌﹐这是一个众所周知的事实。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This is probably their best-known song.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能是他们最有名的歌曲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-known TV presenter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名的电视节目主持人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was well-known for his extreme political views.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以极端的政治观点著称。

Sense.DEF: talking and behaving in a polite way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-mannered child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有礼貌的孩子

Sense.DEF: intending to be helpful, but not succeeding
Sense.TRAN: 本意良好的﹐出于好意的〔但不成功〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of problems can be caused by well-meaning friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多问题会由好心办坏事的朋友引起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s very well-meaning, but he doesn’t really understand what’s going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本意是很好﹐但他并不了解情况。

Sense.DEF: something you say or do that is well-meant is intended to be helpful, but does not have the result you intended
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话或行动〕出于好意的〔但结果不如意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His comments were well-meant but a little tactless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的这番话用意是好的﹐但讲得有点伤人。

Sense.DEF: the state of being healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college has established a wellness program for its students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院为本院学生制订了一套保健方案。

Sense.DEF: almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be well-nigh impossible to raise that amount of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要筹到那么大一笔钱几乎是不可能的。

Sense.DEF: having a lot of money, or enough money to have a good standard of living
Sense.EXAMPLE: children from well-off families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕家庭的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many pensioners are less well-off have less money than they used to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多退休人员生活都不如以前优裕了。

Sense.DEF: having plenty of something, or as much of it as you need
Sense.TRAN: 有充裕的某物﹐有够多的某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re well-off for public transport here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这里公共交通发达。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you don’t know when you’re well-off
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are more fortunate than they realize
an organization or system that works very well
providing or receiving good wages
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-paid job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高薪工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-paid executives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪金丰厚的主管

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-preserved is getting old, but does not look as old as they are
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕身体保养得好的﹐不见老的

Sense.DEF: a well-preserved building or object is old but still in good condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或物品年代久远却〕保护得好的﹐状况良好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the remarkably well-preserved ruins of the church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护得非常好的教堂遗迹

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-read has read many books and knows a lot about different subjects
Sense.TRAN: 博览群书的﹔知识渊博的

Sense.DEF: a well-rounded person has a range of interests and skills and a variety of experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-rounded graduates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全面发展的毕业生

Sense.DEF: well-rounded education or experience of life is complete and varied
Sense.TRAN: 〔教育或生活阅历〕全面的﹐多方面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a well-rounded background in management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有很全面的管理背景。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is well-rounded has a pleasantly curved figure
a well-run organization or business is managed well
Sense.TRAN: 运转良好的﹔经营得好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small, well-run hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家经营良好的小宾馆

Sense.DEF: speaking in a clear and polite way, and in a way that is considered correct
Sense.TRAN: 谈吐文雅的﹔言语得体的

Sense.DEF: a large amount of a personal quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a wellspring of courage within her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她浑身是胆。

Sense.DEF: the situation or place where something begins

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Las Vegas became the wellspring of a new style of family values.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉斯维加斯成为一种新的家庭价值观的发源地。

Sense.DEF: having a large supply and variety of things, especially food or drink
Sense.TRAN: 备货充足的﹐贮货丰富的〔尤指食品或饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-stocked supermarket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 备货充足的超级市场

Sense.DEF: liked and admired by other people
Sense.TRAN: 受人喜欢的﹐受人尊敬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her work is well thought of in academic circles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的研究成果在学术界评价很高。

Sense.DEF: carefully and thoroughly planned
Sense.TRAN: 缜密计划的﹐精心设计的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-thought-out design
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缜密的计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the menus are well-thought-out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有菜单都是精心设计的。

Sense.DEF: a well-thumbed book, magazine etc has been used a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔书籍﹑杂志等〕翻旧了的﹐翻阅过很多遍的

Sense.DEF: said or done at the most suitable moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-timed remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不失时机的评论
Sense.EXAMPLE: My arrival wasn’t very well-timed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来得不太是时候。

Sense.DEF: rich and with a high social position
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-to-do families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有钱人家

Sense.DEF: people who are rich
a well-tried method or principle has been used many times before and has always been successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔方法或原理〕经反复验证行之有效的﹐屡试不爽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-tried formula for success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屡试不爽的成功之道

Sense.DEF: a path that is used a lot by people
Sense.TRAN: 常有人走的小道/小径/路线等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Follow the very well-trodden path to the summit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就沿着这条常有人走的小路登上顶峰。

Sense.DEF: used to describe an idea or a course of action that has been used many times in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种想法或行为〕被多次用过的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Andrew was on his well-trodden path to conquering another willing lady.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁在用他惯用的手法征服又一个甘愿被他俘虏的女子。

Sense.DEF: a well-turned phrase or sentence is carefully expressed
Sense.TRAN: 〔词句〕措辞精当的﹐字斟句酌的

Sense.DEF: someone who is well-turned-out wears nice, good quality clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our customers want to be served by people who are well-turned-out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的顾客希望由穿着体面的人为自己服务。

Sense.DEF: knowing a lot about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: countries not so well-versed in technological advances as our own
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技不如我国发达的国家

Sense.DEF: someone who shows by their behaviour that they like someone and want them to succeed, be happy etc
Sense.TRAN: 表示良好祝愿的人﹐祝福者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prince waved at the crowd of 600 well-wishers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王子向600名祝愿者挥手致意。

Sense.DEF: providing medical care and advice for women, to make sure that they stay healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-woman clinic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女保健诊所

Sense.DEF: worn or used for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-worn jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿旧了的外衣

Sense.DEF: a well-worn expression, phrase etc has been repeated so often that it is no longer interesting or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: well-worn excuses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用滥了的借口

Sense.DEF: a wellingtonkind of boot
Sense.TRAN: 长筒橡胶雨靴﹐防水橡胶靴

Sense.DEF: to not do something you have promised to do, such as paying someone money that you owe
Sense.TRAN: 说话不算数﹐食言﹔赖账﹐耍赖皮
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never welch on my bets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打赌从不赖账。

Sense.DEF: relating to Wales, its people, or its original language
Sense.TRAN: 威尔士的﹔威尔士人的﹔威尔士语的

Sense.DEF: people from Wales
the original language used in Wales
a piece of wooden furniture consisting of drawers and cupboards in the lower part and shelves on top
Sense.TRAN: 威尔士式餐具柜〔下部为抽屉和碗橱﹐上部为搁板〕

Sense.DEF: a dish of cheese melted on bread
a painful raised mark on someone’s skin, for example where they have been hit
a large and confusing amount or number of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a welter of information on the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于这个问题有一大堆乱七八糟的信息。

Sense.DEF: a boxer who weighs less than 66.68 kilograms, and who is heavier than a lightweight but lighter than a middleweight
Sense.TRAN: 次中量级拳击手〔体重在66.68公斤以下﹐级别在轻量级和中量级之间〕

Sense.DEF: a large football ground in northwest London, England
Sense.TRAN: 温布利球场〔伦敦西北部的一个大型足球场〕

Sense.DEF: a girl or young woman, especially a servant
to move or travel slowly from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The procession wended its way through the streets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行队伍缓缓地穿过街道。

Sense.DEF: a toy house that children can play inside
the past tense of go
the past tense and past participle of weep

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘we are’

Sense.DEF: the past tense of be
a person who, in stories, changes into a wolf every month when the moon is full
Sense.TRAN: 狼人〔故事中月圆时会变成狼的人〕

Sense.DEF: the direction towards which the sun goes down, and which is on the left if you are facing north

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A damp wind blew from the west.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从西面吹来一股潮湿的风。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a village to the west of Brussels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁塞尔以西的一座村庄

Sense.DEF: the western part of a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a slight chance of some sunshine in the west.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西部地区见晴的可能性不大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the west of the island
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该岛的西部

Sense.DEF: in the west or facing the west
Sense.EXAMPLE: the west door of the church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂的西门
Sense.EXAMPLE: farmers in West Africa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西非的农民

Sense.DEF: a west wind comes from the west
towards the west
Sense.EXAMPLE: The route then heads west over Gerrick Moor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 之后这条路折向西﹐穿过格里克漠泽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The walk starts at Alnham, six miles west of Bridge of Aln.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次徒步始于阿尔恩桥以西六英里的阿尔恩罕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a west-facing window
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝西的窗户

Sense.DEF: to or in the western part of a country or area, especially the US
Sense.TRAN: 向[在]〔某国或地区﹐尤指美国的〕西部
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family moved out west to Kansas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人搬到西部的堪萨斯州去了。

Sense.DEF: old-fashioned

Subsense.DEF: to die – used humorously
to be damaged or ruined – used humorously

Sense.DEF: the western part of the world and the people that live there, especially Western Europe and North America
Sense.TRAN: 西方﹐西方世界〔尤指西欧和北美〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the industrial countries of the West
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方工业国

Sense.DEF: the western part of the US
travelling or leading towards the west
Sense.EXAMPLE: Westbound traffic is moving very slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西行车流移动非常缓慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an accident on the westbound carriageway of the motorway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路西行车道上的一起事故

Sense.DEF: the part of the US that is next to the Pacific Ocean
the parts of England that are furthest south and west, especially Devon and Cornwall
Sense.TRAN: 英格兰的西南部〔尤指德文郡和康沃尔郡〕

Sense.DEF: the western part of central London, where there are large shops, theatres, expensive hotels etc
Sense.TRAN: 伦敦西区〔指伦敦市中心的西部﹐是大商店﹑剧院﹑高级酒店等集中的地方〕

Sense.DEF: towards or in the west
Sense.EXAMPLE: We set off in a westerly direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出发往西去。

Sense.DEF: a westerly wind comes from the west
a wind that comes from the west
in or from the west of a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: the western end of the bay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海湾的西端
Sense.EXAMPLE: Western Australia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西澳大利亚

Sense.DEF: relating to ideas and ways of doing things that come from Europe and the Americas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Western philosophies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方哲学

Sense.DEF: a film about life in the 19th century in the American West, especially the lives of cowboys
Sense.TRAN: 西部片﹐西部电影〔描写19世纪美国西部生活﹐尤其是牛仔生活的电影〕

Sense.DEF: someone from the western part of the world
someone from the western part of the US
to bring customs, business methods etc that are typical of Europe and the US to other countries
Sense.TRAN: 使〔风俗﹑经营方式等〕西化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tunisian culture has been westernized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突尼斯文化已被西化了。

Sense.DEF: using the customs, behaviour etc typical of the US or Europe
Sense.EXAMPLE: westernised economies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经西化的经济体

Sense.DEF: the type of medical treatment that is standard in Europe and North America
furthest west
Sense.EXAMPLE: the westernmost tip of the island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座岛的最西端

Sense.DEF: the British Houses of Parliament
Sense.EXAMPLE: Westminster was buzzing with anticipation today as MPs gathered for tonight’s crucial vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天议会大厦热闹非凡﹐议员们为了今晚这场至关重要的投票而聚集一堂﹐大家充满了期待。

Sense.DEF: towards the west
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship turned westward, away from the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船调转方向离开海岸﹐向西驶去。

Sense.DEF: covered in or full of water or another liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve washed your shirt but it’s still wet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把你的衬衫洗过了﹐不过现在还是湿的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: wet grass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湿草地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take an umbrella or you’ll get wet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 带把雨伞﹐不然你会被淋湿的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His face was wet with sweat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上湿乎乎的都是汗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The man in the boat was wet through completely wet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船上的那人浑身湿透。

GramExa.GLOSS: very wet
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The towel was soaking wet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条毛巾湿淋淋的。

Sense.DEF: rainy
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s more wet weather on the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未来还有更多湿雨天气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very wet outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面雨很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wettest summer on record
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有记录以来雨天最多的夏季

Sense.DEF: not yet dry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paint’s still wet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆还没干。

Sense.DEF: someone who is wet does not have a strong character, or is not willing to do something that you think they should do – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕犹豫不决的﹐软弱的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so wet! Just tell them you don’t want to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么窝囊！就告诉他们你不想去。

Sense.DEF: if a child or its nappy is wet, the nappy is full of urine
someone is completely wrong
very young and without much experience of life
Sense.TRAN: 年轻而没有人生经验﹔乳臭未干

Exponent.DEF: covered in water or another liquid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve just washed my hair and it’s still wet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚洗过头发﹐现在还是湿的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’d better change out of those wet clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好把那身湿衣服换掉。

Exponent.DEF: slightly wet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wipe the surfaces with a damp cloth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用块湿布擦拭表面。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sheets are still a little damp.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 床单还是有点潮湿。

Exponent.DEF: slightly wet, especially in a pleasant way – used about soil, food, or about someone’s skin or eyes
Exponent.TRAN: 〔土壤﹑食物﹑皮肤或眼睛〕潮润的﹐湿润的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s important to keep the soil moist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持土壤湿润很重要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a delicious moist chocolate cake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美味软润的巧克力蛋糕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her eyes became moist she was almost crying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛湿润了。

Exponent.DEF: feeling slightly wet, cold, and sticky – used about someone’s skin, especially when they are nervous or ill
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因紧张或不适而皮肤〕湿黏的﹐湿冷的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had clammy hands.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手湿乎乎的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ruby was feverish and clammy with sweat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁比发着烧﹐身上因为出汗黏糊糊的。

Exponent.DEF: unpleasantly wet and soft – used especially about food or the ground
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指食物或地面〕受潮的﹐湿软的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bowl of soggy rice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一碗湿乎乎的米饭
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It had been raining hard and the ground was soggy underfoot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直在下大雨﹐脚下的地面湿漉漉的。

Exponent.DEF: used when the weather is hot but the air feels wet in a way that makes you uncomfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Summers in Tokyo are hot and humid.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 东京的夏天又热又潮。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hot muggy day
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 闷热潮湿的天气

Exponent.DEF: very wet all the way through – used especially about people and their clothes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It absolutely poured with rain and we got soaked.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨倾盆﹐我们全湿透了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His shirt was soaked with blood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衬衫被血浸透了。

Exponent.DEF: very wet – used about a person or area after a lot of rain or water has fallen on them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人或地方因大雨或淋到水而〕湿透的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone got drenched when a huge wave hit the boat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个大浪打到小船上﹐每个人都浑身湿透。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The garden was completely drenched after the rain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨后这花园浸满了水。

Exponent.DEF: extremely wet, and unable to take in any more water or liquid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His bandage was saturated with blood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的绷带被血浸透了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The floods were the result of heavy rainfall on already saturated soil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次洪涝是原已饱和的土壤遭强降雨而致。

Exponent.DEF: used about ground that has water on its surface because it is so wet that it cannot take in any more
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The game was cancelled because the field was waterlogged.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛因场地浸水而取消。

Exponent.DEF: very wet with water – used about clothes and the ground. Sodden is less common than soaked.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔衣服或地面〕浸透的﹐湿透的〔sodden不如soaked常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ground was still sodden.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地上仍然湿漉漉的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He took off his sodden shirt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱掉湿透的衬衣。

Sense.DEF: to make something wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wet your hair and apply the shampoo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弄湿头发﹐抹上洗发剂。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself, your clothes, or your bed wet because you pass water from your body by accident

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I nearly wet myself I was so scared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吓得都快尿出来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam’s wet his bed again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆又尿床了。

Sense.DEF: the rain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The path is steep and dangerous in the wet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路陡峭﹐雨天很危险。

Sense.DEF: a politician who belongs to the conservative party, and who supports very moderate ideas – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 保守党温和派成员〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tory wets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党的软骨头

Sense.DEF: someone who does not have a strong character, or is not willing to do something that you think they should do – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 软弱的人﹔窝囊废〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on! Don’t be such a wet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去呀！别这么窝囊！

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone from Mexico who has come to the US illegally. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 湿背人〔指非法进入美国的墨西哥人〕

Sense.DEF: a small bar with equipment for making alcoholic drinks, in a house, hotel room etc
someone who seems to want to spoil other people’s fun, for example by refusing to join them in something enjoyable that they are doing
a sexually exciting dream that a man has, resulting in an orgasm
fresh uncooked fish that is on sale in a shop
an area of land that is partly covered with water, or is wet most of the time
wet-look clothes have a shiny surface so that they look as if they are wet
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服〕表面闪光发亮的〔看起来像湿的一样〕

Sense.DEF: a woman paid to give her breast milk to another woman’s baby
to give someone too much care and attention, as if they were a child
a tight piece of clothing, usually made of rubber, worn by people who are swimming, surfing etc in the sea
Sense.TRAN: 〔在海中游泳、冲浪等穿的〕湿式潜水服

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance which, when spread on a solid surface, makes it hold liquid
a liquid used for storing contact lenses in, or for making them more comfortable to wear
Sense.TRAN: 〔隐形眼镜用的〕护理液﹐润湿液
the short form of 缩略式= ‘we have’

Sense.DEF: to hit someone or something hard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He kept whacking the dog with a stick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不停地用棍子打狗。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just whack the bacon under the grill for a couple of minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就把熏肉放在烤架下烤几分钟。

Sense.DEF: the act of hitting something hard, or the noise this makes
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave the ball a whack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她猛击了一下球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Singleton took a whack at tried to hit Miller’s head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛格尔顿用力朝米勒的头部打去。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you’re unemployed, you don’t have to pay the full whack the full amount.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你没有工作﹐就不用付全额。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s still a fair whack quite a large amount of work to be done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍有很多工作要做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These agencies charge top whack for tickets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些代理处收取高额票价。

Sense.DEF: to do a fair or equal share of a job or activity
Sense.TRAN: 做你应做的一份〔工作或活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve done my whack of the driving – it’s your turn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开过车了——现在轮到你开了。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you any good at doing maths?’ ‘I’ll have a whack at it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你做数学题拿手吗？”“我试试看。”

Sense.DEF: all on one occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve lost $500 in one whack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫一下子损失了500美元。

Sense.DEF: if a system, machine etc is out of whack, the parts are not working together correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The printer’s out of whack again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印机又出毛病了。

Sense.DEF: very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look absolutely whacked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去累坏了。

Sense.DEF: behaving strangely, especially because of having too much alcohol or drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因醉酒或吸毒而〕行为怪异的

Sense.DEF: a whacked situation is very strange, especially in an unacceptable way
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况〕古怪的﹐反常的〔尤指让人无法接受〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone was running around naked. It was totally whacked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都光着身子跑来跑去﹐简直太不可思议了。

Sense.DEF: very big
Sense.EXAMPLE: a whacking great gas bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨额煤气账单

Sense.DEF: another spelling of wacko
another spelling of wacky
a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a whale of a time
Sense.DEF: to enjoy yourself very much
to start hitting someone or something
a hard substance taken from the upper jaw of whales, used in the past for making women’s clothes stiff
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时用以保持妇女衣服挺括的〕鲸须﹐鲸骨

Sense.DEF: someone who hunts whales
a boat used to hunt whales
the activity of hunting whales
used to describe the sound of something suddenly hitting something else very hard
Sense.TRAN: 砰﹐嘭〔形容某物突然撞击他物的声音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wham! The car hit the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砰！汽车撞到了墙上。

Sense.DEF: used to express the idea that something very unexpected suddenly happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life is going along nicely and then, wham, you lose your job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日子正过得好好的﹐然后一下子﹐你失业了。

Sense.DEF: two or three unpleasant things that happen at or around the same time and cause problems or difficulties for someone or for people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s policy is higher tax and higher interest rates. It’s a double whammy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的政策是高税收和高利率﹐这真是双重打击。

Sense.DEF: to use magic to make someone have bad luck
a structure that is built out into the water so that boats can stop next to it
used to say ‘hello’ to people you know very well – used especially by young people
used to ask for information or for someone’s opinion
Sense.TRAN: 什么〔用于询问信息或征求意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you doing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在做什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What subjects did you enjoy most?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最喜欢什么学科？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What colour is the new carpet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新地毯是什么颜色的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your new boss like?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的新老板怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you think of my painting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得我的画怎样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you mean, you want to spend Christmas alone?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是什么意思﹐你想一个人过圣诞节？

GramExa.PROPFORM: what on earth/in the world/in heaven’s name etc
GramExa.GLOSS: used for emphasis when you are surprised, angry etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What on earth’s going on?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到底发生了什么事？

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When there are only a small number of possible things or people, use which , not what.
F2NBox.TRAN: 可选的人或物只有少数时用which﹐不用what
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Which leg (NOT 不说 What leg) did he break?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哪条腿骨折？

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a clause about something that is or was not known or not certain
Sense.TRAN: 什么﹔什么事〔用于引导疑问从句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one knows exactly what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人确切地知道发生了什么事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is not clear to what extent these views were shared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不清楚有多少人认同这些观点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re discussing what to do next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在讨论下一步怎么办。

Sense.DEF: the thing which
Sense.EXAMPLE: Show me what you bought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我看看你买的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I believe what he told me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信他对我说的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could get you a job here if that’s what you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以给你在这里找份工作﹐如果这就是你想要的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What he did was morally wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为很缺德。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him what money she had all the money she had, although she did not have much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把她仅有的钱全都给了他。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: What is not a relative pronoun and should not be used to begin a clause after a noun or pronoun. Use that instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: what不是关系代词﹐不可用在名词或代词后引导从句
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There are so many things that (NOT 不说 things what) can go wrong.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多事情都可能会出错。

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning of a statement to emphasize what you are going to say
Sense.TRAN: …的是…〔用在陈述句的开始﹐强调准备说的内容〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What that kid needs is some love and affection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个孩子需要的是一些爱和关怀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What we’ll do is leave a note for Mum to tell her we won’t be back till late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要做的是给妈妈留一张便条﹐告诉她我们要很晚才回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What matters is the British people and British jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要的是英国的人民和英国的就业机会。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone to repeat something they have just said because you did not hear it properly
Subsense.TRAN: 什么？〔因没有听清楚而要求对方重复所说的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Could you turn the music down a bit?’ ‘What?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能不能把音乐调低一点？”“什么？”

Subsense.DEF: used when you have heard someone calling to you and you are asking them what they want
Subsense.TRAN: 什么事？〔因对方召唤而作出应答〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Elaine!’ ‘What?’ ‘Come on!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “伊莱恩！”“什么事？”“快一点！”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised or shocked by something that someone has just said
Subsense.TRAN: 什么？〔对他人所说的话表示惊讶或震惊〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think I’ve lost my passport.’ ‘What?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想我护照丢了。”“什么？”

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning of a sentence to emphasize that you think something or someone is very good, very bad etc
Sense.TRAN: 多么﹐何等〔用在句子开头﹐强调某事或某人很好或很坏等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a lovely day!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多好的天气！
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a horrible thing to do!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这种事真可怕！
Sense.EXAMPLE: What nice people they are!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是多好的人啊！

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to complete a name when they have only given you the first part of it
Sense.TRAN: 什么〔用于问清别人的全名〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you know his name?’ ‘It’s David.’ ‘David what?’ ”
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你知道他的名字吗？”“戴维。”“戴维什么？”

Subsense.DEF: used to make a suggestion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What about dinner at my place next week?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周到我家吃饭怎么样？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What about going to a movie?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去看场电影如何？

Subsense.DEF: used to introduce a new subject into a conversation, or to mention something or someone else that also needs to be considered
Subsense.TRAN: …怎么样〔用于在交谈中引入新话题﹐或提及也需要考虑的其他事或人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What about Patrick? What’s he doing nowadays?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克怎么样？他现在在干什么？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What about me? Aren’t I coming too?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我呢？难道我不一起去吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: So that’s the food – now what about the wine?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所以这些是吃的﹐那么酒呢？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: And what of her other job? How is that progressing?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的另一份工作呢？进展如何？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask why someone does something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s decided to work part-time.’ ‘What for?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她决定去做兼职。”“为什么？”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What did you do that for?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么那样做？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask what purpose or use something has
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What’s this gadget for?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小玩意儿是干什么用的？

Sense.DEF: used to give yourself time to think before guessing a number or amount
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐哦〔猜测数目或数量前给自己时间考虑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re looking at, what, about £4,000 for a decent second-hand car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买一辆像样的二手车﹐你得考虑花﹐嗯﹐大约4,000英镑。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about a person or thing whose name you cannot immediately remember
Sense.TRAN: 他/她/它叫什么来着〔用于谈论一时记不起名字的人或物时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital have just got a, what d’you call it, er... a scanner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院刚买了一台新的叫什么来着﹐嗯——扫描器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is what’s his name still working there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个谁还在那里工作吗？

Sense.DEF: used when adding information that emphasizes what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 而且〔用于补充信息﹐强调自己所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gas is a very efficient fuel. And what’s more, it’s clean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天然气是高效燃料﹐而且还清洁。

Sense.DEF: the real facts about a situation that are important to know
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been working here long enough to know what’s what.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经在这里工作很长时间了﹐很了解情况。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone angrily that something does not concern them
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s right, I didn’t pass. What’s it to you, anyway?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没错﹐我是没及格﹐可这跟你又有什么关系？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How did he die?’ Suddenly Emily was angry. ‘What’s it to you?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他怎么死的？”埃米莉突然生气了。“那跟你有什么关系？”

Subsense.DEF: used at the end of a question to show that you are impatient with someone or something
Subsense.TRAN: 还是(别的)什么〔用于疑问句的末尾表示不耐烦〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you afraid of him, or what?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是怕他还是什么？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is that work going to be finished by Friday, or what?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项工作是星期五完成还是怎么样？

Subsense.DEF: used after mentioning one or more possibilities to show that you are not certain about something
Subsense.TRAN: 还是别的什么〔用于列举的一个或多个可能性之后﹐表示对某事不确定〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know whether it was an accident or on purpose or what.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道这是意外还是人为所致﹐或是其他什么原因。

Subsense.DEF: used after a description of someone or something to emphasize it
Subsense.TRAN: 很﹐非常〔用于对某人或某物的描述后﹐表示强调〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Nearby are the remains of a deserted village. Spooky or what?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近有一处废弃村庄的遗址﹐特别可怕吧？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is that madness or what?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是不是完全疯了？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not care about something or think it is important
Sense.TRAN: 那有什么了不起？那又怎样？〔表示某人对某事无所谓或认为某事不重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Your room looks a real mess, Tracey.’ ‘So what?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的房间真乱﹐特雷西。”“那又怎么样？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But, Paul, she’s so much older than you?’ ‘What of it?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可是﹐保罗﹐她年龄比你大那么多。”“那又怎样？”

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone to repeat something they have just said. It is more polite to say pardon.
Subsense.TRAN: 你说什么？〔用于让对方重复一遍所说的话﹐这种情况下说pardon 较为礼貌〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I want to tell you something.’ ‘You what? I can’t hear what you’re saying.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想跟你说件事。”“你说什么？我听不到你说的话。”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘So I resigned.’ ‘You what?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “所以我辞职了。”“你说什么？”

Subsense.DEF: used to ask what you should do or what the result will be if something happens, especially something unpleasant
Subsense.TRAN: 如果…怎么办？ 如果…将会怎样？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What if this plan of yours fails, what then?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你的这个计划失败了﹐那又该怎么办？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘What if it rains tomorrow?’ ‘We’ll just have to postpone it.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “要是明天下雨怎么办？”“我们就只好延期。”

Subsense.DEF: used to make a suggestion
Subsense.TRAN: 如果…怎么样？〔用于提出建议〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What if we moved the sofa over here? Do you think that would look any better?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我们把沙发挪到这边来会怎么样？你认为那样看上去会不会好一些？

Sense.DEF: used at the end of a list of things to mean other things of a similar kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shelves were crammed with books, documents, and what have you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 架子上塞满了书﹑文件之类的东西。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a list of reasons that have made something happen or made someone feel in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 因为某事﹐由于某事〔用于列举各种理由〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t get to sleep, what with all the shooting and shouting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪声和喊声此起彼伏﹐她无法入睡。

Sense.DEF: used to ask why a person or group of people is behaving strangely
Sense.TRAN: 某人怎么啦？〔用于询问某人或某些人为何行为古怪〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s with you people?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们这些人怎么啦？

Sense.DEF: used to ask the reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s with all the sad faces?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个个都苦着脸﹐怎么回事？

Sense.DEF: used to ask what is going to happen next, what you should do etc
Sense.TRAN: 下一步会怎样？下一步怎么办？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has no bad qualities or features
Sense.TRAN: 谁不喜欢？〔用于表示某物很好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s not to like about this book?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁不喜欢这本书呢？

Sense.DEF: a word you use when you cannot remember the name of something
Sense.TRAN: 叫什么东西来着〔用于忘记某物的名称时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve broken the whatchamacallit on my bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我包上的那个什么东西弄坏了。

Sense.DEF: any or all of the things that are wanted, needed, or possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Help yourself to whatever you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请随意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were allowed to do whatever they liked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们可以想干什么就干什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll be ready to accept whatever help he can get.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将愿意接受能得到的任何帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am willing to pay whatever price you ask.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你开什么价我都愿意付。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is not important what happens, what you do etc because it does not change the situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever I suggest, he always disagrees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论我提什么建议﹐他总是不同意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building must be saved, whatever the cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不论代价多大都要保护这座建筑物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you are unable to attend the interview, for whatever reason, you should inform us immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不能参加面谈﹐不管什么原因﹐你应该立即通知我们。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that it is very important that they do a particular thing, or do not do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t miss the train, whatever you do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论如何别误了火车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever you do, slow down and take your time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管怎样﹐你要放慢速度﹐不要着急。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not know the exact meaning of something, or the exact name of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: …什么来着〔用于表示不知道某人的姓名或某事物的确切名称或含义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor says she’s got fibrositis, whatever that is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说她得了肌风湿病什么的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you invite Seb, or whatever he’s called, to supper?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不邀请那个叫塞博还是什么的人来吃晚饭？

Sense.DEF: used after mentioning one or two things to mean other things of the same kind
Sense.TRAN: 任何类似的东西〔用于已经提及的一两个东西之后表示同类的其他东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could put an advert in some magazine, journal, newspaper, or whatever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在某个杂志﹑期刊﹑报纸什么的上面登个广告。

Sense.DEF: used when asking a question to emphasize that you are surprised or slightly angry about something
Sense.TRAN: 究竟是什么〔用于疑问句中﹐强调对某事感到惊讶或有些生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever can he mean?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他究竟是什么意思？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you know she’s dyed her hair orange?’ ‘Whatever next?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你知不知道她把头发染成橙色了？”“她接下来还会干什么？”

Sense.DEF: used as a reply to say that you do not care what is done or chosen, or that the exact details of something do not matter
Sense.TRAN: 什么都可以﹐随便什么都行
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What flavour do you want? Strawberry, vanilla ...?’ ‘Whatever.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想要什么口味的？草莓﹑香草……？”“什么都行。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It was Monday, not Tuesday.’ ‘Whatever.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “是星期一﹐不是星期二。”“这无所谓。”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you agree with them or will do what they want, especially when you do not really agree or want to do it
Sense.TRAN: 随你说/想/要〔用于表示赞成﹐尤指并非真的赞同或想做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How about camping, just for a change?’ ‘OK, whatever you want.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “换个花样﹐去野营怎样？”“好啊﹐随你便。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think we’d better discuss this with your parents.’ ‘Whatever you think best.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我认为我们最好和你父母商量一下这事。”“你觉得怎么最好就怎么办吧。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a negative statement
Sense.TRAN: 丝毫﹔任何〔用于强调否定句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是与科学有关的她都没有表现出任何兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是一场无聊的争论﹐和你的工作没有任何关系。

Sense.DEF: something that could happen in the future or could have happened in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I thought about all of the what-ifs in my life, I would go crazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我要考虑到生活中的那么多“假如”﹐我会发疯的。

Sense.DEF: an expression used at the end of a list of things when you do not want to give the names of everything
Sense.TRAN: 诸如此类的东西﹐等等〔用于不想一一列举时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put your bags, cases, and whatnot in the back of the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的袋子﹑盒子等等放到汽车后面。

Sense.DEF: a word you use when you cannot think of the word you want
Sense.TRAN: 那个什么玩意儿〔指想不起名称的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try and undo the screw to get the whatsit off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试着拧开螺丝﹐把那个小玩意儿拆下来。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a negative statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s had no luck whatsoever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一点也不走运。

Sense.DEF: the grain that bread is made from, or the plant that it grows on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a field of wheat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小麦地

Sense.LEXUNIT: separate the wheat from the chaff
Sense.DEF: to choose the good and useful things or people and get rid of the others
the centre of a grain of wheat, which is good for your health and is added to other food
a brown flour made from whole grains of wheat
used to express happiness or excitement, especially by or to children
Sense.TRAN: 哟﹐好啊〔用于表示高兴或激动﹐尤为儿语〕

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do or give you something, for example by saying nice things to them that you do not mean – used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She even managed to wheedle more money out of him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她甚至又从他那里骗来一些钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have to be able to wheedle your client into buying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须能哄骗顾客花钱购买。

GramExa.PROPFORM: wheedle your way in/into/out of etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t think you can just wheedle your way in here!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别想靠花言巧语混进来！

Sense.DEF: one of the round things under a car, bus, bicycle etc that turns when it moves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car slid sideways, its rear wheels spinning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车向一侧打滑﹐后轮猛转。

Sense.DEF: the round piece of equipment that you turn to make a car, ship etc move in a particular direction
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑轮船等的〕方向盘﹐转向盘

GramExa.GLOSS: driving a car
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The driver must have fallen asleep at the wheel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机一定是在开车时睡着了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall I take the wheel drive instead of someone else?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来开车好吗？

Sense.DEF: a flat round part in a machine that turns round when the machine operates
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gear wheel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 齿轮

Sense.DEF: the way in which a complicated organization, system etc works
Sense.TRAN: 〔复杂的机构﹑体系等的〕运作方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope that the next government will do more to keep the wheels of industry turning help it to work smoothly and easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望下届政府作出更多努力﹐让工业顺利发展。

GramExa.GLOSS: help something to work more smoothly and easily
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money people spend at Christmas oils the wheels of the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在圣诞节所花的钱推动经济发展。

Sense.DEF: the way in which things change in life, or in which the same things seem to happen again after a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 命运之轮/生命之轮/时间的车轮等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are powerless to stop the wheel of history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无力阻挡历史的车轮。

Sense.DEF: a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you like my new wheels?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢我的新车吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation is complicated and difficult to understand because it involves processes and decisions that you know nothing about
Sense.TRAN: 错综复杂的情况﹐复杂的形势

Sense.LEXUNIT: set the wheels in motion/set the wheels turning
Sense.DEF: to make a particular process start
Sense.EXAMPLE: It only took one phone call to set the wheels in motion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个电话就促成了这件事的发生。

Sense.DEF: an important person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became a big wheel in the East India Company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成了东印度公司的要人。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: put your shoulder to the wheel
put a spoke in sb’s wheel

Subsense.DEF: to push something that has wheels somewhere
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kate wheeled her bike into the garage.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特把她的自行车推进车库。

Subsense.DEF: to move someone or something that is in or on something that has wheels
Subsense.TRAN: 用轮椅[手推车等]推动〔某人或某物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Two nurses were wheeling him into the operating theatre.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名护士正把他推进手术室。

Sense.DEF: if birds or planes wheel, they fly around in circles
to turn around suddenly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wheeled around and started yelling at us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然转身﹐冲着我们嚷嚷起来。

Sense.DEF: to do a lot of complicated and sometimes dishonest deals, especially in politics or business
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在政治或商业上〕投机取巧﹐玩弄手段

Sense.DEF: to publicly produce someone or something and use them to help you achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为帮助自己达成某事而〕请出〔某人〕﹐推出〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then the prosecution wheeled in a surprise witness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后控方请出了一名意想不到的证人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government wheeled out the same old arguments to support its election campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府又搬出老一套论调来支持其选举活动。

Sense.DEF: a small cart with one wheel and two handles that you use outdoors to carry things, especially in the garden
the distance between the front and back axles of a vehicle
a chair with wheels, used by people who cannot walk

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’ll be in a wheelchair for the rest of his life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的余生都将在轮椅上度过。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Lynn has been confined to a wheelchair has had to use a wheelchair for the last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去一年中林恩都被困在轮椅上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: special parking for wheelchair users
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐轮椅人士的专用停车位

Sense.DEF: a metal object that is fastened to the wheel of an illegally parked car so that it cannot be driven away
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于锁住违章停车车辆的〕车轮锁夹

Sense.DEF: having wheels

GramExa.GLOSS: having two, three etc wheels
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a three-wheeled car
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三轮汽车

Sense.DEF: someone who does a lot of complicated, often dishonest deals, especially in business or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在商业或政治上〕善于投机取巧的人﹐喜欢玩弄手段的人

Sense.DEF: the place on a ship where the captain stands at the wheel
to lift the front wheel of a bicycle that you are riding off the ground, so that you are balancing on the back wheel
Sense.TRAN: 表演后轮平衡特技〔让自行车前轮离地﹐靠后轮支撑平衡〕

Sense.DEF: a large container with wheels, that you keep outside your house for putting waste into
Sense.TRAN: 大型轮式垃圾箱〔在屋外﹐用来存放家庭垃圾〕

Sense.DEF: activities that involve a lot of complicated and sometimes dishonest deals, especially in business or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业或政治上的〕投机取巧﹐玩弄手段

Sense.DEF: someone whose job was to make and repair the wooden wheels of vehicles pulled by horses in the past
to breathe with difficulty, making a noise in your throat and chest
the act or sound of wheezing
a clever and amusing idea or plan
an old joke that no one thinks is funny now
making a noisy sound in your throat or chest, because you cannot breathe easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: You sound wheezy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听起来有些气喘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wheezy cough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呼哧呼哧的咳嗽

Sense.DEF: a small sea animal that has a shell and can be eaten
a young animal, especially a dog or lion
if a dog or lion whelps, it gives birth
at what time
Sense.EXAMPLE: When are we leaving?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们什么时候走？
Sense.EXAMPLE: When did you first meet Dr Darnall?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是什么时候认识达纳尔博士的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: When will the work be finished?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作什么时候完成？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know when I’ll see her again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道何时才能再见到她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll tell you when to stop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会告诉你什么时候停下。

Sense.DEF: at or during the time that something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leonard was nine when his father died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲去世时伦纳德九岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the family came here from Russia, they were penniless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家人从俄罗斯迁来这里的时候身无分文。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he was in the air force he flew Tornado jets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在空军服役时驾驶旋风式战斗机。

Sense.DEF: after or as soon as something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the meal was finished, Rachel washed up and made coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃完饭﹐雷切尔洗了碗并泡了咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll phone you again when I get home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到家后会再给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: used to mention a type of event or situation when talking about what happens on occasions of that type
Sense.TRAN: 当〔某种条件出现〕时会〔产生某种状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When lead is added to petrol, it improves the car’s performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽油中加铅可以提高汽车的性能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When mixed with water the powder forms a smooth paste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种粉末和水混合以后会成为均匀的糊状。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always wears glasses except when playing football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了踢足球的时候﹐他一直戴着眼镜。

Sense.DEF: used to show which particular time or occasion you are talking about
Sense.TRAN: …的时候〔用于表示某一具体时刻或场合〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best moment was when he scored the winning goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最精彩的一刻是他射入制胜一球的时候。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are times when I hate him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也有恨他的时候。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She remembered the day when Paula had first arrived.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想起了葆拉刚来的那一天。

Sense.DEF: before or since which time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby is due in May, by when the new house should be finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝的预产期在五月﹐那时新房子也应该完工了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was written in 1946, since when the education system has undergone great changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是1946年写的﹐自那以后教育体制经历了巨大的变革。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very surprised or angry
Sense.TRAN: 从何时起…？〔表示非常惊讶或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since when have you been interested in my feelings?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从什么时候开始关心起我的感受来了？

Sense.DEF: even though something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does she steal things when she could easily afford to buy them?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全买得起﹐为什么还要偷东西呢？

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a fact or statement that makes something seem surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you consider that the airline handled 80 million passengers last year, the accident figures are really very small.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你考虑到这家航空公司去年运送了8,000万名乘客﹐那么这个事故率其实是非常低的。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Generally, in a clause beginning with when that refers to the future, use the present tense or present perfect, not ‘will’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 一般情况下﹐在以when引导的表示将来的从句中﹐用现在时或现在完成时﹐不用will
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They don’t know what is going to happen when the project is finished (NOT 不说 when the project will be finished).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不知道这个项目完成后会发生什么。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Remove the supports when the glue has set.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 胶水凝固后就把支撑物拿掉。
F2NBox.EXPL: However, when asking or talking about the time that something will happen, use will.
F2NBox.TRAN: 但是询问或谈论某事何时发生则要用will
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: When will the government take action?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府何时会采取行动？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: teenagers who don’t let their parents know when they will be home
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不告诉父母什么时候回家的青少年

Sense.DEF: from where
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked to Rainbagh, whence I could complete the journey by car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我步行至雷恩巴夫﹐从那里我可以开车走完全程。

Sense.DEF: every time that a particular thing happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Larry always blames me whenever anything goes wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每每有什么事情出现问题﹐拉里总是责怪我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whenever I hear that tune, it makes me think of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每当听到那曲子﹐我就会想起你。

Sense.DEF: at any time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come and visit me whenever you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你随便什么时候想来看我就来吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a policy of using recycled paper whenever possible
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽可能使用再生纸的政策

Sense.DEF: used as a reply to say that it does not matter what time something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll call you tomorrow or the day after.’ ‘Okay. Whenever.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我明天或后天打电话给你。”“好﹐什么时候都行。”

Sense.DEF: in or to which place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where are you going?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要到哪儿去？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where do they live?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在哪里？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know where my glasses are?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道我的眼镜在哪儿吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where would you like to sit?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想坐在哪里？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Where have you come from?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从哪里来？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘We’re going on a long journey.’ ‘Where to?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们要去远行。”“去哪里？”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re easy to find, if you know where to look.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你知道去哪里找﹐就很容易找到他们。

GramExa.PROPFORM: where on earth/in the world etc
GramExa.GLOSS: used for emphasis when you are surprised, angry etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Where on earth have you been all this time?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这段时间究竟去哪里了？

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was standing exactly where you are standing now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就站在你现在所站的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stay where you are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 待在原地别动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the place where I hid the key.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我藏钥匙的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1963 we moved to Boston, where my grandparents lived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1963年我们搬到波士顿﹐我祖父母就住在那里。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular stage in a process, conversation, story etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treatment will continue until the patient reaches the point where he can walk correctly and safely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗将一直持续到病人可以正常并安全行走的时候。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You are saying that everyone should be equal, and this is where I disagree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说人人都应该是平等的﹐这一点我不能同意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, where were we? Oh yes, we were talking about John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐我们说到哪里了？噢﹐对了﹐我们正在说约翰。

Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about the origin of something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 哪里〔指某物的来源或某人的来历〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where does the word ‘super’ come from?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: super这个单词是从哪里来的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where does this man get the money to keep two houses?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个男人哪来那么多钱﹐能有两幢房子？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wonder where he gets these strange ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他这些奇怪的念头是从哪里来的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that one person, thing, opinion etc is different from another
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示某人﹑某物﹑某观点等与众不同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where others might have been satisfied, Dawson had higher ambitions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人或许这样就满足了﹐可道森却有更大的雄心。

Sense.DEF: in or to any place
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can sit where you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以随便坐哪里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re free to go where you please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你高兴去哪里就去哪里。

Sense.DEF: used to ask in what general area something or someone is
Sense.TRAN: 在哪里﹐在哪一带〔用于询问大概地点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whereabouts do you live?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你住在哪一带？

Sense.DEF: the place or area where someone or something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He showed great reluctance to reveal his whereabouts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他极不愿意说出他的行踪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police want to know the whereabouts of his brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方想知道他弟弟的下落。

Sense.DEF: used to say that although something is true of one thing, it is not true of another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old system was fairly complicated whereas the new system is really very simple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧系统相当复杂﹐而新系统却很简单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whereas the city spent over $1 billion on its museums and stadium, it failed to look after its schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市花了十亿美元建造博物馆和体育馆﹐但是却忽略了对学校的建设。

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning of an official document to mean ‘because of a particular fact’
by means of which or according to which
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 允许欧盟公民在欧盟任何地方居住的一项提议

Sense.DEF: used to ask why
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wherefore art thou Romeo?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么你偏偏是罗密欧？

Sense.DEF: in which place or part
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wherein lies the difference between conservatism and liberalism?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守主义与自由主义区别何在？

Sense.DEF: of what or of which
on which
another word for wherever
to which place
used when something happens immediately after something else, or as a result of something happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused to hand over her money, whereupon there was a fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝交出她的钱﹐于是发生了争吵。

Sense.DEF: to or at any place, position, or situation
Sense.TRAN: 无论去哪里﹔无论在哪里﹔无论什么情况下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children will play wherever they happen to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子走到哪里玩到哪里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit wherever you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便坐吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that you are talking about any place and not a specific place
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: …或其他任何地方〔用于强调所述的并非一个特定的地方〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dublin people dress more individually than people in London or wherever.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 都柏林人比伦敦或任何其他地方的人都穿得有个性。

Sense.DEF: in all places that
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is shadowed by detectives wherever she goes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走到哪里都有警探跟踪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel I ought to be nice to them wherever possible at all times when it is possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己应该尽可能对他们好一点。

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning of a question to show surprise
Sense.TRAN: 究竟在哪儿〔用在疑问句句首﹐表示惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Wherever did she find that?’ Daisy wondered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她究竟是在哪儿弄到那东西的呢？”黛西自忖道。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not know where a place or town is or have never heard of it
Sense.TRAN: 不知道是个什么地方〔表示不知道某个地方或城镇在哪里或从没有听说过〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wants to move to Far Flatley, wherever that is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想搬到法芙莱特里去﹐不知道是个什么地方。

Sense.DEF: the money, skill etc that you need in order to do something
Sense.TRAN: 做某事所需的金钱[技能等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does Cath have the creative wherewithal to make it as a solo act?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯思有没有可以进行个人秀的创造力？

Sense.DEF: if an experience whets your appetite for something, it increases your desire for it
Sense.TRAN: 引起某人(对某事物)的欲望
Sense.EXAMPLE: The view from the Quai bridge had whetted my appetite for a trip on the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从愧桥望过去的景色勾起了我到湖上一游的念头。

Sense.DEF: to make the edge of a blade sharp
used when talking about a choice you have to make or about something that is not certain
Sense.TRAN: 是否〔用于表示选择或对某事不确定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maurice asked me whether I needed any help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯问我是否需要帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were times when I wondered whether or not we would get there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我也想知道我们能不能做得到。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was uncertain whether to stay or leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿不定主意是该留下还是离开。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know whether to believe him or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道该不该相信他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question arose as to whether this behaviour was unlawful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题出现了: 这种行为是否不合法？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something definitely will or will not happen whatever the situation is
Sense.TRAN: 不管﹐不论〔用于表示无论出现什么情况﹐某事肯定发生或不发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seemed to me that she was in trouble whether Mahoney lived or died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看﹐不管马奥尼是活着还是死了﹐她都有麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, Kate, I’m calling the doctor, whether you like it or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐凯特﹐我要打电话叫医生来﹐不管你愿不愿意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor farmers, whether owners or tenants, will be worst affected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的农民﹐不管是自有农户还是佃户﹐都将是受影响最大的。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with the noun weather (=conditions outside such as rain, snow, sun, wind etc). 不要和名词weather(天气)混淆。

Sense.DEF: a stone used to make the blade of cutting tools sharp
used when you are surprised, very hot, or feeling glad that something bad did not happen
Sense.TRAN: 哟﹐唷﹐哎呀﹐嚯〔表示惊讶﹑感到炎热或因坏事竟没有发生而感到高兴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whew, it was hot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嚯﹐太热了。

Sense.DEF: the watery liquid that is left after the solid part has been removed from sour milk
used to ask or talk about one or more members of a group of people or things, when you are uncertain about it or about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which book are you looking for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在找哪本书？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which are the most important crops?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪些农作物是最重要的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miranda was sure it was one of them, but was not sure which.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米兰达确定此人是他们其中的一个﹐但不能肯定是哪一个。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know which of us was the more scared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道我们中谁更恐慌。

Sense.DEF: used after a noun to show what thing or things you mean
Sense.TRAN: …的那个﹐…的那些〔用于指明事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you see the letter which came today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到今天来的那封信了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now they were driving by the houses which Andy had described.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正开车经过安迪描述过的那些房子。

Sense.DEF: used, after a comma in writing, to add more information about the thing, situation, or event you have just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 〔在书面语中用于逗号之后﹐补充说明前面刚提及的事物﹑情况或事件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house, which was completed in 1856, was famous for its huge marble staircase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子建于1856年﹐以巨大的大理石楼梯闻名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the boys kept laughing, which annoyed Jane intensely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一个男孩不停地笑﹐这大大地惹恼了简。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was educated at the local grammar school, after which he went on to Cambridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在当地的语法学校接受教育﹐接着又上了剑桥大学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She may have missed the train, in which case if this has happened she won’t arrive for another hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能没赶上火车﹐若是如此﹐她还要过一个小时才能到。

Sense.LEXUNIT: don’t know/can’t tell etc which is which
Sense.DEF: if you do not know which is which, you cannot see the difference between two very similar people or things
Sense.TRAN: 不知道/分不清哪个是哪个
Sense.EXAMPLE: The twins are so alike I can never tell which is which.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对双胞胎长得如此相像﹐我怎么也分不清哪个是哪个。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it does not matter which thing or person is chosen because the result will be the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be a difficult operation, whichever method you choose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你选择哪种方法﹐手术都会很复杂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whichever way you look at it, things are pretty bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你怎么看﹐情况都相当糟。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the member of a group of people or things that does something, is wanted, is possible etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whichever player scores the highest number of points will be the winner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得分最高的一方获胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can either have the double room or the family room, whichever you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们可以住双人房或家庭套房﹐随你们喜欢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want tea or coffee?’ ‘I don’t mind – whichever one you’re making.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要茶还是咖啡？”“我无所谓﹐你弄什么我喝什么。”

Sense.DEF: a very slight smell of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a whiff of tobacco
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一股烟草味

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As she walked past, I caught a whiff of her perfume.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走过时﹐我闻到一股淡淡的香水味。

Sense.DEF: a slight sign that something dangerous, exciting etc might happen
Sense.TRAN: 危险/冒险/自由等的些微迹象
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whiff of danger filled her with excitement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 些许的危险让她感到很刺激。

Sense.DEF: a member of a British political party of the 18th and early 19th centuries which wanted to limit royal power, and later became the Liberal Party
Sense.TRAN: 辉格党党员〔辉格党是18及19世纪初期英国的一个政党﹐主张限制王权﹐后成为自由党〕

Sense.DEF: during the time that something is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: They arrived while we were having dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们来时我们正在吃饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: While she was asleep, thieves broke in and stole her handbag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她睡着的时候﹐小偷闯进来偷走了她的手提包。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She met Andy while working on a production of Carmen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排练《卡门》时﹐她认识了安迪。

Sense.DEF: all the time that something is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you look after the children while I do the shopping?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我买东西时你能不能照看一下孩子们？

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In a clause beginning with while that refers to the future, use the present tense, not ‘will’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在while引导的表示将来的从句中要用一般现在时﹐不用will
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I will enjoy my fame while it lasts (NOT 不说 while it will last).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要趁声名尚在时好好享受。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the difference between two situations, activities etc
Sense.TRAN: 却﹔但是﹔而〔用于强调两种情况﹑活动等之间的差别〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schools in the north tend to be better equipped, while those in the south are relatively poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北方的学校设施往往要好一些﹐而南方的学校则相对差一些。

Sense.DEF: in spite of the fact that
Sense.EXAMPLE: While never a big eater, he did snack a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他虽然胃口从来都不大﹐但零食确实是吃得很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: While there was no conclusive evidence, most people thought he was guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然没有确凿的证据﹐大多数人还是认为他有罪。

Sense.DEF: used to suggest that someone should do something at the same time that they do something else
Sense.TRAN: 在做某事的同时〔做另一件事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Print out what you’ve written, and while you’re at it make a copy for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你写的东西打印出来﹐同时给我也印一份。

Exponent.DEF: during the time that you are doing something, or something is happening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I bought a magazine while I was waiting for the train.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在等火车时买了本杂志。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: While we were on holiday, my bag was stolen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在度假时我的包被偷了。

Exponent.DEF: at the same time as something else is happening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’re still working on our bedroom. Meanwhile, we’re sleeping downstairs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还在给我们的卧室装修﹐这段时间我们就睡在楼下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Russians, meanwhile, declared war on August 8.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 与此同时﹐俄国人在8月8日宣战了。

Exponent.DEF: during the period of time between now and a future event, or between two events in the past
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More aid is expected soon, but in the meantime these people are going hungry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快就会有更多的救援物资送到﹐但是在此期间这些人还要挨饿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My new job hadn’t started, so in the meantime I tried to write a book.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的新工作尚未开始﹐所以在此期间我想写一本书。

Exponent.DEF: while. Whilst sounds a little more formal than while.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One American plane was forced to land whilst flying over DPRK.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架美国飞机在飞越朝鲜上空时被迫降落。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Whilst all this was going on, the performers were getting ready for the show.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当所有这些正在进行时﹐表演者正为演出做着准备。

Sense.DEF: a period of time, especially a short one
Sense.TRAN: 一段时间〔尤指较短的时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes a while to recover from the operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术后需要一段时间恢复。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Thomas will be with you in a while.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托马斯先生过一会儿会来见你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At last, he could relax for a while.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于可以放松一下了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wait a little while before deciding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等再作决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We talked for quite a while a fairly long time on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在电话里交谈了很长时间。

Sense.DEF: all the time that something is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: He examined her thoroughly, talking softly all the while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给她作了彻底的检查﹐同时始终柔声细语地跟她交谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She continued working, all the while keeping an eye on the clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她继续工作﹐同时一直留神注意着时间。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be worth sb’s while (to do/doing sth)

Sense.DEF: to spend time in a pleasant and lazy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evenings were whiled away in endless games of cards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上的时光都是在没完没了的牌局中消磨过去的。

Sense.TRAN: 当…时﹔在…的过程中﹔虽然﹐尽管

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason
Sense.TRAN: 突发的念头﹐一时的兴致〔尤指没有重要或充分的理由时〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t leave just on a whim for no good reason.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是一时心血来潮离开的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At work they are at the whim of the boss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作中他们要配合老板的步调行事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their father had always indulged her every whim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的父亲总是对她百依百顺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He appeared and disappeared at whim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想来就来﹐想走就走。

Sense.DEF: to make low crying sounds, or to speak in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He heard the dog whimper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到狗在呜咽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s not my fault,’ she whimpered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这不是我的错。”她抽泣着说。

Sense.DEF: unusual or strange and often amusing
Sense.TRAN: 古怪的﹔异想天开的﹐滑稽可笑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a wonderful whimsical sense of humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怪异的幽默感令人惊叹。

Sense.DEF: a way of thinking, behaving, or doing something that is unusual, strange, and often amusing
Sense.TRAN: 古怪〔而往往好笑的〕想法﹔古怪[荒诞]行径
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sense of fancy and whimsy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀奇古怪的想象力

Sense.DEF: to complain in a sad annoying voice about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh Charlotte, please stop whining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐夏洛特﹐请你别再抱怨了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t understand,’ whined Rose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不明白。”罗斯嘀咕道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sergeant was whining about how hard he had been forced to work recently.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那警官在抱怨最近工作有多辛苦。

Sense.DEF: to make a long high sound because you are in pain or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 〔因痛楚或不愉快而〕悲鸣﹐哀叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could hear the dog whining behind the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听见狗在门后呜咽。

Sense.DEF: if a machine whines, it makes a continuous high sound

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The baby’s howl turned to a high-pitched whine.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝的嚎哭变成了尖声的哀叫。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: the whine of a vacuum cleaner

Sense.DEF: to keep complaining in an annoying way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop whingeing about the situation and accept it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再嘟嘟囔囔抱怨自己的处境了﹐接受吧。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His tale is one long whinge about his own suffering.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的故事是对自己遭遇的长篇诉说。

Sense.DEF: if a horse whinnies, it makes a high sound
to hit someone or something with a whip
Sense.EXAMPLE: He whipped the horse into a canter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抽了一下鞭子﹐马儿就小跑起来。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly and violently, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind whipped her hair into her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风把她的头发吹进了眼睛里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rain whipped across the window pane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨点打在窗玻璃上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The branches were being whipped about in the storm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树枝在暴风雨中被吹得左右摇晃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He whipped round to face them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地转过身来面对他们。

Sense.DEF: to move or remove something with a quick sudden movement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Annie whipped off her apron and put it into the drawer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮迅速解开围裙﹐放进抽屉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He whipped back the sheets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地掀开被单。

Sense.DEF: to mix cream or the clear part of an egg very hard until it becomes stiff
Sense.TRAN: 搅打〔奶油或蛋清使成糊状〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whip the cream until thick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把奶油打到变稠。

Sense.DEF: to steal something
to finish a job very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He whipped through his routine paperwork before going home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家之前他迅速做完了日常的案头工作。

Sense.DEF: to try to make people feel strongly about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ll do anything to whip up a bit of interest in a book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们会想方设法激起人们对某本书的兴趣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to whip up the masses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煽动民众的企图

Sense.DEF: to quickly make something to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother was in the kitchen whipping up a batch of cakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲在厨房里赶做几个蛋糕。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of rope or leather with a handle, that you hit animals with to make them move or that you hit someone with to punish them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coachman cracked his whip and the carriage lurched forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马车夫甩了一记响鞭﹐马车猛然向前冲去。

Sense.DEF: a member of the US Congress or the British Parliament who is responsible for making sure that the members of their party attend and vote
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国国会或英国议会中负责督导本党议员出席会议及投票的〕党鞭﹔组织秘书﹔政党的纪律委员

Sense.DEF: a written order sent to members of the British Parliament telling them when and how to vote
Sense.TRAN: 〔送交英国议会议员的有关投票事宜的〕书面通知﹐鞭令

Sense.DEF: a sweet dish made from the white part of eggs and chocolate or fruit, beaten together to make a smooth light mixture
Sense.TRAN: 蛋奶甜点〔用蛋清加巧克力或水果搅打而成的糊状甜点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: pineapple whip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菠萝蛋奶甜点

Sense.DEF: to have power and control over someone

Crossrefto.REFLEX: give sb a fair crack of the whip

Sense.DEF: a neck injury caused when your head moves forward and back again suddenly and violently, especially in a car accident
Sense.TRAN: 鞭抽式损伤﹐颈部扭伤〔尤指车祸造成的颈部过度屈伸损伤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One officer suffered whiplash injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名警官颈部过度屈伸受伤。

Sense.DEF: cream that has been beaten until it is thick
a young person who is too confident and does not show enough respect to older people
