Sense.TRAN: 妄自尊大的年轻人﹐傲慢无礼的小子

Sense.DEF: a small thin racing dog like a greyhound
a punishment given to someone by whipping them
someone or something that is blamed for someone else’s mistakes
a type of cream that becomes thick when you beat it
long, thin, and easy to bend
Sense.EXAMPLE: new growths of whippy little sapling twigs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新长出的细长小嫩枝

Sense.DEF: if a group of people have a whip-round, they all give some money so that they can buy something together
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a whip-round to pay for a taxi to the railway station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们凑钱坐出租车去火车站。

Sense.DEF: another spelling of whirr
to turn or spin around very quickly, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: We watched the seagulls whirling and shrieking over the harbour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看海鸥在港口上空盘旋鸣叫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She whirled around and her look shook him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她猛地转身﹐脸上的表情让他震惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He whirled her round in his arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抱着她转了起来。

Sense.DEF: if your head is whirling, or if thoughts are whirling in your head, your mind is full of thoughts and ideas, and you feel very confused or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: His head was whirling with excitement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他激动得思绪万千。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The implications began to whirl around her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种可能的后果在她脑子里转来转去。

Sense.DEF: to try something that you are not sure you are going to like or be able to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you give golf a whirl?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不试试高尔夫球呢？

Sense.DEF: a lot of activity of a particular kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: the social whirl of New York publishing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约出版界纷繁的社交活动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The next two days passed in a whirl of activity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的两天在忙乱中度过。

Sense.DEF: to feel very excited or confused about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mind was in a whirl and he was worried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脑子乱作一团﹐忧心忡忡。

Sense.DEF: a spinning movement or the shape of something that is spinning

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A car rumbled over the bumpy dirt road, leaving behind a whirl of white dust.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆汽车隆隆地驶过坑坑洼洼的泥路﹐扬起一阵白尘。

Sense.DEF: a toy that spins
a powerful current of water that spins around and can pull things down into it
a large bathtub that makes hot water move in strong currents around your body
a very busy situation or a strong emotion, from which it is difficult to escape
Sense.TRAN: 感情的旋涡/纷繁的活动等
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who are caught in a whirlpool of grief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉浸在极度悲伤中的人们

Sense.DEF: an extremely strong wind that moves quickly with a circular movement, causing a lot of damage
a situation in which you experience a lot of different emotions, or a lot of different things happen, one after another
Sense.TRAN: 纷乱的情绪/纷繁的活动

Sense.DEF: a whirlwind situation or event happens very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 快速的﹔匆忙的﹔旋风式的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a whirlwind romance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旋风式恋爱

Sense.DEF: to make a fairly quiet regular sound, like the sound of a bird or insect moving its wings very fast
Sense.TRAN: 〔像鸟或昆虫快速拍动翅膀一样〕呼呼作响﹐啪啪作响
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helicopters whirred overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直升机在头顶上轰鸣。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the whirr of an electric motor

Sense.DEF: to mix liquid, eggs etc very quickly so that air is mixed in, using a fork or a whisk
to take someone or something quickly away from a place
Sense.TRAN: 将〔某人或某物〕急忙送离〔某地〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The waitress whisked our coffee cups away before we’d had a chance to finish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还没来得及喝完﹐女招待就收走了咖啡杯。

Sense.DEF: a small kitchen tool made of curved pieces of wire, used for mixing air into eggs, cream etc
a small stiff broom used especially for brushing clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指刷衣服用的〕掸帚﹐小笤帚

Sense.DEF: one of the long stiff hairs that grow near the mouth of a cat, mouse etc
one of the hairs that grow on a man’s face
to win or lose by a very small amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schmidt finished second, losing by a whisker in the final event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施密特在最后的项目中以微弱差距落败﹐屈居第二。

Sense.LEXUNIT: come within a whisker of (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: to almost succeed or fail at doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors say he came within a whisker of dying on the operating table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们说他险些死在手术台上。

Sense.DEF: a strong alcoholic drink made from grain, or a glass of this
Sense.TRAN: 威士忌酒﹔一杯威士忌酒

Sense.DEF: to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t have to whisper, no one can hear us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不必轻声轻语﹐没人听得到我们说话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you two whispering about over there?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们两人在那边嘀咕什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: James leaned over to whisper something to Michael.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯俯身跟迈克尔低声说了些什么。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve missed you,’ he whispered in her ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想你了。”他在她耳边低语道。

Sense.DEF: to say or suggest something privately or secretly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Staff were whispering that the company was about to go out of business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工私下在传﹐说公司要倒闭了。

Sense.DEF: a very quiet voice you make using your breath and no sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Where are we going?’ he asked in a whisper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们去哪里？”他低声问道。

Sense.DEF: a piece of news or information that has not been officially announced and may or may not be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first whisper of the redundancies came from the newspapers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最早的裁员传闻来自报纸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are whispers that the actor was seen checking into a hospital last week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有传言说上周有人看见这位演员住进了医院。

Sense.DEF: a low soft sound made by something such as the wind
a situation in which someone privately spreads criticism about another person in order to make people have a bad opinion of them
Sense.TRAN: 造谣活动〔指私下散布谣言攻击某人〕

Sense.DEF: a card game for four players in two pairs, in which each pair tries to win the most tricks
Sense.TRAN: 〔由四人组成两方对打的〕惠斯特纸牌戏

Sense.DEF: to make a high or musical sound by blowing air out through your lips
Sense.TRAN: 吹口哨﹔用口哨吹奏(曲调)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adam whistled happily on his way to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当在上班路上愉快地吹着口哨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard this song on the radio and I’ve been whistling it all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在收音机里听到这首歌﹐就吹了一整天这个调子的口哨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He whistled a tune as he strolled down the corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他口里吹着一首曲子沿着走廊缓步走去。

GramExa.GLOSS: whistle to get someone’s attention
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad whistled to us to come home for dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸吹口哨叫我们回家吃饭。

GramExa.GLOSS: whistle to let someone know that you think they are attractive
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Men are always whistling at Heidi on the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上总有男人对海迪吹口哨。

Sense.DEF: to make a high sound by blowing into a whistle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The referee whistled and the game began.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判哨声一响﹐比赛开始了。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly, making a whistling sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bullets and shells were whistling overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹和炮弹在头顶呼啸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They listened to the wind whistling through the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们听着风在树林中呼啸。

Sense.DEF: if a steam train or kettle whistles, it makes a high sound when air or steam is forced through a small hole
if a bird whistles, it makes a high musical sound
to be trying to show that you are brave when you are afraid, or that you know about something when you do not
Sense.TRAN: 故作镇定﹐虚张声势﹔不懂乱说
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does he know what he’s talking about or is he just whistling in the dark?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己在说什么吗？还是只是在吹牛皮？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that there is no chance of them getting what they have asked for
Sense.TRAN: 某人在空指望某物﹔某人一定得不到某物

Sense.DEF: a small object that produces a high whistling sound when you blow into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lifeguard blew his whistle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救生员吹响哨子。

Sense.DEF: a high sound made by blowing a whistle, by blowing air out through your lips, or when air or steam is forced through a small opening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Larsson scored just minutes before the final whistle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔森就在终场哨声响起前几分钟进球得分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sanders gave a low whistle when he saw the contents of the box.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德斯看到盒子里的东西时轻轻地吹了一声口哨。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment on a train or boat that makes a high noise when air is forced through it
the sound of something moving quickly through the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could hear the whistle of the jets as they passed overhead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到喷气机从头顶飞过时的呼啸声。

Sense.DEF: someone who tells people in authority or the public about dishonest or illegal practices at the place where they work
a trip during which someone, especially a politician, visits many different places in a short period of time
Sense.TRAN: 每站只停留不久的旅行[访问]﹐走马观花的旅行[访问]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a whistle-stop tour of Texas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次走马观花式的得克萨斯之行

Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sara had not changed a whit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉一点也没变。

Sense.DEF: having the colour of milk, salt, or snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: a white dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色连衣裙

GramExa.GLOSS: completely white
GramExa.EXAMPLE: snow white hair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪白的头发

Subsense.DEF: belonging to the race of people with pale skin
Subsense.EXAMPLE: young white males
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻的白种男性

Subsense.DEF: relating to white people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a white neighborhood
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白人居住区

Sense.DEF: looking pale, because of illness, strong emotion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you OK? You’re white as a sheet extremely pale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还好吧？你脸色煞白。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her voice shook, and her face was white with anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她气得声音颤抖﹐脸色发白。

Sense.DEF: white coffee has milk or cream in it
white wine is a pale yellow colour
a Christmas when there is snow
Sense.TRAN: 有雪的圣诞节﹐白色圣诞节

Sense.DEF: completely morally good
Sense.TRAN: 〔道德上〕清清白白的﹐纯洁无瑕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said that he had never claimed to be whiter than white.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他从未说过自己道德上完美无瑕。

Sense.DEF: the colour of milk, salt, and snow
someone who belongs to the race of people with pale skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mayor is very popular among whites.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长很受白人欢迎。

Sense.DEF: wine that is pale yellow in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice bottle of white
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶上好的白葡萄酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: California has some of the finest whites in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚出产一些世界上最好的白葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF: the white part of your eye
the part of an egg that surrounds the yolkyellow part and becomes white when cooked

Subsense.DEF: white clothes, sheets etc, which are separated from dark colours when they are washed
Subsense.TRAN: 〔洗涤时要跟深色衣物分开的〕白色织物

Subsense.DEF: white clothes that are worn for some sports, such as tennis
Subsense.TRAN: 〔做某些运动时穿的〕白色运动服〔如白色网球服〕

Sense.DEF: to cover something written on paper, especially a mistake, with a special white liquid so that it cannot be seen any more
very young fish of several types, used as food
Sense.TRAN: 银鱼〔供食用的几种小鱼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: deep-fried whitebait
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油炸银鱼

Sense.DEF: one of the cells in your blood which fights against infection
a large board with a white smooth surface that you can write on, used, for example, in rooms where classes are taught
relating to white people who are considered traditional and boring in their opinions and way of life
Sense.TRAN: 〔观念和生活方式〕典型白人中产阶级口味的〔指观点和生活方式守旧无趣的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a white-bread family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型的白人中产阶级家庭

Sense.DEF: the white cliffs made of chalk, which are the first part of England that you see when crossing the English Channel from France
Sense.TRAN: 多佛尔白崖〔白垩质峭壁﹐从法国出发穿越英吉利海峡后最先看到的英格兰景观〕

Sense.DEF: white-collar workers have jobs in offices, banks etc rather than jobs working in factories, building things etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在办公室﹑银行等工作的〕白领阶层的
Sense.EXAMPLE: white-collar jobs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白领工作

Sense.DEF: crimes involving white-collar workers, for example when someone secretly steals money from the organization they work for
a white blood cell
a hot star, near the end of its life, that is more solid but less bright than the Sun
something that is completely useless, although it may have cost a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the theatre first opened it was widely regarded as a white elephant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家剧院刚开张时﹐大家都认为它是个奢侈的摆设。

Sense.DEF: a sign that you accept that you have failed or been defeated

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite the loss, the team refuses to wave the white flag and give up on the season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管失利﹐该队还是不愿意就此认输﹐放弃对这个赛季的希望。

Sense.DEF: wheat flour from which the branouter layer and wheatgerminside seed have been removed
equipment used in the home, for example washing machines and refrigerators
Sense.TRAN: 大型家用电器﹐白色家电〔如洗衣机﹑冰箱等〕

Sense.DEF: the British government, especially the government departments rather than parliament or the Prime Minister
Sense.TRAN: 英国政府〔尤指政府部门而非议会或首相〕

Sense.DEF: the street in London where many of the government departments are
Sense.TRAN: 白厅〔伦敦街道名﹐为英国许多政府部门所在地〕

Sense.DEF: the very high temperature at which a metal turns white
Sense.TRAN: 白热〔金属变成白色的高温〕

Sense.DEF: waves in the sea or on a lake that are white at the top
white-hot metal is so hot that it shines white
involving a lot of activity or strong feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: white-hot passion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炽热的激情

Sense.DEF: the official home in Washington D.C. of the President of the US
Sense.TRAN: 白宫〔美国总统官邸﹐位于华盛顿特区〕

Sense.DEF: the President of the US and the people who advise him
Sense.TRAN: 白宫〔指美国总统及其顾问人员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: claims that the White House had received warnings of a possible terrorist attack before September 11th
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 称白宫在9月11日之前接到过可能会有恐怖袭击的警告的说法
Sense.EXAMPLE: White House officials refused to comment on the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫官员拒绝对此报道作出评论。

Sense.DEF: a person or company that puts money into a business in order to save it from being controlled by another company
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某公司提供资金使其免受另一公司控制的〕救星﹐救急的人[公司]

Sense.DEF: a white-knuckle ride at a fairground makes you feel excited and afraid at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔游乐园乘坐设施〕紧张刺激的

Sense.DEF: if you have white-knuckled hands, your hands are held tightly in a fist because you are anxious or afraid
Sense.TRAN: 〔手因紧张或害怕而〕攥紧拳头的

Sense.DEF: a lie that you tell someone in order to protect them or avoid hurting their feelings
Sense.TRAN: 善意的谎话﹔无伤大雅的谎言
非法酿造的烈酒﹔私酿酒

Sense.DEF: magic used for good purposes
Sense.TRAN: 善意的法术﹐白法术﹐白魔术

Sense.DEF: the pale-coloured meat from the breast, wings etc of a cooked chicken, turkey, or other bird
Sense.TRAN: 白肉〔指鸡﹑火鸡或其他禽类的肉〕

Sense.DEF: to become more white, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: This stuff is supposed to whiten your teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这东西应该是用来增白牙齿的。

Sense.DEF: a substance used to make something more white
noise coming from a radio or television which is turned on but not tuned to any programme
Sense.TRAN: 白噪声〔收音机或电视机没有调到有节目的频道时发出的噪声〕

Sense.DEF: weather conditions in which there is so much cloud or snow that you cannot see anything
Sense.TRAN: 乳白天空〔一种天气现象﹐因云重或雪大而无法看清物体〕

Sense.DEF: the white part of a telephone directory in the US with the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of people with telephones
Sense.TRAN: 白页〔美国电话簿的白色部分﹐刊登电话用户的姓名﹑地址和电话号码〕

Sense.DEF: an official report from the British government, explaining their ideas and plans concerning a particular subject before a new law is introduced
Sense.TRAN: 白皮书〔英国政府就某一问题在立法前所作的正式报告〕

Sense.DEF: a white powder made from the crushed inside of a peppercorn, which gives a slightly spicy taste to food
a thick white liquid made of flour, milk, and butter, which can be eaten with meat and vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 白汁﹐白汁调味汁〔用面粉﹑牛奶和黄油做成﹐可以拌着肉和蔬菜吃〕

Sense.DEF: a clear liquid made from petrol, used for making paint thinner, removing marks on clothes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于稀释油漆﹑除去衣服污渍等的〕石油溶剂油﹐稀释剂

Sense.DEF: someone who believes that white people are better than people of other races
Sense.TRAN: 白人至上主义者〔认为白人比其他人种优越〕

Sense.DEF: a white-tie social occasion is a very formal one at which the men wear white bow ties and tails
Sense.TRAN: 〔社交活动〕男士须打白领结并穿燕尾服的﹐非常正式的

Sense.DEF: an insulting expression used to talk about white people who are poor and uneducated
a man who drives a white van, especially when delivering goods in a city, in an aggressive and dangerous way
Sense.TRAN: 蛮横的送货司机﹔开白色小货车的男人

Sense.DEF: a car tyre that has a wide white band on its side
a report or examination of events that hides the true facts about something so that the person who is responsible will not be punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: The official report into the cause of the fire was labeled a whitewash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方的火灾原因报告被说成是对真相的隐瞒。

Sense.DEF: a white liquid mixture used especially for painting walls
an occasion in sport when one player or team defeats an opponent easily, without the opponent getting any points, goals etc
to cover something with whitewash
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls were whitewashed and covered with bullfighting posters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙壁粉刷过后贴满了斗牛比赛的海报。

Sense.DEF: to hide the true facts about a serious accident or illegal action
Sense.TRAN: 掩饰﹐粉饰〔严重意外或非法行为的真相〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investigators are accused of whitewashing the governor’s record.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查者被指责粉饰州长的政绩。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an opponent in sport easily, without the opponent getting any points, goals etc
a part of a river that looks white because the water is running very quickly over rocks
Sense.TRAN: 〔河水在岩石上激起的〕白浪﹔湍流
Sense.EXAMPLE: whitewater canoeing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激流皮划艇运动

Sense.DEF: a traditional wedding at which the bride wears a long white dress
Sense.TRAN: 白色婚礼〔新娘穿白色婚纱的传统婚礼〕

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a white person or white people in general
to which place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the place whither he went
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他所去的地方

Sense.DEF: used to ask what the future of something will be or how it will develop
Sense.TRAN: 怎样的前途﹐向何处去〔用于询问某事的未来或发展〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whither modern art?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代艺术何去何从？

Sense.DEF: a black and silver fish that lives in the sea and can be eaten
Sense.TRAN: 牙鳕〔一种可食用的海鱼〕

Sense.DEF: almost white in colour
the seventh Sunday after Easter, when Christians celebrate the holy spirit coming down from heaven
Sense.TRAN: 圣灵降临节〔复活节后第七个星期日〕

Sense.DEF: the period around Whitsun
to gradually make something smaller by taking parts away
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to whittle down the list of guests for the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要缩减聚会的客人名单。

Sense.DEF: to cut a piece of wood into a particular shape by cutting off small pieces with a knife
to gradually reduce the amount or effectiveness of something, especially something that you think should not be reduced

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The museum is worried that government funding will be whittled away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆担心政府拨款将会被削减。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress is whittling away at our freedom of speech.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会正在逐步剥夺我们的言论自由。

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: to move very quickly, often making a sound like something rushing through the air
Subsense.EXAMPLE: An ambulance whizzed past.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆救护车呼啸而过。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I saw a big piece of metal whizzing through the air.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见一大块金属嗖地在空中飞过。

Subsense.DEF: to do something very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s just whizz through it one more time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就快速地再来一遍吧。

Sense.DEF: to urinate
someone who is very fast, intelligent, or skilled in a particular activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a math whiz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学高手

Sense.DEF: to urinate
a young person who is very skilled or successful at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: financial whizzkids in the City
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦商业区的金融神童

Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about which person is involved, or what the name of a person is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who locked the door?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁锁的门？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who do you work for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为谁工作？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s that guy with your wife?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和你妻子在一起的那个人是谁？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They never found out who the murderer was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直未查出谁是凶犯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wondered who had sent the flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知道是谁送的花。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t know who to vote for.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不知道该投谁的票。

GramExa.PROPFORM: who on earth/in the world etc
GramExa.GLOSS: used for emphasis when you are surprised, angry etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who on earth would live in such a lonely place?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁会愿意住在这么偏僻的地方？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who the hell are you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你究竟是谁？

Sense.DEF: used after a noun to show which person or which people you are talking about
Sense.TRAN: …的人〔用于名词之后﹐指代提及的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know the people who live over the road?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认识住在马路对面的人吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the woman who was driving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在开车的那个女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the one who did most of the talking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分时间都是她在说话。

Sense.DEF: used, after a comma in writing, to add more information about a particular person or group of people that you have just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 〔在书面语中用于逗号之后﹐补充说明前面提及的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I discussed it with my brother, who is a lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和哥哥商量了此事﹐他是律师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alison Jones and her husband David, who live in Hartlepool, are celebrating their golden wedding anniversary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾莉森•琼斯和她的丈夫戴维住在哈特尔浦﹐他们正在庆祝金婚纪念日。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a question that shows you think something is true of everyone or of no one
Sense.TRAN: 谁又…〔用于引出问句﹐表示谁也不例外〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have the occasional argument. Who doesn’t everyone does?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们偶尔也会吵架﹐谁又不吵呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who wants to come second no one does?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁会想得第二呢？

Sense.LEXUNIT: who is sb to do sth?
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not have the right or the authority to say or do something
Sense.TRAN: 某人算老几？某人有什么资格做某事？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who is she to order me around?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是谁呀﹐竟然支使起我来？

Subsense.DEF: if you know who is who within a particular organization or group, you know what each person’s name is and what job they do or what position they have
Subsense.TRAN: 谁是谁〔指某组织或团体内人员的姓名﹑地位﹑职位等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m just getting to know who’s who in the department.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在熟悉部门里的每个人。

Subsense.DEF: a list of the important people within a particular organization or group – often used to emphasize that many important people are involved in something
Subsense.TRAN: 名人录〔常用于强调某事有许多重要人物参与〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The list of competitors reads like a who’s who of international tennis players.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参赛者名单读上去简直就是国际网坛名人录。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to become calmer or to do something more slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whoa! You’re driving too fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢点！你开得太快了。

Sense.DEF: said to show that you are surprised or that you think something is impressive
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀﹐哇〔表示惊讶或认为某事物令人赞叹〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whoa. That’s a lot of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇﹐那可是一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: used to tell a horse to stop
a book, film etc about a murder case, in which you do not find out who killed the person until the end
Sense.TRAN: 悬疑破案[侦探]故事[小说﹐电影]

Sense.DEF: used to say that it does not matter who does something, is in a particular place etc
Sense.TRAN: 不管是什么人﹔无论是谁
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll take whoever wants to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁想去我就带谁去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you’re done with the book, just give it to Kristin or Shelley or whoever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看完书以后﹐就给克里斯廷或谢利﹐或者随便谁都行。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a specific person or people, although you do not know who they are
Sense.TRAN: …的人〔用于指身份不确定的某个或某类人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whoever is responsible for this will be punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对此事负有责任的人将受到惩罚。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not know who someone is
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got a message from Tony Gower, whoever he is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个名叫托尼•高尔的人给你留言﹐不知这人是谁。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘who’ at the beginning of a question to show surprise or anger
Sense.TRAN: 到底是谁﹐究竟是谁〔置于疑问句句首﹐表示惊讶或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whoever would do a thing like that to an old woman?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 究竟是谁会对一位老太太做出那样的事？

Sense.DEF: all of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have your whole life ahead of you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有一辈子要过呢！
Sense.EXAMPLE: His whole attitude bugs me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的整个态度都让我讨厌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ate the whole cake in about ten minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约十分钟的时间﹐我们就把整个蛋糕都给吃完了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole thing everything about the situation just makes me sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切简直让我恶心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We just sat around and watched TV the whole time the only thing we did was watch television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直都只是坐着看看电视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t believe she’s telling us the whole story all the facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为她没有告诉我们全部实情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was months before the whole truth came out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个月以后才真相大白。

GramExa.GLOSS: all the people in a school, country etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole town came out for the parade.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全镇人都出来游行了。

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: very much
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling a whole lot better.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在觉得好多了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t cook a whole lot anymore.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不怎么做饭了。

Subsense.DEF: a large quantity or number
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to have a whole lot of problems if we don’t finish this by tomorrow.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要是到明天完不成的话问题就多了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can find a nice house in this neighborhood, and you don’t have to spend a whole lot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在这附近找到很好的房子﹐而且不用花费很多钱。

Subsense.DEF: all of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She gave me the whole lot for 20 pounds.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要了20英镑就把所有的东西都给了我。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that there are a lot of things of a similar type
Sense.TRAN: (某物的)范畴/系列/种类等〔用于强调同一类中包含很多东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are a whole range of sizes to choose from.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尺寸齐全﹐任你选择。

Sense.DEF: complete and not divided or broken into parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Place a whole onion inside the chicken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在鸡的肚子里放一整个洋葱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snake swallowing a mouse whole swallowing it without chewing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正把老鼠囫囵吞下的蛇

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the purpose for doing something, especially when you believe this is unclear or has been forgotten
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the whole point of the meeting was to decide which offer to accept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这次会议的主旨是决定接受哪一个提议。

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning ‘anywhere’ or ‘at all’, used to emphasize a statement
Sense.TRAN: 普天之下〔用于强调陈述句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have the best job in the whole wide world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拥有一份世上最好的工作。

Sense.DEF: to do something as completely or as well as you can, without any limits
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m gonna go whole hog and have a live band at the barbecue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算干脆在烧烤野餐上请一个现场乐队。

Sense.DEF: including everything that is typical of or possible in an activity, situation, set of things etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动﹑情况等〕具备一切可能的因素
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our new apartment complex has a tennis court, swimming pool, playground – the whole nine yards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的新公寓楼有网球场﹑游泳池﹑游乐场——应有尽有。

Sense.DEF: all of something, especially something that is not a physical object
Sense.TRAN: 整个事物〔尤用于非实物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole of the morning was wasted trying to find the documents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个上午都浪费在找文件上了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is generally true
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the whole, I thought the film was pretty good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐我认为这部电影很不错。

Sense.DEF: used to say that all the parts of something are being considered together
Sense.TRAN: 整个来看〔用于表示所有部分都已考虑到〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This project will be of great benefit to the region as a whole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目整体来看对该地区将大有好处。

Sense.DEF: something that consists of a number of parts, but is considered as a single unit
Sense.TRAN: 整体〔某物包含数部分﹐但被当成一个单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two halves make a whole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个一半构成一个整体。

Sense.DEF: food that is considered healthy because it only contains natural things rather than anything artificial
involving all your feelings, interest etc
Sense.TRAN: 全心全意的﹐全力以赴的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Montgomery’s new style of leadership met with Leslie’s whole-hearted approval.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒙哥马利的新领导方式得到了莱斯利的完全赞同。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I agree whole-heartedly with the mayor on this issue.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上我完全同意市长的看法。

Sense.DEF: wholemeal flour or bread uses all of the grain, including the outer layer
a musical note which continues for as long as two half notes
a number such as 0, 1, 2 etc that is not a fraction
the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
relating to the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
Sense.EXAMPLE: wholesale prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批发价

Sense.DEF: affecting almost everything or everyone, and often done without any concern for the results
Sense.TRAN: 大规模的〔通常指不考虑结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the capture and wholesale destruction of a city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座城市的沦陷和大规模毁坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: This company will not be successful until there are wholesale changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如不作出大规模变革﹐这家公司不会有所作为。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I can get it for you wholesale.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能以批发价为你买到它。

Sense.DEF: a person or company who sells goods wholesale
likely to make you healthy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: well-balanced wholesome meals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养均衡的健康餐

Sense.DEF: considered to have a good moral effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: good wholesome fun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康有益的娱乐

Sense.DEF: whole wheat flour or bread uses all of the grain, including the outer layer

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘who will’

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wholly satisfactory solution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全令人满意的解决办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report claimed that the disaster was wholly unavoidable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告称这场灾难完全无法避免。

Sense.DEF: the object form of ‘who’, used especially in formal speech or writing
Sense.TRAN: 谁﹐什么人〔who的宾格形式﹐尤用于正式讲话或书面语中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Desperate for money, she called her sister, whom she hadn’t spoken to in 20 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为急需用钱﹐她就给姐姐打了电话﹐她们已经20年没说过话了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She brought with her three friends, none of whom I had ever met before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她带来三个朋友﹐没有一个是我以前见过的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday spoken or written English, people usually use who rather than whom.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语口语或书面语中﹐人们一般用who﹐而不用whom
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Who did you send it to?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把它寄给谁了？
F2NBox.EXPL: Whom is usually used only in the phrases one of whom, none of whom, some of whom etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: whom一般只用于one of whom﹐none of whom﹐some of whom等短语中。

Sense.DEF: to shout loudly and happily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of people ran past them, whooping joyously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百人大声欢呼着从他们身边跑过。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy yourself very much, especially in a large group
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在一大群人中〕玩得很痛快﹔狂欢

Sense.DEF: used to show that you do not think something that someone has told you is as exciting or impressive as they think it is
Sense.TRAN: 好啊〔用于言不由衷地说好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He says he’ll give me a $20 raise.’ ‘Well, whoop-de-do.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他说他要给我涨20美元工资。”“噢﹐好呀。”

Sense.DEF: a shout of happiness

Subsense.DEF: to go out and enjoy yourself
to have sex

Sense.DEF: a rubber bag filled with air that makes a noise like a fart when you sit on it
Sense.TRAN: 放屁坐垫﹐屁袋〔坐上去会发出声响的橡胶坐垫〕

Sense.DEF: an infectious disease that especially affects children, and makes them cough and have difficulty breathing
said when someone has fallen, dropped something, or made a small mistake
Sense.TRAN: 哎哟〔某人跌倒﹑掉了东西或出小差错时用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whoops! I nearly dropped it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎哟！我差点把它掉了。

Sense.DEF: said when someone, usually a child, falls down
Sense.TRAN: 起来吧﹐没事啦！〔通常用于儿童摔倒时〕

Sense.DEF: to move very fast with a soft rushing sound

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a sudden bang and a whoosh of flame
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然一声巨响﹐火苗呼的一声蹿了起来

Sense.DEF: a lie
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tells one whopper after another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说起谎来一个接一个。

Sense.DEF: something unusually big
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fish Mike caught was a whopper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克捉到的这条鱼特别大。

Sense.DEF: very large
Sense.EXAMPLE: a whopping fee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔巨额费用

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘who are’

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a woman who has many sexual partners. Do not use this word.
a female prostitute
a place where men can pay to have sex
the activity of having sex with a prostitute
Sense.EXAMPLE: drinking, gambling, and whoring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒嫖赌

Sense.DEF: a pattern made of a line that curls out in circles that get bigger and bigger
a circular pattern of leaves or flowers on a stem

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘who is’ or 或 ‘who has’

Sense.DEF: used to ask which person or people a particular thing belongs to
Sense.TRAN: 谁的〔用于询问物品归属〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whose is this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是谁的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whose keys are those?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些钥匙是谁的？

Sense.DEF: used to show the relationship between a person or thing and something that belongs to that person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 他(们)的﹔她(们)的﹔它(们)的〔表示人与物之间的关系〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s the man whose house has burned down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就是那个男人的房子被烧毁了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Solar energy is an idea whose time has come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳能理念的时代来临了。

Sense.DEF: used to give additional information about a person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jurors, whose identities will be kept secret, will be paid $40 a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审员的身份是保密的﹐他们每天将得到40美元的报酬。

Sense.DEF: a book produced every year in the UK that contains an alphabetical list of famous and important people, such as politicians, writers, and entertainers, and provides information about their achievements, their families etc. If a list of people ‘reads like a Who’s Who’ of something, it means that it contains a lot of famous people.
Sense.TRAN: 《名人录》〔每年在英国出版的一本书﹐按字母排序收入名人和要人资料。说某个名单read like a Who’s Who的意思是指其中包含许多名人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The list of guests read like a Who’s Who of the pop industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张嘉宾名单读起来就像是流行音乐名人录。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘who have’

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone easily in a sport or fight
Sense.TRAN: 〔在体育运动或打斗中〕轻易战胜
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m gonna whup your ass defeat you very easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要把你打得落花流水。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone and hurt them very badly, especially using something such as a belt
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用皮带之类的物品〕狠打﹐重伤〔某人〕

Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about the reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why are you crying?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么哭？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do we have to take all these tests?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为什么一定要参加这些测验？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She wants to meet you.’ ‘Why?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她想认识你。”“为什么？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I won’t be able to come into work tomorrow.’ ‘Why not?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我明天不能来上班。”“为什么？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no idea why the television isn’t working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白电视机为什么坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon loves you – that’s why he wants to be with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙爱你——所以他想和你在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s angry with me and I don’t know why.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生我气了﹐我不知道为什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no reason why we shouldn’t be friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有理由不成为朋友。

GramExa.GLOSS: used for emphasis when you are surprised, angry etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why on earth didn’t you ask me to help?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到底为什么不叫我帮忙？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t want us to be seen together.’ ‘Why ever not?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不想被人看见我们在一起。”“到底为什么？”

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a question that shows you do not think it is necessary to do something
Sense.TRAN: 为什么…〔用于引出疑问句﹐表示认为没必要做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why worry? You can’t do anything about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么担心？这件事你无能为力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why waste time going to the bank when you can do it all over the Internet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全都可以在网上办的事﹐为什么还要浪费时间去银行？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree with a suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 为什么不呢？〔用于表示赞同某一建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We could invite John and Barbara.’ ‘Yes, why not?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们可以邀请约翰和芭芭拉。”“是呀﹐干吗不呢？”

Subsense.DEF: used to make a suggestion
Subsense.TRAN: 某人为什么不做某事？〔用于提出建议〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you bring over a video for us to watch?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你干吗不带一盘录像带来给我们看看？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why not relax and enjoy the atmosphere?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不放松放松﹐享受一下这气氛？

Subsense.DEF: used to say angrily that someone should do something
Subsense.TRAN: 为什么不…？〔用于气愤地表示某人应该做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you mind your own business?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不去管好你自己的事情？

Sense.DEF: used to ask why a particular person has been chosen or is suffering
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why me? Why can’t someone else drive you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么是我？为什么别人不能开车送你？

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very sorry or angry about something
Sense.TRAN: 为什么要…？〔表示对某事非常后悔或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why oh why did I say those horrible things?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么呀﹐为什么我要说那些难听的话？

Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised or have suddenly realized something
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀﹐嗨〔表示惊讶或突然意识到某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why, look who’s here!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐看看这是谁！
Sense.EXAMPLE: And I thought to myself, why, I can do that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就对自己说﹐嗨﹐我能行的。

Sense.DEF: the reasons or explanations for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whys and the wherefores of these procedures need to be explained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要对这些手续的缘由作出解释。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= Women’s Institute 妇女协会

Sense.DEF: the piece of thread in a candle, that burns when you light it
a long piece of material in an oil lamp, that sucks up oil so that the lamp can burn
to annoy someone
behaving in a way that is morally wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wicked stepmother in ‘Hansel and Gretel’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《糖果屋》中那个恶毒的继母

Sense.DEF: behaving badly in a way that is amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carl had a wicked grin on his face as he crept up behind Ellen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔一脸坏笑地悄悄走到埃伦后面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tara hasn’t lost her wicked sense of humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔拉那促狭的幽默感依然未减。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a wicked bike!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这自行车真棒！

Sense.DEF: thin dry branches or reeds that are woven together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wicker basket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柳条筐

Sense.DEF: objects made from wicker
one of two sets of three wooden sticks that are stuck in the ground in a game of cricket, which the bowler tries to hit with the ball
a small door or gate that is part of a larger one
a player who stands behind the wicket in cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球运动中的〕三柱门守门员

Subsense.DEF: measuring a large distance from one side to the other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a wide tree-lined road
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽阔的林荫道
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a hat with a wide brim
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽边帽子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As he ran toward me, his face broke into a wide grin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑逐颜开地向我跑来。

Subsense.DEF: measuring a particular distance from one side to the other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How wide is the door?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门多宽？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The boat was nearly as wide as the canal.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那船差不多和水道一样宽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The river is more than fifty yards wide.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河宽五十多码。

Sense.DEF: including or involving a large variety of different people, things, or situations
Sense.TRAN: 〔包括或涉及的人﹑物或情况〕广泛的﹔范围大的﹔广阔的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man with a wide experience of foreign affairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交事务经验丰富的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our aim is to bring classical music to a wider audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目的是把古典音乐带给更多的听众。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This year’s festival includes a wide range of entertainers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的艺术节有各类艺人参加。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: holidays to a wide choice of destinations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多处目的地可供选择的度假

Sense.DEF: happening among many people or in many places
Sense.TRAN: 众多的﹔广泛的﹔范围大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The radio and newspapers gave the trial wide coverage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广播和报纸广泛报道了这场庭审。

Sense.DEF: a large and noticeable difference
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的差异/差别/差距等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ever-wider gap between the richest and poorest countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最富国与最穷国之间日益加大的差距

Sense.DEF: the more general features of a situation, rather than the specific details
Sense.TRAN: 更加广泛的背景/问题/情况等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope that by the end of the course students will be able to see their subject in a wider context.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望﹐在课程结束的时候﹐学生能够在一个更为广阔的背景下来理解自己的学科。

Sense.DEF: wide eyes are fully open, especially when someone is very surprised, excited, or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛〕睁大的〔尤指某人非常吃惊﹑兴奋或恐惧时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes grew wide in anticipation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满怀期待地睁大了眼睛。

Sense.DEF: to avoid someone or something
not hitting something you were aiming at
Sense.TRAN: 未击中目标的﹐偏离目标的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His shot was just wide of the goal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的射门踢飞了。

Sense.DEF: places outside the small familiar place where you live
Sense.TRAN: 〔在熟识的小天地以外的〕广阔世界﹐外面的世界
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soon you’ll leave school and go out into the big wide world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快你就要离开学校﹐踏入广阔的世界。

Sense.DEF: affecting all the people in a nation, city etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country-wide revolt against the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国性的反政府起义

Sense.DEF: completely open, awake, or apart
Sense.TRAN: 大开着的/完全醒着的/分得很开的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone left the back door wide open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把后门大开着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At 2 a.m. I was still wide awake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨两点我仍然毫无睡意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandy stood with his back to the fire, legs wide apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑迪背对火站着﹐两腿叉得很开。

Sense.DEF: opening or spreading as much as possible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spiro spread his arms wide in a welcoming gesture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯皮罗张开双臂﹐做出欢迎的姿势。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Leonora’s eyes opened wide in horror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉奥诺拉惊恐地睁大双眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windows had been opened wide and she could feel a slight breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户大开﹐她感觉到一丝微风。

Sense.DEF: if a competition, election etc is wide open, it is possible for anyone to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 〔竞赛﹑选举等〕输赢不定的﹐胜负难料的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most experts agree that the election is wide open at this point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数专家都认为现阶段选举结果尚难预料。

Sense.DEF: not hitting something you were aiming at, and missing it by a large distance
Sense.TRAN: 远未击中目标﹐大大偏离目标
Sense.EXAMPLE: His throw to first base went wide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他投向一垒的球偏出很远。

Subsense.DEF: not correct about something, by a large amount
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The opinion polls were hopelessly wide of the mark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意调查的结果与实际情况相去甚远。

Subsense.DEF: not hitting something you were aiming at, and missing it by a large distance
Subsense.TRAN: 远没有击中目标﹐大大偏离目标
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One of the bombs fell wide of the mark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一颗炸弹落在离目标很远的地方。

Sense.DEF: a camera lens that lets you take photographs with a wider view than normal
a man who makes money in dishonest ways and uses it to buy expensive clothes, cars etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 流氓﹐骗子〔指靠歪门邪道赚钱来购买昂贵衣服﹑汽车等的男人﹔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: with your eyes wide open, especially because you are surprised or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因惊讶或恐惧而〕睁大眼睛的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood there wide-eyed at the appalling scene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在那里睁大双眼看着那令人震惊的场面。

Sense.DEF: too willing to believe, accept, or admire things because you do not have much experience of life
in a lot of different places or by a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organic food is now widely available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在有机食品很多地方都可买到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an author who had travelled widely in East Asia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾游历东亚各地的一位作家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a widely used method
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广泛使用的方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: These laws were widely regarded as too strict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍认为这些法令太苛刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This view was not widely held.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种观点并不普遍。

Sense.DEF: to a large degree – used when talking about differences
Sense.EXAMPLE: The quality of the applicants varies widely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请人的素质差异很大。

Subsense.DEF: read by a lot of people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a widely read magazine
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本读者众多的杂志

Subsense.DEF: having read many different books

Sense.DEF: to become wider, or to make something wider
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re widening the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在拓宽马路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river widens and splits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河有变宽的河段﹐也有分流的河段。

Sense.DEF: to become larger in degree or range, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gap between income and expenditure has widened to 11%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收支差额扩大到了11%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are trying to widen the discussion to include environmental issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正试图扩大讨论范围﹐将环境问题纳入其中。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes widen, they open more, especially because you are surprised or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因惊讶或恐惧而眼睛〕睁大

Sense.DEF: including a wide variety of subjects, things, or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wide-ranging discussion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内容广泛的讨论
Sense.EXAMPLE: wide-ranging proposals to improve the rail network
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善铁路网的各种提议

Sense.DEF: a widescreen television is much wider than it is high
made in a form that is intended to be seen on a screen much wider than it is high
Sense.EXAMPLE: Widescreen movies are often shown on TV with the sides cut short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽银幕电影在电视上播放时两边常常被切掉。

Sense.DEF: in a form that is intended to be seen on a wide screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The series was shot in widescreen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部连续剧是宽屏拍摄的。

Sense.DEF: existing or happening in many places or situations, or among many people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the widespread use of chemicals in agriculture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学品在农业中的广泛使用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was widespread support for the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍支持这场战争。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The storm caused widespread damage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨造成了大范围的破坏。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of equipment that you do not know the name for
used to refer to an imaginary product that a company might produce
Sense.EXAMPLE: Company A produces 6,000 widgets a month at a unit price of $0.33.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: A公司每月生产6,000件产品﹐每件单价0.33美元。

Sense.DEF: a woman whose husband has died and who has not married again
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elderly widow who was attacked and robbed last month
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月遭到行凶抢劫的一位寡居老妇
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wealthy widow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富孀

Sense.DEF: a woman whose husband spends all his free time watching football, playing golf etc – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 足球/高尔夫球等寡妇〔指因丈夫沉溺于观看足球赛﹑打高尔夫球等而被冷落的妻子﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: if someone is widowed, their husband or wife dies
Sense.TRAN: 守寡﹐寡居﹔成为鳏夫﹐鳏居
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was widowed at the age of 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她25岁时成了寡妇。

Sense.DEF: a man whose wife has died and who has not married again
the state of being a widow or widower
the distance from one side of something to the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the width of the desk?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张书桌的宽度是多少？

GramExa.PROPFORM: three feet/two metres etc in width
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s about six metres in width.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它大约六米宽。

Sense.DEF: to exist from one side of something to the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a covered terrace extending the full width of the house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和房子同宽的有顶露台

Sense.DEF: the distance from one side of a swimming pool to the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: I swam ten widths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在游泳池横向游了五个来回。

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth that has been measured and cut

GramExa.EXAMPLE: four widths of curtain material
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四幅窗帘布料

Sense.DEF: across, between the two long sides of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut each rectangular cake in half widthways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把每块长方形的蛋糕横切成两半。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of power or influence, and to use it
Sense.TRAN: 拥有并使用权力/影响/权威等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Church wields immense power in Ireland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在爱尔兰﹐教会操纵着大权。

Sense.DEF: to hold a weapon or tool that you are going to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had her car windows smashed by a gang wielding baseball bats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的车窗被一伙挥舞棒球棒的人砸碎了。

Sense.DEF: a type of sausage
someone who is silly or stupid
a penis – used by children
the woman that a man is married to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you met my wife?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你见过我的妻子吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a refuge for battered wives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受虐待妻子庇护所
Sense.EXAMPLE: his second wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第二任妻子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He threatened to kill his ex-wife’s boyfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他威胁要杀死前妻的男朋友。

Sense.DEF: wifely qualities or actions are supposed to be typical of a good wife – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 贤惠的﹐具备好妻子美德的〔有时为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: an activity in which married couples have sex with each other’s partners, for example at a party
a way of connecting computers or other electronic machines to a network by using radio signals rather than wires
artificial hair that you wear on your head
to become very anxious, upset, or afraid, or to make someone very anxious, upset, or afraid
to move with small movements from side to side or up and down, or to make something move like this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry wiggled his toes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利扭动他的脚趾。

Sense.DEF: if someone leaves themselves some wiggle room, they do or say something in a way that allows them to change it later
a wiggly line is one that has small curves in it
a structure with a round or pointed roof used as a home by some Native American tribes in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去北美印第安人居住的圆顶或尖顶的〕棚屋

Sense.DEF: a website with information that users can change or add things to
Sense.TRAN: 维基〔用户可对信息作修改或添加的网站〕

Sense.DEF: living in a natural state, not changed or controlled by people
Sense.TRAN: 野生的﹔未经栽培的﹔未经驯化的
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野生动物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a field full of wild flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遍地野花的田野
Sense.EXAMPLE: animals both wild and domesticated
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野生动物和家养动物

Sense.DEF: not used by people for farming, building etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nepal is stunning, with its wild, untamed landscape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼泊尔有着自然原始的风景﹐美不胜收。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wild and lonely Scottish hills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荒僻原始的苏格兰山丘

Sense.DEF: feeling or expressing strong uncontrolled emotions, especially anger, happiness, or excitement
Sense.TRAN: 感情强烈的〔尤指生气﹑高兴或激动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: wild laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂笑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was wild with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: behaving in an uncontrolled, sometimes violent way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was completely wild in high school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上中学时很野。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donny could be wild and crazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多尼有时候很疯狂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a wild look about her she seemed a little crazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一副疯狂的样子。

Subsense.DEF: to behave in a very excited uncontrolled way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The crowd went wild as soon as the singer stepped onto the stage.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歌手一走上舞台﹐人群就疯狂起来。

Subsense.DEF: to get very angry
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When Tony heard how much it was going to cost, he just went wild.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼一听这要花多少钱﹐顿时大怒。

Sense.DEF: very enjoyable and exciting
Sense.TRAN: 十分有趣的﹔令人激动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How was the party?’ ‘It was wild!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “聚会怎么样？”“棒极了！”

Sense.DEF: to like something or someone very much
Sense.TRAN: 对某物/某人极喜爱﹔对某物/某人很着迷
Sense.EXAMPLE: My son’s wild about football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我儿子对足球很着迷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not that wild about rap music, to be honest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐我对说唱乐不是很感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: done or said without much thought or care, or without knowing all the facts
Sense.TRAN: 〔做事或说话〕轻率的﹐缺乏根据的
Sense.EXAMPLE: wild accusations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诬告
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just making a wild guess here, so correct me if I’m wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是在瞎猜﹐要是错了请指正。

Sense.DEF: beyond anything that someone imagined or hoped for
Sense.EXAMPLE: an invention that was to change our lives beyond our wildest dreams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将给我们的生活带来超乎想象的变化的一项发明

Sense.DEF: used to say that you did not expect or imagine that something would happen, especially after it has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never in my wildest dreams did I expect to win first place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做梦都没有想到我能得第一名。

Sense.DEF: violent and strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wild and angry sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波涛汹涌的大海

Sense.DEF: a card that is wild can be used to represent any other card in a game
used to say that someone is determined not to go somewhere, do something etc
Sense.TRAN: 任何事情都不能…〔表示某人坚决不去某地﹑不做某事等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wild horses would not have dragged him into a vegetarian restaurant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是叫他去素菜馆﹐八匹马都拉不动他。

Subsense.DEF: if children or animals run wild, they behave in an uncontrolled way because there is no one to control them
Subsense.TRAN: 〔儿童或动物〕无法无天﹐无人管束

Subsense.DEF: if something runs wild, it is not controlled and operates in an extremely free way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Be creative – allow your imagination to run wild.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发挥你的创造力——让你的想象力自由飞翔。

Subsense.DEF: if plants run wild, they grow a lot in an uncontrolled way

Sense.DEF: if plants grow wild somewhere, they have not been planted by people
in natural and free conditions, not kept or controlled by people
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are very few pandas living in the wild now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在只有极少数的大熊猫处于野生状态。

Sense.DEF: areas where there are no towns and not many people live
Sense.TRAN: 非洲/阿拉斯加州等的偏僻地区

Sense.DEF: a large wild pig with long hair
a playing card that can represent any other card
someone whose behaviour or effect on a situation is difficult to guess
a player who is a wild card or who is given a wild card is chosen for a competition although they have not previously done well enough to take part
a symbol that can represent any letter in some computer instructions
a type of cat that looks similar to a pet cat and lives in mountains, forests etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活在山区﹑森林等中的〕野猫

Sense.DEF: to look for oil in a place where nobody has found any yet
an occasion when workers suddenly stop working in order to protest about something, usually without the support of a trade union
Sense.TRAN: 野猫式罢工〔指通常未经工会批准的突然罢工〕

Sense.DEF: a large Southern African animal with a tail and curved horns
a large area of land that has never been developed or farmed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Alaskan wilderness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿拉斯加荒原

Sense.DEF: a place that seems no longer used or cared for by anyone
Sense.TRAN: 荒芜的地方﹔无人照管的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden was a wilderness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座花园一片荒芜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The south side of the city had become a lawless wilderness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市的南部已成为法外之地。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in the wilderness does not have power or is not involved in something in an important way at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 在野/从在野的地位/不再处于在野地位
Sense.EXAMPLE: the re-emergence of Richard Nixon from the political wilderness in 1968
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德•尼克松淡出政坛后于1968年的复出

Sense.DEF: an area of public land in the US where no buildings or roads are allowed to be built
Sense.TRAN: 〔在美国不允许建房﹑筑路的〕公共莽原区

Sense.DEF: a fire that moves quickly and cannot be controlled
birds, especially ones that live near water such as ducks
a situation where you are looking for something that does not exist or that you are very unlikely to find, so that you waste a lot of time
Sense.TRAN: 徒劳之举﹐白费气力的追逐
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks like they’ve sent us on a wild goose chase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来他们是给了我们一个劳而无功的差事。

Sense.DEF: animals and plants growing in natural conditions
Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to protect the area’s wildlife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护该地区野生生物的措施
Sense.EXAMPLE: the destruction of wildlife habitats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野生动植物生存环境的破坏

Sense.DEF: in a very uncontrolled or excited way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience cheered wildly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众热烈欢呼。

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band is wildly popular in Cuba.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队在古巴深受欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: wildly inaccurate statements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离谱的说法

Sense.DEF: the seed of a type of grass that grows in parts of North America and China
Sense.TRAN: 〔产于北美部分地区和中国的〕菰米

Sense.DEF: the western US, where many European settlers moved during the 19th century to establish new farms and new cities. In films it is often shown as a place where cowboys and indiansNative Americans fight each other, and where cowboys use guns rather than the law to settle arguments. A situation where there are no laws or controls is sometimes described as being ‘like the Wild West’.
Sense.TRAN: 西大荒﹐荒野西部〔指美国西部﹐19世纪许多欧洲移民移居到那里建立新农场和新城镇。人们有时用like the Wild West形容没有法制或约束的情形〕

Sense.DEF: clever talk or tricks used to persuade someone to do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was impossible to resist her feminine wiles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那些女人的小花招让人无法抗拒。

Sense.DEF: continuing to do what you want, even after you have been told to stop – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wilful child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任性的孩子

Sense.DEF: deliberate damage etc, when you know that what you are doing is wrong
Sense.TRAN: 故意损害/违抗/夸大其词等

Sense.DEF: used to make future tenses
Sense.TRAN: 将﹐会﹐要〔用于构成将来时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A meeting will be held next Tuesday at 3 p.m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期二下午3点将召开一个会议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time will she arrive?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她什么时候到达？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope they won’t be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他们不会迟到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe by then you will have changed your mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许到那时你已经改变主意了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that someone is willing or ready to do something
Sense.TRAN: 愿﹐要〔用于表示愿意或准备好做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Weir will see you now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦尔医生现在来给你看病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby won’t eat anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝什么都不肯吃。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 请…好吗〔用于请求某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you phone me later?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你过一会再给我打电话好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shut the door, will you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把门关上﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say what always happens in a particular situation or what is generally true
Sense.TRAN: 总是﹐惯于〔表示某事经常发生或总是如此〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil will float on water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油总是浮于水面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Accidents will happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意外总是难免的。

Sense.DEF: used like ‘can’ to show what is possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: This car will hold five people comfortably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车能舒舒服服地坐下五个人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think something is true
Sense.TRAN: 可能﹐大概〔表示认为某事可能是真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That will be Tim coming home now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会儿可能是蒂姆回家了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As you will have noticed, there are some gaps in the data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许已经注意到了﹐数据有些缺漏。

Sense.DEF: used to give an order or to state a rule
Sense.TRAN: 必须〔用于下命令或说明规定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you be quiet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静点好不好！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will do as I say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要按我说的做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every employee will carry an identity card at all times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个员工都必须一直携带身份卡。

Sense.DEF: used to offer something to someone or to invite them to do something
Sense.TRAN: 要不要〔用于提供某物给某人或邀请某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you have some more tea?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要不要再喝些茶？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Won’t you have a seat?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要不要坐下？

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone’s habits, especially when you think they are annoying
Sense.TRAN: 老是〔用于描述某人的习惯﹐尤指讨厌的习惯〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trish will keep asking damn silly questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里斯老是不停地问一些十分愚蠢的问题。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are reporting what someone said, thought etc, will usually changes to would.
F2NBox.TRAN: 转述某人的话、想法等时﹐will通常要改为would
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: My brother said he would help me.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我哥哥说他会帮助我。
F2NBox.EXPL: If the event is still in the future, will is sometimes used, especially after a present perfect tense.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如事件尚未发生﹐有时就用will﹐尤其是在现在完成时之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The Minister has said that he will publish the report soon.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位大臣说他会很快公布这份报告。

Sense.DEF: determination to do something that you have decided to do, even if this is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children sometimes have strong wills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子有时有很强的意志力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even though she was in terrible pain, Mary never lost the will to live.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然承受着巨大的痛苦﹐玛丽从未丧失活下去的意志。

Sense.DEF: a legal document that says who you want your money and property to be given to after you die
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you made a will yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你立遗嘱了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My grandfather left me some money in his will.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 祖父在他的遗嘱中给我留了些钱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the senator’s last will and testament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员的临终遗嘱

Sense.DEF: what someone wants to happen in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused her of trying to impose her will on others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责她想把自己的意志强加于人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Collier claims the police forced him to sign a confession against his will.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科利尔声称警方强迫他违心地在认罪书上签字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the will of the people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人民的意愿

Sense.EXAMPLE: obedience to God’s will
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服从上帝的旨意

Sense.LEXUNIT: with the best will in the world
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not possible, even if you very much want to do it
Sense.TRAN: 尽管真心愿意〔用于表示某事不可能〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: With the best will in the world, I don’t see what more I can do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我非常想再做点什么﹐但我不知道还能做什么。

Sense.LEXUNIT: where there’s a will there’s a way
Sense.DEF: used to say that if you really want to do something, you will find a way to succeed
whenever you want and in whatever way you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can’t just fire people at will, can he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不能就那么随心所欲开除人﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: in an eager and determined way
Sense.TRAN: 起劲地﹔热情地﹔诚心诚意地

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had a very strong will and a clear sense of purpose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她意志坚定﹐目的明确。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an extremely strong will
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her unassuming manner concealed an iron will.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谦逊的态度背后藏着钢铁般的意志。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: determination on the part of governments and politicians
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a lack of political will to do anything about global warming.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府缺乏对全球变暖有所作为的政治意愿。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had achieved success by sheer strength of will.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她纯粹是凭着坚强的意志取得了成功。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a determined effort to do something you do not want to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: With a great effort of will, she resisted the temptation to look at the letter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以极大的意志力才抵御住想看那封信的诱惑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when two determined people oppose each other
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Even the smallest decision could become an exhausting battle of wills.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是最小的决定﹐也会成为一场令人筋疲力尽的意志较量。

Collocate.COLLOC: have the will to do sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be determined enough to do it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you have the will to win?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有获胜的决心吗？

Collocate.COLLOC: lack the will to do sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He lacked the will to resist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他缺乏抵制的意志力。

Collocate.COLLOC: lose the will to do sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country’s troops had lost the will to fight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的军队失去了战斗意志。

Sense.DEF: to try to make something happen by thinking about it very hard
Sense.TRAN: 设法用意志力驱使〔某事发生〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was willing herself not to cry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭力不让自己哭出来。

Sense.DEF: to officially give something that you own to someone else after you die
Sense.TRAN: 立遗嘱把〔财产〕遗赠〔某人〕

Sense.DEF: to want something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The King wills it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王意欲之。

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of wilful
a nervous or frightened feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this talk about ghosts is giving me the willies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这番关于鬼魂的话听得我毛骨悚然。

Sense.DEF: another spelling of willy
prepared to do something, or having no reason to not want to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much are they willing to pay?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们愿意付多少钱？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I told them I was perfectly willing to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉他们﹐我非常愿意帮忙。

Sense.DEF: someone who is eager to help etc and does not have to be persuaded
Sense.TRAN: 热心的帮手/志愿者/积极肯干的搭档等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I soon had an army of willing helpers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快就拥有了一批热心的帮手。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Sixty percent of voters said they would willingly pay higher taxes for better health care.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 60%的选民表示﹐为获得更好的医疗保健服务﹐他们乐意缴纳更高的税款。

Sense.DEF: someone that you can never completely depend on, or something that you can never achieve
Sense.TRAN: 捉摸不定的人﹔实现不了的事

Sense.DEF: a blue moving light caused by natural gases, that can be seen over wet ground at night
a type of tree that has long thin branches and grows near water, or the wood from this tree
tall, thin, and graceful
Sense.TRAN: 修长苗条的﹔婀娜多姿的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was pale and willowy, with violet eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她肤色白皙﹐身材修长﹐有一双紫罗蓝色的眼睛。

Sense.DEF: the ability to control your mind and body in order to achieve something that you want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took all his willpower to remain calm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他竭尽全力才保持了镇定。

Sense.DEF: a penis
if something happens willy-nilly, it happens whether you want it to or not
Sense.TRAN: 不管愿不愿意﹔无论想不想要
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found himself drawn, willy-nilly, into the argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现﹐不管愿意与否﹐他已经卷入了这场争论。

Sense.DEF: without planning, organization, or control
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies were accused of raising prices willy-nilly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司被指责乱涨价。

Sense.DEF: if a plant wilts, it bends over because it is too dry or old

PIC.HEADING: WILT 枯萎；凋谢
PIC.PICCONTENT: The flowers have wilted.花凋谢了。；The plant has wilted.这盆植物枯萎了。

Sense.DEF: to feel weak or tired, especially because you are too hot
clever at getting what you want, especially by tricking people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wily politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狡猾的政客

Sense.DEF: a tennis competition played every year in Wimbledon, south London. At Wimbledon, the games are played on grass and the players must wear all white. Wimbledon is also thought of as a typically English social occasion, and it is traditional to eat strawberries (strawberry) and cream there.
Sense.TRAN: 温布尔登网球锦标赛〔每年在伦敦南部温布尔登举行的一项草地网球赛事﹐也被认为是一项典型的英国式社交活动〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has a weak character and is afraid to do something difficult or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a wimp!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别那么窝囊！

Sense.DEF: a man who is thin and physically weak
to not do something that you intended to do, because you do not feel brave enough, strong enough etc
Sense.TRAN: 退缩﹐畏缩而不敢做〔想做的事〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth that a nun wears over her head
to be the best or most successful in a competition, game, election etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在竞赛﹑游戏﹑选举等中〕获胜﹐赢

GramExa.PROPFORM: win a race/a game/an election etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who do you think will win the next election?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为谁会在下一次竞选中获胜？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He won the Tour de France last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年他在环法自行车大赛中获胜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the young pilots who won the Battle of Britain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打赢不列颠之战的年轻飞行员们

Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s winning who is most successful at this point in the game?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在谁领先？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I never win at cards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打牌从来不赢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We won by just one point.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只赢了一分。

Sense.DEF: to get something as a prize for winning in a competition or game
Sense.EXAMPLE: How does it feel to have won the gold medal?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得金牌的感觉如何？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She won £160 on the lottery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她买彩票中了160英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the man who helped win the Cup for Arsenal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助阿森纳队赢得足总杯赛的男人

Sense.DEF: to get something that you want because of your efforts or abilities
Sense.TRAN: 〔经努力或凭能力〕获得﹐取得〔某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposal has won the approval of the city council.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项提议获得了市政会的批准。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kramer has certainly won the respect of his peers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克雷默无疑赢得了同侪的尊敬。

GramExa.GLOSS: make them love you or feel sympathy for you

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has won a contract to build a new power plant outside Houston.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司得到了在休斯敦城外建造一座新发电厂的合同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Davis hopes to win financial backing from a London investment firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯希望获得伦敦一家投资公司的资助。

Sense.DEF: if something, usually something that you do, wins you something, you win it or get it because of that thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That performance won Hanks an Oscar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉克斯凭借在那部影片中的表演赢得了一项奥斯卡奖。

Sense.EXAMPLE: That kind of behaviour won’t win you any friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样的行为不会让你交到任何朋友。

Sense.DEF: used to agree to what someone wants after you have tried to persuade them to do something else
Sense.TRAN: 算你赢〔用于因说服不了对方而同意对方的要求时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, you win – we’ll go to the movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐算你赢——我们看电影去。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is no satisfactory way of dealing with a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 没法子〔用于表示没有令人满意的方法处理某情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t win, can you? You either work late and upset your family, or go home early and risk your job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有办法﹐是吧？你要么工作到很晚﹐让家里人不高兴﹔要么冒着失业的危险早早回家去。

Variant.LEXVAR: you win some, you lose some

Sense.DEF: used to show sympathy when someone has had a disappointing experience
Sense.TRAN: 你不可能事事都成功﹐有得必有失〔用于安慰别人〕

Sense.DEF: no matter whether you win or lose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Win or lose, I love competitive sports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论胜负﹐我就是喜欢竞技性的体育运动。

Sense.DEF: to finally be successful in a discussion or argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔在讨论或争论中〕最终获得胜利
Sense.EXAMPLE: Common sense won the day, and the plans were dropped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常理占了上风﹐计划取消了。

Exponent.DEF: to be the best or most successful in a competition, game, election etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Italy won the World Cup in 2006.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利队获2006年世界杯冠军。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has a realistic chance of winning the Championship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他夺冠是有实际可能性的。

Exponent.DEF: to win a race or competition
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our team came first.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们队获第一名。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jo was first in the race and I was second.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔在比赛中得了第一名﹐我得了第二名。

Exponent.DEF: to win a race, competition, or election
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Democratic candidate finished in first place.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党候选人排名第一。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t believe it when the horse I chose came in first.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我选中的那匹马竟然得了第一﹐我都不敢相信是真的。

Exponent.DEF: to win a great victory, especially after a long and difficult battle, game etc
Exponent.TRAN: 获胜,成功〔尤指经过漫长﹑艰难的战斗﹑比赛等取得大胜〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Britain triumphed over its enemies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国战胜了敌人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the end, the Yankees triumphed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后,扬基队获胜。

Exponent.DEF: to win a game, competition, argument etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: United came out on top after a thrilling game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过一场激动人心的比赛,联队赢得了胜利。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They did a survey and the Swedish car-maker came out on top.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们做了个调查,瑞典汽车制造商名列前茅。

Exponent.DEF: to be winning a game, race, election etc at the moment
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The High School team are leading with sixty points.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高中队领先60分。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: With only two minutes left to play, we were still in the lead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛只剩两分钟,我们仍然领先。

Exponent.DEF: to be doing better than someone else in a game, competition, or election
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s still fifty seconds ahead of his nearest rival.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍领先于他最接近的对手50秒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A week before the election, they were still ahead in the polls.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选一周前他们仍在民意测验中领先。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting back something or someone that you had before
Sense.TRAN: 重新获得〔某物或某人〕﹐把…赢回来
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can I win back her trust?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎样才能重新赢得她的信任？

Sense.DEF: to finally succeed or defeat other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Often presentation wins out over content is treated as more important than content.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 形式往往重于内容。

Sense.DEF: to get someone’s support or friendship by persuading them or being nice to them
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过劝说或示好以〕获得〔某人的支持或友谊〕﹐把〔某人〕争取过来
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be working hard over the next ten days to win over the undecided voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在接下来的十天好好努力﹐把犹豫未决的选民争取过来。

Sense.DEF: to finally succeed in spite of problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: As in most of his films, it’s the good guys who win through in the end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如在他的大多数电影里一样﹐好人最终获得胜利。

Sense.DEF: a success or victory, especially in sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在体育比赛中的〕胜利﹐赢
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had two wins so far this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个赛季开始以来﹐我们已赢了两场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the under-16 event England had their first win over Germany.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这场16岁以下的青少年赛事中﹐英格兰队战胜德国队赢得了第一场胜利。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly change the expression on your face as a reaction to something painful or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 〔因疼痛或不安而〕龇牙咧嘴﹐皱眉蹙额
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra winced as the dentist started to drill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牙医开始钻牙了﹐桑德拉敛眉蹙额。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly feel very uncomfortable or embarrassed because of something that happens, something you remember etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因发生或记起某事等而突然〕感到不安﹔畏缩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I still wince at the thought of that terrible evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想起那个可怕的夜晚﹐我仍然不寒而栗。

Sense.DEF: a machine with a rope or chain for lifting heavy objects
to lift something or someone up using a winch
Sense.TRAN: 用绞车提起﹔用起货机吊起
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men were winched out of the sinking boat by an RAF helicopter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名男子被皇家空军的直升机从正在下沉的小船里吊了出来。

Sense.DEF: moving air, especially when it moves strongly or quickly in a current
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind blew from the northeast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风从东北方向吹来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Planes were unable to take off because of high winds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机因大风无法起飞。

Sense.DEF: to hear or find out about something secret or private
Sense.TRAN: 听到某事的风声﹔获得某事的线索
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better hope the press doesn’t get wind of this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好指望新闻界没听到这件事的风声。

Sense.DEF: your ability to breathe normally

GramExa.GLOSS: be able to breathe normally again, for example after running
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔跑步等后〕恢复正常呼吸﹐喘过气来

GramExa.PROPFORM: knock the wind out of sb
GramExa.GLOSS: hit someone in the stomach so that they cannot breathe for a moment
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 打某人的腹部使其透不过气来

Sense.DEF: the condition of having air or gas in your stomach or intestines, or the air or gas itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t drink beer – it gives me wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能喝啤酒——喝了就胀气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s wrong with the baby?’ ‘Just a little wind.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “宝宝怎么了？”“只是有点腹胀。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: take the wind out of sb’s sails
Sense.DEF: to make someone lose their confidence, especially by saying or doing something unexpected
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指以意想不到的言语或行动〕使某人丧失信心﹐使某人泄气

Sense.LEXUNIT: see which way the wind is blowing
Sense.DEF: to find out what the situation is before you do something or make a decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔做事或作决定前〕观望形势﹐看风向

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is happening or going to happen, but the details are not clear
Sense.TRAN: 某事正在进行中﹔某事即将发生〔但具体情况不清楚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If there was a merger in the wind, I’m sure we’d hear about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果要合并﹐我们肯定会听说的。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to things that have important effects, and that cannot be stopped
Sense.EXAMPLE: The winds of change are blowing through the entire organization.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个机构刮起了改革之风。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put the wind up sb/get the wind up
Sense.DEF: if you put the wind up someone, you make them feel anxious or frightened. If you get the wind up, you become anxious or frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The threat of legal action will be enough to put the wind up them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威胁起诉将足以使他们惊慌。

Sense.DEF: the people in an orchestra or band who play musical instruments that you blow through, such as a flute
if someone or something moves or runs like the wind, they move or run very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran like the wind down the stairs to escape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她飞也似的冲下楼梯逃跑。

Sense.DEF: talk that does not mean anything

Crossrefto.REFLEX: it’s an ill wind (that blows nobody any good)

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The wind was so strong he could hardly stand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 风大得让他都快站不住了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not strong
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Winds tomorrow will be light.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天是微风。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: strong wind
Collocate.EXAMPLE: High winds are making driving conditions difficult.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风使驾驶变得很困难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very cold
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 冰冷的风/刺骨的风/寒风

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very strong
coming from the north etc
coming from the north etc
the most frequent wind in an area

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A cold wind was blowing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒风劲吹。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes stronger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rain beat down and the wind was picking up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨倾盆,风势越来越大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes less strong
starts blowing from a different direction

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A gust of wind rattled the window.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵大风吹得窗户呼啦啦地响。

Collocate.COLLOC: be blowing/swaying/flapping etc in the wind
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 在风中飘动/摇摆/拍击等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The trees were all swaying in the wind.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木都在风中摇摆。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Wind speeds of up to 80 miles an hour were recorded.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 测得风速高达每小时80英里。

Exponent.DEF: air moving in a current, especially strongly or quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A cold wind was blowing from the east.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 东面吹来一股寒风。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Strong winds caused damage to many buildings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 强风给许多建筑造成了破坏。

Exponent.DEF: a gentle pleasant wind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The trees were moving gently in the breeze.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 树在微风中轻轻摇摆。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A slight breeze ruffled her hair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵微风吹乱了她的头发。

Exponent.DEF: a current of cool air which blows into a room, especially one that makes you feel uncomfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s a bit of a draught in here – can you close the door?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有点穿堂风,请你把门关上行吗？

Exponent.DEF: a very strong wind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ship was blown off course in a severe gale.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 船被一阵狂风吹得偏离了航向。

Exponent.DEF: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water – used about storms in the North Atlantic Ocean
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hurricane devastated Florida and killed at least 40 people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场飓风重创佛罗里达州并导致至少40人丧生。

Exponent.DEF: a violent tropical storm – used about storms in the Western Pacific Ocean
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A typhoon has hit the Philippines, lifting roofs off houses and uprooting trees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 台风袭击菲律宾,屋顶被掀翻,树木被连根拔起。

Exponent.DEF: a violent storm with strong winds that spin very quickly in a circle, often forming a cloud that is narrower at the bottom than the top
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The town was hit by a tornado that damaged several homes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该镇遭龙卷风袭击,多幢住宅被毁。

Exponent.DEF: a violent tropical storm with strong winds that spin in a circle
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A devastating cyclone struck Bangladesh in April that year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那年4月份,一场毁灭性旋风袭击了孟加拉国。

Sense.DEF: to turn or twist something several times around something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hair is divided into sections and wound around heated rods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 头发被分成一绺绺缠绕在加热棒上。

Sense.DEF: to turn part of a machine around several times, in order to make it move or start working
Sense.TRAN: 〔为使机器运转或启动而〕摇动[转动]〔把手等〕﹔给〔机械〕上发条
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you remember to wind the clock?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有记得给钟上发条？

Sense.DEF: if a road, river etc winds some-where, it has many smooth bends and is usually very long

GramExa.PROPFORM: wind (its way) through/ along etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Highway 99 winds its way along the coast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 99号公路沿着海岸蜿蜒伸展。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a winding path
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜿蜒的小路

Sense.DEF: to make a tape move in a machine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you wind the video back a little way – I want to see that bit again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把录像带往回倒一点好吗——那一段我想再看一遍。

Sense.DEF: to gradually reduce the work of a business or organization so that it can be closed down completely
Sense.TRAN: 使〔工作〕逐步减少〔以停止业务或关闭机构〕

Sense.DEF: to rest and relax after a lot of hard work or excitement
Sense.TRAN: 〔紧张工作或极度兴奋之后〕平静下来﹔放松
Sense.EXAMPLE: I find it difficult to wind down after a day at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天工作下来﹐我觉得很难放松下来。
