Sense.DEF: to make something, especially a car window, move down by turning a handle or pressing a button
to bring an activity, meeting etc to an end
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, just to wind up, could I summarize what we’ve decided?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐最后﹐我来把我们的决定做总结好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s time to wind things up – I have a plane to catch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该结束了——我还得赶飞机。

Sense.DEF: to close down a company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our operations in Jamaica are being wound up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在牙买加的企业要关闭了。

Sense.DEF: to be in an unpleasant situation or place after a lot has happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You know you’re going to wind up in court over this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要知道你最终会因为这个上法庭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wound up wishing I’d never come.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最后真希望自己压根就没有来。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately say or do something that will annoy or worry someone, as a joke
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re only winding you up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只是在气你。

Sense.DEF: to turn part of a machine around several times, in order to make it move or start working
Sense.TRAN: 〔为使机器运转或启动而〕摇动〔把手等〕

Sense.DEF: to make something, especially a car window, move up by turning a handle or pressing a button
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you wind the window up, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把车窗摇上好吗？

Sense.DEF: to make someone have difficulty breathing, as a result of falling on something or being hit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fall winded him and he lay still for a moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一跤摔得他上不来气﹐他一动不动地躺了一会儿。

Sense.DEF: someone who talks too much
Sense.TRAN: 夸夸其谈的人﹔喋喋不休的人﹔话匣子

Sense.DEF: a fence, line of trees, or wall that is intended to protect a place from the wind
a type of coat that protects you from the wind
the cooling effect of the wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: It must have been minus 5 with the wind chill factor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加上风寒指数﹐气温肯定只有零下五度。

Sense.DEF: long thin pieces of metal, wood etc hanging together in a group, that make musical sounds when the wind blows them against each other
unable to breathe easily, because you have been running or you have been hit in the stomach
Sense.TRAN: 〔因跑步或腹部被击打而〕呼吸困难的﹐喘不过气的

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you get unexpectedly
Sense.EXAMPLE: his £2 million windfall in the lottery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他彩票中奖得来的200万英镑意外之财

GramExa.GLOSS: high profits that you did not expect to make
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 意外的巨大收获/巨额利润等

Sense.DEF: a piece of fruit that has fallen off a tree
Sense.TRAN: 树上掉落的果实﹐被风吹落的果实

Sense.DEF: an additional amount of tax that the British government sometimes takes from a company that has suddenly earned a large amount of money that it did not expect to earn
a place where a lot of windmills have been built in order to produce electricity
a cloth that is wrapped around a dead person’s body before it is buried, used especially in the past
a musical instrument made of wood or metal that you play by blowing, such as a flute, or one that air is passed through, such as an organ
a large sailing ship of the type that was used for trade in the 19th century
a machine for pulling or lifting heavy objects
a building or structure with parts that turn around in the wind, used for producing electrical power or crushing grain
a toy consisting of a stick with curved pieces of plastic at the end that turn around when they are blown
a space or an area of glass in the wall of a building or vehicle that lets in light
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或汽车上的〕窗﹔窗户﹔橱窗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you mind if I open the window?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开窗你介意吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked out of the window to see if it was raining.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝窗外望去﹐看是否下雨了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sun was shining through the windows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光透过窗户照射进来。

GramExa.GLOSS: just inside a window
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were looking at the Christmas displays in the shop windows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在看商店橱窗里的圣诞节陈列品。
卧室/厨房等窗户

PIC.HEADING: WINDOW 窗
PIC.PICCONTENT: bay window 凸窗；porthole 舷窗；skylight 天窗；bow window 弓形窗；French windows/French doors esp AmE 【尤美】 落地窗；dormer BrE 【英】 竖天窗；sash window BrE 【英】 垂直推拉窗

Sense.DEF: one of the separate areas on a computer screen where different programs are operating
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上显示不同程序正在运行的〕窗口﹐视窗

Sense.DEF: a short period of time that is available for a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 转瞬即逝的机会﹐短暂的时机
Sense.EXAMPLE: Delay might open a window of opportunity for their rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 延期也许会给他们的对手带来可乘之机。

Sense.DEF: an area on an envelope with clear plastic in it which lets you see the address written on the letter inside the envelope
Sense.TRAN: 〔信封上开的〕透明纸窗﹐透明窗口

Sense.DEF: something that makes it possible to see and learn about what is happening in other parts of the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: Television provides us with a useful window on the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视为我们提供了了解世界的有用渠道。

Sense.DEF: to disappear completely or no longer have any effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: One glass of wine, and all my good intentions went out the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就一杯酒﹐我所有的好心都白费了。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow box in which you can grow plants outside your window
someone whose job is to clean windows
someone whose job is to arrange goods attractively in shop windows
something that is intended to make people like your plans or activities, and to stop them seeing the true situation – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 粉饰门面﹔弄虚作假〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these glossy pamphlets are just window dressing – the fact is that the new mall will ruin the neighborhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些精美光亮的小册子都只是表面文章——事实是新商场将破坏附近的环境。

Sense.DEF: the art of arranging goods in a shop window so that they look attractive to customers
without any windows
Sense.EXAMPLE: a windowless basement room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间没有窗户的地下室

Sense.DEF: a single whole piece of glass in a window
a seat next to the window on a bus, plane etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔公共汽车﹑飞机等的〕靠窗座位

Sense.DEF: a seat directly below a window
a blind31
the activity of looking at goods in shop windows without intending to buy them
Sense.TRAN: 浏览商店橱窗﹔逛街看商店橱窗〔不打算购物〕

Sense.DEF: a shelf fixed along the bottom of a window
the tube through which air passes from your mouth to your lungs
the large window at the front of a car, bus etc
a long thin piece of metal with a rubber edge that moves across a windscreen to remove rain
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车挡风玻璃上的〕刮水器﹐雨刷

Sense.DEF: a windscreen
a piece of glass or clear plastic fixed at the front of a motorcycle that protects the rider from wind
a windscreen wiper
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车挡风玻璃上的〕刮水器﹐雨刷

Sense.DEF: a tube of material fastened to a pole at airports to show the direction of the wind
a name used especially by newspapers for the present British royal family, whose family name is Windsor
Sense.TRAN: 温莎〔英国王室姓氏﹐尤用于报纸〕

Sense.DEF: a period of bad weather with strong winds but not much rain
the sport of sailing across water by standing on a surfboard and holding on to a large sail attached to the surfboard
Sense.TRAN: 帆板运动﹐风帆冲浪（运动）

Sense.DEF: a place that is windswept is often windy because there are not many trees or buildings to protect it
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕迎风的﹐当风的﹔无遮挡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: windswept moors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风劲吹的荒野

Sense.DEF: hair, clothes etc that are windswept have been blown around by the wind
a large enclosed passage where engineers test aircraft etc by forcing air past them
a modern windmill for providing electrical power
something that you say or do in order to make someone angry or worried, as a joke
Sense.TRAN: 故意气人的言语[行动]﹐逗弄人的言语[事情]

Sense.DEF: a series of actions that are intended to complete a process, meeting etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一过程﹑会议等的〕结束部分﹐收场
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President made a statement at the windup of the summit in Helsinki.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在赫尔辛基峰会闭幕时发表了一项声明。

Sense.DEF: relating to a machine or toy that you turn part of several times, in order to make it move or start working
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器或玩具〕装有发条的﹐用手柄操作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wind-up gramophone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手摇式留声机

Sense.DEF: towards the direction from which the wind is blowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the windward side of the boat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船迎风的一侧

Sense.DEF: if it is windy, there is a lot of wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too windy for a picnic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风太大﹐不适合野餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold, windy day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个寒冷的大风天
Sense.EXAMPLE: a windy hillside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当风的山坡

Sense.DEF: windy talk is full of words that sound impressive but do not mean much
Sense.TRAN: 夸夸其谈的﹔空话连篇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians’ windy generalizations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们夸夸其谈的空话

Sense.DEF: a nickname for the US city of Chicago
Sense.TRAN: 风城〔美国城市芝加哥的别名〕

Sense.DEF: an alcoholic drink made from grapes, or a type of this drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯葡萄酒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bottle of red wine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶红葡萄酒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dry white wine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 干白葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: an alcoholic drink made from another fruit or plant
Sense.EXAMPLE: damson wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西洋李子酒

Sense.DEF: to entertain someone well with a meal, wine etc
Sense.TRAN: 宴请某人﹐以酒宴款待某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies spend millions wining and dining clients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司花费巨款宴请客户。

Sense.DEF: a place that serves mainly wine and light meals
Sense.TRAN: 〔主要供应葡萄酒和小吃的〕酒吧

Sense.DEF: an underground room where wine is stored to keep it at the right temperature
a drink made with wine, fruit juice, and water
Sense.TRAN: 果汁清凉酒〔由葡萄酒﹑果汁和水调配而成〕

Sense.DEF: a tall glass with a thin stem, used for drinking wine
Sense.TRAN: 〔玻璃制的〕葡萄酒杯﹐高脚酒杯

Sense.DEF: a place where wine is made and stored
the activity or skill of tasting and comparing different wines to see if they are good, or an event where this happens
a type of vinegar made from sour wine, used in cooking

Subsense.DEF: one of the parts of a bird’s or insect’s body that it uses for flying
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a butterfly with beautiful markings on its wings
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翅膀上有美丽花纹的蝴蝶
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The pheasant flapped its wings vigorously.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野鸡猛烈地拍打翅膀。

Subsense.DEF: the meat on the wing bone of a chicken, duck etc, eaten as food
Subsense.TRAN: 〔供食用的〕翅膀〔如鸡翅﹑鸭翅等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: spicy chicken wings
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香辣鸡翅

Sense.DEF: one of the large flat parts that stick out from the side of a plane and help to keep it in the air
one of the parts of a large building, especially one that sticks out from the main part
Sense.TRAN: 〔大型建筑物的〕侧翼﹔侧厅﹔耳房﹐厢房

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the east wing of the palace
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 东侧殿
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She works in the hospital’s maternity wing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在医院的产科病房工作。

Sense.DEF: a group of people within a political party or other organization who have a particular opinion or aim
Sense.TRAN: 〔政党等组织中的〕派别﹐派（系）﹐…翼
Sense.EXAMPLE: the moderate wing of the Republican Party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党内的温和派

Subsense.DEF: a winger
Subsense.TRAN: 〔足球等运动中的〕边锋﹐侧翼队员

Subsense.DEF: the far left or right part of a sports field

Sense.DEF: the part of a car that is above a wheel
to help and protect someone who is younger or less experienced than you are
Sense.TRAN: 把某人保护在自己的羽翼之下﹐将某人置于自己的庇护之下

Sense.DEF: ready to do something or be used when the time is right
Sense.TRAN: 准备就绪〔只待时机成熟〕﹔随时可以使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several junior managers are waiting in the wings for promotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几位低层经理正等着晋升。

Sense.DEF: the parts at each side of a stage where actors are hidden from people who are watching the play

Sense.LEXUNIT: on a wing and a prayer
Sense.DEF: if you do something on a wing and a prayer, you do not have much chance of succeeding
if a bird is on the wing, it is flying
to fly away
to pass the examinations you need to become a pilot
Sense.TRAN: 〔当飞行员前〕通过必要的飞行考试

Sense.DEF: to fly somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flock of geese winging down the coast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着海岸展翅南飞的雁群

GramExa.PROPFORM: wing its/their way to/across etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: planes winging their way to exotic destinations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞往异国目的地的飞机

Sense.DEF: to go or be sent somewhere very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A bottle of champagne will soon be winging its way to 10 lucky winners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马上就要给10名幸运的优胜者分别送上一瓶香槟。

Sense.DEF: to do something without planning or preparing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll just have to wing it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就只好临时应付一下。

Sense.DEF: a comfortable chair with a high back and pieces pointing forward on each side where you can rest your head
a type of shirt collar for men that is worn with very formal clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔男式正装衬衫的〕燕子领﹐翼领

Sense.DEF: an officer of high rank in the British air force
another spelling of whinge
having wings
Sense.EXAMPLE: winged insects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有翅昆虫

Sense.DEF: someone who plays in the far left or far right of the field in games such as football
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球等运动的〕边锋﹐侧翼队员

Sense.DEF: a mirror on the side of a car
a nut for fastening things, which has sides that stick out to make it easier to turn
the distance from the end of one wing to the end of the other
Sense.TRAN: 翼展﹐翼幅〔指两翼展开时的宽度〕

Sense.DEF: the point at the end of a bird’s or a plane’s wing
a type of man’s shoe with a pattern of small holes on the toe
Sense.TRAN: 〔脚尖处有孔的〕男式拷花皮鞋

Sense.DEF: to close and open one eye quickly to communicate something or show that something is a secret or joke

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He winked mischievously at Erica.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他顽皮地朝埃丽卡眨了眨眼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He winked an eye at his companion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝同伴眨眨眼。

Sense.DEF: to shine with a light that flashes on and off
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Christmas tree with lights winking on and off
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯光闪烁的圣诞树

Sense.DEF: to pretend not to notice something bad or illegal, in a way that suggests you approve of it
Sense.TRAN: 对…睁一只眼闭一只眼﹐假装没看见

Sense.DEF: a quick action of opening and closing one eye, usually as a signal to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a wink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她眨了一下眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You look tired,’ he said with a knowing wink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你看上去很累。”他会意地眨了眨眼睛说。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not get a wink of sleep/not sleep a wink
Sense.DEF: not be able to sleep at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t get a wink of sleep last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我一夜都没合眼。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: a nod’s as good as a wink

Sense.DEF: a small sea animal that lives in a shell and is eaten as food
Sense.TRAN: 峨螺﹐玉黍螺〔一种可食用的螺〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Government critics were winkled out of their positions of influence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评政府的人士被解除了重要职位。

Sense.DEF: to get information from someone who does not want to give it to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candy was very good at winkling out secrets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎迪极善于探听秘密。

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that has won something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the winner of the Ladies’ Championship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女子锦标赛的冠军

Sense.EXAMPLE: Five lucky winners will each receive a signed copy of the album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五位幸运的获胜者每人将得到一张签名专辑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a jockey he rode 10 winners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为骑师他曾十度驾驭获胜赛马。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Nobel prize winner
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺贝尔奖得主

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is or is likely to be very popular and successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book has proved to be a winner with young children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明这本书很受小孩子欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company seems to be onto a winner doing something that is likely to be successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司似乎成功在望。

Sense.DEF: a goal or point that makes someone win a game such as football or tennis
Sense.TRAN: 制胜的一球﹔赢得比赛的一分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moran scored the winner with only two minutes left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛只剩两分钟时﹐莫兰射入了制胜的一球。

Sense.DEF: the person who gets most of the advantages from a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a capitalist society there will always be winners and losers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在资本主义社会中永远会有赢家和输家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The real winners this summer have been the sun cream manufacturers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年夏天的大赢家是防晒霜生产商。

Sense.DEF: the winning person or thing is the one that wins or makes you win a competition or game
Sense.EXAMPLE: the winning team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获胜队
Sense.EXAMPLE: The winning design came from an architect in Glasgow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖设计出自格拉斯哥的一名建筑师之手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beckham scored the winning goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克汉姆射入了制胜的一球。

Sense.DEF: making you very successful or likely to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a winning combination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的组合
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a business, they have found a winning formula.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一家企业﹐他们找到了成功之道。

Sense.DEF: a winning quality or way of doing something is one that makes other people like you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a winning smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Sense.DEF: a period of time when you win every game or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team are on a winning streak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队场场获胜﹐正逢顺风顺水。

Sense.DEF: the place where a race ends
money that you have won
Sense.EXAMPLE: lottery winnings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩票奖金

Sense.DEF: to make a list, group, or quantity smaller by getting rid of the things that you do not need or want
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to winnow the list of candidates to three.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要把名单上的候选人删减到三位。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of the things or people that you do not need or want from a group
someone who drinks a lot of alcohol and lives on the streets
behaving in a pleasant and attractive way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a winsome smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Sense.DEF: the season after autumn and before spring, when the weather is coldest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soon it will be winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快要到冬天了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It usually snows here in the winter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿冬天一般会下雪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fuel supplies could be seriously disrupted this winter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年冬季燃料供应可能会受到严重影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: That winter was particularly cold.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个冬天特别冷。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very cold
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In a hard winter, many birds starve.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在严寒的冬天,许多鸟忍饥挨饿。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Winters here are generally mild.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的冬天通常是温暖的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: During the winter months the town is often cut off.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天的几个月里﹐这个镇常常与外界隔绝。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: designed for winter
in the middle of the winter

Sense.DEF: to spend the winter somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year, over 11,000 Canadians wintered in Arizona.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年有超过11,000名加拿大人在亚利桑那州过冬。

Sense.DEF: the shortest day of the year in the northern hemisphere, usually around December 22nd
Sense.TRAN: 冬至〔北半球一年中白昼最短的一天﹐通常在12月22日左右〕

Sense.DEF: sports that are done on snow or ice, such as skiing
the time when it is winter

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hills look very bleak in wintertime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季这些山坡看上去很荒凉。

Sense.DEF: cold or typical of winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wintry day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个冬日
Sense.EXAMPLE: wintry showers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季的阵雪

Sense.DEF: a wintry smile or expression is not very friendly
Sense.TRAN: 〔笑容或表情〕冷漠的﹐冷冰冰的

Sense.DEF: a win-win situation, solution etc is one that will end well for everyone involved in it
Sense.TRAN: 双赢的﹐对各方都有利的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a win-win situation all around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个皆大欢喜的局面。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The agreement is a win-win for everyone.

Subsense.DEF: to rub a surface with something in order to remove dirt, liquid etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wipe the table with a damp cloth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用一块湿布擦桌子。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bill wipedhis eyes wiped the tears from his face and apologized.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔擦干眼泪﹐道了歉。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He pulled a handkerchief from his pocket and wiped his nose.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从口袋里掏出手帕擦了擦鼻子。

Subsense.DEF: to clean something by rubbing it against a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wiped his mouth on the back of his hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用手背抹了抹嘴。

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid, dirt, or marks by wiping

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kim wiped the sweat from her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 金擦去脸上的汗水。

Sense.DEF: to remove all the information that is stored on a tape, video, or computer disk
Sense.TRAN: 抹掉﹐擦掉〔磁带上的录音﹑录像或磁盘上的信息〕

Sense.DEF: to try to forget an unpleasant experience
Sense.TRAN: 把某事从心里/记忆中抹去

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone completely in a competition or argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛或辩论中〕把某人打得一败涂地

Sense.DEF: to agree to forget about mistakes or arguments that happened in the past
Sense.TRAN: 把以往的错误[争论]一笔勾销﹐忘记过去

Sense.LEXUNIT: wipe the smile/grin off sb’s face
Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less happy or confident, especially someone who is annoying because they think they are clever
Sense.TRAN: 抹去某人脸上的笑容〔尤指自以为聪明的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell him how much it’ll cost – that should wipe the smile off his face!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 告诉他要花多少钱——那样他就笑不出来了！

Sense.LEXUNIT: wipe sth off the face of the earth/wipe sth off the map
Sense.DEF: to destroy something completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another few years and this species could be wiped off the face of the earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再过几年﹐这一物种就可能从地球上彻底消失。

Sense.DEF: to dry plates, cups etc that have been washed
Sense.TRAN: 擦干（洗过的碟子﹑杯子等）
Sense.EXAMPLE: You wash, I’ll wipe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来洗﹐我来擦干。

Sense.DEF: to stop something existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: A frown quickly wiped away her smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眉头一皱﹐笑容顿时消失。

Sense.DEF: to completely clean a surface using a wet cloth
to reduce the value of shares or prices by a particular amount
Sense.TRAN: 使〔股票等的价格〕下跌﹐抹掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nearly £7 billion has been wiped off share prices worldwide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球股价下跌造成市值将近70亿英镑的缩水。

Sense.DEF: to destroy, remove, or get rid of something completely
Sense.TRAN: 彻底毁灭﹔勾销﹔去除﹐抹去
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whole villages were wiped out by the floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整座整座的村庄被洪水冲毁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing could wipe out his bitter memories of the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么也抹不掉他对过去的痛苦记忆。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel extremely tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat had wiped us out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热使我们精疲力竭。

Sense.DEF: to fall or hit another object when driving a car, riding a bicycle etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔开车﹑骑自行车等时〕翻跌下来﹐撞上某物

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid from a surface using a cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hastily wiped up the milk I had spilled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我连忙把洒出来的牛奶擦干净。

Sense.DEF: a wiping movement with a cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: An occasional wipe with a soft cloth will keep the surface shiny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔用软布擦一擦可使表面保持光亮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Give the baby’s nose a wipe, would you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给宝宝擦擦鼻子﹐行吗？

Sense.DEF: a special piece of wet material that you use to clean someone or something and then throw away
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pack of baby wipes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包婴儿湿巾

Sense.DEF: extremely tired
a piece of equipment on a car, that removes rain from the windscreen
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车挡风玻璃的〕刮水器﹐雨刷

Sense.DEF: thin metal in the form of a thread, or a piece of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: copper wire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铜丝
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wire fence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁丝网

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal like this, used for carrying electrical currents or signals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a telephone wire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话线

Sense.DEF: to become confused about what someone is saying because you think they are talking about something else
to be finished or achieved with very little time left
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game was very close and went right down to the wire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛竞争非常激烈﹐直到最后才见分晓。

Sense.DEF: a piece of electronic recording equipment, usually worn secretly on someone’s clothes
Sense.TRAN: 窃听器〔一般偷偷地别在某人的衣服上〕

Sense.DEF: a telegram

Subsense.DEF: to connect wires inside a building or piece of equipment so that electricity can pass through
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Check that the plug has been wired up properly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查插头是否插好。

Subsense.DEF: to connect electrical equipment to the electrical system using wires
Subsense.TRAN: 用导线将〔设备〕连接到〔电气系统〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The CD player had been wired up to the car’s cigarette lighter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光唱片播放机已和汽车的点烟器连接。

Sense.DEF: to send money electronically
to attach a piece of recording equipment to a person or room, especially secretly
to have all the necessary wires and connections for an electrical system to work
Sense.TRAN: 接通〔电气系统工作所需的〕线路
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the rooms have been wired for cable TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有房间都已布好有线电视线路。

Sense.DEF: to send a telegram to someone
to fasten two or more things together using wire
Sense.TRAN: 用金属丝把…捆扎在一起

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The poles had all been wired together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杆子全部都捆在一起了。

Sense.DEF: a tool used for cutting wire
feeling very active and excited, especially because you have drunk a lot of coffee or taken a drug
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因喝了大量咖啡或吸毒后〕极其兴奋的

Sense.DEF: connected to, and able to use, the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 〔指计算机系统〕联网的﹐连线的

Sense.DEF: wired glass, cloth etc has wire in it to make it strong or stiff
Sense.TRAN: 〔玻璃﹑布料等〕含有金属丝的﹔夹丝的
Sense.EXAMPLE: wired ribbon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夹丝丝带

Sense.DEF: a radio
a system of sending messages by radio
Sense.TRAN: 无线电发射和接收系统﹐无线电报

Sense.DEF: a system of sending and receiving electronic signals that does not use electrical or telephone wires, for example the system used by mobile phones
wires that have been woven together to form a net, used especially for fences
Sense.TRAN: 金属丝网﹐铁丝网〔尤用于围栏〕

Sense.DEF: the action of secretly listening to other people’s telephone conversations, by connecting something to the wires of their telephone
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某人电话线路上的〕搭线窃听﹐电话窃听

Sense.DEF: a mass of very thin pieces of wire, used for cleaning pans
the network of wires that form the electrical system in a building, vehicle, or piece of equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑车辆或设备中的〕电线线路﹐线路系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wiring needs to be replaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 线路系统需要更换。

Sense.DEF: someone who is wiry is thin but has strong muscles
wiry hair or grass is stiff and strong
good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man of great wisdom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个有大智慧的男人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local people are questioning the wisdom of spending so much money on a new road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人在质疑花这么多钱修建一条新路是否明智。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

Sense.DEF: knowledge gained over a long period of time through learning or experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: the collected wisdom of many centuries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多少个世纪累积的智慧

Sense.DEF: a belief or opinion that most people have
Sense.TRAN: 普遍的看法/公认的见解/传统的信念等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conventional wisdom is that boys mature more slowly than girls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍认为男孩比女孩晚熟。

Sense.DEF: humorous used to say that you do not understand why someone has decided to do something
Sense.TRAN: 以某人（无穷）的智慧〔表示不明白某人为何决定做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boss, in her infinite wisdom, has decided to reorganize the whole office yet again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板凭着她非凡的智慧﹐决定再一次对整个办公室进行整顿。

Sense.DEF: one of the four teeth at the back of your mouth that do not grow until you are an adult
wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment
Sense.TRAN: 〔决定和行动〕明智的﹐合理恰当的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is wise to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s wise to check whether the flight times have changed before you leave for the airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出发去机场之前核实一下航班时间是否有变化﹐这是明智的做法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you were wise to leave when you did.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你当时走掉很明智。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a wise precaution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明智的预防措施
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think that would be a very wise move not be a sensible thing to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为那样做不是很明智。

Sense.DEF: someone who is wise makes good decisions, gives good advice etc, especially because they have a lot of experience of life
Sense.TRAN: 〔人因阅历丰富而〕英明的﹐有智慧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wise old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睿智的老人
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the time I thought he was wonderful, but I’m older and wiser now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时我认为他很了不起﹐但是现在我长大变聪明了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a manager, Sanford was wise in the ways of knew a lot about company politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一名当家人﹐桑福德深谙公司政治之道。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be none the wiser/not be any the wiser

Subsense.DEF: to not understand something even after it has been explained to you
Subsense.TRAN: 〔解释后〕还是不明白﹐仍然不懂
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Charlie explained how the system works, but I’m still none the wiser.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利解释了系统是如何运作的﹐可我还是不明白。

Subsense.DEF: used for saying that no one will find out about something bad that someone has done
Subsense.TRAN: 谁也不会知道〔某人做的坏事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He could easily have taken the money and no one would have been any the wiser.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本可以毫不费力地拿走这些钱﹐而且就算他拿了也不会有人知道。

Sense.DEF: to realize that someone is being dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 意识[察觉]到某人/某事有诈
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers quickly get wise to students who are cheating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师会很快发现作弊的学生。

Sense.DEF: an annoying person who thinks they know more than they really do
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, wise guy, shut up and listen!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐聪明人﹐闭上嘴好好听着！

Sense.DEF: to realize what you should have done in a situation after it has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s easy to be wise after the event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放马后炮很容易。

Sense.DEF: to realize the truth about a bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wise up, Vic – he’s cheating you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清醒点﹐维克——他是在骗你！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Consumers need to wise up to the effect that advertising has on them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者应当认清广告对自己产生的影响。

Sense.DEF: used for saying which feature of a situation you are referring to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time-wise we’re not doing too badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间上我们控制得不错。

Sense.DEF: in a direction across something, along the length of something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the carrots lengthwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将胡萝卜纵向切开。

Sense.DEF: a clever and funny remark or reply
if you wish to do something or you wish to have it done for you, you want to do it or want to have it done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish to make a complaint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要投诉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If you wish to discuss this matter further please do not hesitate to contact me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想进一步讨论此事﹐请尽管和我联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may leave now, if you wish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想走﹐现在就可以走了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used in formal situations to tell someone you will do what they want
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 如你所愿〔告诉某人会按其意思做事〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I’d like it to be ready by six.’ ‘Just as you wish, sir.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我希望6点之前准备好。”“听您的﹐先生。”

Sense.EXAMPLE: The cook will prepare whatever you wish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想吃什么厨师就会给你做什么。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say want rather than wish.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说want﹐而不说wish
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I want to see the manager.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要见经理。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You can go, if you want.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想去就可以去。

Sense.DEF: to want something to be true although you know it is either impossible or unlikely
Sense.TRAN: 希望〔不可能或可能性很小的事成为现实〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish I didn’t have to go to work today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我今天不用上班就好了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish that I could afford a new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是有钱买辆新车就好了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wished Emily were with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真希望埃米莉陪着他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I wish I had never been born.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我倒希望自己没有生出来。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When talking about things that you would like to happen or be true, use wish and the past tense, or wish and would or could.
F2NBox.TRAN: 谈论希望发生或属实的事﹐可以用wish加过去时﹐或者用wish加would或could
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I wish I lived in New York.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望自己住在纽约。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I wish they would explain things better.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他们把事情解释得更清楚。
F2NBox.EXPL: In British English, you can either say ‘I wish I was’ or ‘I wish I were’, which is rather formal. In American English, you should use were.
F2NBox.TRAN: 英国英语中可以说I wish I was或I wish I were﹐后者比较正式。美国英语中应该用were
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I wish I were ten years younger.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望自己年轻十岁。
F2NBox.EXPL: When talking about things that you would like to have happened, use wish and the past perfect tense.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示希望某些事情已经发生﹐用wish加过去完成时
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I wish I had paid more attention in class.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望我以前上课时听讲更认真些。

Sense.DEF: to say that you hope someone will have good luck, a happy life etc
Sense.TRAN: 祝﹐祝愿〔某人好运﹑幸福等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We wish you a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们祝你圣诞快乐﹑新年幸福！

Sense.EXAMPLE: We wish them every happiness in their new home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们祝愿他们在新家一切如意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shook my hand and wished me luck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和我握手﹐祝我好运。

GramExa.GLOSS: say that you hope that good things will happen to someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My friends wished me well in my new job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋友们祝我新工作顺利。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I couldn’t wish for a nicer/better etc ...

Variant.LEXVAR: the nicest/best etc ... I could have wished for

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are very happy with what you have and cannot imagine anyone or anything better
Sense.TRAN: 我不能再奢求更好的…﹔我想要的最好的…
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t wish for a better husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能再奢求比他更好的丈夫了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the best birthday present I could have wished for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我想要的最好的生日礼物。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I wish (that) sb would do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you find someone’s behaviour annoying and want them to change
Sense.TRAN: 我真希望某人能做某事〔指改变令人讨厌的习惯〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop treating me like a child!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望你别再把我当成小孩子了！

Subsense.DEF: to want something to happen or to want to have something, especially when it seems unlikely or impossible
Subsense.TRAN: 希望〔不大可能的事〕发生﹔想拥有〔不大可能拥有的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was no use wishing for the impossible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能的事情想也没用。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was like the sister I never had but always wished for.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就像一个我不曾有过却一直想要的姐姐。

Subsense.DEF: to silently ask for something you want and hope that it will happen by magic or good luck – used especially in children’s stories
Subsense.TRAN: 盼望﹐祈求〔尤用于儿童故事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One day she found a magic ring that brought her whatever she wished for.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一天她找到一枚神奇的戒指﹐能让她想要什么就有什么。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not true, but you wish it was
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think he really likes you.’ ‘I wish!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我认为他很喜欢你。”“但愿如此！”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that what they want to happen or be true will definitely not happen or become true
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m going to be famous one day.’ ‘You wish!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “总有一天我会成名的。”“你做梦吧！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very unpleasant and that you would not like anyone to have to experience it
Sense.TRAN: 不想某事发生在某人身上
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having your house broken into is terrible. I wouldn’t wish it on anybody.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里被撬很可怕。我希望这种事不要发生在任何人身上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I don’t wish to interfere/be nosy etc
Sense.DEF: used to show you are sorry if what you are going to say upsets or annoys someone
Sense.TRAN: 我并不想干涉/多管闲事等〔表示如要说的话令某人不安或不快﹐则致歉在先〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t wish to seem ungrateful, but it’s not quite what I expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不想显得不领情﹐可这并非是我所期望的样子。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do not know something, and you wish you did know
Sense.TRAN: 我知道就好了〔用于强调不知道某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where on earth have they gone?’ ‘I wish I knew!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们到底去哪儿啦？”“我知道就好了！”

Sense.DEF: to make something unpleasant disappear by wanting it to disappear, without doing anything about it
Sense.TRAN: 凭主观愿望使…消失﹐希望〔令人不快的事〕自行消失
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t just wish your problems away, you know!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道﹐你光想是不会让问题消失的！

Sense.DEF: to always be thinking about the future, so that you do not do or enjoy things now – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔总是想着将来而〕忽略了眼下的生活〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t wish your life away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要总是想着将来而忽略当下！

Sense.DEF: a desire to do something, to have something, or to have something happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s important to listen to the wishes of the patient.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 倾听病人的意愿很重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite her wish to continue working, she was forced to retire at the age of 62.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽管有继续工作的愿望﹐可在62岁时还是被迫退休了。

Sense.DEF: a silent request for something to happen as if by magic
Sense.EXAMPLE: Close your eyes and make a wish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闭上眼睛许个愿。

Sense.DEF: if you do something against someone’s wishes, you do it even though you know they do not want you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d left school against her mother’s wishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她违背母亲的愿望辍学了。

GramExa.GLOSS: do something against their wishes

Sense.DEF: used, especially in cards and letters, to say that you hope someone will be happy, successful, or healthy
Sense.TRAN: 最诚挚/良好/最热烈等的祝愿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Best wishes for a long and happy retirement!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝你退休生活长久愉快！

Sense.EXAMPLE: She asked me to pass on her good wishes to all her friends and colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她请我向她所有的朋友和同事转达良好的祝愿。

GramExa.GLOSS: used at the end of a letter before you sign your name
GramExa.EXAMPLE: With best wishes, Celia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝好﹐西莉亚。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have no wish to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do not want or intend to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no wish to speak to her ever again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再也不愿意跟她说话了。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that you will do whatever someone asks you to do
Sense.TRAN: 你的愿望就是对我的命令〔幽默用法〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: silently ask for something that you want to happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He blew out the candles and made a wish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吹灭蜡烛,许了个愿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get what you want
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wanted him to leave, and she got her wish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望他离开,终于如愿以偿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give someone what they want
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His parents would now be able to grant his wish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父母现在能够满足他的愿望了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He expressed a wish to go to the United States.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表达了想去美国的愿望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what someone wants
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have to respect his wishes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得尊重他的意愿。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is important not to ignore the wishes of the patient.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能忽视病人的意愿,这是很重要的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His wish came true when he was called up to play for England.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 被召进英格兰队的那一刻,他的愿望实现了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what they want most of all
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her greatest wish was to see her parents again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最大的愿望是能够再见到父母。

Sense.DEF: the V-shaped bone from a cooked chicken, duck etc, which two people pull apart to decide who will make a wish
Sense.TRAN: 叉骨﹐如愿骨〔煮熟的鸡﹑鸭等的胸骨﹐由两人同时拉扯﹐以决定由谁许愿〕

Sense.DEF: when you believe that what you want to happen will happen, when in fact it is not possible
Sense.TRAN: 单凭主观意愿的想法﹔一厢情愿
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she rather likes me. But maybe that’s just wishful thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她很喜欢我﹐不过也许那只是我一厢情愿的想法。

Sense.DEF: a well or pool of water that people throw coins into while making a wish
all the things that you would like to have or would like to happen in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 愿望单〔指某一情形中你的全部愿望〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Another player on Coach Beane’s wish list is center fielder Jeffrey Hammonds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比恩教练愿望单上的另一名球员是中外野手杰弗里•哈蒙兹。

Sense.DEF: someone who is wishy-washy does not have firm or clear ideas and seems unable to decide what they want – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕优柔寡断的﹐没有明确目标的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of wishy-washy liberals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群稀里糊涂的自由主义者

Sense.DEF: colours that are wishy-washy are pale and unexciting, not strong or dark – used to show disapproval
a wisp of hair, grass, hay etc is a thin piece of it that is separate from the rest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A wisp of hair had escaped from under her hat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的帽子下面露出一缕头发。

Sense.DEF: a wisp of smoke, cloud, mist etc is a small thin line of it that rises upwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wisps of smoke rose into the air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缕缕轻烟袅袅升起。

Sense.DEF: a climbing plant with purple or white flowers
Sense.TRAN: 紫藤〔一种攀缘植物﹐开紫色或白色花〕

Sense.DEF: thinking sadly about something you would like to have but cannot have, especially something that you used to have in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔因得不到想要的东西﹐尤指曾经拥有的东西〕伤感的﹐惆怅的﹐思念的﹐依依不舍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wistful smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怅然若失的微笑

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s the house where I was born,’ she said wistfully.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是我出生的房子。”她伤感地说道。

Sense.DEF: the ability to say things that are clever and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman of great wit and charm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说话风趣﹑风韵动人的女人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His sharp wit had them all smiling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的机智诙谐让他们一个个都露出了笑脸。

Sense.DEF: someone who is able to say clever and amusing things
your ability to think quickly and make the right decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alone and penniless, I was forced to live on my wits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孤身一人又身无分文﹐我只得靠我的机智来过活。

GramExa.GLOSS: be ready to think quickly and do what is necessary in a difficult situation
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 有灵活的头脑﹐随机应变

Sense.LEXUNIT: frighten/scare/terrify sb out of their wits
Sense.DEF: to frighten someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was terrified out of my wits at the very idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这个念头把我吓坏了。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself think about what you are going to do next after you have been surprised by something
Sense.TRAN: 〔受到惊吓后〕恢复理智﹐冷静下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt helpless, but tried to gather my wits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到无助﹐但尽量让自己冷静下来。

Sense.DEF: to compete against someone in a test of knowledge or intelligence
to be very upset and not know what to do, because you have tried everything possible to solve a problem

Sense.LEXUNIT: have the wit to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be clever enough to know the right thing to do
Sense.TRAN: 足够明智﹐作出正确决定做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thankfully, Reid had the wit to see what was wrong with the plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好雷德聪明地看出了这个计划的问题所在。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not be beyond the wit of sb
Sense.DEF: not be too difficult for someone to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s surely not beyond the wit of man to come up with a solution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类要想个解决办法肯定是不难的。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce additional information which makes it clear exactly who or what you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: This does not stop me giving you a little treat. To wit, an invitation to dine at Brown’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使这样﹐我也还是要小小地款待你一下﹐也就是说﹐请你到布朗餐厅吃饭。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is supposed to have magic powers, especially to do bad things
an insulting word for a woman who is old or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 丑老太婆﹐老巫婆〔侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF: the use of magic powers, especially evil ones, to make things happen
a man who is believed to have magic powers and the ability to cure diseases, especially in parts of Africa
a substance used for treating small wounds on the skin, or the tree that produces it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于治疗皮肤小创伤的〕金缕梅酊剂﹔金缕梅（树）

Sense.DEF: an attempt to find and punish people in a society or organization whose opinions are regarded as wrong or dangerous – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 搜捕异己﹐政治迫害〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-Communist witch-hunts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反共大搜捕

Sense.DEF: 12 o’clock at night
used to say that two or more people or things are together in the same place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Bob in town with his girlfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到鲍勃与他的女朋友一起在镇上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put this bag with the others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这个包和其他的包放在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always wear these shoes with this dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋子我总是和这条裙子一起穿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mix the powder with boiling water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用开水把粉调和。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had her husband with her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身边有丈夫陪着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better bring your passport with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好把护照带着。

Sense.DEF: having, possessing, or carrying something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall gentleman with a beard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位留胡子的高个子先生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book with a green cover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本绿色封面的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man with a gun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带枪的男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need someone with new ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要有新观念的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only people with plenty of money can afford to shop here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有很有钱的人才有能力在这里购物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came back with a letter in her hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手里拿着一封信回来了。

Sense.DEF: using something or by means of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chop the onions with a sharp knife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用锋利的刀切洋葱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What will you buy with the money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会用这笔钱买什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I amused myself with crossword puzzles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我填纵横字谜自娱自乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hat decorated with brightly coloured feathers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顶有鲜艳羽饰的帽子

Sense.DEF: because of a particular feeling or physical state
Sense.TRAN: 由于〔某种感情或身体状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were trembling with fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吓得发抖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack beamed with pleasure when he heard the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克听到这消息高兴得眉开眼笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was too weak with hunger to cry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我饿得都没有力气哭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother became seriously ill with pneumonia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲得了肺炎﹐病得很重。

Sense.DEF: including
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two nights’ accommodation with breakfast and evening meal cost us just over £250.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包括早餐和晚餐﹐两晚的住宿花了我们250英镑多一点。

Sense.DEF: used to say what covers or fills something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her boots were covered with mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的靴子上满是污泥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fill the bowl with sugar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这个碗装满糖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In summer Venice is crammed with tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季的威尼斯挤满了游客。

Sense.DEF: used to say what an action or situation is related to
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have a problem with parking in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这里有停车问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful with that glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心那只玻璃杯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there something wrong with your phone?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的电话有问题吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are you getting on with your studies, David?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的学习成绩怎么样﹐戴维？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Compared with other children of the same age, Robert is very tall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和其他同龄孩子相比﹐罗伯特长得很高。

Sense.DEF: used to say which person or thing someone has a particular feeling or attitude towards
Sense.TRAN: 对于〔用于表示对某人或某事具有某种感情或态度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you’re not angry with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你没生我的气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thinks he’s in love with Diana.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想他是爱上了黛安娜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s delighted with her new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的新车很满意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get too friendly with your students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要和你的学生太亲近。

Sense.DEF: supporting someone or sharing their opinion
Sense.TRAN: 支持﹐赞同 〔某人或其意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some opposition MPs voted with the Government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些反对党议员投票支持政府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re either with me or against me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要么支持我﹐要么反对我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m with Harry all the way on this one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这件事上我始终支持哈里。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about an action or activity to say which other person, group, or country is involved
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示行为或活动涉及的对象〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop fighting with your brother!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要和弟弟打架！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used to play chess with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前常和他下国际象棋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good idea to discuss the problem with a sympathetic teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和一位有同情心的老师谈谈这个问题﹐这是个好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re competing with foreign businesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在和外国公司竞争。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s trade with Japan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的对日贸易
Sense.EXAMPLE: She left home after an argument with her parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和父母吵了一架后离家出走了。

Sense.DEF: used to say how someone does something or how something happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示某人的行为方式或某事的发生方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He prepared everything with great care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他精心筹备各项事宜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A rocket exploded with a blinding flash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着一道炫目的闪光﹐一枚火箭爆炸了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh, I’m not in a hurry,’ I said with a smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “噢﹐我不急。”我微笑着说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The day starts with a great American breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上有丰盛的美式早餐。

Sense.DEF: used to say what position or state someone or something is in, or what is happening, when someone does something
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示姿势﹑状态或某人做某事时的情形〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood with her back to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她背对我站着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We lay in bed with the window open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开着窗躺在床上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was knitting, with the television on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在织毛线﹐电视机开着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We jumped into the water with bullets whizzing past our ears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹从耳边嗖嗖地飞过﹐我们跳入了水中。

Sense.DEF: at the same rate as something else and because of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skill which improves with practice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多多练习就能提高的技艺
Sense.EXAMPLE: The risk of cancer increases with the number of cigarettes you smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟越多﹐得癌症的风险就越大。

Sense.DEF: because of a situation that exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: With John away there’s more room in the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为约翰不在﹐家里宽敞了一些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t do my homework with all this noise going on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么吵﹐我没法做家庭作业。

Sense.DEF: employed by someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manager is Stuart Walker, who has been with the company since 1970.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理是斯图尔特•沃克﹐他从1970年起就在这家公司工作。

Sense.DEF: used to say who is looking after something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I left your keys with the janitor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把你的钥匙留在看门人那里了。

Sense.DEF: used to say who or what someone becomes separated from
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joan doesn’t want to part with the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼舍不得这钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a complete break with tradition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与传统的决裂

Sense.DEF: in the same direction as something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sailed with the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们顺风航行。

Sense.DEF: in spite of
Sense.EXAMPLE: With all his faults, I still like him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管他有种种缺点﹐我仍然喜欢他。

Sense.DEF: used to show who or what a strong wish or order concerns
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示某个强烈的愿望或强硬的命令所涉及的对象〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Down with school!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让学校见鬼去吧！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Off to bed with you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上床睡觉去！

Sense.DEF: to understand what someone is telling you or explaining to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I’m not with you – which room do you mean?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我不懂你的意思﹐你指的是哪个房间？
Sense.EXAMPLE: So that’s how the system works. Are you with me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统就是这样运行的。你听懂了吗？

Subsense.DEF: wearing fashionable clothes and knowing about new ideas
able to understand clearly what is happening around you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I’m not feeling very with it today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我今天反应有点迟钝。

Sense.DEF: immediately after doing or saying something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave a little wave and with that he was gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻轻地挥了一下手﹐随即就不见了。

Sense.DEF: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A knee injury forced her to withdraw from the competition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 膝伤使她不得不退出了比赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents have the right to withdraw their children from religious education lessons if they wish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长如有意愿﹐则有权让自己的孩子退出宗教教育课。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone pulls out of something such as a competition or organization rather than withdraws.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示退出竞赛﹑组织等﹐人们一般说pull out of﹐而不说withdraw
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She pulled out with a knee injury.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因膝伤退出。

Sense.DEF: to stop giving support or money to someone or something, especially as the result of an official decision
Sense.TRAN: 取消﹐不再给予﹐停止提供〔支持或金钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the minority parties had withdrawn its support for Chancellor Kohl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一个少数党已不再支持科尔总理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Union members will vote on whether to withdraw their labour stop working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会会员将投票决定是否罢工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government decision to withdraw funding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府取消拨款的决定

Sense.DEF: if you withdraw a threat, offer, request etc, you say that you no longer will do what you said
Sense.EXAMPLE: After much persuasion he agreed to withdraw his resignation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几经劝说﹐他同意收回辞呈。

Sense.DEF: if you withdraw a remark, criticism, statement etc, you say that what you said earlier was completely untrue
Sense.TRAN: 收回﹐撤回 〔言论﹑批评﹑声明等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to withdraw his remarks and was expelled from the Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝收回自己说过的话﹐被开除出党。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspaper has agreed to withdraw its allegations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报社已同意撤回指控。

Sense.DEF: if a product or service is withdrawn, it is no longer offered for sale or use
Sense.TRAN: 撤回﹐停止销售〔产品或服务〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: withdraw sth from sale/from the market
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drug has been withdrawn from the market for further tests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该药已经停止销售以作进一步检测。

Subsense.DEF: if an army withdraws, or if it is withdrawn, it leaves a place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the USA’s decision to withdraw 40,000 troops from western Europe
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国要从西欧撤军四万人的决定

Subsense.DEF: to leave a place, especially in order to be alone or go somewhere quiet
Subsense.TRAN: 离开〔某处﹐尤指想独处或去安静的地方〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We withdrew to the garden for a private talk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们躲到花园里去说悄悄话。

Sense.DEF: to take money out of a bank account

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to withdraw £500 from my current account.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想从活期账户中取出500英镑。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that someone takes or gets money out rather than withdraws it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说take money out或get money out﹐而不说withdraw
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can we stop off at the bank? I need to get some money out.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在银行停一下好吗？我要取些钱。

Sense.DEF: if you withdraw your hand, arm, finger etc from somewhere, you move it from there to where it was before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Claudia withdrew her hand from his.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克劳迪娅把手从他的手里抽了回来。

Sense.DEF: to take an object out from inside something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She withdrew a document from her briefcase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从她的公文包中取出一份文件。

Sense.DEF: to become quieter, less friendly, and only concerned about your own thoughts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ralph has withdrawn from the other kids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫不与别的孩子交往了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many depressed people just withdraw into themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多患抑郁症的人就是把自己封闭起来。

Sense.DEF: the act of moving an army, weapons etc away from the area where they were fighting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the withdrawal of UN forces
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国部队的撤离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Russian withdrawal from Afghanistan
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏联从阿富汗的撤军

Sense.EXAMPLE: large-scale troop withdrawals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模撤军

Sense.DEF: the removal or stopping of something such as support, an offer, or a service
Sense.TRAN: 〔对支持﹑建议﹑服务等的〕取消﹐收回

GramExa.EXAMPLE: withdrawal of government aid
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府援助的取消

Sense.DEF: the act of taking money from a bank account, or the amount you take out
Sense.TRAN: 〔从银行账户中的〕取款﹔取款额
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customers can use the machine to make withdrawals of up to £250 a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客户每天最多可以用取款机提取250英镑。

Sense.DEF: the act of no longer taking part in an activity or being a member of an organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Germany’s withdrawal from the talks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国退出谈判

Sense.DEF: the period after someone has given up a drug that they were dependent on, and the unpleasant mental and physical effects that this causes
the act of saying that something you previously said was in fact untrue

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the withdrawal of all allegations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 撤回所有指控

Sense.DEF: the painful or unpleasant feelings someone has after they have stopped taking a drug that they were dependent on
Sense.TRAN: 脱瘾症状﹐戒断症状〔戒毒后出现的症状〕

Sense.DEF: very shy and quiet, and concerned only about your own thoughts
Sense.TRAN: 孤僻的﹔内向的﹔沉默寡言的
Sense.EXAMPLE: After his wife’s death he became more and more withdrawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子去世后﹐他变得越来越自闭。

Sense.DEF: if plants wither, they become drier and smaller and start to die
to gradually become weaker or less successful and then end
Sense.EXAMPLE: His career had withered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的职业生涯已每况愈下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization just withered away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个组织渐渐解体了。

Sense.DEF: if something withers on the vine, it gradually ends because it is not given enough support
Sense.TRAN: 〔因缺乏支持而〕中途夭折﹐未能成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has allowed the program to wither on the vine by reducing its funding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府减少了对该计划的财政支持﹐使其半途夭折了。

Sense.DEF: a withered plant has become drier and smaller and is dead or dying
a withered person looks thin and weak and old
a withered arm or leg has not developed properly and is thin and weak
Sense.TRAN: 〔胳膊或腿〕发育不良的﹐萎缩的

Sense.DEF: a look, remark etc that makes someone feel stupid, embarrassed, or lose confidence
Sense.TRAN: 打击性的眼神/言语等﹐咄咄逼人的眼神/言语等

Sense.DEF: the highest part of a horse’s back, above its shoulders
Sense.TRAN: 鬐甲〔马背最高的部位﹐在肩胛骨之间〕

Sense.DEF: to refuse to give someone something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I withheld payment until they had completed the work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我扣着钱﹐直到他们完工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ian was accused of withholding vital information from the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩被控向警方隐瞒重要信息。

Sense.DEF: money that is taken out of your wages as tax
before a certain period of time has passed
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should have the test results back within 24 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们24小时之内应该可以拿到化验结果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fell sick and died within a matter of weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他病倒了﹐不出几星期就死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within an hour of our arrival Caroline was starting to complain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到达还没有一小时﹐卡罗琳就开始抱怨了。

Sense.DEF: during a certain period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enormous success of televised sport within the last twenty years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去20年里电视转播体育比赛取得的巨大成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within the space of a year, three of the town’s factories have closed down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年之内﹐镇上已有三家工厂关闭。

Sense.DEF: less than a certain distance from a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The invading troops came within 50 miles of Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侵略军距离巴黎不到50英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within a five mile radius of Ollerton there are several pubs and restaurants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥勒顿半径五英里范围之内有一些酒吧和餐馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We live within easy reach of close to the shops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住得离商店都很近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adjust the driver’s seat so that all the controls are within reach close enough to touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调整驾驶座椅﹐让所有控制装置都伸手可及。

GramExa.GLOSS: close enough to see or hear
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 能看到/听到（某事物）的近距离
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As she came within sight of the house, she saw two men getting out of a car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当她走近能看到那房子的时候﹐发现两名男子从一辆车里出来。

Sense.DEF: inside a particular building or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prisoners who died were buried within the walls of the prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死去的犯人被埋在监狱的围墙之内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: public footpaths within the national park
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家公园里的公共人行道
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rooms within were richly furnished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里面的房间陈设豪华。

GramExa.GLOSS: used on notices on the outside of buildings
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 入内面洽/洽询〔用于建筑物外的通告〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Baby rabbits for sale. Enquire within.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售幼兔﹐请入内洽询。

Sense.DEF: inside a society, organization, or group of people
Sense.TRAN: 在〔社会﹑组织或一群人〕中
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been a lot of changes within the department since I joined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自我加入后﹐部门内发生了很多变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to reform the system from within
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从内部改革体制的尝试

Sense.DEF: if something stays within a particular limit or set of rules, it does not go beyond that limit
Sense.TRAN: 不出〔规定的范围或限度〕﹐在〔规定的范围或限度〕之内
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to operate within a very tight budget.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须在很紧的预算内运作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Security firms have to work strictly within the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安公司必须严格在法律范围之内从事活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can go anywhere you want within reason within reasonable limits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在合理范围内你想去哪里都可以。

Sense.DEF: inside a person’s body or mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elaine felt a pain deep within her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莱恩感到内心深处很痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling more relaxed within myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心里觉得更轻松了。

Sense.DEF: fashionable and modern in the way that you dress, think etc
not having something, especially something that is basic or necessary
Sense.TRAN: 缺乏﹐没有〔尤指基本或必要之物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the storm we were without electricity for five days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨之后我们断电了五天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house without a garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不带花园的房子
Sense.EXAMPLE: We passed two ruined abbeys, one with a tower and one without.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们路过两座破落的寺院﹐一座有塔楼﹐另一座没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m getting used to managing without a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经习惯没有汽车了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular thing has not happened when someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly and without any warning, the army opened fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有任何警告﹐军队突然开火了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had gone out without his parents’ permission.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他未经父母同意便出去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I accepted his offer without a moment’s hesitation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我毫不犹豫地接受了他的提议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got to my destination without too much difficulty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没费太大周折就到达了目的地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you expect?’ he said, without looking at her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你指望什么呢？”他看也不看她说道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Without so much as a word of thanks, Ben turned and went back into the office he did not even say thank you as he should have done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本连一个谢字都没说﹐转身就回到了办公室。

Sense.DEF: not feeling or showing that you feel a particular emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He told his story without anger or bitterness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲述了自己的故事﹐没有怒气﹐也没有怨恨。

Sense.DEF: not being with someone, or not having them to help you, especially someone you like or need
Sense.TRAN: 无﹐没有〔人相伴或给予帮助〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what I’d do without you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道没有你我该怎么办。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Won’t you be lonely without her?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有她你不会寂寞吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rest of the group set off without him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 队里的其他人出发了﹐只留下他一人。

Sense.DEF: used before a criticism, complaint, or other statement to make it less strong
Sense.TRAN: 不想/不愿意做某事〔用于批评﹑投诉或其他陈述之前﹐使语气委婉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without wanting to sound too boastful, I think we have the best television programmes in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不是想吹嘘﹐我确实觉得我们有世界上最精彩的电视节目。

Sense.DEF: outside
to be strong enough to remain unharmed by something such as great heat, cold, pressure etc
Sense.TRAN: 耐受﹐承受〔酷热﹑严寒﹑高压等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This fabric can withstand steam and high temperatures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种织物耐蒸汽和高温。

Sense.DEF: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you
Sense.TRAN: 抵挡﹐顶住〔人们的攻击﹑批评或反对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总理顶住批评﹐坚持立场。

Sense.DEF: feeling very frightened
not very intelligent or sensible
someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One witness to the accident said the driver appeared to be drunk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故的一名目击者说司机似乎喝醉了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an eye witness someone who sees an event to the robbery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢劫案的一名目击者

Sense.DEF: someone who appears in a court of law to say what they know about a crime or other event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the key witness in the case against the brothers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 起诉那几兄弟一案中的关键证人

Sense.EXAMPLE: The defence is expected to call them as witnesses .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计辩方会传召他们作为证人。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone the prosecution or defence lawyers choose as a witness in order to help prove their case

Sense.DEF: someone who is present when an official document is signed, and who signs it too, to say that they saw it being signed
Sense.TRAN: 〔签署正式文件的〕见证人﹐连署人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a witness to a will
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗嘱的见证人

Sense.DEF: to be present when something happens, and watch it happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were witness to the worst excesses of the military.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们目击了最恶劣的军队暴行。

Sense.DEF: a public statement of strong Christian belief, or someone who makes such a statement
Sense.TRAN: 见证〔表示笃信基督教的公开声明〕﹔见证人〔作这种见证的人〕

Sense.DEF: to see something happen, especially a crime or accident
Sense.TRAN: 目击﹐亲眼看见〔尤指罪案或事故〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several residents claim to have witnessed the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几位居民称目击了袭击事件。

Sense.DEF: to experience important events or changes
Sense.TRAN: 亲身经历〔重要的事件或变化〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Priests have witnessed an increase in religious intolerance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师们亲身感受到宗教偏执在日益加重。

Sense.DEF: if a time or place witnesses an event, the event happens during that time or in that place
Sense.TRAN: 是发生〔某事件〕的时间[地点]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent years have witnessed the collapse of the steel industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近几年钢铁产业崩溃了。

Sense.DEF: if you witness the signing of an official document, you are there when it is signed, and sign it yourself to prove this
Sense.TRAN: 在〔正式文件〕上签名﹐连署
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you witness my signature ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你愿意在我的签字旁连署吗？

Sense.DEF: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 以…作证〔用于给刚提及的事举例〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bad economic times can result in political dictatorships. Witness Germany in the 1930s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济不景气时代可能导致政治独裁﹐20世纪30年代的德国便是证明。

Sense.DEF: to speak publicly about your Christian beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 作见证〔公开表示笃信基督教〕

Sense.DEF: the place in a court of law where a witness stands to answer questions
to talk a lot in a boring way or about something unimportant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sick of her wittering on about her boyfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很讨厌她没完没了地讲她的男朋友。

Sense.DEF: a clever amusing remark
using words in a clever and amusing way
Sense.TRAN: 说话风趣的﹔妙趣横生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: witty remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妙语
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura’s very witty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉谈吐很风趣。

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
wife
a man who is supposed to have magic powers
someone who is very good at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a financial wizard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金融奇才

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben’s a real wizard at chess.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本是个国际象棋奇才。

Sense.DEF: impressive ability at something or an impressive achievement
Sense.EXAMPLE: high-speed Internet connections and other technical wizardry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网的高速连接和其他技术成就

Sense.DEF:
a wizened person, fruit etc is small and thin and has skin with a lot of lines and
wrinkle s

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= week 星期﹐周

Sense.DEF: to move unsteadily from side to side, or make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pile of bricks wobbled and fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那堆砖摇摇晃晃地倒塌了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom stopped, wobbling from the weight of his load.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆停下来﹐身上的东西压得他摇摇晃晃。

Sense.DEF: to go in a particular direction while moving unsteadily from side to side

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cindy wobbled along the street on her bike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛迪歪歪扭扭地骑着自行车沿街而行。

Sense.DEF: to be unsure whether to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President appeared to wobble over sending the troops in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在派兵问题上显得犹豫不决。

Sense.DEF: moving unsteadily from side to side
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wobbly table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摇摇晃晃的桌子

Sense.DEF: if you or your legs feel wobbly, you feel weak and unable to keep your balance
a wobbly voice is weak and shakes, especially because you feel frightened or upset
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因感到害怕或不安而声音〕微弱颤抖的

Sense.DEF: not very good or not likely to be successful
Sense.TRAN: 不太好的﹔不大可能成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting yesterday got off to a wobbly start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天的会议开头不顺利。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very angry or frightened
a thick solid piece or large amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wodge of ten pound notes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一厚叠十英镑钞票

Sense.DEF: the problems and troubles affecting someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s economic woes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的经济困难

Sense.DEF: great sadness
used to say that you are extremely unhappy or in a difficult situation
used to warn someone that there will be trouble if they do something – especially used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某人将要遭殃〔用于警告某人做某事会有麻烦﹐幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Woe betide anyone who smokes in our house!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁在我们房子里抽烟谁倒霉！

Sense.DEF: looking very sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: her woebegone expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满脸的愁容

Sense.DEF: very bad or serious
Sense.TRAN: 极坏的﹐糟透的﹔极严重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woeful lack of information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息极其匮乏

Sense.DEF: very sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: woeful eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲伤的眼神

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a black person. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 黑鬼﹐黑鬼佬〔对黑人的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF: a wide pan shaped like a bowl, used in Chinese cooking
Sense.TRAN: 〔中国烹饪中使用的〕铁锅﹐镬子

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
wake

the past participle of
wake
a word for an area of hilly countryside, especially used in the names of places
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Lincolnshire Wolds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林肯郡丘陵

Sense.DEF: a wild animal that looks like a large dog and lives and hunts in groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pack of wolves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群狼

Sense.DEF: someone who seems to be friendly or harmless but is in fact dangerous, dishonest etc

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep the wolf from the door
Sense.DEF: to earn just enough money to buy the basic things you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: I work part-time in a coffee shop just to keep the wolf from the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在一家咖啡馆打零工﹐勉强糊口。

Sense.DEF: to eat something very quickly, swallowing it in big pieces
a type of extremely large dog
a way of whistling that men sometimes use to show that they think a woman is attractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔男人对美貌女子吹的〕挑逗口哨

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
wolf
an adult female person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was talking to a woman I met on the flight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正和一个在飞机上认识的女子交谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: married women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已婚妇女
Sense.EXAMPLE: a popular women’s magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本受欢迎的女性杂志
Sense.EXAMPLE: When a woman is pregnant, the levels of hormones in her body change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人怀孕时﹐体内的荷尔蒙水平会发生变化。

GramExa.GLOSS: a priest etc who is a woman
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ireland’s first woman president
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱尔兰的第一位女总统
GramExa.EXAMPLE: women artists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女艺术家

Sense.DEF: women in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: A woman’s work is never done used to say that women have a lot to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人的活儿永远干不完。

Sense.DEF: a woman who has a particular kind of job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congresswoman Ellen Tauscher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会女议员埃伦•陶舍尔

Sense.DEF: a woman that a man is having a sexual relationship with, even though he is married to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 别的女人〔指已婚男人的情人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he’s got another woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢肯定他有别的女人了。

Sense.DEF: to make your own decisions and be in charge of your own life, without depending on anyone else
a word meaning a wife or girlfriend, which many women find offensive
Sense.TRAN: 老婆﹔女朋友〔许多女性认为这具有冒犯性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did he bring his new woman with him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带新女朋友来了吗？

Sense.DEF: a rude way of speaking to a woman when you are angry, annoyed etc
Sense.TRAN: 婆娘〔生气﹑恼怒等时对妇女的粗鲁称呼〕

Sense.DEF: a female servant or person who does cleaning work for you in your house

Crossrefto.REFLEX: make an honest woman (out) of sb
be a woman of the world

Exponent.DEF: a female adult person
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a young woman with dark brown hair
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个深褐色头发的年轻女子

Exponent.DEF: a polite word for a woman – used especially when you do not know the woman, or when the person you are talking to does not know the woman
Exponent.TRAN: 女士,夫人,小姐〔礼貌称呼,尤用于称呼或谈及不认识的女子〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A glass of white wine please, for this lady here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给这位女士来杯白葡萄酒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The young lady stood up and shook my hand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位年轻女士站起来和我握手。

Exponent.DEF: a young female person – usually used about someone younger than about twenty
Exponent.TRAN: 女孩,姑娘〔通常用于年龄约在20岁以下的年轻女子〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a very pretty girl
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很漂亮的女孩
Exponent.EXAMPLE: teenage girls
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女

Exponent.DEF: a woman – used especially when you are giving information about women, for example in surveys and reports
Exponent.TRAN: 女性,女人〔尤用于正式调查﹑报告等提供有关女性的信息时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Females account for 46% of Internet users.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网用户中女性占46%。

Section.SECHEADING: RELATING TO WOMEN 与女性有关的

Exponent.DEF: relating to women or girls
Exponent.EXAMPLE: female voters
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性选民
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Advertisers try to sell things by using images of the female body.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告商试图利用女性的身体形象来推销商品。

Exponent.DEF: used about qualities that are considered to be typical of women
Exponent.TRAN: 有女性气质的,具女性特征的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must not cry or show any other feminine weakness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不可以哭,也不可以表现出任何其他的女性弱点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the ideal of feminine beauty
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性美的完美典型

Exponent.DEF: behaving, dressing etc in a way that is thought to be typical of or suitable for a woman – used to show approval
Exponent.TRAN: 有女子气质的,有女人味的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: her womanly figure
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她富于女性美的形体
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the womanly virtues of compassion and patience
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有同情心和耐心的女性美德

Exponent.DEF: behaving or dressing in a way that is thought to be typical of young girls, or suitable for a girl – often used disapprovingly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stop being so girly! It’s only a mouse!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么女孩子气！那只是只老鼠！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a very girlie pink dress
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很女孩气的粉红色连衣裙

Exponent.DEF: a man who is effeminate looks or behaves like a woman
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His long blonde hair made him look rather effeminate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长长的金发使他看上去很女人气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pale effeminate-looking young man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个面色苍白、女里女气的青年男子

Sense.DEF: the state of being a woman, not a man or a girl
women in general
a womanish man looks or behaves in a way that is thought to be typical of women
Sense.TRAN: 〔男人的外表或举止〕女人气的﹐娘娘腔的

Sense.DEF: a man who has sexual relationships with many different women – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 玩弄女性的男人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: women considered together as a group
behaving, dressing etc in a way that is thought to be typical of or suitable for a woman – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑衣着等〕有女子气质的﹐有女人味的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: her soft womanly figure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那女人味十足的婀娜身段

Sense.DEF: the part of a woman’s or female animal’s body where her baby grows before it is born
an Australian animal like a small bear whose babies live in a pocket of skin on its body

the plural of
woman
all the women in a particular family or society
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个家庭或社会中的〕（全体）妇女

Sense.DEF: all the ideas, actions, and politics relating to giving women the same rights and opportunities as men

all the women who are involved in the aim of improving the social, economic, and political position of women and of ending sexual
discrimination
Sense.TRAN: 妇女（解放）运动﹐女权运动

Sense.DEF:
a public
toilet
for women
the study of women in history, literature, and society
Sense.TRAN: 〔历史﹑文学和社会学方面的〕妇女研究

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
win
a standard unit of money in ROK and DPRK
Sense.TRAN: 圆〔韩国和朝鲜的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wonder how James is getting on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想知道詹姆斯的近况。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想知道﹐他们现在打算怎么办呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wonder if I’ll recognize Philip after all these years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了这么多年﹐我不知道是否还认得菲利普。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: used to ask politely for something
Sense.TRAN: 我不知道是否〔用于礼貌地要求某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wonder if I might have a drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不可以要一杯饮料？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone politely to help you
Subsense.TRAN: 我想知道是否〔用于礼貌地请求帮助〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was wondering if I could borrow your car?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问我能否借一下你的汽车？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone politely if they would like to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 不知可不可以〔用于礼貌地请求他人做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was wondering if you’d like to come to dinner.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知道你是否愿意来吃晚饭。

Sense.DEF: to feel surprised and unable to believe something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某事〕感到惊讶﹐感到难以置信

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I wonder about his behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时我对他的行为感到惊讶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wonder how he dares to show his face!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我奇怪他竟然还敢露面！

GramExa.GLOSS: I am not surprised
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t wonder you’re tired.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你感到疲倦﹐我并不奇怪。

GramExa.GLOSS: I would not be surprised about something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’ll come back soon enough, I shouldn’t wonder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就会回来﹐我不会觉得奇怪。

Sense.DEF: to doubt or question whether something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is she serious?’ ‘I wonder.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她是认真的吗？”“我怀疑。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I wonder if he’s got any sense at all!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我怀疑他到底有没有头脑！

Subsense.DEF: a feeling of surprise and admiration for something very beautiful or new to you
Subsense.TRAN: 〔对优美或新鲜事物的〕惊叹﹐惊奇
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The sight of the Taj Mahal filled us with wonder.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看见泰姬陵﹐我们满怀惊叹。

Subsense.DEF: something that makes you feel surprise and admiration
Subsense.EXAMPLE: technological wonders
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技奇迹
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Seven Wonders of the World
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界七大奇观

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not surprised by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: No wonder you’ve got a headache, the amount you drank last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怪不得你头痛﹐你昨晚喝太多了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a wonder no one got hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竟然没有人受伤﹐真是奇迹。

Sense.DEF: to be very effective in solving a problem
Sense.TRAN: 创造奇迹/取得惊人成效

Sense.DEF: used humorously to show you are surprised and pleased about something
Sense.TRAN: 永远都会有奇迹〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is good at doing difficult things
very good and effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new wonder drug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的灵丹妙药

Sense.DEF: making you feel very happy
Sense.TRAN: 令人高兴的﹐使人愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a wonderful time in Spain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在西班牙玩得非常开心。

Sense.DEF: making you admire someone or something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s wonderful what doctors can do nowadays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今医生的本领着实令人称奇。

Sense.DEF: very well or to a very great degree, in a way that makes you feel happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: All of the performers played wonderfully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有演员都表演得非常精彩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wonderfully rich sauce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓稠美味的酱汁

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows admiration, surprise, and pleasure
an imaginary place in stories
a feeling of pleasant surprise or admiration
good or impressive in a surprising way
someone who works very hard and is very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are issues that would only interest policy wonks people interested in details of government .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题只有政策研究专家才会感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: unsteady or not straight or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wonky table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摇摇晃晃的桌子

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘will not’

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is someone’s habit to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke for too long, as is his wont.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他像平常一样讲了太长的时间。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to do something
to try to persuade someone to do something such as buy something from you, vote for you, or work for you – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 极力劝说〔某人做某事〕﹐争取…的支持﹐拉拢〔用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Party’s efforts to woo working class voters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党拉拢工薪阶层选民的努力

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade a woman to love you and marry you
the material that trees are made of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put some more wood on the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往火上再添些木柴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a polished wood floor
