Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 擦得锃亮的木地板
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her house was made of wood .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她家的房子是木头盖的。

Sense.DEF: a small forest
Sense.EXAMPLE: a walk in the woods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林间的散步

Sense.DEF: said just after you have said that things are going well for you, when you want your good luck to continue
Sense.TRAN: 上帝保佑〔说自己好运后马上说此话﹐以期好运持续〕

Sense.DEF:
one of a set of four
golf club s
with wooden heads
Sense.TRAN: 木头球杆〔杆头为木制的高尔夫球杆〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: not be out of the wood(s) yet
Sense.DEF: used to say that there are likely to be more difficulties before things improve

Sense.LEXUNIT: not see the wood for the trees
Sense.DEF: to not notice what is important about something because you give too much of your attention to small details
Sense.TRAN: 见树不见林〔指过于关注细节而忽略重要部分〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can install a solid wood door.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以装一扇实木门。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not painted or covered
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The floors were of bare wood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板是光光的木头。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Oak is a hard wood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡木是一种硬木。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was chopping wood for the fire.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在劈柴。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A local carpenter cut the wood to size.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个本地木匠把木头截成合适的尺寸。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He made a bench out of pieces of wood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用几块木料做成了一张长凳。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a long thin flat piece
the natural lines in it
small rough pieces
thin curly pieces

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔木头未完全燃烧时冒出的〕木柴烟

Sense.DEF: a piece of wood with a shape cut on it, used for printing
a block of wood used in making a floor
the process of shaping wood with special tools, or a piece of art produced in this way

a
groundhog
the practical knowledge of woods and forests
Sense.TRAN: 林中生活技巧﹔森林知识

Sense.DEF: a picture made by pressing a shaped piece of wood and a colouring substance onto paper
someone whose job is to cut down trees in a forest
having woods or covered with trees
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wooded hills of Northern Virginia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北弗吉尼亚林木茂盛的丘陵

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a thickly wooded area
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木茂密的地区

Sense.DEF: made of wood
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wooden bench
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木制长椅

Sense.DEF: not showing enough expression, emotion, or movement, especially when performing in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公开表演时〕呆板的﹐木讷的﹐笨拙的

Sense.DEF: a large spoon made of wood, used to mix things when cooking
to come last in a competition
an area of land covered with trees
a small grey creature like an insect that lives under wood, stones etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活在木头﹑石块等下面的〕潮虫

Sense.DEF: a bird with a long beak that it uses to make holes in trees
a pile of wood to be burned in a fire
wood crushed into a soft mass, used for making paper
a place for storing wood for burning
someone who works in a forest taking care of, planting, and cutting down trees
relating to the woods
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woodsy smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树林的气息

PIC.HEADING: WOODWIND INSTRUMENTS 木管乐器
PIC.PICCONTENT: recorder 竖笛；piccolo 短笛；flute 长笛；saxophone 萨克斯管；clarinet 单簧管；oboe 双簧管；bassoon 巴松管

Sense.DEF:
musical instruments made of wood or metal that you play by blowing and that usually have finger holes or
key s
Sense.EXAMPLE: woodwind instruments such as the flute or saxophone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木管乐器﹐如长笛和萨克斯管

Sense.DEF:
the people in an
orchestra
or band who play woodwind instruments
the skill or activity of making wooden objects
the parts of a house or room that are made of wood
if someone crawls out of the woodwork, they suddenly and unexpectedly appear in order to take advantage of a situation, express their opinion etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔为得到好处﹑发表意见等而〕突然冒出来﹐突然露面〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to seem to disappear, or to behave in such a way that no one notices you
a small insect that makes holes in wood
the damage that is caused to wood by this creature
a woody plant has a stem like wood
a woody area of land has a lot of trees growing on it
a word used for describing the sound a dog makes

the
weft
the soft thick hair that sheep and some goats have on their body
material made from wool
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pure wool skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯羊毛裙子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mix of 80% wool and 20% man-made fibres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 80%羊毛和20%人造纤维的混纺织物

Sense.DEF:
thread made from wool that you use to
knit
clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ball of wool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团毛线

Sense.LEXUNIT: pull the wool over sb’s eyes
Sense.DEF: to deceive someone by not telling the truth
made of wool
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woollen scarf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羊毛围巾

Sense.DEF: relating to making cloth from wool
Sense.EXAMPLE: the woollen industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛纺业
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woollen mill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛纺厂

Sense.DEF:
clothes made from wool, especially
knit ted
clothes such as
sweater s
etc
made of or feeling like wool
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woolly hat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羊毛帽子

Sense.DEF: not showing clear thinking
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave a rather woolly argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提了个思路相当混乱的论点。

Sense.DEF:
a
sweater
or similar piece of
knit ted
clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll need your winter woollies!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会需要冬天穿的毛衣！

Sense.DEF: feeling weak and unsteady
Sense.EXAMPLE: Giving blood makes me feel really woozy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 献血后我会觉得头晕目眩。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone who is Italian. Do not use this word.
a single group of letters that are used together with a particular meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Write an essay of about five hundred words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写一篇约500字的文章。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does that word mean?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个单词是什么意思？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Vater’ is the German word for that means ‘father’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: vater在德语中是“父亲”的意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps ‘lucky’ is not exactly the right word .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许“幸运”一词还不够贴切。

Sense.DEF: the things that someone says or writes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those are his words, not mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那都是他说的话﹐我可没这么说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jones was, in the judge’s words, ‘an evil man’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用法官的话来说﹐琼斯是个“邪恶的人”。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In your own words, explain the term ‘personal service’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用你自己的话解释一下“个性化服务”的意思。

Sense.DEF: the words that are sung as part of a song
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know the tune, but I’ve forgotten the words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道曲调﹐但把歌词忘了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people don’t know the words to the country’s national anthem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国许多人不知道国歌的歌词。

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone quickly, especially because you need their advice about something or you want to tell them to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某人〕说几句话〔尤因要征求对方意见或叫对方做事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could I have a word?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可否谈谈？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll have a word with him and see if he’ll help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要和他谈谈﹐看他是否愿意帮忙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was hoping to have a quick word with you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望能和你简短地说两句。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could I have a few words with you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以和你说几句话吗？

Sense.DEF: to want to talk to someone, especially in order to criticize them
Sense.TRAN: 想和某人谈话〔尤指为批评某人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wait a minute! I want a word with you!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下！我想和你谈谈！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you cannot hear, understand etc what someone says or writes
Sense.TRAN: 一点都听不到/不理解/不相信
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one could hear a word because someone had cut the amplifier cable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人听得到﹐因为有人把扩音器的电线切断了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t understand a word of Russian.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一句俄语也不懂。

Sense.DEF: if you do something without a word, you do not say anything while you do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left without a word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一句话也没说就离开了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: say a word/say a few words
Sense.DEF: to make a short speech about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to say a few words about the plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想就计划说两句。

Sense.DEF: something you say that warns someone, thanks them etc
Sense.TRAN: 警告/告诫/建议/感谢等的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a beautiful city, but a word of warning: street robberies are very common.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个美丽的城市﹐但是我提醒一句: 街头抢劫的事屡见不鲜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left without a word of apology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一句道歉的话也没说就走了。

Subsense.DEF: to not say anything about something because it is a secret
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Promise you won’t say a word to anyone?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你保证不跟任何人说？

Subsense.DEF: to not say anything
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What’s wrong? You haven’t said a word since you got here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么了？你来了以后还没说过一句话呢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put your feelings/thoughts etc into words
Sense.DEF: to express what you want to say clearly
Sense.TRAN: 用语言表达自己的感觉/思想等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found it difficult to put ideas into words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现很难用语言表达自己的想法。

Sense.DEF: to argue – use this when you do not want to make the argument seem serious
Sense.TRAN: （与某人）吵架﹐（和某人）吵嘴〔委婉说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was in a bad mood and he kept pestering me, so we had words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我情绪不好而他又一直烦我﹐所以我们就吵了起来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a harsh/a cross/an angry etc word
Sense.DEF: something you say that shows you are angry or want to criticize someone
Sense.TRAN: 刺耳/生气/气愤等的言辞
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mountain rescue teams have harsh words to say to people who climb without proper equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山地救援队想要批评那些不带必要装备的登山者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were married for 50 years and she says there was never an angry word between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们结婚50年﹐她说他们之间从未有过激烈的言语。

Sense.DEF: a piece of news or a message
Sense.EXAMPLE: Word came that our duties would be changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有消息说我们的职责会有变动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you heard from Ann?’ ‘No, not a word.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你有安的消息吗？”“没有﹐一点消息也没有。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was still no word from John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还是没有约翰的消息。

GramExa.GLOSS: people hear about something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a very small town and if you do something bad, word gets around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个很小的镇子﹐要是有人做了坏事﹐消息很快就会传开。

GramExa.GLOSS: people are saying that
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The word is that the two companies are planning a merger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们都说这两家公司正计划合并。

GramExa.GLOSS: tell other people some information or news
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Health officials are encouraging people to spread the word about the benefits of exercise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生官员鼓励人们宣传锻炼身体的好处。

GramExa.GLOSS: send or bring a message
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传话
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mayor sent word he’d be late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长传话说他会晚一点到。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Word of mouth information you get by someone telling you is one of the best ways of getting business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口口相传是做生意最好的方法之一。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Much of this information is picked up by word of mouth from previous students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中很多信息是从往届学生的口中得知的。

Subsense.DEF: the power to decide whether or how to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The final word on policy determination belongs to the committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的决策权掌握在委员会手中。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: She has the final word on whether policies are put into action or not.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策实施与否由她说了算。

Subsense.DEF: the last statement or speech in a discussion or argument
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The last word must go to Nick, who has organized the whole project.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的发言必须由尼克来作﹐他是整个项目的策划者。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why must you always have the last word in any argument?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么每次争论都得你最后说了算？

Subsense.DEF: in sports, the last hit or kick in a game, especially when it is successful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Adams had the final word with a last-minute goal.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当斯最后一分钟进球﹐锁定胜局。

Sense.DEF: a sincere promise to do something, or a promise that what you say is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I trust him to keep his word .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信他会履行诺言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I give you my word I promise that it won’t happen again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向你保证这种事不会再发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had given their word of honour that they would not attempt to escape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已郑重保证不会试图逃跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We only have his word for it that he has already paid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是听他自己说他已经付款了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Delors claimed that Johnson had gone back on his word not done what he had promised to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德洛尔声称约翰逊违背了诺言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is doing very well. You can take my word for it accept that what I say is true .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意很红火﹐你可以相信我的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never know whether to take him at his word believe what he says .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来不知道该不该相信他的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His word is his bond he always does what he promises to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他信守诺言。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be true to your word/be as good as your word
GramExa.GLOSS: do what you promise to do

GramExa.PROPFORM: a man of his word/a woman of her word
GramExa.GLOSS: a man or woman who does what they have promised to do

Subsense.DEF: in exactly the same words
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The newspaper printed his speech more or less word for word.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸几乎逐字逐句刊登了他的讲话。

Subsense.DEF: if you translate a piece of writing word for word, you translate the meaning of each single word rather than the meaning of a whole phrase or sentence

Sense.DEF: used before giving a very simple answer or explanation
Sense.TRAN: 总之﹐一句话﹐简言之〔用于引出十分简单的答案或解释〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are, in a word, busy. Ridiculously busy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总之﹐我们很忙﹐忙得离谱。

Sense.DEF: saying something in a way that is very easy to understand, especially because the person you are talking to is stupid
Sense.TRAN: 用极其简单的话〔尤因对方很笨〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to put everything in words of one syllable for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每件事你都得用非常简单的话对她解释。

Sense.DEF: in a direct way, or in a way that makes it very clear what you mean
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aunt Fay wasn’t happy and said so in as many words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费伊姑妈不开心﹐并且明确地这么说了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take the words (right) out of sb’s mouth
Sense.DEF: if someone takes the words out of your mouth, they have just said what you were going to say
to tell someone what you think they are trying to say, in a way that annoys them
Sense.TRAN: 硬说某人说过某些话﹔把话强加于某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you stop putting words into my mouth – I never said I disliked the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不要信口开河——我从未说过不喜欢这份工作。

Sense.DEF: an order to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the word ‘go’ everyone has to run to the end of the room and back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一听到“开始”的口令﹐所有人就必须跑到房间尽头并返回。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I give the word , grab him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一下命令﹐你们就抓住他。

Sense.DEF: from the beginning of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The marriage was a disaster from the word go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场婚姻从一开始就是灾难。

Sense.DEF: extremely silly, complicated etc
Sense.TRAN: 傻/复杂/荒谬等得难以形容
Sense.EXAMPLE: His behaviour has been too pathetic for words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的举止太不像话了！

Sense.DEF: to say something to someone privately, especially to give them advice or a warning
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指把建议或警告〕私下告诉某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I were you, I’d have a word in his ear before it’s too late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我的话﹐就会趁现在还来得及悄悄地和他说一声。

Sense.DEF: to get a chance to say something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once George starts talking it’s difficult to get a word in edgeways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治一开口﹐别人就很难插得上嘴。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put in a (good) word for sb
Sense.DEF: to try to help someone get or achieve something by saying good things about them to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 为某人说好话〔以帮助他得到某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got the job because Paul put in a good word for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得到这份工作是因为保罗为我说了好话。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are so surprised, angry, or shocked that you do not know what to say
Sense.TRAN: 〔因惊讶﹑生气或震惊〕说不出话来﹐不知说什么好
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ... words fail me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我……我不知说什么好。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you understand or agree with what someone has just said
used when you are very surprised
Sense.EXAMPLE: My word! Hasn’t she grown?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀！她长那么大啦？

Sense.LEXUNIT: surprised/angry/pleased etc isn’t the word for it
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are extremely surprised, angry etc
Sense.TRAN: 惊讶极了/生气极了/高兴极了等

Sense.LEXUNIT: a man/woman etc of few words
Sense.DEF: someone who does not say very much
Sense.TRAN: 寡言少语的男子/女子等
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was a man of few words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲是个话很少的人。

Sense.DEF: the religious ideas and messages in the Bible
Sense.TRAN: 神的话﹐上帝的道〔《圣经》里的宗教思想和信息〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be the last word in sth

Exponent.DEF: a single group of letters that are used together with a particular meaning
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Casa’ is the Italian word for ‘house’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: casa是意大利语“房子”的意思。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I looked up the word in a dictionary.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在词典里查了这个单词。

Exponent.DEF: a word that you use for a particular thing, place, organization etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Iberia is the ancient name for the Spanish Peninsula.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊比利亚是西班牙半岛的古代名称。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s the name of that type of dog?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种狗叫什么？

Exponent.DEF: a word or group of words that is used in a specific subject or area of language
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The medical term for losing your hair is ‘alopecia’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: alopecia是表示“脱发”的医学术语。

Exponent.DEF: a group of words that have a particular meaning when used together, or which someone uses on a particular occasion
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We don’t really have a phrase for ‘bon appétit’ in English.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: bon appétit（【法】愿你胃口好）在我们英语中没有很对应的说法。

Exponent.DEF: a fixed phrase which is used in a language and has a particular meaning
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He uses a lot of obscure expressions that I don’t really understand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用了许多我不太懂的晦涩措辞。

Exponent.DEF: a word or group of words that people in a particular type of work or activity have started using a lot because they think it is important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: E-learning is the buzzword in educational publishing at the moment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在线学习是时下教育出版行业的流行语。

Exponent.DEF: a group of words that has a special meaning which you cannot guess from the meanings of each separate word
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Full of beans’ is an idiom which means feeling lively and energetic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: full of beans是习语﹐意思是感觉充满活力﹐精力充沛。

Exponent.DEF: a group of words that is used so often that it seems rather boring, annoying, or silly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a bit of a cliché, but good communication skills are the key to success.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这话说起来有些老套,不过良好的沟通能力的确是成功的关键因素。

Exponent.DEF: very informal words used especially by a particular group of people such as young people, criminals, or soldiers
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Grass is slang for marijuana.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: grass是俚语﹐指大麻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: prison slang
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱俚语

Exponent.DEF: words and phrases used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The instructions were full of technical jargon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本说明书里都是些技术术语。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: complicated legal jargon
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 复杂的法律术语

Sense.DEF: to use words that are carefully chosen in order to express something
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can we word the letter so as not to offend the parents?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信我们怎么措辞才不会得罪家长？

Sense.DEF: using words that express an idea carefully or clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carefully worded question
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 措辞谨慎的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strongly worded letter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一封措辞强硬的信

Sense.DEF: the words and phrases used to express something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exact wording of the contract
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同的确切措辞

Sense.DEF: without using words
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wordless prayer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 默祷
Sense.EXAMPLE: She threw her arms around him in wordless grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她张开双臂一把抱住他﹐满怀无言的悲痛。

Sense.DEF: able to remember and say every word of something correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rehearsed her speech until she was word-perfect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她反复练习﹐直到把讲稿背得滚瓜烂熟。

Sense.DEF: making jokes by using words in a clever way
Sense.TRAN: 文字游戏﹔俏皮话﹔双关语

Sense.DEF: computer software or a small computer that you use for writing letters and other documents
Sense.TRAN: 文字处理软件﹔文字处理机〔一种小型计算机〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most reports are produced on a word processor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数报告是用文字处理机写成的。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I mostly use my computer for word processing.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常用电脑做文字处理工作。
用文字处理机写成的文件

Sense.DEF: someone who is clever at using language
using too many words
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wordy explanation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冗长的解释

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
wear
to do a job that you are paid for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where do you work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在哪里上班？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many young people in the area have never worked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的许多年轻人从未工作过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The injury means he’ll probably never work again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这伤意味着他很有可能再也不能工作了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He works for a law firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一家律师事务所工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I work at the university.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这所大学工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She works as a consultant for a design company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一家设计公司当顾问。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The studies were undertaken by people working in education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些研究是教育界人士做的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I work part-time in a library.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在一家图书馆兼职。

Sense.DEF: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sally isn’t working tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉明天不上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff will have to get used to a new way of working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工必须适应新的工作方式。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the women I work with is getting married this weekend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一位女同事这个周末结婚。

GramExa.GLOSS: have someone who is in charge of you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each site has a fully trained team who work under a site manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个工地都有一支训练有素的队伍﹐在工地经理手下工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I get paid more if I work nights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是上夜班就可以多拿工资。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re sometimes expected to work twelve-hour days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有时候需要一天工作12小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you working late working after the time you usually finish again tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今晚又要加班吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forty police officers are working round the clock working day and night without stopping to find Murray’s killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了找出杀害默里的凶手﹐40名警察正日夜工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nowadays, many people are able to work from home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐很多人可以在家工作。

Sense.DEF: if you work with someone or a group of people, your job involves trying to help them
Sense.TRAN: 从事帮助〔某人或某群体〕的工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s just retired after 38 years working with children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她做了38年儿童工作﹐刚刚退休。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has worked among some of the world’s poorest people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做过扶贫工作﹐帮助过一些世界上最穷困的人。

Sense.DEF: to spend time and effort doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been working in the garden all afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一下午都在花园里干活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to have to work really hard to pass these exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要通过这些考试﹐我必须非常刻苦地学习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re working together to develop a new system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在合作开发一种新系统。

Sense.DEF: to try continuously to achieve a particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are working towards a solution to their problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正设法找到解决问题的方法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will work for the release of the hostages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会争取让人质获释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are working to provide more help for victims of crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在尽力为犯罪受害人提供更多帮助。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is working hard to improve its image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司正竭力提升自身形象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He worked tirelessly worked very hard in a determined way for the charity throughout his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毕生为这个慈善机构孜孜不倦地工作。

Subsense.DEF: if a machine or piece of equipment works, it does what it is supposed to do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You should check that the smoke alarm is working properly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该检查一下烟雾警报器运转是否正常。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The delete key doesn’t work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 删除键失灵了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t get the heater to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法让加热器正常工作。

Subsense.DEF: to make a machine or piece of equipment do what it is supposed to do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My parents can’t even work the video.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母甚至连录像机都不会用。

Sense.DEF: to be effective or successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Making a marriage work can take a lot of effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要让婚姻美满有时需要付出很大努力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never found a diet that works.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未找到过有效的节食方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recipe works just as well if you use margarine instead of butter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果用人造黄油代替食谱中的天然黄油﹐效果一样好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cream works immediately to relieve sore skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种乳霜可以立即缓解皮肤疼痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to find which method works best for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要找出哪种方法对你最有用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drug that works against some types of cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种对某些癌症有疗效的药物

Sense.DEF: if something such as a fact, situation, or system works in a particular way, it has a particular effect on someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arrangement works well for everyone involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项安排对所有参与者都有利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The French team are the heavier crew, which should work in their favour help them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国队体重更重﹐这应该对他们有利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sexism still works against harms or causes problems for women in many professions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性别歧视依然在许多行业阻碍女性的发展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loyalty works both ways involves two opposite or matching effects : we are loyal to our employees and, in turn, they are loyal to us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠诚是相互的: 我们对待雇员忠诚坦白﹐雇员投桃报李也对我们贞心不贰。

Sense.DEF: if a painting, design, piece of writing etc works, it is successful because it has the effect on you that the painter, writer etc intended
Sense.TRAN: 〔画作﹑设计﹑文章等〕奏效﹐产生预期效果
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think the scene with the horses really works, do you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得那些马的场面效果不好﹐你说呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The colour combination just doesn’t work for me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种色彩搭配就是不合我意。

Sense.DEF: if you work a material such as metal, leather, or clay, you cut, sew, or shape it in order to make something
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过切割﹑缝纫等〕使〔金属﹑皮革﹑陶土等〕成形[定形]

Sense.DEF: to use a particular material or substance in order to make something such as a picture, design, jewellery etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用某种材料〕作画[设计﹐制作珠宝等]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sculptor who works in steel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢雕雕塑家

Sense.EXAMPLE: a jeweller who works with silver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打造银首饰的珠宝匠

Sense.LEXUNIT: work your way to/through etc sth

Subsense.DEF: to move somewhere slowly and with difficulty
Subsense.TRAN: 缓慢而费力地移到/穿过某处
Subsense.EXAMPLE: From here, we worked our way carefully across the rock base.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从这里小心翼翼地穿过岩基。

Subsense.DEF: to achieve something gradually by working
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He had worked his way up to head of department.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一步一个脚印不懈努力﹐终于做到部门主管。

Sense.LEXUNIT: work your way through school/college/university etc
Sense.DEF: to do a job while you are a student because you need the money to pay for your courses, books etc
to move into a particular state or position very gradually, either in a series of small movements or after a long time
Sense.TRAN: 逐步移动到〔某位置〕﹔逐渐达到〔某状态〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slowly he worked the screwdriver into the crack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢把螺丝刀插进裂缝中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the screws must have worked loose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯定是有颗螺丝松了。

Sense.DEF: to use and exercise a muscle or part of your body
Sense.TRAN: 使〔身体肌肉或某部位〕活动起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Swimming is a form of exercise that works every muscle in your body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳是一种锻炼全身每一块肌肉的运动方式。

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body works or you work it, it moves
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was trembling and her mouth was working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身体在颤抖﹐嘴唇也在哆嗦。

Sense.DEF: if you work a particular area or type of place, you travel around the area for your job, or work in that type of place
Sense.TRAN: 从事〔某区域的〕工作﹔在…工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Markowitz works the Tri-State area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马科维茨在三州交界地区工作。

Sense.DEF: to take tickets from people as they enter a club, theatre etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在夜总会﹑剧院等门口〕收票﹐检票
Sense.EXAMPLE: Binns worked the door at various Manhattan clubs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾斯在曼哈顿的多家夜总会做过检票员。

Sense.DEF: if an entertainer or politician works a crowd of people, they entertain them and get their interest or support
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺人〕娱乐〔观众〕﹔〔政客为获得支持〕取悦〔众人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She really knew how to work a crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很会逗观众开心。

Sense.DEF: if you work the land, soil etc, you do all the work necessary to grow crops on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was left to work the farm alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一个人被留在农场耕作。

Sense.DEF: to remove a substance such as coal, gold, or oil from under the ground

Sense.LEXUNIT: work like magic/work like a charm
Sense.DEF: to be very effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: a polish that works a treat on windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用在窗户上效果很好的擦光剂

Sense.DEF: if your mind or brain is working, you are thinking or trying to solve a problem

Sense.LEXUNIT: work on the principle/assumption/basis etc that
Sense.DEF: to base ideas, plans etc on a particular fact that you think is true
Sense.TRAN: 以某原则/假设/基础等为前提
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re working on the assumption that the conference will take place in Canada, as planned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们假定大会将按计划在加拿大召开。

Sense.LEXUNIT: work yourself into a frenzy/panic/state etc
Sense.DEF: to make yourself become very nervous, angry etc
Sense.TRAN: 使自己变得疯狂/恐慌/紧张等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seemed to be working himself into a rage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎开始怒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: to make arrangements for something to happen, especially by behaving in a clever or skilful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should try and work it so that we can all go together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该设法安排一下﹐让大家都可以一起去。

Sense.DEF: to understand how a system works so that you can get advantages for yourself, often in a slightly dishonest way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lynn could show the rest of us how to work the system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林恩会教我们其余的人怎么钻空子。

Sense.DEF: to make someone work very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coach has been working us really hard this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练本周让我们训练得非常辛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People have complained that they are being worked into the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们抱怨工作太辛苦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve worked myself into the ground setting up this interview.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了安排这次访谈﹐我把自己弄得精疲力竭。

Sense.LEXUNIT: work your fingers to the bone
Sense.DEF: to work very hard
not polite to work very hard
to calculate the answer to a mathematical problem
Sense.TRAN: 计算﹐算出〔数学题的答案〕

Sense.DEF: to protest about a situation at work by doing your job slowly, with the excuse that you must obey all the rules exactly
Sense.TRAN: 故意严守规章而少干活﹐按章工作

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very suitable for you and does exactly what you wanted or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: I meditate and do Yoga every day. It works for me and I think it could work for you too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天静思做瑜伽。这对我挺管用﹐我想对你可能也会有好处。

Sense.DEF: to arrange or organize something so that you avoid problems that may stop you from doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为避免做某事受阻而〕安排﹐组织
Sense.EXAMPLE: John won’t be here on the 15th so we’ll have to work round that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰15号不在﹐所以我们只好另作安排。

Sense.DEF: to gradually mention a subject in a conversation or piece of writing, especially because it is embarrassing
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to work round to the subject gradually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得慢慢转到这个话题上。

Sense.DEF: to try hard to improve something or achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Learning a language isn’t easy. You have to work at it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学语言不容易﹐必须很努力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: couples who want to work at improving their relationship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想努力改善关系的夫妻

Sense.DEF: to include something in a speech, piece of writing, activity etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to work in a few references to his new book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他设法在自己的新书里加进了一些参考书目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here are a few goodies you can work into your daily diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有几样好东西﹐可以加入你的日常食谱里。

Sense.DEF: to add one substance to another and mix them together in a very thorough way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work the butter into the flour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄油拌进面粉里。

Sense.DEF: to arrange to meet someone, even though you are very busy
Sense.TRAN: 〔尽管很忙还是〕安排与〔某人〕见面
Sense.EXAMPLE: My schedule’s pretty full, but I think I can work you in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的日程很满﹐不过我想还是可以安排和你见面的。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something, especially a feeling such as anger, nervousness etc, by doing something that uses a lot of your energy
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过消耗精力〕消除﹐发泄〔怒气﹑紧张情绪等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Walking is excellent for working off tension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 散步对于消除紧张情绪非常有效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to go and work off a few of these calories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要去消耗掉一些卡路里。

Sense.DEF: to do a job for someone else because you owe them money or because they have helped you in the past
Sense.TRAN: 干活抵销〔欠款或人情债〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hasn’t worked off her debts to me yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她干的活还没有抵清欠我的债。

Sense.DEF: to spend time working in order to produce or repair something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has spent the last two years working on a book about childcare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去两年来他一直致力于撰写一本育儿书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every weekend you see him working on his car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个周末你都能看到他在鼓捣他的汽车。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to improve or achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A trainer has been brought in to work on her fitness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来一位教练帮她健身。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to work on ensuring that the children feel safe and confident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要努力确保孩子们有安全感和自信心。

Sense.DEF: to try continuously to influence someone or persuade them to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You leave him to me. I’ll work on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把他交给我吧﹐我会尽力说服他。

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about how you are going to do something and plan a good way of doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: UN negotiators have worked out a set of compromise proposals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国谈判人员制订出一套折中方案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to work out how we’re going to get there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要想想如何去那里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I had it all worked out had made very careful plans .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已制订了细致的计划。

Sense.DEF: to calculate an answer, amount, price etc
Sense.TRAN: 计算出〔答案﹑数量﹑价格等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: See if you can work this bill out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你能不能把这份账单算出来。

GramExa.PROPFORM: work out how much/how many etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to work out how much food we’ll need for the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须算出这次聚会需要多少食物。

Sense.DEF: to think about something and manage to understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plot is very complicated – it’ll take you a while to work it out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 故事情节很复杂——要花点时间才会明白。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sure you can work it out for yourself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你自己一定会弄明白的。

Sense.DEF: if a cost or amount works out at a particular figure, it is found to be that much when you calculate it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill works out at £15 each.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 账单算下来是每人15英镑。

GramExa.GLOSS: be expensive or cheap
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If we go by taxi, it’s going to work out very expensive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我们坐出租车去﹐算下来要不少钱。

Sense.DEF: if a problem or complicated situation works out, it gradually gets better or gets solved
Sense.TRAN: 〔问题〕逐渐解决﹔〔复杂情况〕逐渐化解
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things will work out, you’ll see.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况会好起来的﹐看着吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope it all works out for Gina and Andy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望吉娜和安迪的问题会得到解决。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sure everything will work itself out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信一切都会好起来的。

Sense.DEF: if a situation works out in a particular way, it happens in that way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Financially, things have worked out well for us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的经济情况很好。

Sense.DEF: to make your body fit and strong by doing exercises
Sense.EXAMPLE: He works out with weights twice a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每星期练两次举重。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot understand what someone is really like or why they behave in the way they do
Sense.TRAN: 我弄不懂某人〔指不理解某人的性格或行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t work her out at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全弄不懂她。

Sense.DEF: if a mine is worked out, all the coal, gold etc has been removed from it
to attack someone by hitting them several times
to deal with problems or unpleasant feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: After someone dies, it can take a long time to work through your grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人去世之后﹐为之悲伤不已的人可能需要很长时间才能从哀痛中走出来。

Sense.DEF: if the result or effect of something works through, it becomes noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The positive effect on businesses may take up to three years to work through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对各企业产生的积极影响可能要经过长达三年的时间才会显现出来。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself feel interested, brave etc
Sense.TRAN: 激起热情/激起兴趣/鼓起勇气等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to work up enough courage to go to the dentist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在努力鼓起勇气去看牙医。

Sense.LEXUNIT: work up an appetite/a thirst/a sweat
Sense.DEF:
to make yourself hungry or
thirsty
, or make yourself
sweat
, especially by doing physical exercise
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指运动之后〕引起食欲/渴感/出汗
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can work up a really big thirst playing tennis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打网球能让人非常口渴。

Sense.DEF: to make someone very angry, excited, or upset about something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人感到气愤[激动﹐不安]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re working yourself up again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你又激动了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had worked herself up into a state .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己弄得很紧张。

Sense.DEF: to develop and improve something such as a project or a piece of writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack took notes which he would work up into a report later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克记了笔记﹐稍后会将其整理成一份报告。

Sense.DEF: to gradually prepare yourself to do something difficult
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐准备〔去做困难的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d been working up to asking her for a date all week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个星期他都在准备约她出去。

Sense.DEF: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money
Sense.EXAMPLE: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年这个时候工作机会都不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been out of work without a job for two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他失业有两年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: More people are in work have a job than ten years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

GramExa.GLOSS: before a day of work or at the end of a day of work
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you want to go for a drink after work?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下班后你想去喝一杯吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In this meaning, work is an uncountable noun. Do not say ‘a work’. Say work or a job .
F2NBox.TRAN: work用于这个意思是不可数名词﹐不要说a work﹐而要说work或a job
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It may be difficult for older people to obtain paid work.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 上年纪的人找到拿薪水的工作可能有困难。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I applied for a job (NOT 不说 a work) as a reporter.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我申请了一份记者工作。

Sense.DEF: a place where you do your job, which is not your home
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had an accident on the way to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上班路上我出了事故。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left work at the usual time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在平常的时间下班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went out with the girls from work last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我和工作单位的姑娘们出去了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad’s at work right now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸现在正在上班。

Sense.DEF: the duties and activities that are part of your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large part of the work we do involves using computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大部分工作要使用电脑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He starts work at 4 am.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他清晨4点开始工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s started a business doing gardening and roofing work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开办了一家承揽园艺和房屋盖顶业务的公司。

Sense.DEF: something that you produce as a result of doing your job or doing an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send a résumé and examples of your work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请寄一份履历及你所做的样品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building is the work of architect Rafael Moneo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢大楼是建筑师拉斐尔•莫内欧的作品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher should make sure that each child has a piece of work displayed on the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师应该确保每个孩子都有一幅作品挂在墙上展示。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The standard of work has declined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作品的水准下降了。

Sense.DEF: the papers and other materials you need for doing work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you move some of your work off the kitchen table?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否把你的工作材料从厨房桌子上拿走一些？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I often have to take work home with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我经常要把工作带回家做。

Sense.DEF: something such as a painting, play, piece of music etc that is produced by a painter, writer, or musician
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Collected Works of Shakespeare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《莎士比亚全集》
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is another accomplished work by the artist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是那位艺术家的又一杰作。

Sense.DEF: when you use physical or mental effort in order to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 〔花费体力或脑力做的〕事情﹔工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Work will start next month on a new swimming pool in the centre of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个月将于市中心动工兴建一座新游泳池。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Looking after children can be hard work .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照看孩子会非常辛苦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should not allow unqualified people to carry out work on your house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能让非专业人员来装潢你的房子。

GramExa.PROPFORM: set to work/get down to work
GramExa.GLOSS: start work
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He set to work immediately.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他立即开始工作。

Sense.DEF:
study or
research
, especially for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为某一目的进行的〕学习﹐研究

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The centre carries out work to monitor trends in housing management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该中心开展研究以监测住房管理趋势。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He did his postgraduate work in Sociology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他读研究生时学的是社会学。

Subsense.DEF: doing your job or a particular activity
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He spent most of his time watching the fishermen at work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大部分时间都在观察渔民如何作业。

Subsense.DEF: having a particular influence or effect
Subsense.TRAN: 有某种影响﹔起某种作用
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Volcanoes display some of nature’s most powerful forces at work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火山展示了大自然一些最强大的威力所产生的作用力。

Sense.DEF: used after mentioning several things, to emphasize that someone or something has everything you can think of
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel had everything – sauna, swimming pool, the works.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店设施齐全——桑拿浴室﹑游泳池﹐应有尽有。

Sense.DEF: used to praise someone for doing something well or quickly
Sense.TRAN: 干得好/干得快 〔用于称赞某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was quick work!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干得真快！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is being planned or developed
Sense.TRAN: 某事在计划中﹔某事在筹备中
Sense.EXAMPLE: Upgrades to the existing software are in the works.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现有软件的升级版本正在开发中。

Subsense.DEF: activities involved in building or repairing things such as roads, bridges etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the official in charge of the engineering works
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 负责工程的官员

Subsense.DEF: a building or group of buildings in which goods are produced in large quantities or an industrial process happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The brick works closed last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 砖厂去年倒闭了。

Sense.DEF: the moving parts of a machine
an operation to make you look younger or more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these celebrities have had work done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些名人都做过整容手术。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your work cut out (for you)
Sense.DEF: used to say that it will be very difficult to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team will have their work cut out if they are to win the competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队要想赢得比赛必将苦战一番。

Sense.DEF: to do something very quickly and easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: A microwave oven can make light work of the cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微波炉可以让烹饪变得简单容易。

Sense.DEF: to do something with difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: They made hard work of what should have been an easy game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原本应该是很轻松的比赛﹐他们却打得非常艰苦。

Sense.DEF: to not be finished or perfect yet
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden is still very much a work in progress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园离完工还差得远呢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: all work and no play (makes Jack a dull boy)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not spend all your time working, but should spend some of your time relaxing
Sense.TRAN: 只工作不娱乐[只会干不会玩]（会把人变傻）

Sense.DEF: force multiplied by distance

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be all in a day’s work
nice work if you can get it

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He started work as a trainee accountant.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从会计实习生做起。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Young people come to town looking for work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人进城来找工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get a job
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was difficult for them to find work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很难找到工作。

Collocate.COLLOC: return to work/go back to work
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His doctor agreed he was fit enough to return to work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生也认为他身体恢复的很不错﹐可以回去工作了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In recent years part-time work has become more popular.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来兼职工作越来越流行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Are you available for full-time work?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能干全职工作吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She hasn’t done any paid work since she had children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自从有了孩子以后就没做过任何有薪酬的工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: work done by lawyers
work done with your hands
a job you are not paid for
the work someone does every day
type of work
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I meet lots of interesting people in my line of work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我干这一行可以认识许多有趣的人。

Sense.DEF: a workable system, plan etc will be practical and effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: a workable solution to the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这一问题的可行方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: a workable timetable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可行的时间表

Sense.DEF: a substance that is workable can be shaped with your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: workable clay for making pots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制作陶罐的可塑黏土

Sense.DEF: ordinary and not interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: He promised to tackle the workaday matters affecting people’s daily lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承诺要解决影响人们日常生活的一般问题。

Sense.DEF: someone who chooses to work a lot, so that they do not have time to do anything else
Sense.TRAN: 醉心于工作的人﹐工作狂

Sense.DEF:
a method, especially a temporary one, that you use to achieve something when the normal method is not successful. In computing, workarounds are used to solve problems with
hardware
or software.
Sense.TRAN: 〔原方案不成功时的〕变通办法﹐替代方法〔在计算机技术中用于解决硬件或软件问题〕

Sense.DEF: a container for sewing equipment
a strong table used for working on with tools
a school book containing questions and exercises
the amount of time that you spend working in a day
Sense.TRAN: 工作日〔一天的工作时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 10-hour workday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十小时工作日

Sense.DEF: a day of the week when most people work
Sense.EXAMPLE: He commutes three hours on workdays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天上下班往返要花三小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: workday traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作日的交通

Sense.DEF: very upset or excited about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t get so worked up about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该为此事那么激动。

Sense.DEF: someone who does a job, especially a particular type of job
Sense.EXAMPLE: workers in the tourist industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游行业工作者
Sense.EXAMPLE: reports from local aid workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自当地援助人员的报道

Sense.DEF: someone who works in an organization and who is not a manager
Sense.TRAN: 工作人员﹐雇员〔与管理者相对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: conflicts between workers and management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳资冲突
Sense.EXAMPLE: attacks on workers’ rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对雇员权利的侵犯

Sense.DEF: someone who works very well or quickly
Sense.TRAN: 工作出色/努力/快等的人

Sense.DEF:
the members of the
working class
Sense.EXAMPLE: the workers’ revolution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人阶级革命

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one who has special skills
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a shortage of skilled workers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术工人缺乏。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 非技术工人﹐非熟练工人
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some exminers now had jobs as unskilled workers in factories.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些过去当过矿工的人现在在工厂里做非技术工人的工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A high percentage of the female staff were part-time workers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很大比例的女员工是兼职工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: working somewhere for a limited period of time
someone who does physical work
someone who works in an office, a bank etc

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 工厂/农场/办公室工人[员工]

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who builds buildings, bridges etc

Sense.DEF: a belief in the moral value and importance of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: They instilled the work ethic into their children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们逐步培养孩子的职业道德。

Sense.DEF: the experience you have had of working in a particular type of job
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s well qualified but has no relevant work experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全够资格﹐但没有相关的工作经验。

Sense.DEF: a period of time that a young person spends working in a particular place, as a form of training

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teenagers spend two weeks on work experience in local businesses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些青少年在当地公司进行为期两星期的实习。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do I have to do work experience ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为什么一定要实习？

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实习安排/方案/计划等

Sense.DEF: a system in which unemployed people have to work before they are given money for food, rent etc by the government
Sense.TRAN: 工作福利制〔要求失业者先从事某种工作﹐然后才能领取政府提供的救济金〕

Sense.DEF: the way that a particular project is organized by a company, including which part of a project someone is going to do, and when they are supposed to do it
all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area
Sense.TRAN: 〔行业或公司的〕全体从业人员﹔〔公司的〕全体员工﹔〔国家或地区的〕劳动力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women now represent almost 50% of the workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今女性几乎占全部劳动人口的 50%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is cutting its workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司正在裁员。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术熟练的/受过教育的/灵活应变的等从业人员

Sense.DEF: a person, machine, or vehicle that does a lot of work, especially when it is hard or boring
Sense.TRAN: 吃苦耐劳的人﹐老黄牛﹔重负荷机器[运载工具]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Hercules aircraft has been the workhorse of the air force for over 25 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 25年来﹐大力神运输机为空军立下了汗马功劳。

Sense.DEF: a building in Britain in the past where very poor people lived if they had nowhere else to go

Subsense.DEF: having a job that you are paid for
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a working mother
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在职母亲
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many working women rely on relatives for childcare.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多在职妇女靠亲戚照看孩子。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A smaller working population will have to support a growing number of retired people.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缩减的劳动人口将不得不供养越来越多的退休人员。

Subsense.DEF: having a physical or practical job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ordinary working man
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通劳动者

Sense.DEF: the time that people spend doing their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a normal working day, I see around 6 or 7 clients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般每个工作日我会见大约六七个客户。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Telephone at any time during normal working hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正常工作时间内随时可以来电。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many mothers prefer flexible working hours .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多母亲更喜欢弹性工作时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We do a 37-hour working week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每周工作37小时。

Sense.DEF: a day of the week when most people work. In Britain and the US this is usually Monday to Friday
Sense.TRAN: 工作日〔英美国家一般为星期一至星期五〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be returned within three working days three days, not including weekends or public holidays .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将于三个工作日之内退还。

Sense.DEF: the situation in which you work, especially the physical things such as pay or safety
Sense.EXAMPLE: improvements in working conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作条件的改善

Sense.DEF: the way in which you do your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: training in up-to-date working practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新工作惯例的培训

Sense.DEF: the part of your adult life when you have a paid job
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent all his working life in a factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一家工厂干了一辈子。

Sense.DEF: working properly and not broken

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in good/perfect/full etc working order
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car was old, but the engine was still in good working order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这汽车虽旧﹐但引擎仍然运转正常。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the amount of exercise needed to keep your body in working order
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持身体健康所需的运动量

Sense.DEF: the way that people work together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They want to establish a better working relationship between medical and nursing staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望在医护人员之间建立更好的工作关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have a close working relationship with other voluntary groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们和其他志愿团体之间有密切的合作关系。

Sense.DEF: enough knowledge of a system, subject, language etc to be able to use it or to do a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 足以应付〔特定〕工作的…方面的知识
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good working knowledge of the building regulations is necessary for the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熟知建筑规程对这份工作来说是必要的。

Sense.DEF: clothes which you wear for work or are designed for people to work in
a model that has parts that move
the parts of a machine that move

a
definition
, idea etc that may not be exactly right but is good enough to use when you start working on something
enough support in parliament for a government to continue making laws and ruling a country
Sense.TRAN: 〔议会中支持政府的〕有效多数

Sense.DEF: a breakfast, lunch etc which is also a business meeting
the part of a person’s or computer’s memory which stores information about the thing being worked on now
Sense.TRAN: 〔人的〕工作记忆﹔〔计算机的〕暂存器

Sense.DEF: the way something such as a system, piece of equipment, or organization works
Sense.TRAN: 〔系统﹑设备﹑组织等的〕工作方式﹐运行方式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his knowledge of the inner workings of the department
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对部门内部运作方式的了解

Sense.EXAMPLE: I shall never understand the workings of his mind how he thinks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远理解不了他的想法。

Sense.DEF: a particular way of working, especially relating to the hours which someone works
a mine or part of a mine where soil has been dug out in order to remove metals or stone
the money that is available to be used for the costs of a business
Sense.TRAN: 运营资金[资本]﹔周转资金

Sense.DEF: the group of people in society who traditionally do physical work and do not have much money or power
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marx wrote about the political struggles of the working class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思描述了工人阶级的政治斗争。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的工人阶级的职业
RunOn.EXAMPLE: He is proud of his working class background.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的工人阶级出身感到自豪。

Sense.DEF: a woman who has sex for money – used when you want to avoid saying this directly
Sense.TRAN: 打工女郎〔对妓女的委婉称呼〕

Sense.DEF: a group that is formed to examine a particular situation or problem and suggest ways of dealing with it
Sense.TRAN: 专题调查委员会﹔特别工作组

GramExa.PROPFORM: set up/establish a working group (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The commission has set up a special working group to look at the problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该委员会成立了一个特别工作组来调查这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a working group on constitutional reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宪法改革工作组

Sense.DEF: an official document that you need in the US in order to get a job if you are young or were born in a different country
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国未成年人或侨民受雇时必须持有的〕工作许可证

Sense.DEF:
a
working group
Sense.TRAN: 专题调查委员会﹔特别工作组

Sense.DEF: the ability to give a sensible amount of time and effort to your work and to your life outside work, for example to your family or to other interests
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t have a proper work-life balance if you’re in the office for 12 hours a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你每天有12个小时在办公室﹐工作和生活之间就不可能有恰当的平衡。

Sense.DEF: the amount of work that a person or organization has to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或组织的〕工作量﹐工作负荷
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s struggling to cope with the heavy workload .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在努力应付繁重的工作量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve got to find ways of reducing Gail’s workload next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须想办法减轻盖尔明年的工作负担。

Sense.DEF: someone who does physical work such as building, repairing things etc
done in a way which shows skill and hard work, but may not be exciting
Sense.TRAN: 娴熟卖力的〔但可能平淡无奇〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team put up a good workmanlike performance to win 1-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队技术娴熟﹐表现卖力﹐以一比零获胜。

Sense.DEF: skill in making things, especially in a way that makes them look good
someone you work with

a painting,
sculpture
etc of high quality
something that is very attractive and skilfully made – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 精致的东西〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That cake’s a real work of art!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那蛋糕简直是艺术品！

Sense.DEF: a period of physical exercise, especially as training for a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: a daily workout in the gym
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在健身房的日常锻炼

Sense.DEF: an official document that you need if you want to work in a foreign country
Sense.TRAN: 〔在外国工作时所需的〕工作许可证

Sense.DEF: the room, building etc where you work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a report into discrimination in the workplace
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查职场歧视的报告

Sense.DEF: a system in which a prisoner is allowed to work outside a prison
Sense.TRAN: 监外就业〔允许囚犯离开监狱外出工作的制度〕

Sense.DEF: a room that you work in, especially making things, often in your home
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指设在家中的〕工作间﹐作坊

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper with questions and exercises for students
Sense.TRAN: 学生作业纸﹐活页练习题

Sense.DEF: a room or building where tools and machines are used for making or repairing things
a meeting at which people try to improve their skills by discussing their experiences and doing practical exercises

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They held a number of music workshops and seminars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们多次组织音乐研习班和研讨会。

Sense.DEF: someone who is work-shy tries to avoid working because they do not like it
a computer that is part of an office computer system
the desk where an office worker works
a flat surface for working on, especially in a kitchen
a situation in which people in a particular job refuse to do any additional work as a protest
Sense.TRAN: 〔拒绝做额外工作以示抗议的〕怠工﹐按章工作

Sense.DEF: the total amount of time that you spend working during a week
Sense.TRAN: 工作周﹐一周的工作时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 40-hour workweek
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 40小时工作周

Sense.DEF:
the
planet
we live on, and all the people, cities, and countries on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tuberculosis is still common in some parts of the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结核病在世界上某些地区仍很常见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that time China was the most powerful country in the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时中国是世界上最强大的国家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: building
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上最高的建筑

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Taj Mahal attracts visitors from around the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰姬陵吸引了来自世界各地的游客。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students from all over the world come to study at Oxford.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界各地的学生到牛津大学来求学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children are the same the world over .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全世界的孩子都一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book has been published throughout the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书已在世界各地出版。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is nothing quite like it anywhere in the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上任何地方都找不出和它类似的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe’s relationship with the rest of the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲和世界上其他地区的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to take a year off to travel the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定休息一年去周游世界。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a crime that shocked the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 震惊全世界的罪行

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 世上﹔究竟﹐到底〔用于强调〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: the happiest/most exciting etc ... in the world
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m the luckiest man in the world!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是世上最幸运的人！

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bali is my favourite place in the whole world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴厘岛是我最最喜欢的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Off he went, without a care in the world not worried about anything at all .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他啥也不管就走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: nothing at all can save them now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在什么也救不了他们。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, we’ve got all the time in the world plenty of time so you do not need to hurry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我们有的是时间。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you are very surprised or annoyed
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 究竟是什么/是谁/在哪儿/怎么样等…？〔用于表示很惊讶或恼怒〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What in the world are you doing here at seven in the morning?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你早上7点钟在这儿到底干什么？

Sense.DEF: the society that we live in, the way people behave, and the kind of life we have
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents want a better world for their children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母都希望孩子有更好的天地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The world is being transformed by information technology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息技术正在改变世界。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You had to go into politics if you wanted to change the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你若是想改变世界就必须从政。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say how you would like things to be
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In an ideal world, we would be able to recycle everything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在理想世界里﹐任何东西都可以循环使用。

GramExa.GLOSS: the way life really is, not how people would like it to be or imagine it
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现实生活
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the real world, things are never quite so simple.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现实生活中事情从来都不是那么简单的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: what is the world coming to?
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you do not like the way society is changing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five pounds just to park your car! I don’t know what the world’s coming to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 停停车就要五英镑！这世道怎么了？

Sense.DEF: a particular group of countries

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the highest unemployment rate in the Western world
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方世界中最高的失业率
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the English-speaking world
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说英语的国家

Sense.EXAMPLE: agricultural practices in the developing world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展中国家的农业耕作
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economies of the industrialized world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业化国家的经济体

Sense.DEF: a particular period in history

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the peoples of the ancient world
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古代的民族

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the world of the ancient Greeks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古希腊时期

Sense.DEF: the life and experiences of a particular person or group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the world of children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们的世界

Sense.EXAMPLE: The diary gives us an insight into Hemingway’s world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本日记可以让我们了解海明威的世界。

Sense.DEF: a particular area of activity or work, and the people who are involved in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She knew little about the world of politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对政治领域知之甚少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: personalities from the sporting world
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育界的名流

Sense.DEF: all of nature, or all animals or plants considered as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wonders of the natural world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然界的奇观

Sense.DEF: a particular kind of place or situation, especially one that someone describes or which you imagine
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某人描述或想象的〕地方﹐情景

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the nightmare world of Orwell’s novel ‘1984’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥威尔小说《一九八四》中的梦魇世界

Sense.EXAMPLE: a world of lies and secrecy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满谎言和秘密的世界

Sense.DEF: a place like the Earth in another part of the universe where other things may live
Sense.TRAN: 〔可能存在其他生物的〕天体﹐星球
Sense.EXAMPLE: strange creatures from another world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自另一个星球的奇异生物

Sense.DEF: used in the following phrases to emphasize that something is very different
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于以下短语强调某事物大不相同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a world of difference between the US and Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和欧洲完全不同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realized we were still worlds apart very different, especially concerning your ideas, opinions etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我意识到我们的观念依然有着天壤之别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a world away from completely different from the grand hotels she was used to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这和她住惯的大酒店完全是天上地下。

Sense.DEF: the people who live outside a particular place or country – used when the people of that place or country do not often meet other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prisoners have little contact with the outside world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人和外界接触很少。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be cut off from/closed to/isolated from the outside world
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parts of the country have been virtually closed to the outside world for 20 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的一些地区已经有20年和外界几乎隔绝。

Sense.DEF: real things, rather than ideas and beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the material world all that exists?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物质世界就是存在的一切吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: for all the world as if/as though/like
Sense.DEF: exactly as if or exactly like
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat reading her paper, looking for all the world as if nothing had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐着看她的报纸﹐就像什么都没有发生过一样。

Sense.DEF: extremely good, enjoyable etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The graphics and sounds are out of this world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图像和声音都很完美。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sb a world of good
Sense.DEF: to be very good for someone’s health or mental state
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bit of fresh air and exercise will do her a world of good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呼吸点新鲜空气和适当锻炼会对她大有好处。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in a world of your own/in your own little world
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone seems to spend a lot of time thinking or imagining things, and does not seem to notice what is happening around them
Sense.TRAN: 生活在自己的（小）天地里
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a shy child who seemed to live in a world of her own .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个腼腆的孩子﹐似乎生活在自己的世界里。

Sense.LEXUNIT: mean the world to sb/think the world of sb
Sense.DEF: if someone or something means the world to you, or if you think the world of them, they are very important to you and you love or respect them very much
Sense.TRAN: 对某人非常重要/非常喜欢[尊敬]某人[某物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lee thinks the world of that dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李非常宠爱那条狗。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb would give the world to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone would like to do something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would give the world to see her again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常渴望再见到她。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/feel on top of the world
Sense.DEF: to feel extremely happy

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a man/woman of the world
Sense.DEF: to be someone who has had many experiences and is not easily shocked
Sense.TRAN: 是阅历丰富的人﹐是见过世面的人

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you would not do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t hurt her for the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不会伤害她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t have missed it for the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绝对不该错过它。

Sense.DEF: there is no limit to the opportunities that someone has
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’ve got a good education, the world is your oyster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你接受了良好的教育﹐你就会拥有远大前程。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have the world at your feet

Subsense.DEF: to be very famous, popular, or successful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In those days the band had the world at their feet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候这支乐队红极一时。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a position where you have the chance to become very successful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a bright young lad with the world at his feet
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前途无量的聪明小伙子

Sense.LEXUNIT: go up/come down in the world
Sense.DEF: to move to a higher or lower position in society
Sense.TRAN: 升到更高/跌到较低的社会地位﹔发迹/落魄
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s gone up in the world a bit since I knew him at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从我大学里认识他以来﹐他已经开始崭露头角。

Sense.DEF: to have a big effect or be very successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her last film didn’t exactly set the world on fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的上一部电影并未引起轰动。

Sense.DEF: to discuss or say how the world should be changed to make people’s lives better
Sense.TRAN: 谈论如何改变世界﹐指点江山
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were having a few beers and generally putting the world to rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一边喝啤酒﹐一边大谈如何匡时济世。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the Michael Jacksons/Mother Teresas/Microsofts etc of this world
Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular kind of person or group, by using one person or group as an example
Sense.TRAN: 迈克尔•杰克逊/特蕾莎修女/微软公司等一类人 [团体]〔用于举例谈论某一类人或团体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US team is new to the soccer scene, and can’t expect to beat the Brazils of this world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国队是足坛新秀﹐并不指望打败巴西队之类的球队。

Sense.LEXUNIT: think the world owes you a living
Sense.DEF: to think that you should not have to work and that other people will provide you with everything you need – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 认为整个世界都欠你的〔含贬义〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: think (that) the world revolves around you
Sense.DEF: to think that you are the most important person and everyone else should only be interested in making sure that you have what you want – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 认为世界围着自己转﹐认为自己是最重要的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: everyone or anybody –used when you want to emphasize that a lot of people do something or anyone can do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seemed that the world and his wife had come to Madrid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎全世界的人都到马德里来了。

Sense.DEF: to be born

Sense.LEXUNIT: bring a child into the world
Sense.DEF: to have a baby, or help a baby to be born
Sense.TRAN: 把一个孩子带到这个世上〔指分娩或接生〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb is not long for this world
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is likely to die soon

normal life in society, as opposed to a religious way of life, especially in a
monastery
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She renounced the world and entered a convent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她宣布弃绝俗世﹐进了修道院。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: it’s not the end of the world

Sense.DEF: existing in, involving, or affecting all or most countries in the world

GramExa.GLOSS: a competition involving people from many countries
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He won the world title in 2001.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2001年他赢得了世界冠军称号。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the reigning Formula One world champion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一级方程式赛车现任世界冠军

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the impact of the crisis on the world economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场危机对世界经济造成的影响

Sense.DEF: a world figure is one of the most important people in the world
Sense.TRAN: 〔人物〕在世界范围内举足轻重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meeting of world leaders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界领袖会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: a world authority on climate change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究气候变化的世界级权威

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is the best at a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 举世无双的人[物]﹔天下无敌的人[物]

Sense.DEF: among the best in the world
Sense.TRAN: 世界级的﹐世界第一流水平的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a world-class tennis champion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界级网球冠军
Sense.EXAMPLE: world-class research facilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界一流的研究设施

Sense.DEF: the most important international competition in football, which is held every four years in a different country. The winners receive a gold cup called the Jules Rimet Trophy.

a similar international competition in some other sports, such as
cricket
or
rugby
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球﹑英式橄榄球等国际比赛的〕世界杯

Sense.DEF: English words that are understood and used by speakers of English everywhere
Sense.TRAN: 世界英语﹐规范英语〔世界各地的说英语者都能听懂并使用的英语〕

Sense.DEF: the types of English used in particular countries
Sense.TRAN: 世界英语〔某些特定国家使用的英语〕

Sense.DEF: known about by people all over the world
Sense.TRAN: 举世闻名的﹐世界著名的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a world-famous singer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界著名歌手

Sense.DEF: everything you own

relating to ordinary life rather than
spiritual
or religious ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seemed very calm and far removed from worldly concerns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显得非常淡定﹐完全没有俗世的忧虑。

Sense.DEF: having a lot of experience and knowledge about people and life
Sense.TRAN: 生活经验丰富的﹔老成练达的

Sense.DEF: having a lot of experience and knowledge about life so that you are not easily shocked or deceived
Sense.TRAN: 老于世故的﹔善于处世的

Sense.DEF: a type of popular music which has influences from traditional music from different countries
Sense.TRAN: 世界音乐〔受世界各地传统音乐影响的一种流行音乐〕

Sense.DEF: a country that has a lot of power and influence in many parts of the world
the fastest time, longest distance, highest level etc which anyone has ever achieved anywhere in the world, especially in a sport

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He set a new world record for the marathon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他创下了新的马拉松世界纪录。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the 800 m world record holder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 800米世界纪录保持者

Sense.DEF: a set of up to seven baseball games played every year in the US or Canada between two professional teams, the winner of the American League and the winner of the National League. The winner of the World Series is considered to be the best team in the Major Leagues.
Sense.TRAN: 世界职业棒球大赛〔每年在美国或加拿大举办的棒球赛事﹐在美国棒球联盟冠军和全国棒球联盟冠军之间进行〕

Sense.DEF: part of the BBC which broadcasts radio programmes, especially news, to all parts of the world. Its official name is the BBC World Service.
Sense.TRAN: 全球服务〔英国广播公司一部门﹐向全世界播出广播节目﹐尤其是新闻节目。其官方名称是英国广播公司全球服务〕

Sense.DEF: someone’s opinions and attitudes relating to the world and things in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: the limited nineteenth-century world view
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有局限的19世纪世界观

Sense.DEF: a war involving many of the countries of the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: fears of another world war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对再次爆发世界大战的担心
Sense.EXAMPLE: Churchill was prime minister during the Second World War.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丘吉尔在第二次世界大战期间任首相。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the years after World War I
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一次世界大战后的岁月

Sense.DEF:
(1914–1918) a war in Europe fought between France, the UK and its
empire
, Russia, and the US on one side (known together as ‘the Allies’), and Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Turkey on the other side. The war started as a result of the murder in Sarajevo of the Archduke Franz Ferdinand, a member of the Austrian royal family.
Sense.TRAN: 第一次世界大战〔1914-1918年在欧洲进行的一场大战﹐一方为法国﹑英国及英联邦国家﹑俄国和美国（“协约 国”）﹐另一方为德国﹑奥匈帝国和土耳其〕

Sense.DEF: (1939–1945) a war involving almost every major country in the world. On one side were the Allies (including the UK, France, and Poland, and after 1941 the US and the Soviet Union) and on the other side the Axis (including Germany, Japan, and Italy). The war was started by Adolf Hitler, the Nazi leader of Germany, who aimed to increase German power by attacking other countries and taking control of them.
Sense.TRAN: 第二次世界大战 〔1939-1945年的一场大战﹐几乎所有世界主要国家都被卷入其中﹐一方为同盟国（包括英国﹑法国和波兰﹐1941年后美国和苏联亦加入）﹐另一方为轴心国（包括德国﹑日本和意大利）。战争由德国纳粹头目阿道夫•希特勒发动〕

Sense.DEF: not feeling excited about anything any more
everywhere in the world
Sense.TRAN: 遍及全世界（的）﹔在全世界
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have offices in over 56 countries worldwide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在全世界超过56个国家设有办事处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: cars with a worldwide reputation for reliability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以性能可靠享誉世界的汽车

Sense.DEF: a long thin creature with no bones and no legs that lives in soil
the young form of an insect, which looks like a short worm

if a person or animal has worms, they have legless
parasite s small creatures that eat their food or their blood
in their body
someone who you do not like or respect

a type of computer
virus
that can make copies of itself and destroy information on computers that are connected to each other
Sense.TRAN: 蠕虫病毒〔一种计算机病毒﹐会自行拷贝并销毁联网计算机内的信息〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone who normally obeys someone without complaining suddenly refuses to do this
Sense.TRAN: 蠕虫也会翻腾﹐兔子急了也会咬人〔指一贯温顺者突然反抗〕

Sense.DEF: to move through a small place or a crowd slowly, carefully, or with difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 缓慢[小心﹐艰难]地进入/穿过等〔狭小的地方或人群〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wormed his way under the fence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吃力地从栅栏下钻过。

Sense.LEXUNIT: worm your way into sb’s affections/heart/confidence etc
Sense.DEF: to gradually make someone love or trust you, especially by being dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过欺诈手段〕逐渐获得某人的喜爱/欢心/信任等

Sense.LEXUNIT: worm your way out of (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: to avoid doing something that you have been asked to do by making an excuse that is dishonest but clever
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve wormed his way out of going to the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫找借口不去开会。

Sense.DEF:
to give an animal medicine in order to remove
parasite s
that live inside it
to get information from someone who does not want to give it

a
CD
on which information can be stored only once, but seen or used many times
worm-eaten wood or fruit has holes in it because it has been eaten by worms
Sense.TRAN: 〔木材或水果〕虫蛀的﹐多蛀孔的

Sense.DEF: a hole, which may exist, that connects one part of the universe with another part far away
Sense.TRAN: 蠕虫洞﹐虫洞〔宇宙中可能存在的连接遥远空间的通道〕

Sense.DEF:
a hole in a piece of wood etc made by a type of
worm
a plant with a bitter taste

a prison in West London. In 1998, prisoners there claimed that some of the prison officers treated them in an unfair, sometimes violent way, and the government set up an
inquiry
to discover the truth.
Sense.TRAN: 苦艾丛监狱〔位于伦敦西部﹐1998年监狱囚犯声称受狱警虐待﹐政府对此展开了调查〕

Sense.DEF: full of worms

the past participle of
wear
a worn object is old and damaged, especially because it has been used a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔物品〕用旧的﹐用坏的﹐又旧又破的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a worn patch on the carpet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯上一小块磨破的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: well worn stone steps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 残破的石阶

Sense.DEF: someone who looks worn seems tired
very tired because you have been working hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must be absolutely worn out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定累坏了。

Sense.DEF: too old or damaged to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of old worn-out walking boots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双穿破了的旧步行靴

Sense.DEF: unhappy because you keep thinking about a problem, or about something bad that might happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave me a worried look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心地看了我一眼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m really worried about my brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的很担心我弟弟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local people are worried by the rise in crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地老百姓因为犯罪率上升而感到不安。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was worried we wouldn’t have enough money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心我们的钱不够。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His parents must be worried sick extremely worried .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父母肯定担心死了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone made you feel anxious because you did not properly understand what they said, or did not realize that it was a joke
Sense.TRAN: 你让我虚惊一场〔用于表示某人令自己感到担心﹐因为误解对方的话或不知道对方在开玩笑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You had me worried there for a minute!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把我吓了一跳！

Exponent.DEF: not feeling happy or relaxed because you keep thinking about a problem or something bad that might happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was worried that you had forgotten our date.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心你已经忘了我们的约会。

Exponent.DEF: worried because you think something bad might happen or has happened. Anxious is more formal than worried , and is often used about a general feeling of worry, when you are not sure what has happened.
Exponent.TRAN: 焦虑的,担忧的〔anxious比worried正式,常用于表示因不确定发生了什么而感到担忧〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A lot of employees are anxious about their jobs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多员工为自己的饭碗担忧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Anxious relatives waited for news.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲人们在焦急地等待消息。

Exponent.DEF: worried or frightened about something you are going to do or experience, and unable to relax
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone feels nervous before an exam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试前人人都会感到紧张。

Exponent.DEF: a little worried because you feel there may be something wrong and you are not sure what is going to happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When she still wasn’t home by midnight, I began to feel uneasy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 到午夜时她还没回家﹐我心里开始不安起来。

Exponent.DEF: worried, usually about a problem affecting someone else or affecting the country or the world
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对影响他人的问题或国家大事〕关切的,担忧的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many people are concerned about the current economic situation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人对当前的经济状况感到担忧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school received dozens of calls from concerned parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校接到许多忧心忡忡的家长打来的电话。

Exponent.DEF: worried by something that happens – often used in negative sentences
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为发生的事〕烦恼的,担心的〔常用于否定句〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She didn’t seem particularly bothered by the news.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个消息好像并没有让她特别不安。

Exponent.DEF: very worried, so that you think about something a lot
Exponent.TRAN: 不安的,烦恼的〔因而对某事思虑过度〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She fell into a troubled sleep.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她带着不安入睡了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a troubled expression
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 烦恼的表情

Exponent.DEF: a little worried about something you are going to do, or about the future, because you are not sure what it will be like
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因对将要做的事或对未来没有把握〕略感忧虑的,担心的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt a bit apprehensive about seeing him again after so long.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔了这么久又要见到他,我感到有些不安。

Exponent.DEF: very worried and tired because of problems, too much work etc, and unable to relax or enjoy life
Exponent.TRAN: 极其焦虑的﹔心力交瘁的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People who are stressed at work are more likely to become ill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作压力大的人更容易得病。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’d been working ten hours a day and was stressed out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一天工作十个小时,心力交瘁。

Sense.DEF: someone who often worries about things
Sense.TRAN: 经常担心的人﹐经常发愁的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother was a born worrier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲天生爱发愁。

Sense.DEF: making you anxious
Sense.EXAMPLE: a worrisome problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个令人担心的问题
