Sense.DEF: to be anxious or unhappy about someone or something, so that you think about them a lot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I worry about my daughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心我女儿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve really got no need to worry about your weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的不必担心你的体重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She worried that she wasn’t doing enough to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心自己帮不上忙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad worries over the slightest thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸一点点小事就会发愁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t tell Mum about this – she’s got enough to worry about she already has a lot of problems or is very busy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把这件事告诉妈妈——她已经够操心的了。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are trying to make someone feel less anxious
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, darling, Daddy’s here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小宝贝﹐别怕﹐爸爸在这儿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry if you can’t finish all the questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不能做完全部题目也不要紧。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that they do not need to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 不用费心〔用于告诉某人不用做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry about sorting them out – I’ll do it later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不用费心整理——回头我来整理。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you will definitely do something
Subsense.TRAN: 别担心〔用于告诉某人自己肯定会做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you worry, I’ll make sure he does his fair share.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别担心﹐该他做的我一定会让他去做。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel anxious about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recent changes in the Earth’s climate are beginning to worry scientists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来地球的气候变化使科学家开始担忧起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t tell Mum and Dad – I didn’t want to worry them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没告诉爸妈——我不想让他们担心。

GramExa.PROPFORM: what worries me is .../the (only) thing that worries me is ...
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The only thing that worries me is the food. I don’t want to get food poisoning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我唯一担心的是食物﹐我可不想食物中毒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Doesn’t it worry you that Sarah spends so much time away from home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉整天往外跑﹐你不担心吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: feel anxious, especially when there is no need to
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re worrying yourself unnecessarily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在自寻烦恼。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not important
Sense.TRAN: 没关系〔用于指某事不重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not to worry, we can always go another time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没关系﹐我们总有时间去的。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that something is not as serious or difficult as they think
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just a check-up – nothing to worry about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是一次检查——没什么可担心的。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat didn’t seem to worry him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酷热似乎并没有让他烦恼。

Sense.DEF: if a dog worries sheep, it tries to bite or kill them
if an animal worries at a bone or piece of meat, it bites and shakes it
if you worry at a problem, you think about it a lot in order to find a solution
a problem that you are anxious about or are not sure how to deal with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My main worry is finding somewhere to live.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最大的烦恼是找住处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a lot of financial worries .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有很多经济上的烦心事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Money was always a big worry for us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱的问题一直是我们的一大烦恼。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use concern rather than worry , because it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英语书面语中,人们往往更喜欢用concern﹐而不用 worry﹐因为concern较正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: One of voters’ key concerns is crime.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民关心的主要问题之一就是犯罪问题。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being anxious about something

GramExa.GLOSS: feel extremely anxious
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His mother was desperate with worry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妈妈担心得要命。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been a constant source of worry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是让人担心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had no worries about safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不担心安全问题。

Sense.DEF: used to agree to what someone wants and to say that it will be no problem
Sense.TRAN: 没问题〔用于应允别人的要求〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you deliver on Thursday?’ ‘Yeah, no worries, mate.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “星期四你能交付吗？”“噢﹐没有问题﹐老兄。”

Sense.DEF:
a set of
bead s
on a string that you move about in order to keep yourself calm
something that is worrying makes you feel anxious or worried
Sense.TRAN: 令人担忧的﹔令人发愁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation is extremely worrying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形势非常令人担忧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a worrying development for small businesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对小公司来说这种发展态势令人担忧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a worrying few weeks for us all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几个星期大家都忧心忡忡。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Levels of some pollutants are worryingly high.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些污染物的含量高得令人担忧。

Sense.DEF: someone who worries a lot about unimportant things
more unpleasant, bad, or severe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The violence was worse than we expected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力事件比我们预想的更为严重。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic is much worse after five o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5点以后交通拥堵严重得多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather was a lot worse this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年天气糟糕得多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conditions will get worse as the winter continues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着冬天持续下去﹐情况会更糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: High inflation will make unemployment worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高通货膨胀率将使失业状况更加严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t say anything, you’ll only make matters worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么也别说﹐说了只会火上浇油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bullying got worse and worse until finally he had to leave the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他所受的欺侮越来越过分﹐最后只得离开了学校。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing worse than being robbed while you’re on holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有比度假时被抢劫更糟的了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school’s not perfect, but I suppose it could be worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校不是十全十美﹐不过我想还不算太糟吧。

Sense.DEF: more ill than before
Sense.TRAN: 病情更重的﹐更不舒服的
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she’s worse in the morning, I’ll call the doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她早上病情加重的话﹐我就去请医生来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was worried because he seemed to be getting worse rather than better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很担心﹐因为他的病情好像没有好转﹐反而恶化了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tablets seemed to make him worse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吃了那些药片后似乎病得更重了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be none the worse for sth
Sense.DEF: to not have been harmed by something
Sense.TRAN: 没有受到某事物的伤害
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed none the worse for her night out in the cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在外面冻了一晚上﹐好像一点事也没有。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are disappointed or annoyed by something
Sense.TRAN: 真不幸〔因某事而感到沮丧或生气时用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got one more year of college, worse luck!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还得再上一年大学﹐真倒霉！

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb could do worse than do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you think that someone should do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could do worse than marry Eleanor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和埃莉诺结婚倒不错。

Sense.DEF: to continue getting worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things went from bad to worse, and in the end she lost her job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况越来越糟﹐最终她丢了工作。

Sense.DEF: drunk

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: worse, worst
F2NBox.EXPL: Worse is a comparative form.
F2NBox.TRAN: worse是比较级形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The problem got worse and worse.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这问题变得越来越严重。
F2NBox.TRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘more worse’ or 或 ‘worser’.
F2NBox.EXPL: Worst is a superlative form.
F2NBox.TRAN: worst是最高级形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It was the worst film (NOT 不说 the worse film) I have ever seen.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我看过的最烂的电影。
F2NBox.TRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘most worst’ or 或 ‘worstest’.

Sense.DEF: something worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: We thought the situation was bad, but worse was to follow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们觉得当时形势很糟﹐但更糟的还在后头。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a turn for the worse
Sense.DEF: to change and become worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year his health took a turn for the worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年他的健康状况开始恶化。

Sense.DEF: in a more severe or serious way than before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By lunch time it was raining worse than ever.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到午饭时间﹐雨下得更大了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The business could become less profitable or, even worse , could close down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司可能会出现盈利减少﹐甚至有可能倒闭。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Suppose Rose, or worse still , Peter had seen the photograph?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如罗斯﹐甚至说彼得﹐已经看到了照片呢？

Sense.DEF: to become worse or make something worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of teachers expect the situation to worsen over the next few years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老师认为接下来的几年情形会更糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interfering now could worsen the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前介入可能会使问题更严重。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We are now faced with a worsening economic recession.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正面临日益加剧的经济衰退。

Sense.DEF: if you are worse off, you have less money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rent increases will leave us worse off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金提高会使我们更加拮据。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t think we’re any worse off than a lot of other people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不认为我们比其他许多人穷。

Sense.DEF: in a worse situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: People in rural areas are even worse off, as they have no regular bus service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在乡村地区的人情况更糟﹐因为他们没有定时班车服务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Other sports are much worse off than athletics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他体育项目的情况比田径运动要糟得多。

Sense.DEF: to show respect and love for a god, especially by praying in a religious building
Sense.TRAN: 敬奉（神）〔尤指在教堂﹑庙宇等祷告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all worship the same god.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都信奉同一个神。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a church where people have worshipped for hundreds of years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们做了几百年礼拜的一座教堂

Sense.DEF: to admire and love someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He absolutely worships her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他太崇拜她了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: worship the ground sb walks on
Sense.DEF: to admire or love someone so much that you cannot see their faults
Sense.TRAN: 拜倒在某人脚下〔以致看不到缺点〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She was a regular worshipper at the parish church.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经常在教区的教堂做礼拜。

Sense.DEF: the activity of praying or singing in a religious building in order to show respect and love for a god

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They bowed their heads in worship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们低头拜神。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Worship of the old gods still continues in remote areas of the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在该国的偏远地区﹐人们依然信奉古老的神明。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The ceremony must take place in a recognized place of worship .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该仪式必须在获得认可的敬拜场所举行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were invited to join in their act of worship religious ceremony .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们受邀参加他们的敬神仪式。

Sense.DEF:
used to talk to or about a public official such as a
mayor
or
magistrate
Sense.TRAN: 阁下〔对市长或地方法官等公务人员的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: worse than anything or anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the worst recession for fifty years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是50年来最严重的一次经济衰退。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My worst fear was that we would run out of food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最大的担忧是我们会把食物吃光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is the worst possible thing that can happen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最糟可能会发生什么事？

Sense.DEF: to cause a lot of problems for yourself because of your own behaviour
to lose a fight or argument
the person or thing that is worse than all others

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This year’s harvest is the worst that people can remember.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的收成是人们记忆中最差的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year was by far the worst much worse than any other for road accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年是交通事故最严重的一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think the worst is over now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想现在最糟的情况已经过去了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the worst part of the situation is , I can’t tell anyone what’s happening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最糟的是﹐我还不能告诉任何人发生了什么事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You saw the garden at its worst, I’m afraid when it is worse than at any other time .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你看到的是花园最荒凉时的情景。

Sense.DEF: most of something, or the most unpleasant or difficult part of it
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的大部分 ﹔某事物中最糟的一部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: The worst of the storm seemed to be over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最猛烈的一阵暴风雨似乎已经过去。

Sense.DEF: to expect or fear that something will not be successful or something bad will happen
Sense.TRAN: 预期/担心最坏的事情发生﹐作最坏打算
Sense.EXAMPLE: When it got so late and they still weren’t home, I began to fear the worst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天那么晚了他们还没回家﹐我开始担心发生了最坏的情况。

Sense.DEF: to lose a fight or argument
if things are as bad as they can be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Choosing the right software can be time-consuming at best and confusing or frustrating at worst .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑选合适的软件顺利的时候也是很费时间的﹐不顺利的时候会让人不知所措甚至灰心丧气。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone can try to harm you but they will not be able to
Sense.TRAN: 你/他/她/他们有什么手段尽管使出来〔但不会对自己造成伤害〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They can do their worst now, because I’m leaving in three weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们现在想怎么使坏就怎么使坏吧﹐反正我三星期以后就走了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: if the worst comes to the worst
Sense.DEF: if the situation develops in the worst possible way
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the worst comes to the worst, we’ll sell the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果发生最坏的情况﹐我们就把汽车卖掉。

Sense.DEF: most badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aid is being sent to areas that have been worst affected by the earthquake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 援助物资正在送往受地震影响最严重的地区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the worst-dressed man in the office
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里衣着最差的男人

Sense.DEF: used to say what is the worst part of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had no office of her own and, worst of all, she didn’t even have her own computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有自己的办公室﹐最糟的是﹐她甚至连自己的电脑都没有。

Sense.DEF: a type of woollen cloth

Subsense.DEF: to have a value in money
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The house must be worth quite a lot of money now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子现在一定值大钱了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One of the pictures is worth £50,000.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一幅画值5万英镑。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you know how much the ring is worth ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道这枚戒指值多少钱吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This art collection is worth a fortune worth a very large amount of money .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这批艺术收藏品价值连城。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be worth nothing/not be worth anything
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a very old machine so I shouldn’t think it’s worth anything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台机器已经很旧﹐因此我觉得它一文不值。

Subsense.DEF: to have money or possessions that have value
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard that he’s worth over $2 million.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说他有两百多万美元的身家。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The man who founded the company must be worth a fortune .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 创立这家公司的人一定家财不菲。
Subsense.HINTTRAN: Worth is not a verb. Do not say that something ‘worths’ something. worth不是动词﹐不要说something worths something。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is interesting, useful, or helpful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the small towns in the area are definitely worth visiting.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区的许多小镇确实值得去看一看。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The film is well worth seeing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片很值得一看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The local museum is worth a visit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地这家博物馆值得参观。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone should do something because they will gain something from it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s worth checking the details of the contract before you sign it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在合同上签字之前应该核对细节。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s well worth getting there early if you want a good seat.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果想要一个好座位﹐就该早点到那里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a great evening, and definitely worth all the hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个夜晚太美妙了﹐所有的辛苦绝对没有白费。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you gain something from an action
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a lot of hard work, but it was worth it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然非常辛苦﹐但是值得。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not gain anything from an action
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought about trying to talk to him about it, but decided it wasn’t worth it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾经想过和他谈谈这件事﹐不过最后还是认为谈了也是白谈。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be worth sb’s while (to do/doing sth)
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should spend time or money on something because they will gain something from it
Sense.TRAN: 值得某人花时间[钱]（去做某事）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: your while to talk to the head of department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和部门主管谈谈也许对你会有好处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people feel it’s not worth their while working if they can get money from the state.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人觉得要是可以从政府那里拿到钱就没有必要去工作。

Sense.DEF: to offer something to someone so that they will do something for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He promised to make it worth our while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他答应要酬谢我们。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to ask someone how they will reward you if you do something for them
Sense.TRAN: 有什么好处？〔用于替别人做事时问对方会怎样酬谢自己﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving someone information, to say that you are not sure how useful it is
Sense.TRAN: 不管有没有价值〔用于表示自己提供的资料不一定有用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s the list of names, for what it’s worth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有一张名单﹐不一定能派上用场。

Sense.LEXUNIT: for all you are/he is etc worth
Sense.DEF: with as much effort as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was pulling the rope for all he was worth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在拼命拉绳子。

Sense.DEF: doing their job well or deserving respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any player worth his salt would love to play for his country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何一名值得尊敬的运动员都愿意为国家效力。

Sense.DEF: very useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: In these mountains, an experienced guide is worth his weight in gold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这群山里﹐一位经验丰富的向导是极有帮助的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: ten pounds’ worth/$500 worth etc of sth
Sense.DEF: an amount of something worth ten pounds, $500 etc
Sense.TRAN: 价值10英镑/500美元等的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to win £2,000 worth of computing equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次赢取价值2,000英镑的电脑设备的机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire caused thousands of pounds’ worth of damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火灾造成了数千英镑的损失。

Sense.LEXUNIT: ten minutes’ worth/a week’s worth etc of sth
Sense.DEF: something that takes ten minutes, a week etc to happen, do, or use
Sense.TRAN: 可维持[使用]十分钟/一星期等的某物﹔需要十分钟/一星期等来完成的某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had only three days’ worth of food left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只剩下够吃三天的食物了。

Sense.DEF: how good or useful something is or how important it is to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new computer system has already proved its worth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的计算机系统已经证明了它的价值。

Sense.DEF: how much money something is worth
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to estimate the current worth of the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难估算出这家公司当前的资产价值。

Sense.DEF: something that is worthless has no value, importance, or use
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was full of worthless junk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子里堆满了没有用的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information was worthless to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些资料对我毫无用处。

Sense.DEF: a worthless person has no good qualities or useful skills
Sense.EXAMPLE: His parents had made him feel worthless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父母让他觉得自己一无是处。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She struggled to overcome her feelings of worthlessness.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭力不让自己觉得自己一点用也没有。

Sense.DEF: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it
Sense.TRAN: 重要的﹔有益的﹔值得做的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想做有意义的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause one that helps people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定把这笔钱投入到慈善事业中。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is worthwhile to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I thought it was worthwhile to clarify the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为有必要澄清事实。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t worthwhile continuing with the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目不值得再继续了。

Sense.DEF: deserving respect from people
Sense.TRAN: 值得尊敬的﹔值得赞赏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leeds United were worthy winners of the competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹联队是比赛当之无愧的获胜者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a worthy opponent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 值得钦佩的对手

Sense.DEF: to deserve to be thought about or treated in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of other books are worthy of mention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有一些其他的书值得一提。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a teacher who is worthy of respect
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位值得尊敬的老师

Sense.DEF: to be as good as something that a particular person would do
Sense.EXAMPLE: a goal that was worthy of any of the great footballers of the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堪与世界上任何一位伟大足球运动员相媲美的一个进球

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that you consider it a great honour to be with someone because they are famous, or much more skilful at doing something than you are
Sense.TRAN: 我/我们不配〔幽默用法﹐表示很荣幸和某个名人或水平高得多的人在一起〕

Sense.DEF: trying to help other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money will go to a worthy cause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱将用于慈善事业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure his motives were worthy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信他的动机是助人。

Sense.DEF: someone who is important and should be respected
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were met by a group of local worthies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批当地的知名人士接见了我们。

Sense.DEF:
an informal spelling of
what
used to say what someone intended to do or expected to happen
Sense.TRAN: 将﹐将会〔表示想做某事或认为某事会发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They said they would meet us at 10.30 at the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说过会在10点30分到车站接我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said she wouldn’t be coming to the library any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她再也不会到图书馆来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arnold knew he would be tired the next day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿诺德知道自己第二天会很累。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would soon be dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天很快就要黑了。

Subsense.DEF: used when talking about the result of a possible or imagine situation or event, or describing one
Subsense.TRAN: 会〔用于设想的或希望发生的情形〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What would you do if you won a million pounds?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你赢得100万英镑，你会做什么？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I would be amazed if I got the job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是得到这份工作就会喜出望外。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It would be lovely to see you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如能见到你那就太好了。

Subsense.DEF: used when talking about something that did not happen, or a situation that cannot exist
Subsense.TRAN: 会〔用于不曾发生或不可能存在的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I would have phoned you, but there wasn’t time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本想给你打电话﹐但没有时间。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Alex would never have found out if you hadn’t told him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你没有告诉亚历克斯﹐他绝对不会发现的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What would have happened if I hadn’t been here?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我没在这里﹐会发生什么事？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Everything would be very different if your father were still alive.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你爸爸还在世﹐那一切都会很不一样。

Subsense.DEF: used to mention an unlikely situation or event that you want to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: they would come and visit us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿他们会来看我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: he would listen to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能听我的话就好了。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use the past tense, not would , in a clause beginning with ‘if’ when mentioning a possible or imagined situation or event in the present or future.
F2NBox.TRAN: 若if引导的从句中提及现在或将来的某种可能或设想的情况或事件﹐要用过去时﹐而不用would
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I would be surprised if he did not agree with me (NOT 不说 if he would not agree with me).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他不同意我的意见﹐我会感到意外的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happened often or regularly in the past
Sense.TRAN: 老是﹐总是〔表示过去经常做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we worked in the same office, we would often have coffee together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过去在同一间办公室工作的时候﹐经常一起喝咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On summer evenings they would sit out in the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天的晚上他们会坐在外面的花园里。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone politely to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you shut the window, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把窗户关上﹐好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you mind waiting outside?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您在外面等好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would someone please tell me what is going on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问谁能告诉我发生什么事了？

Sense.DEF: used to offer something to someone or invite them somewhere politely
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于礼貌地向某人提供某物或邀请某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a coffee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要喝杯咖啡吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to the theatre this evening. Would you be interested in coming?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我们要去看戏﹐你有没有兴趣一起来？

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone wants something or wants to do something
Sense.TRAN: 想〔用于表示某人想要某物或想做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Yes, please, I’d love a coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的﹐我想喝杯咖啡。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents would like to meet you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母想见见你。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Claudia would have liked to refuse wanted to refuse , but she didn’t dare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克劳迪娅本想拒绝﹐可是她不敢。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d hate I do not want to disappoint you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让你失望。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say what someone prefers
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d rather stay in this evening, if that’s all right with you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你觉得可以﹐今晚我宁可待在家里。

Sense.DEF: used after ‘so that’ to show that someone was trying to make something happen or prevent something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于so that后表示试图让某事发生或防止某事发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We packed all the books in wooden boxes so that they wouldn’t get damaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把所有的书籍都装入木箱防止受损。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone refused to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He wouldn’t give us any money.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不会给我们钱的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something did not happen, even though someone was trying to make it happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The door wouldn’t open, no matter how hard she pushed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管她怎么用力推﹐门就是打不开。

Sense.DEF: used when giving or asking for advice
Sense.TRAN: 会…〔用于提出或寻求建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d try to get there early if you can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你可以早到﹐我也会尽量早到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would talk to the doctor if I were you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是你的话﹐就会和医生谈谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would you do if you were in my position?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是碰到我这样的情况会怎么办？

Sense.DEF: used to give your opinion about something when you are not very sure about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would think you’d be happier in a different school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你要是换一所学校也许会更快乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will it cost a lot?’ ‘I would imagine so.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “要很多钱吗？”“我猜是的。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that an action is typical or expected – usually used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 会…〔表示某行为很典型或在意料之中﹐一般含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You would go and spoil it, wouldn’t you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会去把事情搞砸﹐是不是！
Sense.EXAMPLE: She insists that she was innocent, but then she would say that, wouldn’t she?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚称自己是无辜的﹐不过她总是那么说﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: used to express a strong wish or desire
Sense.TRAN: 但愿…﹔要是…多好〔表示强烈的愿望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would that we had seen her before she died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我们能在她去世之前见上她一面该有多好。

Sense.DEF: someone who hopes to have a particular job or intends to do a particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 想当演员的人/企图行凶的人等
the short form of 缩略式= ‘would not’
the short form of 缩略式= ‘would have’

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
wind 2
an injury to your body that is made by a weapon such as a knife or a bullet
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体遭受刀﹑子弹等伤害留下的〕伤口﹐创伤
Sense.EXAMPLE: A nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士把伤口清洗包扎好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took several months for his wounds to heal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的伤口几个月后才愈合。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several of the victims suffered severe stab wounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中几个受害者受了严重的刀伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was treated in hospital for head wounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因头部受伤在医院接受了治疗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He died of gunshot wounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死于枪伤。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor said it was only a flesh wound one that does not cut the skin very deeply .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说那只是皮肉伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gaping wound one that is wide and open on his thigh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大腿上裂开的伤口

Sense.DEF: a feeling of emotional or mental pain that you get when someone says or does something unpleasant to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will take much longer for the mental wounds to heal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神创伤需要更长的时间才能愈合。

Sense.DEF: to remind someone of unpleasant things that happened in the past
to injure someone with a knife, gun etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gunmen killed two people and wounded six others in an attack today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在今天的一起袭击事件中﹐持枪歹徒打死两人﹐打伤六人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five people were killed and many others were seriously wounded in the attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在袭击中五人死亡﹐另有多人受重伤。

GramExa.GLOSS: be wounded so badly that you die

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel unhappy or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was deeply wounded by his comments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话使我深受伤害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made some very wounding remarks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说了一些很伤人的话。

Sense.DEF: injured by a weapon such as a gun or knife
Sense.TRAN: 受〔刀﹑枪等〕伤害的﹐负伤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wounded soldier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤的士兵

Sense.DEF: very upset because of something that someone has said or done
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was only wounded pride that stopped him from apologizing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是因为伤了自尊而不愿道歉。

Sense.DEF: people who have been injured, especially in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: providing medical care for the wounded
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对伤员进行救治

GramExa.GLOSS: people who have been injured but are well enough to walk

Sense.DEF: anxious, worried, or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was too wound up to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我激动得睡不着。

Sense.DEF:
a past tense of
weave

a past participle of
weave
used when you think something is very impressive or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 呀﹐哇〔表示非常赞叹或惊奇〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wow! Look at that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇！看呀！

Sense.DEF: to make people admire you a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show has wowed audiences all over the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目赢得了全国观众的交口称赞。

Sense.DEF: a great success
an interesting, exciting, or unusual feature of something, that people will notice and think is very impressive
a female police officer

used to describe the speed at which someone can write using a
keyboard
Sense.TRAN: 每分钟字数〔表示打字速度〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
rack 2

a
ghost
a long and complicated argument

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bitter wrangle over copyright
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对版权问题的争论不休

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was involved in a long legal wrangle with his employers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和雇主陷入了一场长期的法律纠纷。

Sense.DEF: to argue with someone angrily for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are still wrangling over ownership of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们仍在就房子的所有权问题争吵不休。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The various government departments are wrangling with each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府各部门之间在相互争论。

Sense.DEF:
a
cowboy
to put paper or cloth over something to cover it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The present was beautifully wrapped in gold paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 礼物用金色包装纸包着﹐很漂亮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ella wrapped a thick coat around her shoulders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉肩上围了一件厚外套。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wrapped a bandage around my injured wrist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我受伤的手腕包上了绷带。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

Sense.DEF: if you wrap your arms, legs, or fingers around something, you use them to hold it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wrapped his arms around her waist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用双臂搂住了她的腰。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: wrap sb around your little finger

Sense.DEF: to put on warm clothes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure you wrap up warm – it’s freezing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要穿暖和点——天很冷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was wrapped up in a thick winter coat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她裹了一件厚厚的冬装。

Sense.DEF: to finish a job, meeting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping to wrap up the negotiations this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望本周结束谈判。

Sense.DEF: to give so much of your attention to something that you do not have time for anything else
Sense.TRAN: 把全部精力放在某事上〔以至于没有时间关心别的事〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders
a type of thin clear plastic that is used to cover food
to keep something secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project has been kept under wraps for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目保密了许多年。

Sense.DEF: to show or tell people about something new or secret
Sense.TRAN: 揭开某事物的面纱﹐把某事物展示出来[公之于众]

Sense.DEF: a type of sandwich made with thin bread which is rolled around meat, vegetables etc
Sense.TRAN: 三明治卷〔用薄面包片包卷肉﹑蔬菜等制成〕

Sense.DEF: the end of a day’s filming
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK everybody, it’s a wrap!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐各位﹐收工！

Sense.DEF: a wrap-around skirt is one that you wind around your body and fasten in place

wrap-around
sunglasses
curve around the sides of your face

an arrangement in which young children in Britain can go to school early in the morning and stay at school after the normal school day has finished, and take part in organized activities until their parents can collect them after finishing work
Sense.TRAN: 〔在英国指到校早并有课后托管的〕全包式儿童照顾服务

Sense.DEF:
sunglasses
that are curved in such a way that they fit close to your face, from one ear to the other
the piece of paper or plastic that covers something when it is sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: old sweet wrappers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧糖果纸

Sense.DEF: the cloth, paper, or plastic that is wrapped around something to protect it
Sense.TRAN: 包装布﹔包装纸﹔包装塑料
Sense.EXAMPLE: I finally managed to get the plastic wrapping off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于去掉了塑料包装。

Sense.DEF: coloured paper that you use for wrapping presents
a short report that repeats the main points, for example of a news broadcast
extreme anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was scared of incurring his father’s wrath .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他害怕惹他父亲大发脾气。

Sense.DEF: to cause a lot of damage or problems
Sense.TRAN: （对某事物）造成浩劫/混乱/破坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: These policies have wreaked havoc on the British economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些政策严重破坏了英国经济。

Sense.DEF: to do something unpleasant to someone to punish them for something they have done to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He promised to wreak vengeance on those who had betrayed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发誓要报复那些背叛他的人。

Sense.DEF: a circle made from leaves or flowers that you put on the place where a person is buried
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prime minister laid a wreath at the war memorial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相向战争纪念碑献了花圈。

Sense.DEF: a circle of leaves or flowers that people use to decorate their houses at Christmas
Sense.TRAN: 〔圣诞节期间装饰屋子的〕花环

Sense.DEF: a circle made from leaves that a person wore on their head in the past as a sign of honour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a laurel wreath
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桂冠

Sense.DEF: to be covered in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mountains were wreathed in mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山笼罩在迷雾中。

Sense.DEF: to be smiling and look very happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: His plump face was wreathed in smiles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他胖乎乎的脸上乐开了花。

Sense.DEF: to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Injury threatened to wreck his sporting career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤病可能会毁了他的运动生涯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was drink that wrecked their marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是酒毁了他们的婚姻。

Sense.DEF: to damage something such as a building or vehicle so badly that it cannot be repaired
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was completely wrecked in the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车在事故中完全损毁。

Sense.DEF: if a ship is wrecked, it is badly damaged and sinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship was wrecked off the coast of Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船在非洲沿海失事了。

Sense.DEF: a car, plane, or train that has been damaged very badly, especially in a crash
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指事故中〕遭严重毁坏的汽车[飞机﹐火车]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was still alive when they pulled him from the wreck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把他从失事的车辆中拖出来时﹐他还活着。

Sense.DEF: a ship that has sunk

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜水员发现了一艘沉没的德国旧军舰。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very nervous, tired, or unhealthy
Sense.TRAN: 十分紧张[疲劳﹐不健康]的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked a complete wreck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去元气大伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The attack had left her an emotional wreck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次袭击让她变成了惊弓之鸟。

Sense.DEF: an accident involving cars or other vehicles

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father died in a car wreck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲死于车祸。

Sense.DEF: a place that is very untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you’re here, this place is a wreck!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一来﹐这地方就变得乱糟糟的！

Sense.DEF: an old car that is in a very bad condition
the parts of something such as a plane, ship, or building that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑船只﹑建筑物等被毁后的〕残骸
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firemen managed to pull some survivors from the wreckage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防队员设法从残骸中拖出了几名幸存者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Accident investigators will examine the wreckage of the plane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故调查人员将检查飞机残骸。

Sense.DEF: the parts of someone’s relationships, hopes, or plans that remain after they have been spoiled
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系﹑希望﹑计划等遭破坏后的〕残余

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She still hoped to salvage something from the wreckage of her marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍然希望从自己破碎的婚姻中挽回点什么。

Sense.DEF: very drunk
extremely tired
someone who deliberately destroys something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She accused him of being a marriage wrecker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指责他破坏婚姻。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle that is used to take away damaged cars after an accident
Sense.TRAN: 〔事故发生后拖走毁坏车辆的〕拖吊车﹐救险车﹐清障车

Sense.DEF:
a heavy metal ball attached to a chain or
cable
which is used to knock down buildings
Sense.TRAN: 破碎球﹐落锤〔指挂在铁链或缆绳上用于拆除建筑物的金属球〕

Sense.DEF: a group of workers whose job is to knock down buildings
a very small brown bird
to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wrenched the packet from his grasp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用力夺过他攥在手里的纸袋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door had been wrenched open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门被猛地拉开了。

Sense.DEF: to use your strength to pull yourself away from someone who is holding you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to wrench herself free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想方设法挣脱了出来。

Sense.DEF: to hurt a joint in your body by twisting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ve wrenched my knee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我膝盖扭伤了。

Sense.DEF:
especially AmE a metal tool that you use for turning
nut s
to do something that will cause problems or spoil someone’s plans
Sense.SYN: throw/put a spanner in the works

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of sadness that you get when you leave a person or place that you love
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaving New York had been a terrible wrench.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开纽约让人十分伤感。

Sense.DEF: a twisting movement that pulls something violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grabbed the rope and gave it a wrench.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓住绳子猛地一拉。

Sense.DEF: to take power or influence away from someone, especially when this is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are fighting to wrest control of the party from the old leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正极力从老一辈领导人手中夺取对党的控制权。

Sense.DEF: to pull something away from someone violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to wrest the photograph from his grasp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法把他攥在手里的照片夺了过来。

Sense.DEF: to fight someone by holding them and pulling or pushing them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two men wrestled with each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子互相扭打着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Police officers wrestled him to the ground .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察把他扑倒在地。

Sense.DEF: to move something or try to move it when it is large, heavy, or difficult to move
Sense.TRAN: 使劲搬动[移动]〔很大﹑很重或很难移动的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ray continued to wrestle with the wheel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷继续猛扳方向盘。

Sense.DEF: to try to understand or find a solution to a difficult problem
Sense.TRAN: 努力解决某事﹔为某事绞尽脑汁
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have been wrestling with this problem for quite some time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题我折腾了好久。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes part in wrestling
a sport in which two people fight by holding each other and trying to make each other fall to the ground
someone that you feel sorry for
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a lonely, miserable wretch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个孤独的可怜虫。

Sense.DEF: someone you are annoyed with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop pulling my hair, you wretch!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别拉我头发﹐你这淘气鬼！

Sense.DEF: someone who is wretched is very unhappy or ill, and you feel sorry for them
Sense.TRAN: 极不愉快的﹔病得很重的﹔极不幸的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the poor, wretched girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其不幸的可怜姑娘

Sense.DEF: if you feel wretched, you feel guilty and unhappy because of something bad that you have done
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于做了不好的事〕感到愧疚的﹐难过的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guy felt wretched about it now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在盖伊对那件事觉得很愧疚。

Sense.DEF: making you feel annoyed or angry
Sense.TRAN: 令人恼怒的﹔使人愤怒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where is that wretched boy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个可恶的男孩在哪里？

Sense.DEF: extremely bad or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shocked to see their wretched living conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他们恶劣的生活条件我很震惊。

Sense.DEF: to twist your body from side to side with small quick movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop wriggling and let me put your T-shirt on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别扭来扭去的﹐让我把T恤给你穿上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wriggled through the window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扭动身子钻出窗户。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog wriggled free and ran off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗挣脱开跑了。

Sense.DEF: to move a part of your body backwards and forwards with small movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took off her shoes and wriggled her toes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脱掉鞋子﹐扭动脚趾。

Sense.DEF: to avoid doing something by using clever excuses
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to wriggle out of your responsibilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别想逃避责任。

Sense.DEF: to take off a tight piece of clothing by twisting your body from side to side
Sense.TRAN: 扭动身体脱掉〔紧身的衣服〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wriggled out of her dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扭动身体脱掉了连衣裙。

Sense.DEF: a movement in which you twist your body from side to side
to succeed in getting something from someone, but only after a lot of effort

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are always trying to wring additional funds from the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们总想从政府手中搞到更多的资金。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to wring the information out of him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想法从他那里弄到了这些信息。

Sense.DEF: to tightly twist a wet cloth or wet clothes in order to remove water
Sense.TRAN: 把 〔湿布或湿衣服〕拧干﹔绞出〔水〕

Sense.DEF: to rub and twist your hands together because you are worried and upset
to shake hands very firmly with someone
to kill a small animal by twisting its neck
Sense.TRAN: 拧断某只小动物的脖子

Sense.DEF: used when you are very angry with someone
Sense.TRAN: 我要拧断某人的脖子〔用于表示愤怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll wring her neck when I get hold of her!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我抓到她﹐我要拧断她的脖子！

Sense.DEF: extremely wet
Sense.TRAN: 湿得能拧出水来的﹐湿淋淋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This jacket’s wringing wet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件上衣湿得都能拧出水来！

Sense.DEF: a machine with two parts that roll over each other and press on wet clothes to remove water
to have a lot of problems and upsetting experiences
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s really been through the wringer since her husband died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫去世之后﹐她历尽艰辛。

Sense.DEF: wrinkles are lines on your face and skin that you get when you are old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face was a mass of wrinkles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸上布满皱纹。

Sense.DEF: a small untidy fold in a piece of clothing or paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked over to the bed and smoothed out the wrinkles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走到床边﹐抚平皱褶。

Sense.DEF: to solve the small problems in something

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那瘦削的布满皱纹的脸庞

Sense.DEF: if you wrinkle a part of your face, or if it wrinkles, small lines appear on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex wrinkled up her nose at the smell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闻到那股味道﹐亚历克丝皱起了鼻子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carter wrinkled his forehead in concentration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特全神贯注﹐眉头紧锁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His brow wrinkled when he saw us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一看见我们就皱起了眉头。

Sense.DEF: if a piece of clothing wrinkles, it gets small untidy folds in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trouble with linen is that it wrinkles so easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚麻布的麻烦是太容易起褶。

Sense.DEF: skin or cloth that is wrinkled has small lines or folds in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: her wrinkled old face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满是皱纹的苍老面容

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for someone who is old
the part of your body where your hand joins your arm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a gold watch on her wrist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手腕上戴了块金表。

Sense.DEF: a band that some tennis players wear around their wrists
a band with your name on it that you wear around your wrist, for example in a hospital
Sense.TRAN: 〔医院等使用的写有姓名的〕腕带

Sense.DEF: a watch that you wear on your wrist
a document from a court that orders someone to do or not to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He issued a writ against the newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他签发了传讯这家报纸的令状。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has been served with a writ for damages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司收到了给予损害赔偿的令状。

Subsense.DEF: very easy to notice
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I could see the curiosity writ large on Rose’s face.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出罗丝脸上明显表露出好奇。

Subsense.DEF: in a very clear strong form
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This is an example of bureaucracy writ large.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是典型的官僚主义行为。

Subsense.DEF: to produce a new book, article, poem etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He wrote some very famous books.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写过一些很有名的书。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Who wrote ‘Harry Potter’?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《哈利·波特》是谁写的？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can’t come with you – I have an essay to write.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能跟你一起去——我有一篇文章要写。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: O’Brien often writes about her native Ireland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥布赖恩经常写她的故乡爱尔兰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The article is very well written.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章写得非常好。

Subsense.DEF: someone who writes earns money by writing books, plays, articles etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sean decided he wanted to write, and quit his job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖恩决定从事写作﹐于是辞掉了工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maureen Dowd writes for ‘The New York Times’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫琳•多德为《纽约时报》撰稿。

Sense.DEF: to put words in a letter to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve written to my MP, and to the city council.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已给我们议员以及市政委员会写了信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chris hasn’t written me for a long time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯很长时间没给我写信了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wrote her several letters , but she didn’t reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给她写了几封信﹐可是她没有回复。

Sense.DEF: to form letters or numbers with a pen or pencil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kerry could read and write when she was five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克丽五岁时就能读书写字了。

Sense.DEF: to state something in a book, letter, advertisement etc, or on a label

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Isabella wrote that she was dying, and asked him to visit her for the last time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莎贝拉写信说她快死了﹐要他去见她最后一面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The price is written on the label.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格写在标签上。

Sense.DEF: to write a piece of music or a song
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mozart wrote the music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特创作了这首曲子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The song was originally written by Leonard Cohen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌由伦纳德•科恩原创。

Sense.DEF: to make a program for a computer to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: He writes software programs for financial institutions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为金融机构编写软件程序。

Sense.DEF: if a computer writes something, it records it on a disk or in its memory
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机〕将…写入〔磁盘或存储器〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: data that had been written to disk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 写入磁盘的数据

Sense.DEF: to write information on a cheque, form etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wouldn’t it be easier if I just wrote a cheque for the lot?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果全部数额我就开一张支票﹐不是更方便吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor wrote me a prescription for sleeping pills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生给我开了一张安眠药处方。

Sense.DEF: if a pen writes, it works properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do any of these pens write?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些笔当中有能写的吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sth/be written all over your face
Sense.DEF: to show very clearly what you are feeling or thinking
Sense.TRAN: 脸上明显表露出〔感受或想法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had guilt written all over his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满脸内疚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know you’re lying, Tyrell – it’s written all over your face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你在撒谎﹐蒂雷尔——你脸上明明白白写着呢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sth written all over it
Sense.DEF: to show a particular quality or fact very clearly
Sense.TRAN: 明显表现出某种性质[事实]
Sense.EXAMPLE: This awful film has ‘career-killer’ written all over it for the actors involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部烂片对参与拍摄的演员来说显然就是“演艺生涯杀手”。

Sense.DEF: not particularly good or special
Sense.TRAN: 平平常常的﹔没什么了不起的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel was good, but the food was nothing to write home about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店不错﹐但食物就不怎么样了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb wrote the book on sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone knows a lot about a subject or is very good at an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Motorola wrote the book on quality control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩托罗拉精通质量监控。

Sense.DEF: used to mean that you cannot stop what happens next in a situation, especially when it is bad

Exponent.DEF: to use a pen or pencil to make words, letters etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you written a shopping list?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你写购物清单了吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children are learning to read and write.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在学习识字和写字。

Exponent.DEF: to write something on paper, in order to remember it or make a record
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He wrote down everything she said.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她说的一切都记了下来。

Exponent.DEF: to write something in a particular place, or to write particular words
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve put the dates of the meetings in my diary.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在记事簿中写下了会议的日期。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At the end of the email she put ‘PS I love you’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在电子邮件的末尾她写上了“还有﹐我爱你”。

Exponent.DEF: to write something that you have agreed or promised, so that there is an official record
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They said they would pay me 50%, but they haven’t actually put it in writing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说会付给我50%﹐但实际上没有通过书面形式明确下来。

Exponent.DEF: to write information that you might need later
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll just make a note of your address.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来把你的地址记下来。

Exponent.DEF: to write things while someone is speaking or while something is happening, so that you can use them later
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His lawyer was with him taking notes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的律师在他旁边做笔录。

Exponent.DEF: to write something carelessly and untidily, especially in big letters – often used to show disapproval
Exponent.TRAN: 潦草地写﹐涂写〔常含贬义〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone had scrawled graffiti on the school wall.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在学校墙上涂鸦。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’d scrawled a few unhelpful comments at the bottom of my work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在我的作业下面潦草地写了些没有用的意见。

Exponent.DEF: to write information on a form or other official document
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Please fill in the application form in black ink.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请用黑色墨水填写申请表。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Would you mind filling out a questionnaire?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 能请你填一张问卷吗？

Exponent.DEF: to write your name at the end of a letter, document etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Read the contract carefully, and then sign it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细阅读合同﹐然后签字。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to sign your name.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了签名。

Section.SECHEADING: TO WRITE SOMETHING QUICKLY 快速写某物

Exponent.DEF: to write something very quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Start your essay by jotting down a few ideas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始写论文时﹐先把一些想法记下来。

Exponent.DEF: to write something quickly and in an untidy way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Andy scribbled a quick note and handed it to the chairman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪草草写了张纸条交给主席。

Section.SECHEADING: TO WRITE SOMETHING ON A COMPUTER 在计算机上写某物

Exponent.DEF: to make words or numbers appear on a computer screen by pressing the keys
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You have to enter your password twice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 密码必须输入两次。

Exponent.DEF: to write or record information on a computer, especially something you are copying
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve keyed in my credit card details.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我键入了我的信用卡信息。

Sense.DEF: to write a letter to a company or organization asking them to send you goods or information
Sense.TRAN: 给〔公司或机构〕写信索取〔货品或信息〕﹐函索
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve written away for their free catalog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已去信索取他们的免费目录。

Sense.DEF: to reply to a letter that someone sent you, by writing a letter to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent them a card once, but they never wrote back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾给他们寄过一张卡片﹐但他们根本没有回信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wrote back to them immediately, thanking them for their kind invitation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我立即给他们回信﹐感谢他们的盛情邀请。

Sense.DEF: to write something on a piece of paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the address. Do you want to write it down?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是地址﹐你要不要记下来？

Sense.DEF: to officially say that a debt no longer has to be paid, or officially accept that you cannot get back money you have spent or lost
to write a letter to an organization to give an opinion, ask for information etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔给某机构〕写信〔表述看法﹑索取资料等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you would like a copy of our fact sheet, please write in, enclosing a stamped addressed envelope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如需说明资料﹐请来函索取﹐并附邮资已付的回邮信封。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: And so I wrote in to Radio Brighton.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因此我给布赖顿广播电台写了信。

Sense.DEF: to write a piece of information in the space provided for it on a form or document
Sense.TRAN: 在〔表格或文件预留的空白处〕填写〔资料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Provide some space for students to write in their hobbies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 留些空白给同学们填写他们的兴趣爱好。

Sense.DEF: to add someone’s name to the official list on your voting form, to show that you want to vote for them
Sense.TRAN: 在选票上加进某人的名字
Sense.EXAMPLE: The campaign to write in Johnson for governor failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图加选约翰逊为州长的活动失败了。

Sense.DEF: to add or include something in a contract, agreement etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was written into his contract that he had to make two records a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一年必须出两张唱片﹐这是写在他的合同里的。

Sense.DEF: to write a letter to a company or organization asking them to send you goods or information
Sense.TRAN: 〔给公司或机构〕写信索取〔货品或资料〕﹐函索

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you going to write off for that free poster?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备写信索取那张免费海报吗？

Sense.DEF: to decide that someone or something is useless, unimportant, or a failure
Sense.TRAN: 认为某人/某事无用[不重要﹐失败]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After six months of work, we eventually wrote the project off as a non-starter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 干了六个月以后﹐我们最终认定这个项目不可能取得成功。

Sense.DEF: to officially say that a debt no longer has to be paid, or officially accept that you cannot get back money you have spent or lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: The United States agreed to write off debts worth billions of dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国同意勾销数十亿美元的债务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Inland Revenue wrote off £900 million in unpaid taxes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内税务局勾销了九亿英镑的未付税款。

Sense.DEF: to make an official record of the amount of money that you have spent on things relating to your business, in order to reduce the amount of tax that you have to pay
Sense.TRAN: 〔为减少税款而〕把〔某笔公司运营成本〕做进财务记录

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The costs of setting up a business can be written off against tax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的创办费用可以抵扣税款。

Sense.DEF: to damage a vehicle so badly that it can never be used again
Sense.EXAMPLE: At thirteen he stole a car and wrote it off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他13岁时偷过一辆汽车﹐然后把它弄报废了。

Sense.DEF: to write something on paper, especially in a neat and clear way, including all the necessary details
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were asked to choose their favourite poem and write it out in their best handwriting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们被要求选出他们最喜欢的诗歌﹐并用最工整的字抄写出来。

Sense.DEF: to write information on a cheque or a form
Sense.EXAMPLE: She calmly wrote out a check for $500 and handed it to Will.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她镇定自若地开出一张500美元的支票交给威尔。

Sense.DEF: to remove a character from a regular radio or television programme, by making him or her leave or die in the story
Sense.TRAN: 去掉﹐写死〔系列广播或电视节目中的角色〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was revealed last week that Alma is being written out of the series.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周剧情透露阿尔玛将从系列剧中消失。

Sense.DEF: to write a report, article etc using notes that you made earlier
Sense.TRAN: 〔根据先前的笔记〕写成〔报告﹑文章等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to write up my report before the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须在会议前把报告整理出来。

Sense.DEF: to write something on a wall, board etc where people can see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher repeated the word, and then wrote it up on the blackboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师重复了一遍那个单词﹐然后在黑板上写了下来。

Sense.DEF: if something is written up in a newspaper, magazine etc, someone describes what it is like and gives their opinion of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to a Spanish restaurant that was written up in Time Out’s good food guide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们准备去《消费导刊》美食向导栏目介绍过的一家西班牙餐厅。

Sense.DEF:
a vote you give to someone by writing their name on your
ballot paper
a vehicle that has been so badly damaged that it can never be used again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was a complete write-off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆汽车彻底报废了。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when you fail to achieve anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: This morning was a complete write-off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天上午一事无成。

Sense.DEF: an official agreement that someone does not have to pay a debt

if a computer document or
disk
is write-protected, the information in it cannot be changed or removed
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机文件或磁盘〕写保护的
Sense.EXAMPLE: write-protected files
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写保护的文件

Sense.DEF: someone who writes books, stories etc, especially as a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s one of my favourite writers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我最喜欢的作家之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a science-fiction writer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科幻小说作家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a well-known writer on American music
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名的美国音乐乐评人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a writer of children’s stories
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童故事作家

Sense.DEF: someone who has written something or who writes in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always been a sloppy writer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写字向来潦草。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the writer of the previous message on this topic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个话题前一条消息的留言人

Sense.DEF: the problem that a writer sometimes has of not being able to think of new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 作者的文思不畅﹐作者卡文

Sense.DEF: a feeling of stiffness in your hand that you get after writing for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔书写时间过长而引起的〕书写痉挛

Sense.DEF: a written opinion about a new book, play, or product in a newspaper, magazine etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸﹑期刊等上对新书﹑新剧或新产品的〕评论文章
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play got a really good write-up it was praised in the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏在报刊上大受好评。

Sense.DEF: to twist your body from side to side violently, especially because you are suffering pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因疼痛〕剧烈地扭动身体

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lay writhing in pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他躺着﹐痛得身体直扭动。

Sense.DEF: words that have been written or printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does the writing on the back say?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背面的文字说什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a T-shirt with Japanese writing on it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件印有日语的T恤衫

Sense.DEF: books, poems, articles etc, especially those by a particular writer or about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某作者或关于某主题的〕著作﹐作品
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of his most powerful writing is based on his childhood experiences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一些最震慑人心的作品是根据儿时经历写成的。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游记/女权主义作品/科学性著作等

Sense.DEF: the activity of writing books, stories etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1991 she retired from politics and took up writing as a career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1991年她退出政坛﹐然后开始从事写作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short story that stands out as a brilliant piece of writing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇脱颖而出的短篇小说杰作
Sense.EXAMPLE: a class in creative writing a subject studied at school or college, where you write your own stories, poems etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文学创作班

Sense.DEF: the particular way that someone writes with a pen or pencil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your writing is very neat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的字很工整。

Sense.DEF: the skill of writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: At this age we concentrate on the children’s reading and writing skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个年龄﹐我们着重培养儿童的阅读和写作能力。

Sense.DEF: if you get something in writing, it is official proof of an agreement, promise etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you put that in writing , please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把它写下来好吗？

Sense.DEF: the books, stories etc that an important writer has written
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darwin’s scientific writings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文的科学著作

Sense.LEXUNIT: the writing is on the wall

Variant.LEXVAR: see/read the writing on the wall

Sense.DEF: used to say that it seems very likely that something will not exist much longer or someone will fail
Sense.TRAN: 厄运临头的预兆已经显露〔指某事物很可能即将消失或某人即将失败〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The writing is on the wall for old manufacturing industries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的制造业分明已经日薄西山了。

Sense.DEF: a desk with special places for pens, paper etc
good quality paper that you use for writing letters

the past participle of
write
recorded in writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the development of written language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书面语的发展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please send a cheque with written confirmation of your booking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请寄支票﹐并附预订的书面确认。

Sense.DEF: a test etc in which you have to write the answers
writing as a way of expressing ideas, emotions etc, as opposed to speaking
not correct, and not based on true facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your calculations must be wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定算错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I got question 3 wrong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想第三题我做错了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is wrong to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is wrong to assume that technological advance brings a higher quality of life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为科技的进步能提高生活质量是错误的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop trying to prove me wrong show that I am wrong all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你不要总是想证明我错了。

Sense.DEF: to not be right in what you think or believe about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, you’re wrong. Brett wouldn’t do a thing like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐你错了。布雷特不会做那样的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was wrong about the new guy – he’s not Belgian, he’s French.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把那个新来的家伙的情况搞错了——他不是比利时人﹐而是法国人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s where you’re wrong! We never slept together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你错就错在这里！我们从未上过床。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a situation where there are problems, or when someone is ill or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 〔状况〕有问题的﹔〔身体〕有病的﹔〔人〕情绪不佳的

GramExa.PROPFORM: there is something wrong/something is wrong
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When he didn’t come back that night, I knew that something was wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上他没回来﹐我就知道出问题了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What is wrong with our society? People just don’t seem to care any more.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的社会是怎么啦？人们好像都无所谓了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Is anything wrong? You haven’t said more than two words since you got here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出什么事啦？你到这儿以后还没说超过两句话呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave’s got something wrong with his foot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫的一只脚出了点毛病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, there’s nothing wrong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐没问题的。

Sense.DEF: not the one that you intended or the one that you really want
Sense.EXAMPLE: The letter was delivered to the wrong address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信送错地址了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: driving on the wrong side of the road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在马路上逆向行驶
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got the wrong man. I didn’t kill her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们抓错人了﹐我没有杀她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we went the wrong way at that last turning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们在刚才那个转弯处转错方向了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no one called Julia here. You must have the wrong number wrong telephone number .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里没有叫朱莉娅的人。你肯定是拨错号码了。

Sense.DEF: not morally right or acceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s wrong that people should have to sleep on the streets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人不得不露宿街头﹐这让人无法接受。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is wrong to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We all accept that it is wrong to torture people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都同意严刑逼供是不对的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We weren’t doing anything wrong !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有做任何不正当的事！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing wrong with making a profit, provided you don’t cheat anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要不是欺骗别人﹐赚取利润没有什么不对。

Sense.DEF: not suitable for a particular purpose, situation, or person
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某目的﹑情况或人〕不适合的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the wrong time of year to be planning a holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一年中的这个时间安排休假是不合适的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anna and I were wrong for each other in dozens of ways not suited for a romantic relationship with each other .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和安娜在许多方面都彼此不适合。

Sense.DEF: if something is wrong with a vehicle or machine, it stops working properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆或机器〕出故障的﹐不能正常运行的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s something wrong with the car again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这汽车又出毛病了。

Subsense.DEF: to be in the wrong order
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These two paragraphs are the wrong way round.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个段落次序颠倒了。

Subsense.DEF: if something is the wrong way round, the back is where the front should be
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got your T-shirt on the wrong way around.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的T恤前后穿反了。

Sense.DEF: if something is the wrong way up, the top is where the bottom should be
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting was hung the wrong way up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画挂倒了。

Sense.DEF: to be offended by a remark because you have understood it wrongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like you. Don’t take this the wrong way, now. I mean as a friend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢你。不要误解﹐我的意思是作为朋友。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the wrong place at the wrong time
Sense.DEF: to get involved in trouble without intending to
Sense.TRAN: 在错误的时间来到错误的地点〔指无意中落入困境〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: get on the wrong side of sb
Sense.DEF: to do something that gives someone a bad opinion of you, so that they do not like or respect you in the future
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事〕冒犯某人﹐招某人讨厌
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t like to get on the wrong side of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想招她讨厌。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get on the wrong side of the law
Sense.DEF: to get into trouble with the police

Sense.LEXUNIT: get off on the wrong foot
Sense.DEF: to start a job, relationship etc badly by making a mistake that annoys people
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作﹑关系等〕一开始就不顺利〔因犯错而使别人讨厌〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: get the wrong end of the stick
Sense.DEF: to understand a situation in completely the wrong way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Geoff had got the wrong end of the stick, and thought I was angry with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫完全误解了﹐他以为我生他的气了。

Sense.DEF: to have the wrong idea about a situation so that you are unlikely to get the result you want
Sense.TRAN: 〔思考时〕方向错误/路子不对头

Sense.LEXUNIT: be from the wrong side of the tracks
Sense.DEF: to be from a poor part of a town or a poor part of society
Sense.TRAN: 来自贫民区﹔来自下层社会

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the wrong side of thirty/forty etc
Sense.DEF: to be older than 30 etc

Crossrefto.REFLEX: get out of bed on the wrong side

Sense.DEF: used as a polite way of saying that you think what you are going to say is correct
Sense.TRAN: 如果我错了请予纠正〔礼貌地表示自认为将要说的话是正确的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Correct me if I’m wrong, but didn’t you say you were going to do it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我错了请纠正﹐但你不是说过你打算做这事吗？

Sense.DEF: used to agree with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘This government is ruining the country!’ ‘You’re not wrong there!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这个政府正在把国家毁掉！”“说得一点没错！”

Sense.DEF: if something secret or dangerous falls into the wrong hands, it is discovered by someone who may use it to harm people
Sense.TRAN: 〔秘密〕落入坏人手中﹔〔危险的事〕被小人发现

Exponent.DEF: not correct or right – used about facts, answers etc, or people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For every wrong answer, you lose five points.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每答错一题就扣五分。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The figure he gave me was wrong.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我的数字是错的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think you’re wrong about that.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得那件事你搞错了。

Exponent.DEF: something that is incorrect is wrong because someone has made a mistake. Incorrect is more formal than wrong .
Exponent.TRAN: 错误的﹐不正确的〔incorrect比wrong正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid these prices are incorrect.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕这些价格有误。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor had made an incorrect diagnosis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生误诊了。

Exponent.DEF: something that is inaccurate is not exactly right and contains mistakes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: inaccurate information
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不准确的信息
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The old maps were often inaccurate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧地图通常不准确。

Exponent.DEF: not based on true facts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are the following statements true or false?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下列说法是否正确？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was accused of giving false information to the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控向警方提供虚假信息。

Exponent.DEF: not based on true facts, especially because someone is lying or guessing
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因某人说谎或猜测〕不真实的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe he said that about me. It’s completely untrue!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我简直不敢相信他那么说我﹐真是一派谎言！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The allegations were untrue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些指控是不真实的。

Exponent.DEF: a misleading statement or piece of information makes people believe something that is wrong, especially because it does not give all the facts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The article was very misleading.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那篇文章很误导人。

Exponent.DEF: a misguided decision, belief, action etc is wrong because it is based on bad judgement or understanding
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因判断或理解有误而〕做错的﹐错误的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That decision seems misguided now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在看来那个决定是错误的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was the consequence of a misguided economic policy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是错误的经济政策造成的结果。

Exponent.DEF: wrong – used about ideas and beliefs. Also used about a person being wrong. You’re mistaken sounds more polite and less direct than saying you’re wrong .
Exponent.TRAN: 弄错的﹐犯错的〔you’re mistaken比you’re wrong听起来更礼貌委婉〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s completely mistaken if she thinks that I don’t care about her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她认为我不关心她﹐那她完全错了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a mistaken belief
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 错误的想法

Sense.DEF: not in the correct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve spelt my name wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把我的名字拼错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What? Have I done it wrong ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么？我做得不对吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked him to sort those files, but he’s done it all wrong in completely the wrong way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我让他整理这些文件﹐可是他弄得根本不对。

Subsense.DEF: to stop working properly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Something’s gone wrong with my watch.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的手表出毛病了。

Subsense.DEF: to make a mistake during a process so that you do not get the right result
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Follow these instructions and you can’t go wrong you are sure to succeed .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照这些说明去做﹐就不会出错。

Subsense.DEF: to do something that makes a plan, relationship etc fail
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Thinking back on the marriage, I just don’t know where we went wrong.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回想这段婚姻﹐我真不知道我们的问题出在哪里。

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake in the way you write, judge, or understand something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This isn’t it. We must have got the address wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是这里﹐我们肯定把地址搞错了。

GramExa.GLOSS: understand a situation in completely the wrong way
GramExa.EXAMPLE: No, no – you’ve got it all wrong! We’re just friends!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐不——你完全搞错了！我们只是朋友！

Sense.DEF: used when you think someone may understand your remarks wrongly, or be offended by them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get me wrong – I like Jenny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别误会——我喜欢珍妮。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular object will always be suitable, satisfactory or work well
Sense.TRAN: （某物）不会出问题〔用于表示总是合适﹑令人满意或运行良好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t go wrong with a little black dress, can you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿件黑色小礼服总不会有错﹐是吧？

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is not morally right
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s too young to know right from wrong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他太小﹐还不能辨别是非。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those who do wrong should be punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干坏事的人应该受到惩罚。

GramExa.GLOSS: they are perfect
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nathan adored her, and she could do no wrong in his eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内森非常爱她﹐在他眼里她做什么都是对的。

Sense.DEF: an action, judgment, or situation that is unfair
Sense.TRAN: 不公正的行为[判决﹐情形]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The black population suffered countless wrongs at the hands of a racist regime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一个实行种族主义的政权下﹐黑人受尽了冤屈。

GramExa.GLOSS: bring justice to an unfair situation

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake or deserve the blame for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which driver was in the wrong?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是哪个司机的责任？

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly and unfairly – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 冤枉某人﹐不公平地对待某人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: two wrongs don’t make a right
Sense.DEF: used to say that if someone does something bad to you, you should not do something bad to them
Sense.TRAN: 冤冤相报何时了﹔以牙还牙行不通〔指不应报复〕

Sense.DEF: to treat or judge someone unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides felt that they had been wronged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都觉得自己被冤枉了。

Sense.DEF: illegal or immoral behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 不法行为﹔不道德行为﹔坏事

Sense.DEF: to surprise and embarrass someone, especially by asking a question they did not expect
Sense.TRAN: 使大吃一惊﹐使仓皇失措〔尤指提出意想不到的问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Woo’s political skill and ability to wrongfoot the opposition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吴令反对派方寸大乱的政治才干

Sense.DEF: a wrongful arrest etc is unfair or illegal because the person affected by it has done nothing wrong
Sense.TRAN: 不公正[非法]的逮捕/判决/入狱/解雇等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s threatening to sue her employers for wrongful dismissal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扬言要控告雇主非法解雇。

Sense.DEF: used to describe an idea, plan, or belief that someone has, that is based on wrong ideas that they are not willing to change
Sense.TRAN: 坚持错误的﹐执迷不悟的

Sense.DEF: not correctly or in a way that is not based on facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matthew was wrongly diagnosed as having a brain tumour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修被误诊有脑瘤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name had been wrongly spelt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字被拼错了。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is unfair or immoral
Sense.EXAMPLE: Human rights organizations maintain that the men have been wrongly convicted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人权组织坚称这些人被错判了。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
write

the old past tense and past participle of
work
Sense.TRAN: work在旧时的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: long thin pieces of iron formed into shapes to make gates, fences etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔制作闸门﹑栅栏等的〕锻铁﹐熟铁

Sense.DEF: very nervous and excited
Sense.TRAN: 非常紧张的﹔十分激动的

the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= with regard to , used in email or by people communicating in
chat room s
on the Internet 关于〔用于电子邮件或网上聊天〕

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
wring
a wry expression or wry humour shows that you know a situation is bad, but you also think it is slightly amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Was it as bad as you expected?’ Travis gave a wry smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那事和你想的一样糟吗？”特拉维斯苦笑着问道。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= weight 重量

Sense.DEF: a young person who is very successful
a Chinese fighting art in which you fight using your hands and feet
someone who you think is weak or lacks courage

Sense.TRAN:
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=
world war i
第一次世界大战

the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=
world war ii
第二次世界大战

PronCodes.PRON: ‚dʌb ə ljuː dʌb ə ljuː 'dʌb ə ljuː

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= World Wide Web 万维网

Sense.FULLFORM: What You See Is What You Get
Sense.DEF: a word used to mean that what you see on the computer screen is exactly what will be printed
Sense.TRAN: 所见即所得〔指在计算机屏幕上看见的与打印内容丝毫不差〕

Sense.DEF:
an imaginary animal that has two legs and wings and looks like a
dragon
